column9: A part of my daily routine

First, I do want to say that overall this should be an amazing journal app. The UI is easy, I love the idea of a continuous journal, and the capability to add pictures and comments to entry is wonderful. It allows you to document your life to your heart's content with minimal effort. As far as functionality, my only complaint is that entries cannot be back-dated(so I can't easily transfer entries from my paper journals).

But, the bottom line is that without the security updates that Bloom Built keeps promising are coming, I simply cannot use this to it's potential. Journals can(and should) be not only the general happenings of the day, but also personal, private thoughts. I can't feel comfortable sending those un-encrypted to some company's server. As soon as they get to add those features, I can gladly and honestly give this app 5 stars. If you'd like a journal app and security does not concern you, this app is the best.

column9: Some minor improvements would be welcome
column10:
I got this app in anticipation of wanting to journal every day of the new year. The good news is, I have had no problem with the application's basic capabilities: the cloud backup, social media integration, and simple journaling tools make it quite easy to use.

The interface is also nice ‚Äì mostly, anyway. I think that viewing metadata (such as date, weather, and music), looks quite unpolished compared to the rest of the app. Not to mention that for me, the music information seems largely impractical, considering that there is no way to play the song from within the application itself (or if there is, at least, it is not easy to find). I also have a pretty big problem with the way that photos are handles within the entires: there is no text wrapping or precision resizing, making the entire process feel kind of clunky. Without these options, you'll have to be prepared to scroll quite a bit if you want to add a lot of pictures along with a lot of text.

I'd also point out a very annoying bug that I have found consistently plagues my journaling: contractions always appear as misspelled words. I don't have this problem outside of the app, and after saving the entry and going back to edit it, the red underlining disappears, but any new contractions I add are similarly misrepresented. (Note to the developers: this problem occurs on my 12.9" iPad Pro using Apple's Smart Keyboard, but not on my iPhone 7 Plus.)

Perhaps what was most disappointing to me after using this app was the lack of statistical analysis concerning the entries. I'd love to be able to view average word counts and times of entries, along with nice graphs that show the same. I would also love some kind of word association chart to see which words are the most common. While these aren't necessities, I was expecting them to be included in such a relatively expensive journaling app.
It's great !

Day One allows me to record my life in a way that's simple and intuitive. Many people around me are also using it to take note in the class. After sticking to writing every day for about a month, it's epic!

Easy to use, reliable and does all I need!

I like many people stopped using the old version then i couldn't find it to reinstall. I like the program but was disappointed to pay so much for an app i already owned. I have no problems so far though do not use on my Ipad

Having used the original DayOne Journal for years, I was actually shocked when they released a version 2 with minimal changes and decided to charge users a second time, instead of simply updating the previous journal app. Additional photos per entry was something that had been requested for ages in the original app. Additional journals is a nice way to record different daily trends outside of my everyday journal, granted and well done on that. I'm also not a fan of the removal of the previous sync options. It just doesn't make sense to remove them. Why not at least give the option to the user? With all this in mind I thought I'd pay the fiver anyway and give it a go because I love the previous version but the app crashes every time I try to add a photo to my journal! That's literally the only reason I wanted to get the new version and it doesn't even work. Glad I didn't remove the old app. If only I could get a refund. Please bring back the old sync options and don't charge us for a version 3 in doing so.

Enjoying the app, especially now it gives you the option for multiple journals. i also like being able to set date & time manually so you can link an entry to the time/date it happened rather than when you write it

This is a highly functional journaling app that has a lot of flexibility and nice little features to make journaling a pleasure. 

It's great that it captured your location (optional) so that you can go back and enter information after the fact if you're not super diligent. 

The iOS app has a great interface, though sometimes it can take a while to get used to navigating around at first. 

I'd recommend it.

Literrally.
I've set for myself ambitious life changing goals this year.
I needed a way to be reflective on my progress, to keep track of everything without filling an impersonal excel sheet. Something that would help me think and reflect on my experiences, that would be easy to use 10 times a day, and that would make it motivating to look back at the parh accomplished. This app does just this. It has become my best friend, i love it. 
Without it i would find it impossible to "multitask" between my different 2017 goals. Thanks!
Exactly what I was looking for! I have had no problems apart from one crash, and it saved what I was writing. Very clever.....

I purchased this app when I bought an iPhone 7 Plus and had enough memory for it. The app works really well on the large screen. I am using it to record weight, blood sugar, exercise etc during a diet. Today I ate out and included a photograph of my meal for later calorific analysis. The photo fits in really well and is easy to import. The first paragraph of each day is in bold print so I put my important info there, to see an easy overview over several days. I am also using it as a journal for prayer and daily Bible reading etc. I love it. Great app and very easy to use for my purposes.
Good app, hope to be better in the near future. Nice design, easy to use. It will be good to permit synchronizing on all my devices.
With a daily reminder and a simple interface, this app has gotten me back to daily journaling after years away from any kind of reflective writing practice. I like this app.
I‚Äôve yet to discover anything missing from this app that I might want implemented. Excellent journaling app, syncing well across all platforms.
With the last update, it looks really nice.
Last update needs improvement, very laggy !!

column9: Easy to use. Great layout and design.
column10:
Never used a journal at all , decided to use one at the suggestion of all the great mentors.
  The reminder is helpful. Easy to add entries through out the day. Well done . üëç

It's available at a click or a touch on my desktop, laptop, iPad, and phone. Always in sync, no idea gets lost in the shuffle. I depend on it for first drafts, managing sources, and capturing all the odd thoughts.

Really like entering my thoughts on this application, however, there have been a number of entries that has disappeared a day or two after making them. This is a flaw of the program that the app creators need to address.
This is my favorite journaling app

What a great way to organize your thoughts each and every day. A special bonus--since I've been using it over a year--is how it reminds you of your entry from a year ago.  A great way to reflect on how your life has changed in a year. I took off 1 star because it's difficult and costly to work with multiple devices.
What gives guys? Still forced to use Day One classic bc you clearly don't care about your customers.
... has caused big problems on tag entry. Delays on character entry for tags makes that element of the app almost unusable- desperately needs fixing.

- I like the support across various iOS devices
-I like the format
-NEEDS ENCRYPTION esp since I keep it in multiple devices

column9: Fell in love with doing journals!!!
column10:
I love how this app makes my life more organized and well-documented.

I personally use the Day One app for my daily devotions and reflections. It's been a great support in my spiritual walk because I can use it anytime and anywhere.

Doing journals has never been this fun! I love it!
App crashed after update!
There's simply no excuse to not journal any longer. Do it for the kids ... do it for yourself.

column9: Great app - this version crashes instantly
column10: I love using this app but this update has broken it; ipad3 os9. Crashes within a second of opening. Please fix!
This app has just about everything I could desire in a journal. I just wish I could edit my entries on a pc.
My days are better because of it. I feel so motivated.

column9: LOVE the app, but new update crashes repeatedly, is unusable.
column10: New version will not work in iPad 2 under iOS 9.3.5. Launches, then crashes. Removing and reinstalling does not correct. Please fix; I use this app every day.

column9: Great App with intuitive UI for a quick log!

This is the best app for memory keeping! Love the new changes and more than one pic per day makes it a 5 star!

I want my entries/life back..

Plz fixüíî

After a lot of research I downloaded this app Dayone is simply awesome 
Best in class to maintain your journaling.

I love it sooo much and use it every single day!!! Love how versatile it is...
The only thing on my wish list is a web version!!

column9: Yeah it's helpful and I like to use it for my everyday life
column10: Yeah it's quite great

column9: I prefer the old version of day One
column10:
This app interface is not nice and fluid enough compared to the old version. No full screen view as well. 
So even I bought the new app, I'm still using the old one.

It's really unfortunate that I have to air my concerns in a review: After the latest update, I can no longer access my app - which I rely on multiple times a day. When I tap on the app, and after I enter my password, it closes (crashes) immediately. 
I tried to submit a request through the support page on your website but after completing the form, the submit button doesn't seem to function. 
This seemed to be the only place to gain your attention. I have an ios 9.3.5 on an iPhone 6splus. 
Would appreciate an immediate resolution to this issue. Thanks so much.
Thanks to the reviewer that saved me time by saying encryption still not available. Won't ever be using this until it is, wish the feature came as promised.
I am really satisfied and impressed. GPS location is sometimes incorrect but can be corrected manually.
It's very easy to use, and the interface design is simply eye-candy.  I love writing on DayOne especially now that more photos can be added to entries.
App crashed as many times I opened it. Update it soon plz! I could write even a single entry since this new version! üò°üòû
Very disappointing that this app is so broken since the last update as I use it regularly. Now it is literally completely unusable. Very shocked that this passed any in-house quality testing.

column9: App crash after ifttt post a photo from Instagram.
column10: App crash after ifttt post a photo from Instagram.

Yet Another update and no  end to end encryption. not trusting their security 

So they just released a new Mac version and still no E2E encryption?????? I am getting worried that part of their business plan is to be able to scan your journal (with bots like Google does email) so they can gather data worth selling - anonymous probably but still worrisome 

So far I like the IOS version but will be holding off on the Mac version till they get encryption. 
Also wish it supported short movies.  Not sure why they dropped ICloud support for syncing.  I would prefer that to their server. 
Also needs to support tracking of health concerns as part of the journal.

column9: Latest update has major bug when using tags
column10: Normally the app is amazing, however the latest update has caused the app to become so slow and unresponsive as soon as you open up the tags window. It's such a pain it makes the app nearly unusable, so now I only put in one or 2 tags that are the most important for a post. Please fix, as the app is normally 5 stars.

Night mode!! So simple, but so necessary especially for a journaling app. 

Keyboard in split mode on iPad needs to keep text scrolling so what you're typing doesn't fall behind the keyboard. 

Newest update lags typing like crazy

You can forget trying to go back and change something you've written unless you want to keep hitting the backspace button. Impossible to select text and change it or undo a change you made. Deleted an entire day of writing by trying to change one line of text. Not intuitive to use at all. Very frustrated with this app.
I can't log into my journal it keeps crashing. I just realized it updated automatically today know it's not loading. HELP!!!
Bring back iCloud Sync. I don't trust your servers
Love DAY ONE since DAY ONE. LOL

I am satisfied with this app in all but one important regard: whenever I try to add tags to a journal entry, the app freezes and sometimes crashes as well. This is making it nearly unusable if I want to tag things (which I do). If this was not an issue I would give 5 stars!

column9: App has potential but not there yet
column10: I purchased this app because I thought it had higher positive reviews, somehow, I missed looked at it.  Anyhow, it's not to bad but having a function to make certain entries private will do great wonders with it.  The other issue is time function should have the option of a start, an end, or either or.  Come on guys your almost there, get it right.

I cannot use the app as it crashes 5 seconds after i went in.
I paid for this and deleted version 1. I want my money back
Shows the period of time I moved from point a to point b time wise but says I was at point a both entrys

** 01.17.17 Update

Update is broken. Prevents the app from opening do to lag. 

If you are considering paying for this app never update at the initial update wait for the 2nd update where they fix all the bugs created in the previous release. 

Spotty development at best. 

***Updated
The latest update fixed the posting issue using a url scheme. I am back to a happy journaler. 

With functionality of IFTTT, Workflow, and Launcher Pro this is the easiest and best jouenaling tool out there. 

**old

If you have the classic day one app to not update. 

Day One 2 has only accomplished breaking any functionality that was working. 

The only feature added that appears to work is the ability to put more than one picture in a post. 

However in classic you could accomplish this same feature by using markdown and linking to the picture. 

In classic you are able to use Launch Center Pro to create writing prompts. You could also use Workflow to create entries regarding books, movies, etc. All that is broke with Day One2.
Cannot use the app any more, crashes incessantly upon startup as it tries to sync.  Deleting and reinstalling does not help.

column9: Still one of the best but....
column10: I finally gave in and purchased the latest version for my iPad. I had the original but had stopped using it for many reasons. I really like the updated app but still think the price is too high to also replace my mac version, since for now they still work together that's fine but I gave one less star for that and one less for taking away a choice of cloud syncing. I'm a bit concerned that limiting users to only their cloud storage may eventually lead to a subscription style pricing, another reason I'm waiting to repurchase the mac version.

column9: Crashes on start. Cannot be opened.
column10: No way to open the app.

The app across all of my devices is just a pleasure to use.  I think it's absolutely great.

Great at review time to go back through everything I've done as well as my thoughts on others who I've interacted with.

I would absolutely encourage anyone to make this part of everyday usage.

I prefer to use this app for keeping a record of some notable events in my life and for reflecting on devotionals and scripture. Needless to say, it's simple design makes it ideal for daily use for me. Of course, this isn't an app for extreme personalization so you'd be erroneous to judge it on that criteria.

I've been using Evernote and paper journals for years, but only ever managed to journal sporadically. I wanted to try DayOne, but I was afraid it was just another editor-same as Evernote. It's not. Reminders come up at just the right time so I don't forget. But the context is what really makes this app work. Where was I when this note was written? What was I listening to? What did I take a picture of? The calendar is also helpful and helps me to go back and fill in entries in the past. If you want to journal more this app is definitely worth the cost.
I don't want yet another cloud provider. The removal of iCloud support from the app is a terrible decission. As long as there is no iCloud support, this app can go to the trash, where it belongs.
It is a rather fun and easy way to write and record journal entries.

column9: Been using it for over three years, love it
column10:
It is simple and elegant. 

I have been using it for three years.  It synced well and the design it nice.

column9: Push me to write down dairies
column10: Pleasant structured and information is included in diaries automatically such as temperature and steps

I've tried and tried to be consistent in journaling.  Day One has helped me make this more of a habit because of the convenience and the daily reminder.  Great app, I just wish the MAC version wasn't so expensive.  I have the new version on my iPad and iPhone but the classic version on my MAC.  Lower the price to something more reasonable Day One.

This app has made my journaling so much easier. I can journal in the car, waiting at the doctor's office, and on the toilet. My friend has a disease that makes her lose her eyesight. She is in her 30s and legally blind. She planted the idea of speaking into my phone to journal. With a little editing, it works like a charm. I love being able to add pictures, too!

I use to write quite a bit when I was younger and with life getting in the way I sort of stopped. I decided this year to start something nice and heard about this app.  Wow!  Love how easy it is to use and how friendly it is.  It keeps track on things I have been doing which help when I write.  Love how I can add any pictures I have taken during the day.  Can't be happier!
Got rid of all of my annoying paper notebooks and now use just this.

With this features you can write your journal every day
Thank you!
I use this app a daily! Good way to catalog your life.

I especially love the Apple Watch compatibility. Still getting used to journaling again, but being able to dictate into my watch makes it so easy! I also love the fact that you can check in, add pictures, and just get a good overall reminder of what your day was like.
...for all sorts of things. üëçüèª
Loving it so far. Using it for personal, professional, data bases.
Tried many apps. This is one provides all I need and syncs across devices.  Big help!! I enjoy using it.

Day One is useful for so many things, but can also be useful for just one thing. For example, I'm using it as a gratitude journal. (I use Evernote for all other note-taking needs.) But this single-purpose approach to using Day One has me opening it everyday, even excited to use it.

Fantastic online journal with great features. Allows you to safe photos and locations too. It also has a review function letting you look back over past entries. It's incredibly easy to use and syncs over various devices. Having always struggled with journaling, thanks to this app, I have now successfully journaled for over a year and I'm loving it.
I have been looking for an App that i could use to do my journal and work journal seamlessly and this App does it all for me.

column9: Still love it after 2 year, and the update is greatüëçüèª
column10: An app I still use a couple times per week

I've been using Day One for several years, mostly as a travel journal, keeping our camping log digital. I frequently back it up and share pages, or groups of pages via email (pdf). I love that it now allows more than one photo per entry. 

This is an extremely user-friendly format/interface, and has plenty of versatility for the uses I have for it. 

The developers quickly respond to any questions I send them, with helpful, clear instructions on solving my issue. 

I've tried Evernote, and some others, but Day One is, and has been, my go-to journaling app!

column9: Amazing app with amazing customer service
column10:
I've been using Day One for a long time now and I've always loved it. 

I had a problem syncing the old version up to the new one and had help from the developers within fifteen minutes, and they stayed and helped me figure out my problem
Fabulous app! Daily must use

Great app for tracking daily events. I like to add a photo diary, and use screen shots of my map track saved in photos for route records for walks. Be nice to auto upload steps at end of each day so there's a daily total. And be pleased when I can add a video.
Had the old version since it came out, just upgraded and love it

column9: Nice and easy way to capture ideas and notes!
column10: I use it for quick capturing ideas and notes... for several years now! Really nice and important tool for me...

While I had a rather dodgy start with this app, having changed from another similar one, everything seems to be working smoothly now. I like the simplicity of the style and the functions offered and the fact that it syncs across all my devices, including the iMac. 

Others have gone into much more detail so I will just endorse the positive aspects of DayOne. Let's hope it continues!

Can't believe that all i needed was an app to say "Hey write today" to help me actually do it. Been feeling down for too long and knew all i needed to do was spew onto a page or two...or three or one hundred million. 
Thanks a billion times 2.5 for making this available. Smooches!

If you like journaling as much as I do, this is your app, well worth the money you'll pay for it. If you still think that journaling is pointless, or incompatible with the busyness of everyday life, this app might help you change your mind. The interface provides a calm and inspiring environment to write about your thoughts and experiences without distractions or constraints. Its functionality is simple and sophisticated at the same time; you'll write in your journal in the same way as you would post entries in a blog (you can also add pictures). If you want to classify your posts into different themes or areas you can run up to 10 journals (you can also add tags to your posts, which makes it easier to go back to older entries and see e.g. how your views about a certain topic have changed).

This app lets me do everything I would ever WANT in a journal and and it just looks so beautiful! I love that I can now color code my journals too. I HIGHLY recommend this app!! I seriously can't go without it.
I love this app. I love journaling but writing can be time consuming... having the app on my phone allows me to get my daily journaling in.

I journaled a ton as a kid and a young adult....and then life took over....I am just starting back with this app and it is really easy and I am enjoying it.  I hop between work and life but just trying to connect with myself again.  Love it.

Every simple apps have improved the right to left writing Unicode! This app still has this problem!
Do something

Love this! Have always wanted to get into journaling but carrying around an extra book in my bag wasn't convenient and finding somewhere discreet wasn't always possible. This is available at any time and I can even set reminders and add photos.

column9: An easy and pleasant way to reflect and journal
column10: I have tried to journal in spiral notebooks, in small diaries, etc. it never last largely because its cumbersome to carry a notebook And pen around and i usually misspell regularly so it makes it even worse. I have looked and used numerous apps trying to find the mist practical that I could stay consistent with. Day One is perfect because it manages the calendar on its own, it notifies when its time to journal and you can freely edit, save photos and publish, export or print. I started the year with it and have been ising it daily ever since to capture our family's life, moments, feelings and photos. I love the app! Well done.

My husband and I started with the Mac OS version of Day One as a replacement for other software that proved to be too unstable to keep using.  We looked at a number of options but Day One was by far the most user friendly. The interface is crisp and clean and a pleasure to work with.   The iOS app is a tremendous compliment to the Mac app.  It's very easy to use and the syncing between the two is magical. These products make journaling fun. We've encountered no bugs or issues and are implementing all the features.  You'll be happy you bought this.
Have been using this for the last 2 years! It has become a must do Everyday, and never fail to put a smile on my face! Great Apps! Must have if you want to record down your life!

I am someone who has cared deeply about journalists and how stories are told for far too long to not take a moment to praise this app for how quickly it has allowed my life to become a full picture to examine and review. This is why I journal at all. The only reason i could recommend not using this app is if you don't want to deal with problems that journaling can quickly address and this app has allowed me to simply be more productive.
Makes journaling easy and quick. Also helps me to keep track of hours spent at work (or other places).

Day one has been a great way to both journal and keep all my thoughts together. I love that I can have multiple journals for different projects, Bible study, and tracking events. The only thing missing is a way to sync my Fitbit with steps counter. Add this feature and I'll give it 5 stars.
I love to write with a fountain pen in a paper journal, but this app has helped me be more consistent and more expansive because I can either type or dictate faster than I can write.

I have been wanting to start a daily gratitude journal for many years. Having the paper and pen available is not always easy.  This online app makes daily journaling convenient and allows for a picture to capture each day!
Easy to use, love it!!
I like this app. It lets me keep my thoughts on what is important. I need this to help me talk with God

I've used Day One since the classic version (back when it was free). I got a new phone and hadn't downloaded the new app til yesterday and I figured it's worth the $5. I do have to say I'm a little disappointed. It doesn't have a clean, minimalistic feeling. The whole interface is very crowded and feels almost tacky to write my deep thoughts/poems in. For $5 I think it should be better looking (I personally would prefer a color selection of more subtle/pastel colors). I'm not trying to be /that/ person but the "aesthetic" of the app kind of kills my inspiration to write because it doesn't feel personal or clean, just cringey and cluttered. I should have maybe bought the Lock Notes instead, much simpler design.
This app is truly amazing, great UI and features! But it's missing a huge feature to add videos to your journals.

I say simply because it's a super easy tool to lay down thoughts or ideas beautifully and keep track of them.

I say awesome because it's markup features are really fascinating and inspiring.
Keeps me on track recording my progress in my quest for weight loss!

I never before bought an app without trying it out first. I took a chance on this one and I am so pleased. I would like to recommend adding a number entry that could then be tagged and graphed in a nice line graphics. That is the only thing missing. Of course since the export function is so good I could do it myself. Thanks
enjoy myself
Love it!  Thanks DayOne!
Always wanted to "journal". This app has made it so easy, i don't have to think about it. Set a reminder and boom I do it! Looking forward to buying the Mac version.
Easy to use, low threshold. Automatically tracks location, easily adds foto's, keeps the weather etc. Great to note your thoughts and recall memories.

column9: Has made my journal writing a lo easier
column10: I have about six different journal subjects maybe seven actually and Day one journal makes it so easy for me to do my journal writing it is a lifesaver and I love it!!!
Easy to use and so amazing to look back on memories ‚ù§Ô∏è

I love this app. It has great voice recognition. The notifications are great and it syncs with all my other devices and I never have a snag I've tried every other journal app out there and haven't been as happy as I have with this one.
This is a very good journaling app! Would recommend it to others.

Enjoy writing daily thoughts / experiences almost as simultaneously as they happen.  As I get older, I am plagued with memory lapses and it's wonderful to have a handy tool to record things I want to remember in my life as they are occurring.
So good for keeping all whats important to me
Good app for keep track of days events. Easy and always have it with me.

I love this app!!  Super user friendly- I had no trouble creating three different journals and once created, I was able to transition from one to the other with ease.  Better than any others I've tried in the past.  Definitely recommend.

I've been using Day One and now Day One version 2 since 2013. Great app, but I tried adding a photo every day for a couple of years and the file size ended up over 2Gb! Luckily can be exported as PDF so I've done that and deleted previous years. Unfortunately this means I don't now get the "memories" reminder but at least I can read the diaries on my laptop and iBooks. When I've had problems I've contacted the developers, can't fault them, they answered my queries very speedily, so helpful!

I've done all of my journaling for the last few years in a single text file. While I've tried other methods I've always come back to that. It's dead simple, easy to back up, and is everywhere Day One gets that. While I have the convenience of journaling in bed or anywhere, I can still export to a long term format. The only thing I really want from this app now is a way to export to plain text in reverse order so my latest entry is always at the top. Again thank you for this well made app and while having the option not pressuring me to use a cloud service.

What a great utility. I use for almost everything from daily memos to important dates which are easily located with the tag system and adding pictures is a breeze. I have the mobile and mac apps. Hope the Windows version is in the pipeline.

Totally worth the money.  Just get it.  Mac OSX version?  Maybe not worth it (unless you want to journal a lot) but the iOS version?  Amazing value.  My favorite part is looking at entries on a map later and seeing the weather from that moment.
Really love this app! Best journaling app I've found in a long time.

Using the app for years now. Can't say that about most apps.

Now if only they had a simpler full screen mode on the desktop App like they used to!
Very good app to keep track of your days and write cleanly your thoughts, sharing other items like photos.

Just a really well designed app that makes it easy to keep a simple or more complex journal. I've always wanted to journal but have never been able to get myself to keep up with it. But this app makes it so delightful to do so that I've gotten myself on a good streak. The ability to add photos and track other locations is letting me make a rich story of me to look back on in the future.

column9: Life is about experiences not things
column10: If you think that life is about the things you do, the places you go to, what you think- then keeping a journal is a great thing. Using Day One with IFTTT to automate your daily timeline is fantastic!

Love this app.  I've used other journaling apps in the past but this one is the best by far.  Very easy to navigate, tag, add photos, etc.  It also syncs across devices so you can always make or review entries no matter where you are.
Really love this app and well worth the price. Provides insight into my daily life without judgement

I use Day One not only for my personal journaling but also for taking down notes during official meeting and when I get inspiration for writing. 

It is very helpful.  I am planning to give this to some people I know who are keeping journals.
Using this app makes me enjoy journaling again. I also like that I can add old pics and the app knows and changes the current date to the date of the pic. Makes it good for record keeping!
Jornaling is extremely private.

This new version of app is excellent! I was thinking that there is no room for any improvement after first version, but I'm glad I was wrong! I must admit that I've never saw more elegant and refined app in App Store! Excellent job! :)

New user.

Sync keeps failing. An entry on my iPad doesn't transfer to the iPhone. "Error" and "Bad gateway" are the reasons the app gives me.

My iPad receives entries from my iPhone, but scrolling began to lag after I wrote enough (just a little over a page/screensworth). A reboot of the app was necessary to bring it up to speed.

column9: This app is amazing, but there is one more thing...
column10: I think this app is wonderful and I highly recommend it. The only feature I can't get to work is the music. The song you set to the journal entry should start to automatically play once you open it for review. Please make this happen. Literally the only thing that's missing to make this a truly personalized journaling experience. Adding the song information just isn't enough...
It's got a few kinks here and there, performance-wise, and maybe a few bells and whistles, but the journaling experience is with few parallels.
It's worth to spend money buying this app. Can write your journal everyday and can enter more than one journal each day. Recommend for those who loves to write diary.

I've always wanted to do a daily journal, but always struggled with keeping up with it after a few days or a week.  With this app I can schedule reminders for myself and sync my journal across all my devices.  The user interface is good, I think it could be a bit better; but I'm not going to gig them on that too much.  It does exactly what you want it to!
Kept me journaling consistently
Mad that I had to drop some Jacksons for the upgrade but it does all the things I'd want a journal app to do

I've been using Day One for 3 years and so far it's been great. Love this app! 
(Just a little problem I hope to be fixed: when I switch to the horizontal mode, the keyboard panel overlaps the text. This problem disappears once I press "done" and continue to edit, but it'll be great if the problem doesn't occur in the first place. Also I hope the app becomes a little faster.)
I love how there are multiple paramametersbto add about your entry and it allows you to take photos or add photos from your roll.

Trying to use it every day. 
So far it's been great. Thanks
Why does this cost money it's the worst app ever
Great journaling app allows you to create many more journals.
Enjoying it a lot but have to get used to it not to forget to write daily.
like it
Day One provides the perfect travel companion to record your activities throughout your trip. The integration of timelines, ease of incorporating photos and intuitive design are awesome.

column9: Have loved since it was first released
column10:
The app remains my go-to app to record daily journal entries. I've tried others in the past, but once I discovered Day One, I've never looked back, particularly their commitment to continue to upgrade the app and add new features. 

The latest feature of allowing me to select from a list of recent locations is a godsend, as it allows me to look back and be reminded of places I've been and want to describe in a journal entry.
I have used Day One for years and continue to love this app. I use it across all my devices and have loved all the updates.
Works perfectly on my iPhone 6 Plus, iPad Mini 3 and MacBook Pro. Love the fact that this app allows you to keep multiple journals. Very happy with this new version!!

This app is making it possible for me to finally get back to journaling consistently. I can do so wherever I am. I'm thinking of getting a keyboard for my iPad because of it. The fact that it syncs with my Mac and i can keep separate journals is great. I love being able to unlock using TouchId, too!
Everything is perfect except when typing on landscape mode on the iPhone SE. What you type keeps violently moving up and down, being hidden from view

column9: Mac Version is Pricey but a Lovely App
column10: Has everything you could possibly want in a journal app. If you're a journal junkie like me, or you want somewhere to keep every thought, note, reminder, idea, you'll like this app.
With the 2.0 version Day One has fixed the only thing that I missed... Multi picture per post. THANKS Day One. Now you are perfect!
If you're looking for peace of mind this can offer some help. I can't talk to anyone but this lets me express what I wish I could say

column9: Exactly what a journal should be
column10: I've been using this app for a really long time now, and it's been perfect the entire time. Even more so after the latest update! I really love it and would recommend to anyone who wants to do anything that has to do with writing

Does everything very well. I only have one suggestion: when you first open the app, I don't like the giant camera and plus sign.  That could take a fraction of the space and allow more log to be seen.

I have never journaled in my life.  Partly because of privacy and partly because I prefer to type over write.  This app is one of the most significant on my iPhone. I'm in my 3 year, and it just keeps things simple.

Extremely useful app. Multiple journals with single and aggregate feed is perfect. 
I use this to record 
- daily gratitude
- daily thoughts/lessons
- progress etc

It does the job perfectly.
Also very polished, UI, aesthetics etc. 

Great work guys. Thank you.
I've been using DayOne for over two and a half years now and it is one of my favourite apps. It's easy to use, intuitive and presents your entries in an easily readable format. Definitely recommend.
Encourages you to fill it out and gives you a great view of the year of all the things you have done. I have it on MacBook as well as phone. Thumbs up from me!

I've been meaning to journal for years, this makes it easy. I'm even taking more pictures because it's so easy to integrate text and pictures. I'm sure I'm going to appreciate being able to look back at all the memories. 

Creating entries is so simple and fast.
I've enjoyed using the app to keep track of the things I do each day.
Must have app.

column9: Been a Good since Day One
column10:
Bought v2 over the holidays. So far loving it, and also the Timehop like feature to check prior journal entries.

Haven't dived into all the new features but for the current ones of just putting down one's thoughts, they are solid.

column9: Somehow Is More Useful Than Most eJournals
column10: Journaling, keeping a daily journal, has been my practice since 1964. For many years only pen and paper would do. Then I broke the mold and switched to pencil to get more paper and pencil traction feel,feeling the friction, so I always liked paper journals. I've tried many electronic journals but always stop using them because I lose the data. However, for unknown reasons, good ones, I like this journal enough to have stayed with it for six months. I like the password feature, finger print password on my iPad Pro. I encrypt my entries by writing in Portuguese! However, it works great in English too. I like the format, the features, and include pictures, links (really almost anything). I use it every day and often more than once a day. It is totally convenient and no bugs or problems at all.

I had Day One classic and enjoyed it.  Moving to the "upgraded" version I was very disappointed that iCloud backup was no longer an option.

The only way to port my existing data was to create an account with Day One.

I will not be forced to share such personal information.  Because any "privacy" guarantees, which can change anytime or be bought by some other data-mining company, I will not be using the app and be forced to divulge my everyday activity and personal family information.

I deleted the app.

I can't tell you the impact this app has made on my life. As someone who has always found an excuse or a distraction when it comes to sitting and writing. That has all gone away with this app, I have a hard time using pen and paper and with this I can keep a variety of thoughts and idea's organized in a way that fits me. Having the ability to create a variety of different journals and put pictures in with them is so great. I can't thank you enough for developing this app!

column9: Not perfect but better than some.
column10:
It's not perfect, but on the whole I find it easy and convenient to use. I particularly like the function of adding a hashtag in front of word as an aid to keeping track of specific issues.
: I like the theory but it clearly has not always worked. 
My gripes: I bought this app for my laptop, then for my iPad, because the iPad version is newer they don't talk to each other and it seems I am expected to pay for the update - that won't be happening.

It's nice to do it for yourself, instead of social media. I even set things so the pictures I take don't save to the camera roll. It truly is for me and myself, and I can share if I want, but I probably won't. There are a lot of informative tags you can add that your phone will keep track for you. It's fun for mundane pictures to look back for later, and now I have a reminder to jot something down. I find myself doing it 4-5 times a day, and it's been fun learning how to write my own story. I highly recommend. Even for the price. It instantly turned into one of my most used apps.
very good

I have been a fan of Day One since it was first developed. Every version improves and refines the last.. well done guys it's a great offering to the world. You should be proud on what you have achieved.

Really enjoying using Day One. Good intervention. Easy to use. Pleasant to look at too. I do wish the desktop version was a little bit cheaper though. ¬£30 seems a bit much when I can just use a pen and notebook. If the price came down I'd use it a lot more. Still enjoying it though.
good

column9: Day One is a great way to start the new year!!!
column10: I absolutely love that I can have a visual and written journal on Day One! I also love the interface.

If you want to journal, use this app. It makes it fun and really helps you pull all your thoughts together. Adding pictures is my favorite part. I do wish it had daily inspirational quotes. I'll rate it 5 stars if the developers add that!

Any shortcomings are my own as I occasionally fall off the journaling bandwagon. 
I can easily add photos. The journal records where and when and even the weather for the day I journal. 
Yes, yes. You could use a note taking app to journal, but trust me, it doens't have that journal feel. Let's face it, if you're going to reap the benefits of journaling, you might as well enjoy it.
Note taking apps are overkill with too many features. And like I said, note taking apps don't have that 'open a journal and just write' sort of feeling. 
The iOS app works well between devices and the desktop version works equally as smooth. Syncing  is a breeze. 
The desktop version was a bit steep, but I'm still happy to support the developer for a well-made product. I like that I can keep multiple journals, too. One for personal, one for household things and communications. 
If in doubt, give the desktop trial version a try. I think you'll like it. You might even decide the iOS version is all you need - it even works well with dictation.
Best journaling app for the iPhone. Been using it for years.
This by far is one of the better journal app I have downloaded. Enjoy everything about the app.

column9: Well organized and a lot of features!
column10:
Well organized, easy to use.
Supports multiple journals and export to plain text or pdf.
I have loved this app. I use it several times a week. It allows me to get closer to God, while also being able to release some stresses of this world.

I actually write in my journal everyday. It's easy to use and aesthetically pleasing. Options to add photos, edit date/time, or even make an entry on a past date are awesome. I love that it incorporates your location, daily steps and the weather. You can even tell it to use the location of photos you add. Awesome. Its motivates me to write in my journal every day because it's so easy.

column9: Lovely way to record memories and thoughts
column10: Lovely app makes it easy to write on the go without having to carry a paper diary. Photos work as great reminders of the day. Love that i can send my entries on pdf form to myself so there's no need to save them on my phone and waste space and no need to be anxious about losing the entries. However you have to get in the habit to send them regularly otherwise if your entries include photos the file may be too big to send in one go. Lovely way to record memories and thoughts
Not really found any negatives as yet - shame you can't upload to a blog so easily but a small issue.
Keep you're memories!! such an easy way to hold on to all the things you one day want to remember
Really enjoying using this app to capture daily reflections and count my blessings. Highly recommended.
First app to install on every new iPhone I get. Already on my 7000th entry.

I wanted an app for personal journaling as well as a place to keep ideas. Day One gave me that interface. Day one syncs between my iOS and MacBook fast and accurately. Adding location and pictures from the day is another wonderful touch. I am satisfied.

I love Day One! It's been my go-to journal for years! I was so upset when I realised recently that I hadn't synced it properly and when I changed phones I lost a lot of my records. Won't make that mistake again! Now my memories and my photos on my journaling app are safe. Thanks for making an app that's efficient, safe and easy to use!
I love the idea and reality of a visual journal this ap allows me to create. Wish I could make the time daily and I don't even mind the prompts to do so..

column9: Bring back iCloud sync / Apple Pencil
column10: Still using DayOne Classic over here until iCloud sync is brought back. Also where is Apple Pencil support?

I am a paper guy. Since my 20s, I have kept a journal, though not always as disciplined as I'd like. Still, I have recorded the events, big and small, that have moved me along my path.
For much of that time, until 2011, I used journals purchased at stores, and I have a neat row of them as proof. I occasionally visit all of them to look back the long years and reminisce. Sometimes, I even decipher my old, fading chicken scratch writing!!
Day One changed my process. I ALWAYS have a journal on me, I can easily consult past posts, wherever I may be, and I can always read my writing!!
Apart from some issues with it changing stored-post locations on its own and me struggling to find where they went, it's been a great and faithful tool to capture my thoughts as I unfold this Life.

I really like its seamless syncing and the capacity to include multiple photos. Clean design, sometimes almost a bit too clean as I struggle to figure out how to do simple things like change the date of an entry.  All doable.  But it has been a companion now for 3+ years and I'm very glad of that fact. Highly recommended.
A beautiful comprehensive journal app. This is it.
desirable diary APP!
This app is a saviour
Very simple and easy to use. Cool interface.
Used it and journaled for 20 minutes before it crashed and I lost everything I'd written. Guess it's good to know early that it's unreliable.
Been using this for years, great app!

In general I really have no complaints. I've been using this app for like six months and I love going back and reading about myself, remembering little jokes with my friends, and seeing how I've changed. Before this, I'd tried keeping other diaries but it never worked because I forgot about it, or I lost my notebook, or my hand got too tired so my handwriting started to get really bad. 

With this app you just type. You don't have to worry about running out of pages, or someone finding it and reading it. (Unless u have a bad passcode) 

My only complaint is that I've noticed recently that when you look back to read entries, the scrolling thing is really really messed up. It just like pauses for a full minute and then jumps down the whole page. Please fix so the app can be perfect again!!!

Any app that can get me to journal is a winner! Really easy to use, love adding pictures and having the app set the date and time to the picture. Just got the Mac version - great way to make it easy for me to journal. Look ing back at my entries is a great way to remember and reinforce memories.
Full score

I could sing this app's praises as everyone else has done, but I think they've said it all for me!
There are a few things that I think would make it absolutely perfect, such as:
‚Ä¢Being able to add videos and live photos,
‚Ä¢The 'tag music' feature including third party music streaming services like Spotify,
‚Ä¢(And, I know this is small, but) being able to force touch photos for preview when adding them. 

Otherwise awesome app - I look forward to updates in the future!
Love this app. Photo journaling made easy. Import multiple photos, add a title, then add incites and observations. Syncs flawlessly.

I've tried many ways of keeping a diary - pen and paper, various other apps - and this one is the only one I've managed to stick with longer than a few weeks. Photos and location make for great entries, and multiple journals allow for logging various different things. Highly recommend.

DayOne 2 helps me to finally get started with writing daily notes on a regular basis, thanks to the easy interface and use, and by gently reminding me at a time of day I can choose myself. Adding a photo is also an attractive option: pictures are often more illuminating than words.
A wish of mine: a built-in (i.e. offline) help file and an introductory tutorial for the first steps - the you-tube clips are nice but too short.

Since I bought it about a week ago, I've been logging my day activities, ideas, thoughts, opinion, feelings, and anything that I wanted to remember someday and reminisce. I've been using it like every time, all the time.

Day One has been my favorite journaling app for years. I use a lot of notes apps and am a heavy Evernote user but Day One has a major place in my daily routine for a few reasons. 

- Day One is the perfect app for date based jornaling. It encourages regular use and ties entries to the calendar day well. It reminds you of entries on this day from previous years to help you retrospect. 
- Privacy is a major factor in any app where you're recording personal information and Day One's touch ID integration gives piece of mind 
- As a IFTT user I can automate a lot of information into various Day One journals for a comprehensive picture of my life in a daily snapshot.
Challenges me to take a picture everyday.
Incredibly well designed and user-friendly. I am really enjoying journalling for the first time with this app
A very good product
It doesn't sync well across devices and is riddled with bugs.
Love that I can have multiple journals and being able to upload pics.

column9: Data scandal - not funny at all
column10: Day One is one of these extremely useful gems, that turn into rot when economics kick in. Functionality, usability - all fine. I would even pay more money for regular updates. But: these are my private thoughts. No encryption? Non at all? And then you want to save these unencrypted texts and fotos on your private servers. Well if I want the world to know my private life I turn to Facebook. Bloom Built will have to make a decision: Care about users with the best jounal app or be another rip-off data fraud that will come and go as soon as people realize what the hell is happening with their most private thoughts. I will never use this app again as long as these things aren‚Äôt fixed.

been usibg this for 3days.
enjoying it very much.

can improve with reminder feature for birthday n special ocassion.

column9: CYRILLIC AND ROMAN FONTS DON'T MATCH!!!!
column10: GUYS, PLEASE, ADD A FONT FOR CYRILLIC. I'm Russian and I use both my native language and English while writing and... FONTS DON'T MATCH. It really bothers me, 'cause I just payed a lot of money to purchase the app which is not half as perfect as I expected, so I'm really upset and I wish you would pay some attention to my review and MAKE THE BEST APP EVEN BETTER FOR ONE MORE TIME.

column9: I hope I can trust this company!:)
column10: I have been using this app since 2011 when it was first released. I paid $9.99 at that time and never had major trouble but it has always been one of my favorite apps. Now I found that they have released a new version and I was debating myself rather to get it or not. First, I didn't like to pay extra $5.49 but soon I was convinced that they've worked hard on developing a new version so they might deserve it and considering how much I make use of this app, I'm willing to pay. Second, I really didn't like the fact that I need to use their own sync system NOT iCloud which I've been using. It's simply because I count on Apple iCloud...I want to keep my precious journals to a server that will likely last until I'm alive:p I hope dayone as a company survive and support their users as long as iCloud would do. This app is simply a wonderful diary app as long as they can keep our data safe.

If your intention to keep a daily journal or simply to log impromptu thoughts and experiences, then this is the app to use. Location data, photos and even weather can be added to each entry . A great feature is setting yourself to be reminded to expound on the day's goings on and also to be reminded of past entries on a given day. This latter feature is great for reflection and to remind you just how things change.
Nice, easy to use. Helps keep track of all the important things in life

A great app that's easy to use, aesthetically pleasing and keeps me from posting inane stuff to social media - if it's important to me but inane to others it goes in Day One. If it's good for the internet then it goes in both Day One and social media.
Exactly what you need for all your journal needs.

I've been writing journal entries once a day for two years with the old Day One app. I was upset that I couldn't do simple things like put multiple photos on one entry. Fortunately this app does it all and then some. I still do my daily journal entries and look forward to doing them even more.
Live this journal and love the prompts
Can't live without it.
Simple, beautiful, easy to use. Love it!

column9: Great day to day journal tool
column10: Works from everywhere to keep in connected.

Lag on iPad mini 2, to the point that the keyboard takes few seconds later to register what I typed. Then the app crashed and half of what I had typed was gone. 

I used to be a fan of this app when it started (previous version). A journaling app that cannot even ensure smooth typing is a big disappointment.
Love the organization and ease of use. You can organize your thoughts and activities in different journals, add photos and memories.
Much much much worse than the classic version
Best app ever!
I've tried many others...this is by far the best!
I love it. Day One is simple to use. It comes with many features that make your journal entries richer. The best feature is that it works without all the nonsense of other apps.

The app feels incomplete at export and presentation layout. It does a good job at keeping track of all data on what you're doing, where you are, the music you are listening to, your activities, the weather.... I want to create a nice looking travel journal with pictures, map cutouts, some layout possibilities... I can see how people can like this app purely for journaling, but it's missing media rich output possibilities at this moment for me. I want more like a media rich travel journal I can export to nicely layed out pdfs and this is not it.
When it comes to keeping a journal, this is by far my favorite app. While improvements can still be made, it is still by far one of the best I've used.

I am an avid journalist. Hand writing has gotten harder due to  carpal tunnel, with this app it has become easier. And I love how I can do it anywhere and anytime. 

It is easy to use. User friendly.
Well designed, great feature set. Perfect
Love the app, but it crashes just about every time I open it.   Unfortunately, this has gone on for months.   I keep hoping one of the updates will make it more stable.

Useful discussion in the reviews below. Here is the full passage concerning "license to your content" from the Terms of Use as of Dec 23, 2016:
"License to Your Content: Subject to any applicable account settings that you select, you grant the Company a fully paid, royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable, worldwide, royalty-free, non-exclusive and fully sublicensable right (including any moral rights) and license to use, license, distribute, reproduce, modify, adapt, publicly perform, and publicly display, Your Content (in whole or in part) and/or to incorporate it in other works in any form, media or technology now known or later developed, for the purposes of operating and providing the Company Properties to you and to our other Users. Before that scares you off, keep reading. We know these rights seem broad, but we are trying to cover all of the use cases for Your Content in one sentence ‚Äì otherwise, this Agreement would be even longer. Don‚Äôt worry ‚Äì this does not mean that all Content you provide us will be made publicly available. We will use Your Content in accordance with the settings in which you submitted such Content, as detailed under our Privacy Policy . To be clear, if Your Content is a journal entry or page, the default is private to you. Please remember that other Users may search for, see, use, and reproduce any of Your Content that you ‚Äúpublish‚Äù on the Company Properties. You warrant that the holder of any worldwide intellectual property right, including moral rights, in Your Content, has completely and effectively waived all such rights and validly and irrevocably granted to you the right to grant the license stated above. You agree that you, not the Company, are responsible for all of Your Content that you Make Available on or in the Company Properties."

In a nutshell, read the privacy policy closely! I would certainly hope this can be improved as it does seem a scarily broad license! Why not tighten it up a bit?
This app is something which has out grown it's own Importance...the more you use it, the more it works
I love this app and the ability to journal anywhere!!

Nice application to write your journal, its full complete

Actually im write after watch "that anime"

Day one is great! 

It is seamless in how it integrates with pictures, dates, location and being able to create different types of journal topics with tags across the entire platform.

It allows me to write what I want when I want. 

Could use some improvements... I like the idea of having a section specifically for moods. Maybe a drop down menu or even to just leave it open ended. 

Am I able to create checkbox lists? Or strike out through the line?
Sleek and elegant. Easy to use and its the best journal you can have...because its always with you!
This is a great app, I use it as an electronic baby book and love that I can print it and send it to family!
Easy to use and lovely to read old entries.
And it works with IFTTT appletsüëçüèª
The best app for writing my life daily.  We don't need any word to express the best of this app.

column9: Finally a path to journaling that works
column10:
Works for me at least!  It's convenient and the ability to add photos/images makes it interesting. Photos jump off the page and has the power of immediate recollection and emotion that just writing lacks. 

I'm enjoying this thoroughly!

I'm being using this app for months and is great!
I've tried other journals apps but in my opinion this is the best of all.
It's a must have app.

I find day one extremely useful, especially now that it supports multiple journals. It gives me a place to leave my gym workout information, notes about what happened at work (we all need that every year for our performance reviews!) and a personal diary that I fill in on occasion as well.

Works without friction. Even easier to use with something like Drafts, which lets me save text to multiple applications.

Highly recommended!
Easy to use and record
No words to describe how much I love this app!

I was using Narrato, but upon trying to export my entries I discovered the Narrato website is gone, the iOS app also gone. Needing to journal, I read some reviews and made the jump to Day One (v2.1.1). It is excellent. Exports entries to pdf, and has a macOS Sierra counterpart which syncs to the iOS app.
If you journal and aren't using Day One- you are missing out.
The app is worth every penny and it is extremely easy to sync your thoughts with locations and pictures.

Just perfect. Great simple interface, great usability, and all the features you'd want in such an app.
And it works flawlessly.
I just love the app! It has so many options. I use it everyday.
Would be five stars, except it locks up or gets really slow when entering or editing text sometimes.

I use day one to keep my dairy and it is very easy to use, I love the UI which makes me want to write something just by looking at it. The only thing I would suggest is introducing a way to sync all my data from the day one classic version on my MacBook to the new version..
Only major disappointment is the hefty cost of the sister Mac app

I feel like this app brings everything that is good in my life together. 
The pictures I take, the feelings I have, the inspirational messages that motivate me to be better, are at the tip of my fingers, all day, everyday. 
    It's so easy to open Day One, type my feelings, or activities, throw in several pictures that speak volumes, and even texts, Facebook comments, or quotes I have copied, to paste in my there.  
   I also have it on my computer, but find I use my phone ninety percent of the time, because it's handy. When something happens, it can be recorded instantly, before I forget. 
   It's so easy to find anything you have recorded, through the tags and search. I love that feature. 
   I also print my Day One every year. It is formatted beautifully. I print it with my computer, and bind it for $3. 
    I've used this app for three years. It's my absolute favorite!
Easy using, clean and practical.
It is a good App

column7: Made a son by Jesus Christ
column10: ...as opposed to merely intending to. Provoked by DayOne. Thank you.

column9: Well structured, but awful word processing
column10:
I want to love this app.  It's well structured and offers good features for multiple topic-specific journals and incorporating photos, calendar and location into the journaling process.  However, the text entry and word processing functions are a ridiculous throwback to green screen days.  You need to use text symbols to mark words for bold or italic, make a bulleted list, etc.  Your input/edit screen shows these symbols without application and you need to finish to see how the text will really look.  Come on!  Is this 1975?

Put a word processing capability that works like Word or Pages into this product and it would be 5 star.
Liked it before the latest update. Love this version especially being able to add multiple pictures.
Needs updated!!!!!!!!!!

column9: Used to be good but ruined!
column10: I loved this app but they over worked it. Too many pointless features. Login used to be easy but not now. Doesn't work anymore like it used to. What a shame! Will look elsewhere and I would advise you do too.
I like it.  I use it for many things in addition to a journal program

column9: Really helps me get my thoughts together
column10: Great having the this was a year ago as well
How do I get a refund? This product was sold with the feature of encryption. It's still not ready, with the last update in August. I want my money back.

column9: Have enjoyed in both phone versions
column10: Decent quaint Dailey notes and journal

Love the way this swaps between iPad, phone, desktop etc so I can journal wherever I am. 
The create entry from photos is great, both from a reminder point of view but being able to store the photos in the entry makes it far better than other journals I've used previously. 
Great App!!
All intuitive to use. Very good work.

I haven't even noticed I still have this app. After they excluded iCloud for backup, 

it is only a novelty app 

and is no longer concerned with encryption or privacy.
I hadn't kept one in years, but the simplicity and availability of Day One has helped me get back into that routine.
Been looking for a journaling app and have tried a bunch. Day One fits the bill! Highly recommend
Lots of useful features and easy to use.  Dayone gets it right.
There's really nothing comparable to this app on the market. It's so worth it.
I love being able to type out my thoughts when I think them!! Also really love how I can add pictures and how the time stamps carry!!

I've always been a journaler. Now as a mom and business owner I find myself going months between entries. This app allows me to journal in bed at night with the lights out and my head resting on my pillow. Life changing. Seriously.

I really enjoy this app.  It is the best journaling app i have found so far and has great options and makes it super easy to capture mood and reflection; pictures and other media can be added easily while at the same time regular written word can be done simply and comfortably.  

I recommend this app to all dreamers, artists and thinkers.

So far this App is AMAZING. It allows me to capture realtime feelings, events and I can even start an entry and come back to it later. The fact that I can add pics which remind me to comeback and complete my journal entry later is pure awesomeness.
Simple and efective
Very easy app to use to log all kinds of daily data and activities. I would not be without it.
Really great app! I recommend it. I love to write everyday and being able to add pictures üëçüèª
I actually write in my journal now since it's not on paper with inky pens.
One of the best journaling apps out.

This is a great app. It's super versatile. I use it for journaling and keeping quotes as well.
It is stellar and well worth the asking price.
Wish I had it years ago. Be nice if it correlates a little better with other apps I use. The Strava data is inaccurate in its metrics
Good Job ! Hopefully the next updated version would allow more photos and not just 10

I love my app journal. I have always tried to keep a journal. With Day One, I have succeeded. 

So, simple, so easy to add pictures, so convenient. My days almost always begin with a daily entry. 

It is time for me to express my own matters. My thoughts do not need to go public, but they do need to come out of my heart, to objectified. 
I really,  really like Day One!
This is an excellent, user-friendly product! I highly recommend.
been meaning to keep a journal for a long time. this has made it enjoyable. would couple it with a habit forming app like streaks or omnifocus in the beginning.

Good cross-platform support.
Set up was easy if a bit fiddly.  I plan to use this to create a memorable diary of retirement.

column9: This app has motivated me to write
column10: This has helped me induce my creativity and has helped me release any emotions or stuck energy. It is an outlet where I can store my memories and create. It helps me to keep in check with my life, and helps me with self-discovery. Thanks! Journaling is great! :)

column9: great, quick and easy to use
column10: love this app!  an easy way to make one small memory each day of ordinary, everyday life. I find my teenage kids scrolling through it occasionally, just for fun....me too!  a quick photo with a comment, so easy. Great improvements in Vers. 2, like being able to save places that I use often, seeing all the tags at a glance, and others. Well done!

column9: Crashes have made the app unusable.
column10:
I love the app and use it everyday, I normally write 800-1000 words in one go, but a lot of writing gets lost when the app crashes and that happens at least 3-4 times in 1 session, not to mention the lag which kills the writing vibe.

I write in notes app and copy it in Day One, this has made me think thats its way too overpriced. Very disappointed.
The app has a cute and productive my design. It is certainly my official application of notes.

This is a great journalling app for anyone that is looking for an app that will help them document their daily lives!

It has multitasking, daily reminders, formatting, and metadata (such as the song you're listening to, the weather, location, etc.), which are all of the key things that you might need / want for an app like this.

I would like to see a Windows / Web implementation of this app, or at least some way to sync to a journalling app on my desktop, so that I can access them from many different places and not just my iPad Pro 12.9"

I am new at the journaling thing and OCD. I looked at sooooo many apps, read the reviews and then tried a few out. This one is awesome! Easy to use. Tons of features like adding pictures, links, etc. It also has options to automatically add health, location and weather info. 
But my favorite feature is that it allows multiple journals. This allows me to keep one as my personal diary and others for work, keeping notes on tenants, etc.
It can be synced in the cloud so no worries about losing your thoughts.

column9: Should work fine, but it keeps crashing
column10: Just downloaded this, and seems neat and user-friendly. But as I'm typing my entry, it crashed twice. Not very nice, since the entry I've been writing was not saved and means i have to re-type again. Am considering for a refund.

I downloaded this and was disappointed to find you've removed iCloud sync. It worked so well, whereas your own service has outages. I trust my very personal journal entries to be stored on iCloud much more than on your own servers (that aren't even encrypted!!). I refuse to use the app until iCloud sync is available again. Until then, classic is working well as it always has. But I'm extremely disappointed you've removed it from the App Store. Also disappointed you charged me, again, both iOS and macOS, for the apps I've already paid for. üòî
Really enjoying using this. Spent some time seeking a journaling app and this one fits the bill. Would recommend.
Beautiful and easy to use
And I've vetted all of them. Paid and unpaid. This is leagues above the rest.

Day One  can not be compared to any one 
category of apps. It is 
many. It is life style, productivity , it's photo 
and it's writing.  
And  that's just off the top 
of my head! I used to be a 
big fan of one of the first interactive journal apps, 
My Secret Diary. But when 
it went through a rough reformatting  period 
to catch up, I gave up 
digital journaling altogether.
I couldn't even  journal by hand, I had been spoiled!  

Then I discovered Day One. 
I mean ... 
It's secure. It can be synced or shared and it can easily 
be backed up. Day One is versatile, user friendly, convenient and accessible. The design is a functional
and visual success. It is an elegant creation and wildly  efficient . Don't hesitate.  
Just get it .

Day one is easy adds many details to my journal entries... now I can add more then one picture to anything I write!

It also shows where I've been that day,
The only thing that is missing is the possibility to add some audio data to the entries. The rest is super
If encryption of data is available I'll gladly change back to 5 stars.

I'm using Day One app since 2007. I wrote hundreds of entries on that app. It is very beautifully designed and reliable. I just wish to add videos since sometimes I just want to talk to camera and save the vlog on my journal privately.

column9: Just one journal entry, but I already love it.
column10: Initially, I stumbled around trying to figure out how to use this app. After finding a YouTube video which helped explain it, I found it was pretty intuitive. I've always wanted to journal, but never had the time to sit and write. Being able to dictate makes it so easy, and the ability to add pictures makes those memorable experiences even more so.

column9: Documenting my daughters life day to day
column10: Wonderful app. I've gotten so much joy from chronicling my baby's day to day. I don't care if someone "hacks" this journey. They'd be bored out of their minds. Have at it.

column9: Excellent way to capture the moment.
column10: Great upgrades - would like to sync to Dropbox and have encryption, would rate 5 stars if that was available.
I love this app. Easy to write, easy to use... let me to ad picture wherever I want. To have the amazing experience with this app buy it and you'll see.
Have always wanted to keep a journal but never got round to it. This method on my phone with its scrapbooky style and multiple journals is simple to use. Highly recommended

I've tried a lot of different journaling apps but this is by far the best.    It is easy to use, and the sinc between devices is seamless.  Both of these things make it more likely that I will journal.

column9: One of the best apps to grace my iOS devices
column10: I would give this app 6 stars and still not be over exaggerating. From keeping a journal it also records the temperature of that day, the time... one can take pictures for that day to keep with the journal notes. It has so many little enhancements that make journal keeping a joy every day.
I lost my photos and stuff btw was using iphone 6 when i captured all, when i change into ip7 i lost all of it it has been backswd up
The best app for diary!

column9: It's the best app out there for keeping a log/diary
column10:
DayOne is the best app out there. There is room for improvement on things such as exercise tracking. (Please work on this DayOne). 

Overall it is good. I've been using Day One for 4 1/2 years. The developers have done a good job with continually making the app better. 

(But having a way to integrate and log exercise from tracking devices like Garmin, would be over the top good.)
Love the new additions but very disappointed that there is no iCloud sync anymore:(
I have enjoyed using Day One for over two years now, and could not be more happy with an app like this.
So many regrets buying this

column9: Want to get journaling but aren't good at keeping up the habit?
column10: This app is fantastic. It's easy to use, it has reminders that aren't invasive and annoying, and most importantly the app itself has a lot of features that most others don't. The tagging system allows me to see the ups and downs as periods of my life. The lock lets me feel safe and free to write whatever I want. I would recommend to anyone who needs an outlet or journal
This is a lot of fun. So far I have found it very useful.
I use this app almost every day and love it.  And each update gets better.  Highly recommended...

column9: Journals should be inherently and indefinitely private.
column10:
Here is an excerpt from the terms and conditions that you won't see posted on the app store description:  

"...you grant the Company a fully paid, royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable, worldwide, royalty-free, non-exclusive and fully sublicensable right (including any moral rights) and license to use, license, distribute, reproduce, modify, adapt, publicly perform, and publicly display, Your Content (in whole or in part) and/or to incorporate it in other works in any form, media or technology now known or later developed..."

Think about what this means. As usual, we are in between being the customer and being the product.
I have used it since the first version, it really is an excelent piece of software!
I've been using for about 2 weeks. Having voice notes would've been nice. Especially from the Apple Watch.

I've been using this app for almost 2 years and it has most if the bells and whistles I was looking for in a journal.  Easy to use, organize, search, customize and it even backs up to iCloud and allows you to export your journals just in case you want a copy for whatever reason. I did notice something today that bothered me a bit, it's that you can only create 10 journal categories.  It would be nice if there were no limits but I guess this forces you to think about your journals and categorize them accordingly.  Good app. I recommend for sure. Oh and the Touch ID is nice too üòÄ

I keep track of everything with One Day. What household & car repairs and when they were done. (And cost). Medical test results, who we entertained, and what I served
I really like it that I can now add more than one photo. Thanks for the improvements

Exactly what I have been looking for.  I use both as a daily personal diary; and also use to keep notes on different subjects.  Tags are great for cross referencing.  Easy to import photos, drawings etc..  Using on multiple devices great using iCloud.
On iPhone 7 iOS.10.1., scroll on main page is laggy. Day one classic working much better than this new version.

This app is great for daily journalling, keeping track of life stuff, a junk journal, a thoughts and creative space journal. I am still exploring the options and so far extremely pleased with the quality.
... and enjoying using it.
Only draw back is no cloud sync to drop box or iCloud. I have been using since version one.
Really enjoyed the experience.

column9: Keep track of what you've done
column10: Great way to summarize your day, include pictures and location. Easy to use!

My three favourite writing / productivity apps are Evernote, Scrivenar (desktop) and now, Day One. 

It's beautiful, intuitive and makes you want to write. Can't recommend it highly enough.
Really a great app that I use every day. My only request would be, why don't they allow me to scribble in my notes too?

column9: Day One is elegant but limited
column10:
It's a nice journaling app, it's always had the most elegant design. It handles writing and photos and tags well.  

I wish I could tag people, and search by contact.  Then I would use it a lot more.
Many thanks to developers for the new version of the app. Very useful to have ability to make several different journals at one time.

column9: Liked it a lot before; love it now.
column10:
