The multiple photos per entry is a feature I have waited for, for a few years.
Now, I love it. I use it throughout my travels (been travelling for a couple of years), often to inspire my FB travel entries.
This app has helped me keep track of my thoughts and stay very sane.

column9: I journal several things a day
column10: I really love so many of the features of the DayOne app.  The touchID is my favorite - giving me peace of mind that my thoughts are protected but I have quick access to start writing.  But I also love that you can create multiple "books", use tags, stars - all for better organizing and later searching.  And I love one of the newest features where I can look back on past entries on the same day of the year - it gives me the opportunity to reflect on how far I've come in my personal growth or just appreciate all that I have experienced in my life.
Love it - great app to keep track of day to day events. 2 small children it's all to easy to let the moments pass you by. This has helped me to record special moments
Only limit is your creativity with what you can do with Day One!
Thanks to this app I'm keeping a diary for the first time in my life

I use it on Macbook, iPhone and iPad.  It is a perfect log book for all conversations or meetings throughout the day.  
My notes are always available to search and review.
This is "THE" journaling app!
The app makes very easy to record events and every aspect of the day. The developers continue to add timesaving functionality. Highly recommend it.
Love capturing my thoughts through this app. It's extremely intuitive.
Great compatibility and integration with third party apps. Was able to transfer text from other apps to DayOne.
hope the app for mac and ios support webdav or droxbox or onedrive‚Ä¶

The fact that it works with geolocation, will record the weather at the time is indispensable for travel- you can jot quick notes immediately and fill them out in detail at your leisure. I'm always discovering new facets of this app (like adding music!) Maybe future updates can include drawing/sketching?
I love the fact that I can upload more than one photo. I wish all the photos would be shown on the thumbnail.

column9: Great app for keeping a journal
column10: This app is just what I've been looking for to keep a record of my activities with pictures and links. Very easy to add entries.  Awesome app!
I like this app a lot for the simplicity of its design. I find myself using it a lot for journaling. I like the photo-integration feature, and the quotes as you log in are always thought provoking.
Makes it fun to keep a journal. Easy. The new timeline future, we are automatically pulls from your location, is outstanding!
I absolutely love how it reminds me to journal daily, how I can attach photos, etc! Overall wonderful App!!!
Beautiful, easy to use, and secure.
Just keeps getting better. Attractive, polished, professional, and easy to use.

column9: All time favorite app... Could not live without it
column10: This is the best app for journaling.  There is no other choice.  Buy it. Use it. Change your life.  Works like a charm.  Multiplatform. Syncs.  Unobtrusive.  Useful for personal thoughts and create another journal for logging work activities and thoughts.
Im grateful for this superb app
Help me to record my memories, really good app.

I can write down my ideas, record my location, create a tag so I can search for it later, attach photos and start an entry on my ipad and when I need to pick up and run, continue that same entry on my iphone. Seamless. Has everything I need. I can even voice record my entries on those days my fingers just won't type.
Excellent app. So easy and user friendly
Not only the best journaling app on the market, but also one of my favorite apps period. So many different ways to use this powerful application.
Whit this app you are selling your SOUL to the devilüë∫ you have to read the agreements i will lost 5 dolars but its the best thing that i can do  DONT BUY IT ,i deleted it üò°üò°üò°üëé
This is a great journal to carry on the go!

I can't figure out how to put a journal entry in it. I have a daily journal template and wanted to copy it daily with a new date and entry. I'm not very computer savvy but thought with all the positive reviews that this would be easier to use.

Very easy to use and lots of features like taking a photo or creating hashtags. It also records a lot of interesting things the moment you write an entry like music you're listening to, current weather, and location you're at. They can be configured if you don't want them. Syncs with iCloud if you're using more than once Apple device. Very satisfied!
If you're a Mac or iOS user ‚Äî this app is essential.  Get it!
I have never had a habit of writing a journal. This app make it so easy to write one while on the go and it is seamless. Great job!
Just the best to keep a journal
This is one of my favorite apps, it's super easy to use and I'm very happy and pleased with it!! :)
You won't regret it. A companion for life.
I really like that I can use IFTTT with this it makes it easier to actually use the app, instead of just getting nagged. I can see what I did that day and write about it later.
Best journal app by a mile.

Multiple journals are amazing! The ability to add multiple photos is a huge plus! The only downfalls is as of yet you can't add video and for some odd reason you can tag anything while adding something from outside the app! But even with those 2 issues it's totally worth every penny!! Well done guys!
I've enjoyed using this - the option to have multiple diaries (for different themes/occasions) is super useful and exactly what I was looking for.

I use the main journal as a daily
journal.  A second journal to track all medical events and notes. A third journal to track jobs ( I have one note for each client to keep current to dos and to which I post emails noting things that need immediate attention). 

It's versatile and VERY enjoyable to use.

I had a friend recommend this app to me, and it has revolutionized journaling for me! Absolutely love being able to have multiple journals, attaching photos, tagging, and date and time and temp stamps are all major positives for this app. Highly highly recommend!!

column9: Took time to start liking it
column10: When DayOne converted to this new version from 1.0 I wasn't happy. Since that time I have become satisfied with application and find it very useful for keeping my journal.
Dayone is like a best friend: always there, trusted, easy to share with, remembers everything, and a joy to be with.
Awesome app. Use everyday. Attractive design, big functionality.

column9: A MUST for every person that journals.
column10: This is by far the best way to journal. It's ideal whether you need to capture a thought, memory or idea. And it's very convenient no matter where you are or what you're doing since there are versions for iPhone, iPad and even Apple Watch! I love the ability to add pictures, tag entries and include weather/date/time stamps. Started out with the free version and graduated to the 2.0! You won't be disappointed!
I am using this app for tracking my daily activities, my mood and my weight loss journey. Love that you can add photos. Very easy to use.

works great with other apps, and also has a desktop version.

I use it absolutely every day‚Äîit makes it possible (in combination with another app called "Workflow") to keep a meaningful diary every day.

column9: I really do love this app
column10: I love using Day One. It is simple and intuitive. I have the iOS and Mac version and love them both. I love that it tells me about past entries on a day and I can relive those great memories. A great app.

column9: A great app and getting greater each moment!
column10: When I first started using DayOne it provided a great way for me to track my own journaling by allowing me to easily go back and find previous entries, to review my history, and to add new entries to old entries, to put tags and even a photo or two. Now that the next version has been born it is a great step to expanding on all the great things I've desired as I've grown up with it. For me, it is a great addition to my life.
A good app to use as a journal. Excellent backups and works very fast! Highly recommended!
I held off in upgrading to 2.0, but I'm so glad I did it!  The ability to upload 10 pictures within an entry is worth the upgrade fee alone.
I use this daily..journaling after my morning meditation. It's perfect.

column9: Nice app, but can't sync with iCloud or Dropbox
column10: Day One Classic allowed the user to sync with different cloud servers. This iteration forces you to use Day One's sync. And unencrypted no less! I'm worried about investing time writing my journal only to find the company shutting down the sync service or starting to charge a subscription fee. I'd prefer the ability to select my cloud provider (at least iCloud and Dropbox), encrypt my data, and have confidence the pricing model won't change after I'm locked in with hundreds of entries.

column9: This is your app for Journaling
column10:
If you're looking for an app for writing a diary or journal, here it is. DayOne is the absolute best app in this category.
I've never written in a paper journal for more than a week or two, but I write thousands of words a week using DayOne.
The app is so polished and intuitive, DayOne has been the best thing I've ever bought from the app store.
Great way to keep a running journal

Excellent app and can highly recommend. 
One problem though. No video support. These days people regularly use video to record their experiences. Why doesn't this app allow users to save their video? 
In my opinion, until this has been sorted the app will be 3* but could so easily be 5*.
Title says it all.
Constantly crashing on iPhone 6. Had enough....app deleted.  Lazy developers!!

column9: If you would like to try Journaling, this is the one
column10: I have been using this journal app for a couple years now. It is easy, creative and a joy to write in every day. The latest version allows me to add more than one picture which I do all the time. I add music and have a great time every morning composing my thoughts. I really like the ability to look back one year ago to see what life was like. I send the year ago today to my wife and she like seeing them every day. It has become a favorite part of my day writing in this app.

I love to use this app when I am traveling - to keep my family up to date with where I go and to show them photos and also to give me a great reference in the future. V2 is great because you can add more than one photo, BUT, it nowhere near as easy to share with others as v1 was. Please add this feature.
Seriously, the best journal software out there. Love that it is so easy to navigate. Awesome app, well done.

column9: Greatest. Have used it for years
column10: Clearly the best journal for all my devices.
That is all :)
Love the app - works great, and I trust it with my memories

column9: I finally made the move to v2
column10:
I've been holding off upgrading to v2, as I also use the mac app, and it's a little expensive for me at the minute. However, I took the plunge and bought the new version for the iPhone and iPad and I'm really glad I did.

Multiple journals was one of the biggest selling points, as I can now have a work as well as a private journal. Multiple pictures per entry is also very nice to have.

Another nice feature is the "on this day" notification. Surprising how much I forget. It's also a big spur to get me to actually make (meaningful) entries on a daily basis!

No problems with syncing, and all works well on an iPhone 7 and iPad pro.

Highly recommended.
Really good journal app. The only thing missing is the ability to make headlines and change the text to make it more personal with cursive and fat and underlining...
Best journal app available but still missing a few features which Facebook enables which would make it perfect... in desperate need of a check-in function!!

One of the cleanest note taker amongst many.
Bonus camera function included.
Fingerprint lock function rarely works,and I cannot find a calendar function.

I've used this app for several years,  beginning with the classic version. This version has several useful improvements, however the inability to use iCloud as storage means it will quickly fill your device memory. Splitting entries into yearly journals can help this, but then you lose some of the nice features in this version. Hopefully full access to iCloud storage will be added soon. I've already asked for it...
Fantastic app, except I don't understand why it needs to use my location while I'm not using the app? Should just ask for minimal permissions on location.

I have always had a problem journaling and even with me trying to do it on paper. This not only allows me to look back and see what has been going on with my life. I do a brain dump at the beginning of the day (have a journal called brain dump) to just get out of my own head. Day One allows me to keep that journal separate from other moments in my life.
This app is awesome!

Its so much easier when you can just wake up and write on your phone. I love how its password protected and also how you can insert photos from your phone. Makes me very mindful and helps me work through some problems.

This is by far my favorite, most trusted iPhone and Mac app. It is also the one I depend on most! The capabilities are endless, the support staff unbeatable. The updates frequent, the reliability unparalleled.

I have tried many other similar apps and I truly believe this is the best one for me.  I like thing to be simple.  Simple to get information in and simple to get it out.  I do not like a bunch of bells and whistles as they distract or just get in the way.  The interface is clean and easy to enter my thoughts.  Changing notebooks is easy and keeps my entries well organized. When the desire arrives to get an old school hard copy of a journal, this app provides a clean printout of the journal and that is unusual in the current times 

Simply a great way to do mime the my life.
App does just what I need. I just wish you could also embed video into an entry line you can images.

This is an awesome app and I would give it five stars if I had the ability to also write/draw/doodle on the pages, in addition to adding photos and typing. Then it could be a complete journal solution, for sure.

I know that if U want to write You should not find exceptions as You do not have a right tool/app to do it. But...I was in such situation. I may say that DayOne enabled be to start writing. Simple but not simplistic interface, very intuitive and encoiraging to start and be regular in You writing. The way how the program works - suports You in writing. 

New version is a good evolution. I regret that there is no package to get iPhone and Mac versions together. 

Download and write. Everyday.
It's good to have a habit using this journal for all sorts of notes, reminders, photo stories, and web page posts. Love this app.

The lack of security it a big issue if you use app for private information, if you do not want it seen in public do not put it in this app.
But the app it is Fantastic . Even better now that there are multi journal functions and an event can have more than one picture attached. I have used for couple of years it is simple and quick to use. Great app.

column9: Best Journal App I've Ever Used
column10: So many great features and user friendly!

What a great app. I bought it a year ago and only now started using it to help me journal may way through this recent election. It is doing the trick. I'm hooked in it and now an avid user. Thx for a great product.
Constantly impressed with this piece of software. An elegant interface coupled with rich journaling ability. Would recommend completely without reservation.
No surprises. Day one delivers on everything it says.

Haven't kept a journal in some time. Glad to do it again. This app makes it so straightforward. Further the tagging capability plus the multiple journal feature really makes it easy to gather, organize, and review.
The best!
I am enjoying keeping track of small and big thoughts on each day and recording this in such a simple format with added features. Get this app!

I've tried nearly all the journal apps out there, as well as other comprehensive filing systems for notes. However, Dayone is always my go to for journaling. TextExpander and Markdown support, simply amazing.
I am grateful for this app. Won't mind buying version 3 when it comes out. It is a low friction way to record random events and feelings every once in a while.
Finally upgraded to the "pro" version. I like it very much. I like the search function! Hoping to add more photos from my Photos to better remember wonderful travels with friends and family!
I recommend it.

I started with a desire to keep a personal journal to maintain a retraceable trail of my experiences, thoughts, and insights. But once engaged in Day One I wanted to fine-tune my notes. Now I have three journals, one for each of my major interest areas. Day One is user friendly and flexible. I've only been using it for a week but it has been perfect, so far!
For journaling. Would be greater still if you could reference emails. 1 star open for improvement :-)
This app always works. It is powerful and is feature rich. But most importantly gives you the ability to take your journal wherever you go. I use this app more than any other I have.

It is really an excellent app for journal writing. I have only recently developed an interest in writing journals and I was looking at all those apps that helped you keep daily journals. I've read many comments about Day One Journal and many people recommend that. I was hesitating at first because it costs you five bucks on this but I then decided to give it a try(among all those journal apps, I was slightly attracted by its app iconüòÇüòÇ). And I found it really a good app and worth of the money. It is clear, simple, well-designed. You can take photos directly using the app to record beautiful moments. It allows you to add tags, to record the places and weather if you want, and add musics and activities and many other things. Give it a try and it really worths it. It also motivates you to keep writing. Fabulous!
Great! I just love this apps from the simplicity layout and it really help me on my job
Good app

I've been trying to find a way to keep a journal for over a decade. I just find the time to sit and write in a traditional journal so I just don't do it. I found this app and I've written more the past month than I have the past decade! Love that you can add pictures and locations. Love this app!!

column9: Easy to Use and Clean UI
column10: I started using this app a few days ago and it has really rejuvenated my journalling life. The ability to link the song I'm listening to, photos I've taken, and the thoughts in my head all in one place is incredibly nice. The UI is clean, dates easy to find, and the widgets are fun to use to. Cloud integration so that I could use it on my iPad too is a great feature. Worth the $5 I spent to pay for this app.
Enjoying the app so far. Great interface
Easy to use, and love that pictures can be added. It's also accessible from many devices, so picking up what you were on is easy.

My biggest motive in starting to write down what I do everyday came from the motivation to remember. Just remember anything. My confidence in myself fell each time I couldn't recall a moment from the past completely like I wanted to. It was disheartening. But now I just make it my habit to write. Sometimes I'm technical and I include a lot of the details of my day. Other times I'll choose a specific moment where I was really present and describe how I was in that moment. What I felt, what I though and analyzing my actions. Just taking a moment to pause and reflect on my life has been good for me.

Also being able to add all those photos makes the experience that much more enriching.
Works smooth

I love to journal and since purchasing my Ipad Pro I am wanting to do more "online".  I was using my NOTES section that comes with the iPad, but wanted a place that was more private and also a place to organize long term.  One Day is the best $5 purchase I've made!  I love the color coding of each journal! (Pink-Devotions, Green-Health).  The only thing I would LOVE to see is a better editor for iPad.  I would love to be able to highlight and position notes so they are prettier.  But those are just minor things that would add icing.
Great App!
Wonderful app with great features and design. Looking forward to future developments!

And I mean writers of any sort. I use this app for my day to day journal, my poetry, and my occasional lyrics. The fact that you can make several different journals and call them for the different things you write about makes this a very versatile and handy app. I'm pretty picky with which apps I get and don't usually write reviews but I had to for this one. It has made lots of things in my life easier. Before I was buying notebook after sketchbook after whatever else, this way it's saved to the cloud, and it lessens the amount of books that I buy for the same things that I use this one app for.

Now that you can add multiple photos to each entry this has gone to 5 star rating for me. I download photos from my camera daily and add a description of what I have seen and done each day on my travels. Because it is so user friendly I actually manage to keep up the journey for the entire trip even if it is several weeks in length.
Have been using Day One for a few years, I really love it, it's a great app.
Works well
What can I say I love it!   And I've been able to sync the one on my iPhone to my Mac which is epic!!! And the tech support is Ace!!! (Thanks Adam!) :-)

This app is so easy to use! Memories frozen in time, thoughts shared, reflections in writing all are fun and useful to read again and add perspective to your life. Love the ease of adding photos - really helps capture important, funny, touching moments. Kudos to the developers!

column9: Haven't missed a day in two years
column10: Looks beautiful. Records a bunch of stuff automatically (weather, location, steps taken). Love that we can now add more than one image in this version.

I really like the concept I recommend it to everyone.. it crashes and makes it difficult to commit.
If I would commit to journaling my journey daily then I would probably give it a 5

It's a good app, you can export your entry's to PDF, that hooked me. The interface is alright, takes a bit getting use to, but it's fun. However, it's still a bit laggy at times. But this should be fixed in future updates I trust.

UPDATE:
Used it a while, it's unstable AF.
Lost pages of text due to a random crash. PLEASE FIX

When you have a terrible memory, day one is there for you to keep a record of your days and the little things that happen in your life. Great way to include social media, calendar event and help you fill your journal.

I use this app daily now, it's integral in my life. I only wish lists could be numbered or bulleted. Sure you can do it manually with markdown, but other apps like iawriter and bear have numbered lists that behave like day ones bulleted list. That's literally my only feedback, it's so good! End to end encryption isn't a huge concern for me, but I do recognize the importance there.

I have enjoyed using the app Day One. I reminds me to write something everyday. I love that I can add pictures of my day and view the month of entries scanning the photos. Great app for the light-hearted journal-er.

column9: A daily reminder to be a writer
column10:
I enjoy how you can set it up everyday to remind you "it's time to pour out some of your thoughts, dreams, stories".
I'm exploring this amazing app but it's an amazing journal
Which is whatever you want to write about every day, or whenever, or multiple journals, pix, etc!

Latest update is trash. Laggy, constantly crashes, puts the activity as walking even though I'm sitting in a chair with my iPad on the table not moving at all. Used to work so perfect, even on a iPad two years older than this one. Now it just lags, freezes, crashes and makes me lose 10-20 minutes of typing. I try to save it every few minutes to not lose as much but it's still annoying.

column9: Terrific app for academic project journaling
column10:
I purchased Day One with the intent of upping my daily writing through personal journaling, but have found myself using it instead to maintain daily notes and ideas on complex projects. It's been a wonderful and transformative experience.  The interface is not only clean and intuitive, but everything just flat works (including the sync) in a very snappy way.  This inspires me to use it at the end of every work day and I've since developed the positive habit of project journaling.  This allows me to pick up every morning exactly where I left off the night before, eliminating the considerable warm up time that I used to spend every morning after arriving at my desk.  

Because I work with data and programming languages, my one big wish for the app is that it improves tables support and offers the opportunity to insert code blocks in native formats (like, for example, R or Stata).  

In short, I could not be more enthusiastic about the app.  Kudos and thank you to the developers for creating something so versatile, so solid and so enjoyable to work with.  Keep up the great work.

column9: App is very easy to use
column10: I haven't found any clutches/crashes so app is very stable. Pleased to say. üëç
Use every day and never disappoints.

Love this app. I can keep track of so many things with it, including travel itineraries and activities. One of my favorite features is that you can add a picture that automatically puts in location, weather, and time and date. I like that it syncs, and I can saving PDF or PNG or screenshot.
Excellent interface!
I really like this app and that you can have different entrys plus photos and weather and reminders of what you have written earlier. I would just like more styles to chose from.
Seriously such a wonderful app. Whether you're into taking notes for class or recording events that happen to you during the day, Day One is an awesome app to record all of it.
Love this app and in my opinion the best one. Recommend highly!!!
Easy to track daily events and a good record of your days. It was worth the money I paid for it! I totally recommend it!

One of my two favorite apps. A great way to keep a diary. I love finally being able to put multiple pics on a post. DayOne sync has worked reliably from the start. Highly recommended.
I particularly like the fact that you can access easily this day last year and the years before.  Also that it allows you to export a PDF file of your journal

column9: Pdf cr√©ation does not work anymore
column10: I use and like this app for a while but for the last 2 months, it's impossible to create PDF and makes the app crash. Despite support contacted, No solution was found. Please work on an update ASAP or I'll have to move to another app... :-/
Encryption is the most important feature in an app such as this, 5 stars when it comes.

column9: If you want to start journaling regularly, this is the way to do it.
column10:
I am terrible at getting new habits to stick. I can usually push through for a few weeks to a month, then I trail off. With Day One, I just finished 1 full year of regular journaling! The convenient reminders, shared access from my Mac, iPad, iPhone, and Apple Watch, and inviting interface made it easy for me to stick to my goals.

I really like all of the changes in version 2.0. Multiple journals for separating different types of entries is particularly nice.

The one thing that I miss from the old version is the ability to publish entries, and the one thing that I wish they would add is support for markdown checklists e.g. '[x]' like Github's.
Very happy with this app

I never write reviews. I love this app so much. The level of interaction with everything is amazing. I've been using it for almost one month and I'm still in love with it. I like the gps, photo and calendar integration as well as the watch app.

Far and away my favourite journal app. Does what I want, updates are always an improvement and it syncs quickly and seamlessly on my mobiles and desktop. I seldom give five stars but Day One earns them.

Where's end to end encryption you promised for version 2.1?

Since you forced people to use your personal sync system, full encryption should be implemented from the beginning.
Perfect for what it is intended to.
Easily the best journaling app!

column9: Great app but needs 2 things for 5 stars
column10:
Great app. Tried others and this one just does it for me. Aesthetically it's much more pleasing than it's competitors and it's a very fluid app. Usually runs great. Does have a bug where if you're typing a lot sometimes it slows the app down; kill and restart fixes but still annoying. These two things would make it 5 stars for me. 

1. Sync across devices. I've had so much pain with them on this. Seriously had to do a profile fix like 3 times and I'm not sure what that even does. Must refresh an API plugin for their server or something.  It's an atrocious implementation though. They need to use iCloud or Dropbox or google drive or anything else really. If they can get it fixed then great but iCloud just seems so much more straight forward and easier since it's pretty much baked in for use. 
2. Features. Would be great for more editing tools like annotation on a picture or lists and things. It doesn't recognize when I'm trying to number things and that's annoying. 

Overall, Great app and it's my go-to for journaling. Love it. Just needs a couple things to make it awesome.
Using it to help me to keep track of my health.
I like how we are told of memories (same as FB). The biggest change is how FB, Twitter and Instagram can all be synced.

column9: Get it, Use it...Life is worth remembering
column10: Love this app!!  I learned the importance of journaling when I was in High School...wish I was more consistent with it, but this app really helps with that!  I like that I can publish it to FB or other places if I want, or just keep it private!   If you are looking for a way to keep track of life, this is it!  I love it, I use it, You Should TOO!

column9: This app is just write, pun intended
column10: I have never been a journaled before but this app makes it very easy. It is simple to use rather than a distraction
It crashes when logging the items, love the app but it need to work!
Hopefully this app will last for the next 10 years because I write a lot of my memories here.

I can't quite put my finger on it, but journaling in Day One 2.0 is just that much more pleasurable. It has won me back from using Evernote as a journal. 

When you open Day One, it's like stepping into the quiet corner of a caf√©. Whereas I put all my IDEAS in Evernote, all my REFLECTIONS go to Day One. Everything about it just nudges you gently into a reflective, introspective state. Where Evernote is like a digital trapper keeper, Day One is the digital version of your weathered, dog eared, leather bound notebook. 

There's no overlap between them, and I rely on them both.
Love this app. The recent updates around photos and multiple devices make it easy to synch memories and draft entries from whatever device I'm using wherever I am. Keep up the good work!
At hand journal 24/7, I love it. Easy, simple, all the right options.

I was an idiot who jumped into buying this app because of the stellar rating without checking the negative reviews.  Had I had the sense to do this I would have never purchased the app due to the lack of encryption coupled with the fact that everything I would enter in this journal is stored - unencrypted - on a third-party server (for syncing purposes) thereby making my journal easily available to hackers, the developer, or even government agencies.  This is completely and totally unacceptable! I don't care how many cool features this app has.  A journal without the utmost guarantee of privacy is a horrible thing to charge money for.  I may as well write in a literal diary with one of those tiny little locks on it and then just leave it laying around where anyone with a pair of scissors can find it and cut it open.  $5 down the toilet.
Thx.

My mentor, Jim Rohn, always stressed religiously, the significant importance of keeping a daily journal. 
I tried relentlessly for years but never managed to do it consistently, as I never had my journal with me when I needed it. ONE DAY is with me all the time as it is on my smartphone. Since I have started using it I write my daily goals in it, my daily lessons in it, my achievements. 
I can now fully understand why Mr.Rohn preached the use of a journal so passionately.

It is so much easier to keep a journal with this app and I am extremely happy with it. After comparing with several apps, I have found this is the one can be used for business as well as personal purpose.  It even makes tracking workout easy.  If I had found it earlier there wouldn't be so many missing entries in my hand written journals in the past few years.  The functions are well designed and simple to use. I would highly recommend it.
Great to look back on things!

I really enjoy using this app. Nice interface, great for people on-the-go with not much time to write in a traditional journal.  Great for keeping thoughts organized and tagged.

Not so great for attaching files. Pictures are not a problem; but not being able to attach an email or a PDF, is a big deal. Need to take pics/screenshots of everything, a bit of a pain. Hope this is being considered for the next update.

column9: Not Perfect but Really, Really Close
column10:
Most journals include thoughts, ideas, memories and self reflections as entries. It would be really cool if there was an easy way to set reminders within an entry to come back and explore, add to it, or review those entries later.

It would be even better if we could record voice memos or dictate directly into an entry to get ideas out of our heads and into Day One.

Currently there is no way to set reminders on an entry to further explore the idea or finish a thought to an entry.
Good layout and easy to use but it stalled a few times and I was worried I would lose my work.

column9: I love it EXCEPT the keyboard lags
column10:
Running on an iPhone 5S or an iPad Mini 1 (I know, I'm behind the times) the in-app keyboard lags, making typing frustrating. I make many more typos in it than I do in the Notes app because of this. The first word typed is particularly troublesome, as the app tends to recognize the first and maybe second letters, then struggles to keep up and it mis-autocorrects the first word as a result.

I changed the body font to Georgia, so perhaps this is the reason...?

Second, the app should automatically go into edit mode when I click on any text I've written, rather than require me to click the Edit button. This is my journal, after all! Trust me - if I didn't want my text changed, I wouldn't have tapped on it!

The slow typing problem notwithstanding, I love this app very much. I love how it integrates time stamps, weather, temperature, step count, and location along with customizable tags. I use tags to track stress headaches for my doctor, as well as coffee intake to see whether the two are related.

Typically, I take a photo while I make an entry, simply because I like that each entry has a photo beside it - even if it is unrelated for the most part.

I now have upgraded Day One on all my devices, including my Mac, and the syncing is seamless.

Great work - just fix the keyboard issue please.

----
Update 10/27/16

The new "journal entry" feature adds unnecessary complexity. I would prefer the "quick-entry" ability so when I click the plus icon, I can type.

The lag upon opening is still there. These two aspects detract from what could be a nearly perfect app.

Like the app but have two issues.  I strongly suspect that finanacial motives drive this:
They do not allow you to backuyp to dropbox or iCloud claiming users have had issues in previous versions. If that's true, it's the developers fault, not dropbox or apple.
Second, you have to pay for two different apps if you want to use on a mac and IOS devices.  When I asked why was told they are different platforms.  Rubbish, many other companies manage. 
Convinced that when they devise more ways to screw money off subscribers they will.
Look out, your data is not secure on their servers.

I upgraded from classic for $4.99 which in itself was a joke. But, this version doesn't have iCloud, or Dropbox sync.  You're left with their own sync service.  It would have been nice to know before I shelled out the cash. Go back to iCloud sync!!!!

column9: Enjoying it after a week - quick and easy
column10: It is convenient for journaling 'diary' style. Also using it for some less conventional uses, like to track progress on various gym targets (created a separate journal and make an entry for each exercise each day, a quick search shows progress) and also to note some of the people I meet and might otherwise forget. Very useful as it is quick to change journals, make and edit posts. I'm sure I haven't tried out all the functionality of it, but for my simple purposes it is turning out to be much better than some of the free apps I tried.

Day One is no different than the other password protected journaling apps. Which is a shame, because I really do like the app. A password to get into the app only prevents someone from accessing your journals when they are on YOUR device. It's like locking your front door but leaving your backdoor unlocked. All it does is provide the perception of security. Anyone with a little computer knowledge can access our most intimate thoughts, feelings, and ideas. Think about what you are putting in your journals and ask yourself if you want just anybody having that information. You can unknowingly be putting your children and loved ones in jeopardy. Without end-to-end encryption our journals are not private nor secure. I won't even use it for my shopping list. To me, encryption should have already been built in when this version was released. Safety and security above all else.

I'm currently thru-hiking The Long Trail in VT. 276 miles. I use this app to document my hike while in the wilderness and there is no cell signal. Then paste into my blog when in town. The app just works.

It's also my safe place, where I can dump everything g uncensored, and that's how I am able to manage my mental health. I've been in love with this app from beta to now. There are many copycats but day one is the original and he blueprint for all be others. The makers of this app, get it, and it shows in their product. Don't even think about going away.

I have created three journals: personal life, spiritual life commentary, and trading diary.  The program works very well in syncing between iPad, iPhone, and Mac.  Can't imagine not. Having this app.  Now I can add ten pictures / PDF daily instead of one.  Very nice.

I love this app, I have been using the classic version for years to record the days of my children and the new version is even better. I had an initial issue syncing the data to the new app but the customer support was excellent. Highly recommend the upgrade or  purchase of this app!

column9: Great app to get out thoughts
column10: I really like the tagging option to keep track of what things I've been journaling about.
And pretty!

Clean look, and the possibility to make multiple diaries.

This is a great way to keep track of your life.
Why app need my geolocation while reading old entries. App should use geolocation ONLY during creation of new entries. Mac version is so done.
I've tried. A lot of apps for journalling. I just recently converted all my old entries to this and it's been the most pleasant of all. Definitely recommend.
I really like the completeness of the app. It encourages you to actually use it, unlike some of the others.
Very simple and clean.

I was looking for an application that would allow me to journal notes, and allow pictures. This app met those needs, and added functionality for ease of use. I don't feel obligated to document events in social media anymore, but can still add pictures. This application was well worth the price, and I would have paid more.
What's happened to the calendar view?! It's gone or hidden or I don't know what hastened to it but it's horrible now. I loved the way it was, why destroy a good thing?
Best APP ever

Although I am an old user of One Day Journal and migrated from the previous version, I need to say that app is very unstable. It freeze when you try to save notes, sometimes shows you that it is saving the version when you just started writing it, collapsed at certain point, etc. All these make me feel like my notes are not safe, so I'd better use another app for some time until you fix these problems.
This app is so well designed and flexible,while easy and intuitive to use, that I find myself journaling at least once a day.  Worth the price and then some.
Makes journal keeping so easy and efficient that I actually do it now.
I recommend very few apps to others - in fact no more than a handful - this one is always top of the list. Ease, simplicity, structure and utility - all in one. Day one.
Great for controlling work & travel data
best purchase to make!
I've been using Day One and pretty much the beginning. The features continue to be great! It's made creating entries so easy and so much fun! Love that you can upload more than one photo!

column9: Good app‚Ä¶ could use a few additions
column10: I agree it's a solid app, however it would be nice to have the choice to add video and audio, not simply photo.

column9: Google Drive and other synchronization platforms
column10: Why it's not possible to sync with other cloud services apart from iCloud?
I like to write down my thoughts and Day One is the best tool I've ever used to do so.  I is simple and the sync works great between devices.
Nice but really missing Web version

This app is solid. Good synchronization across devices. Somewhat disappointed that I cannot add video or audio recordings. That would make it a five star- with picture addition only it's 3 stars only.
I absolutely love this app. I have tried many but this one is the best I have found
I am finally in the happy habit of journalling every day, a discipline I have wanted for years and now achieved with the help of Day One.
I've been using Day One Journal for about 6 months now and it's been so good! I've found so many uses for it. This has definitely replaced my Google Doc and handwritten journals forever.

I got this app a few days after it was released. There were a few bugs, but truth is, the positives outweighed the negatives and those bugs have since been fixed. I'm thrilled. 

I've tried quite a few journal apps and none had as many great features as this one has. The highlights for me, are the ability to edit the text to include bold and italics as well as a fair selection of fonts to choose from.  The ability to add photos to each entry inline is great. Exporting in pdf or plain text and being able to save to Dropbox is great. 

Sure there are more features I'd love to see added like the ability to colonize text or put a wallpaper on each individual page, but that's just nitpicking really.  

I've been an avid journaler for 30+ years and this is well worth the minimal price they charge to have ease of use and the ability to be expressive. I love it.  I look forward to future updates... But as it stands now... I'm so pleased.

It has everything that a person could need to keep a track on what's going on in their daily routine and life. Various ways to note in your journal every moment.

Works smooth and it's great how pictures can be added with location, great App.
I have been using this app for a couple of years now and really like the updated features.  I am waiting for the app to have video functionality as well!

Honestly I can't say anything bad about this app. It's fast, intuitive, and has a lot of functionality. 

Just be easy on holding the delete key, as I have deleted whole paragraphs accidentally...

It took some time for me to get used to but the learning curve was small. I had my doubts at first. However, after my first week of use it has grown on me and I find myself using it a lot. I like how it automatically makes a collage when I put multiple pics. I wish that I could change the font or the color of the background to add a little flair to my journals. Other than that it is worth it IMHO.
I use Day One every day.  Its the best!
This app is a payed update of a previous one, and do not supports videos!!

Enjoying this app so far - does what I need it for which is a personal diary. One also that I can password or fingerprint protect on it. I have a few journals at home I love to write down rather than use an app - but for a very personal one this is ideal. give it a try you won't be disappointed
Easy to use, but slightly expensive..

I have been using Day One consistently for years, starting back on OS X. It has evolved so wonderfully over the years. It is an invaluable tool to keeping track of what I do with my life. What did you do March 7th, 2013? You don't know? Well, I do, because I wrote it down in Day One.
A picture says a 1000 words; and that's great if you're a lazy journaler! Now my spawn (lol) will have a record to look back on of our life journey.  PricelessüòÅ

column9: Can't turn off the "you have an entry on this day in history" notification
column10: First, I'd like to say that I do love this app. It's a great journal but I'm only giving it 3 stars because the notifications for historical entries can't be turned off. I don't care about my historical entries unless I need to search for something I don't want to look back at things I've written unless I want to.

If you own Mac devices, then this is the perfect journal / diary app.  Easy to use, enables synchronisation across devices and includes adding photos, labels and other info such as a song/music, the number of steps you took that day etc.  Great integration, easy to use, makes it a great tool.

column9: My diary of 5 years was erased
column10: I'm not sure what happened. I didn't have the app for a long time and got it back and to my surprise I had entries from 2012 in there! I was so happy. But then my phone crashed after I had been using it consistently for like a year. I assumed it would just pop back up as normal, but not only did it make me BUY it again- my entries were all gone. It makes me really sad.

column9: Loved Day One Classic -Bought new version by mistake
column10:
I loved the classic version, used it almost daily on my iDevices and Mac.
mobile version costs 6.99 Mac version costs 50 bucks; so I can add several photos per entry, takes away iCloud and Dropbox sync.  Not acceptable.
I have migrated my entries to Evernote, for which I'm already paying a similar amount, but offers so much more value.
Great application to write everyday.

Really good app. The desktop version is slightly expensive of you want to synch between multiple devices but it's worth it. Love putting short journals all the time. I'm over 100 entries and ive only had it a couple of weeks. Especially good if you want to keep track of something, keep track of workouts, what you eat how you sleep etc. All in one place.
Besides encryption not being added, it's perfect.
I love the multiple journals, search feature, and auto date, time and gps logging.

This is one of those " why didn't I think of that " Apps. Amazingly easy to use & actually encourages you to log entries. Allows you to post pictures with your entries, very cool feature. The most used app on my iPhone 7! Love it! Hope it can sync to Shutterfly so you can create a year end review book.

column9: Great app to record everything of my life
column10: Finally I find an app to replace  xanga.

column9: Daily Use - Concerned about encryption/privacy statements
column10: I love day one. I write in it every day and after doing so for several years it is awesome to look back on posts from each year and see how I have learned and grown. I love the features of the new version. My one concern is that others bring up privacy and the lack of encryption. This concerns me. I am going to investigate further and see if this is true but it it troubling that something as private as daily journal thoughts are not protected in the best way possible.
Worth every penny. Well organized and easy to use.

I really love the updates on the 2nd version.  I told my son to use it in school when taking notes. He is loving it now after just a week of use.

It is a "must have" app. So easy to use!

column9: Add video and do a sketch?
column10:
The app is great, it has got a great interface and it's super easy to use, but can you add the possibility to add a video or do make a sketch or a draw in a page? 

Thanks üòÄ

Simple. Easy to use

Your journaling app remembers where you where, how was the weather, if you were active or no, and so many other things. It's like it is a person helping you remembering things when you go back and read your journal. Super cool!

I love this app - Truly wonderful and simple to use, I'd give it 5 stars but it lacks of video support. Nowadays, specially when you travel you collect memories in different ways not only photos, video is essential. Please add it and I'll make the perfect journal.

I've journaled for years using notepads and most recently a running Word doc. This app has been so much better. I particularly liked ability to create 10 different topics so entries are easily entered in the running topic I'm thinking about that day. Having the sync across iPhone, iPad and Mac are also wonderful. I've been able to dictate entries on my walks using my iPhone for example of ease of use. Great job and highly recommended app.

column9: Day One helped me create a habit
column10: Keeping a journal is something I've always wanted to do, but could never find any consistency. Since I started using Day One I find it *incredibly* difficult to create excuses not to jot down at last some thoughts from my day. Day One removes all the hurdles that typically stood in my way when I tried to keep a journal in the past. Any app that can help me form a positive habit gets an instant 5 stars.
Hooked on to this app for journaling for almost 3 yrs now & loving the upgrade. Expect you would have some discounts or wave off for existing customers
I am very pleased that the program

column9: Great Investment And easy to keep up with entries
column10:
The ability to watch social channels and the integration with IFTTT is so key. Love how you can approve entries before they are committed to the main journals. Multiple photos per entry too. 
I'm very new to this app and it will replace my recent Chronodex on paper experiment. 
I do wish there was a graphical representation of the day related to tags or journals when you view a single day on the calendar. I'm solving this need with photos for as many entries as possible. 
Definitely one of my top 5 apps
This is a simple and easy app to you love how you can add photos it adds the time and date for you and will you take your photos at

column9: Personal and professional journal in one place
column10: I just started using this app but already I love it. I can easily tag personal or work stuff and it prompts me to write and even reminds me to add photos. I love it!
I moved over from a text journal to this one that can handle media. I looked for other journal apps and this seemed to be the best. I do love it now.

Journaling must be one of the best things you can do to improve your health, (other than changing your diet and exercising properly) and at this price it's pretty much a no-brainer. 

The app itself is fantastic and does everything I want; recording my thoughts, photos and (optionally) automatically capturing the entries I make on Facebook and so on. It's much improved in the past year becoming more stable and intuitive. 

If you want an app in which to document your day-to-day thoughts and ideas whether to help you identify and resolve negative thought patterns or as an aide memoire, look no further.
I really like the application. It does a great job of journalising.

column9: The App to improve your life
column10:
1. Buy it today!
2. Use it every day, use it creatively
3. Reap the benefits as the time goes on
It's useful for me .

This is a great journaling app for anywhere, anytime.  It has a lot of features and acts as its own digital time capsule.  I liked that it showed all the stats for the day like your fitness activity, what you did during the day or the weather OH and it also showed us our current altitude, that was cool!  This app is great and definitely worth your money.
This software has been amazing for my wife and I as we enjoy our life we are able to create entries for our memories.
great user experience, pleasing to the eyes, great functions. the widget is a plus.

column9: Easy to use, good for travel

Easy to use. Encourages me to journal.

I was looking for a journal program that I could use with my iOS device as well as my Mac. This app fits the requirement quite nicely! I have looked at many different journal/notebook apps and I can say that you won't be disappointed. The only reason why I haven't awarded 5 stars is that I am relatively new to this app (less than 6 months) and I am still finding little tricks that make keeping a journal easier. This app is well worth the asking price!
I have been using this app for years. It just keeps getting better and better.

I've been working with it for some time now, the more I use it, the more adept I become with it. Like anything else, the more familiar your are with it, the more you can get it to do. Read the reviews, this is the best app out there. There's cheaper ones with more reviews, but that doesn't  make them better!

I'm terrible at journaling consistently. I love to do it, but I have a hard time getting around to doing it. Day One makes it really easy to journal from my iPhone, iPad, or MacBook... no matter where I am or what I'm doing, if I have time to fire off a text message, I have time to jot stuff down in my journal.

Absolutely awesome. It's been so wonderful to create the habit of daily journaling, and it's so nice to know that my most important thoughts are well-preserved and available to me in any moment on any device!
I've used a lot of journal apps and Day One is the best by far. Well worth the $ @billknox

I hope Day One works through the bugs. Since this latest version which ushered in a bunch of questionably useful features, Day One has been slow; randomly freezing up; and crash-y. It reminds me of how Evernote went from high utility to buggy, bloated mess. I love Day One and hope to see it right the ship.
There is not enough words for this app. It just an awesome journaling app!

column9: Great app motivate me to write more
column10: Is a great app to encourage a person to stay consistence in dropping down a few notes bout his / her day ... love how easily we can record and review each of the entry. Great e journal
Great app, love the syncing between devices.

This app got me journaling at last!
I'd give it 5 stars if I could use Apple Pencil to write in my own handwriting.
It's the best I've seen and used in journaling.
Easy to use. Good app.  I'm writing more.

They did a great job with this new version. Love the multiple journals feature most - that is what was missing from the first Day One. Highly recommended!
I have been using it only for a couple days, but so far, it's a great application. I wish it had a way to mark some entries as a sticky. It would be great if one could set the maximum photo size.

Have been using Day One for over a year and a half now. The new timeline feature is wonderful and lets me add notes for check ins, tweets, posts and pictures. 
The memories I get to revisit through this app are truly amazing.
App is well designed and functions well for the most part. The few bugs that exist pale in comparison to all that this app offers

I love journaling using this app. It allows to add multiple photo in a single entry. The activity feed connect to Facebook, photo, calendar or location service in phone. This allow to add the journal from these event quickly. 

The apps also have a feature to remind what happen last year on the same day (if there is an journal entry). This feature is good for reviewing what happen last year or previous year on the same day. 

It worth the money for this nice app.
Great app. I love documenting my day to day adventures on this app.
Yes! Love this app.

I've tried several journaling apps and this one is the best BY FAR! It's great to be able to have a digital, private journal that is always with you and that automatically records so much great data. Having different journals also makes it easy to properly record the moments you want a record of. Highly recommend!
Perfect for daily use
For me this is a killer app for Apple. Love the way you can feed in social media and export to PDF.
With its wonderful UI, keeping track of life has never been easier. Being able to use multiple photos in an entry is awesome!

I really want to use this app because I've been using DayOne Classic for a couple of years. But the way this app stores your data, isn't safe.  They are stored as individual files. As text files and photos and they can be opened with any text editor.  

There is no privacy when it comes to the widgets. No matter if you put a password, you can see photos and other information on your phone's home screen without unlocking it. 

I don't like this proprietary syncing limit. 

Password for your journal is only 4 digits. Should be 6 or more. 

DayOne replied to an user that in version 2.1 there will be encryption and other sync options and I don't see that just yet.

column9: Wish I could go back to old version
column10: I never spend money on apps, but I use this app daily and expected the new version to be amazing. Instead it has been a huge disappointment. In fact the only benefit of the new version over the old one is that you can post more than one picture to a day's entry. Unfortunately, everything else is a mess. It crashes every 2 minutes (when I scroll down looking for dates, the screen just goes white) so I have to exit out and then come back. Also, in the old version, when you put in an entry for a date in the past, when you saved the entry and went back to the journal, it would put you back in that year and date so you could see all the entries around your new entry. This made it really easy to find a date without going into the calendar, which is laborious. Now, you have to scroll, which takes a long time. I hate that. Wish they had left that feature and frankly I wish I had never upgraded. Never had these issues with the original app. If anyone knows how I can go back, pls tell me. Hate the new version. :(
Played with half a dozen journals. This is the winner.

column9: Who needs the little black book
column10: I've been using a moleskin for two years to jot down ideas as they came up and journal. But now after two weeks I don't use it at all! Loving this app. Give it a try and see.

column9: Terrific for marking locations, even when beyond cell towers
column10:
I recently took a trip through Alaska, including going fairly deep into the Brooks Range mountains in the north. There were no cellular connections for hundreds of miles. I wanted to mark and remember some of the major places I visited, so I took photos and journaled them with some text in Day One. To my delight, GPS locations still worked! So I was able to easily mark the furthest north I've been along with my thoughts about it. It all worked great. Once I was back in the connected world everything sync'd back up.

DayOne can be a wonderful thing to take along when camping or exploring when outside of cell phone range (which can be a great place to be) - you can still take pictures and track your location and personal thoughts when completely offline.

One of my very favourite apps. Multiple journals is a great new feature that means I can track family events separately to my BBQ cooking log. Beautifully designed, and continually developed. Highly recommended.
The app is good for keeping a journal but I wish it had the ability to record voice notes.

I'm not a compulsive journaler but this app makes it easy to capture events over time. I use it with my kids to track their development, trying to record the 'small moments' and Day One let's me do that, share across devices and in theory share with others. Just have to get family using it. Seems a potential private alternative to Facebook.
Lost a very long entry immediately after saving. Rebooted and retyped an even longer one. Lost again. After 3 years Im think that I might return to using Momento.

All my entries are now synced to day one's servers and stored in a format that allows them to read the contents. They say "use day one classic if you need iCloud sync" but have pulled it from the store, so I can't.

Massive step backwards in privacy protection, the only reason I used their app to begin with.

Massive betrayal of user trust.
Great app, great sync with the Mac App, and perfect way to take notes & keep and everyday diary!
I have been using Day One for some time now and thoroughly enjoy it. Great way to record your life with words and photos.Easy to use and very user friendlyüëçüèø

I purchased Day One a few years back and used it regularly for a while. It eventually fell out of my graces and I moved on to more robust apps. I decided to give it a go again and WOW what an improvement. The multiple journals is the best feature. I use Day One now like I used Evernote. If I had to gripe about something it would be the app is a little slow when you do a lot of writing. When my word count climbs past 500 the app acts like it's chugging to keep up. I think it's just a syncing issue and should be a quick fix. Other than that... worth the price.

I've tried a lot of different methods for regularly keeping a journal. This is the first time I've been able to consistently write every day. I particularly like adding a picture to bring me back to the time when I made the entries.

I love this app.  Journaling electronically is great because you don't have to worry about running out of paper.  I also really like the multiple journal option and the recent feature that asks you if you want to add recent photos on the same entry that the photo is dated on. My only thing is that when I've typed my first line, the words suddenly turn into storage symbols when I start my second line.  Other than that, great app.

column9: An awesome app to take down my thoughts.
column10:
I have been a user of this app for a long time, four years to be or more. This is a super easy to take down my thoughts, to reflect, to have a conversation with myself. I also use it to save YouTube links I love, articles I enjoy reading, my book summary, etc. I use this app on my iPhone, iPad and Mac, and it is fun to use it on all three platforms. 

If there was something I would want to improve in this app, that would be the ability to add audio and video recordings. Otherwise this is a really good app and I would highly recommend it.

Stress-free program that is simple and straight-forward. Easy to drop in pictures. Not a ton of frills (if you want a program that acts more as a scrapbook, this is not it). But this makes it possible to get quick journal entries in and be really organized!
This is the best journaling app I've ever used. Great to have the ability to make quick entries.
I resisted using this app for sometime since I've traditionally used Evernote. But I'm glad I started using it. It's simple and elegant.
Awesome app, i love the design
So easy to use, and intuitive. Just an all around great app!
very goodÔºÅthanksÔºÅ
Not much to say! üëçüèº
Easy to use and worth every penny! Awesome way to jot down memories and reminders!

I use this daily and with all the new features it's even more helpful and amazing. I can go back years and track myself. I highly recommend this app... enjoy it. It's obvious how hard these developers worked to bring this to us. 

Only dislike about this is that I'm not able to back up or sync using my own methods such as Dropbox or other ways. I'm forced to use their method. I wish that would change back.
Easy and fun way to journal
Great photo journal app - really pretty and easy to use layout - although needs to develop the web based platforms asap

column9: I expected so much more for $4.99!
column10: Diaro is better than this app and it's free. I'm frustrated that I took a chance on this app with so few features and so many restrictions.

It's everything you could want in a journal. Fun and easy to use. Buy the iOS version. I really would like the Mac version but not sure why the price is so much more. Does it have more features? One big advantage of the iPhone iOS version is that the voice feature works really well and makes input much easier than typing!
Thanks to this simple but powerful journal app, updating my diary has become my nightly ritual. The reminder function is such a simple little feature but so important.
Would be perfect if it can also extract sleep data from the iOS health app !

Have used DayOne for four years. Love it. I record memories, funny things my kids say, ideas, random rants & milestones. The newer features (multiple photos per entry, multiple journals, etc) have been long awaited and are worth the slightly higher price tag. It's a full package app, don't need to buy add ons or extra features. 
Only problem I've had was transferring from my old phone to my new one (which also meant switching from old DayOne to DayOne2) - I've "lost" a whole year of entries & I don't know how to restore them! New version has had no issues but this.
Essentially syncing doesn't work at all over devices. Blew my money away, big time.
It's the best journaling app on the market. Very well executed.
Otherwise let down by lack of iCloud sync
This is the easiest journal I have used. My favorite feature is that it reminds about using it.
Please, return back the text setting while typing! It was so comfortable!!!
I really like the layout of this app.  Very clean, simple to navigate and can store pictures  and text.  Strongly recommend!!
Love the app! Great user interface and developers - no subscription!

Great diary. Two things though. Wish it had the option of adding unlimited photos. However it does allow for 10 per entry which is pretty good. And I would prefer the option of backing it up through the apple servers rather than the day one servers. I worry what would happen to my diary if the company ever goes out of business. That said its a really nice diary
Can't believe how awesome this version is. Use it everyday for everything. Can't imagine my life without it.

Using more than 1 device? Forget about sync. I've been working on the same entry on 2 devices only to discover parts got deleted during a sync multiple times. 

Also, there's no consistency between the desktop and iOS apps, like mark ups. The desktop companion is buggy as well. 

VERY DISAPPOINTED

Have upgraded and like the development of the phone app. It's a well-designed method of catching moments of our life as it speeds by. BUT - I feel the price of the Mac app is far too high - particularly for existing, loyal users. I have yet to upgrade that one. So not fully happy.
App crashes after uploading more than 2 pictures on my IPad .Unable to work with this program. A waste of money.
Very easy to use, very complete app
Effective.
Nuff said.

I'm not the kind of person who likes to leave reviews on apps. Frankly I find the process of leaving reviews tedious and time-consuming. Today I opened up DayOne to write a journal entry, and I noticed that the interface had changed, and there was a new opportunity to add things from my social network. 

Curious (and wary) I decided to try it. Wow! I cannot believe it. 

To me, while this may not be a 'professional feature', is it if fantastic and welcome update for lazy or busy wannabe journalists. 

Of course there are always privacy concerns, and I will be looking carefully to see what protection I have, but since this is pulling data FROM my Facebook, FROM, my Instagram, and FROM, my Twitter feed,  and placing info into my personal diary, I worry a little less. In fact, to me, this is welcome as I was already trying with IFTTT and Zappier, some glue, spit and a Macguyver wire to do this anyway. 

 I also like the fact that it's holding onto information about where I've been, so that I can make notes later on. Yeah. I'm shocked too. Again privacy alarmist I understand. Normally I shut all that stuff down. For a diary? Well it's kind of useful.

For me this is a fantastic update. Well done DayOne.
Use it everyday, love the sync to the Mac too

It's September and this app is still a security nightmare waiting to come true. I feel like we're all using the app praying that nothing terrible happens before the long-promised end-to-end encryption is released.

On a more grounded note, the Watch app for Day One is basically broken now, even though the release notes promised WatchOS 3 compatibility. Ideally putting it into the dock would keep it ready to do a quick entry at all times. In reality, it force quits after a few unresponsive moments, then fails to ever launch again.
I've used this app for a long time now, and I've loved it. But now it crashes every time I try to add a photo to an entry... so now I don't use it :(
Amazing. I really wanted to hate this app after what they did with the classic version but it's too good
This is the best journal app so far. Highly recommended.

I haven't really used the app long enough to write a great review. So far though, I love that it is locked and easily opens with my fingerprint. I like the fonts available and the ease at which I can do entries. I am not the best at keeping up with my journaling goals and hope this one keeps me going.

The functionality is great.  It's simple, but allows for a variety of options.  I have also been more consistent with using this as a journal than with pen and paper.  I was able to create a second journal within the app to track a specific goal and my progress towards it.

column9: brilliant app to capture life for reflection
column10: It is good to use to capture your life no matter the time interval from minutes to days.

column9: This app inspires me to journal
column10: I‚Äôve never been one to journal.  I‚Äôve tried note pads, pretty diaries, and at least three other journaling apps.  Since I‚Äôve started using Day One Classic  Ive been consistently journaling for almost a year now. I appreciate the simple interface so that I can easily write without  wasting time figuring out how the app works.   I just upgraded to Day One Journal and Diary and love that I can add up to 10 photos.  An additional glowing note - app support was immediate and incredibly helpful resolving an issue with iCloud sync.  Clearly, Bloom Build LLC stands behind their product and their customers.  I strongly recommend Day One Journal and Diary as your go-to journalling app.
Been using it for a few years now. I love it!

column9: Simple and powerful esp. with dictation on iOS!
Great app a little on the pricey side
column10: The app is fantastic. I particularly like being able to have multiple journals. It's a little expensive for the iOS version but the desktop version is very very expensive

Day One developer keep coming up with useful new features that makes journaling with Day One an evermore powerful and joyful experience.

The implementation of activity feeds fetched from popular social media sites is a great addition to an already feature rich app.

The search tool is more powerful. Now, when I search for a key word or phrase, I can also select the tags from entries in the search result to narrow down the result to include the words AND entries with the specified tags only.

The calendar view is now more easily navigable than ever. Before I have to scroll through all the interim dates to get to a specific past entry. Now, I can select a specify month, date, and year and jump right to it!

I'm always surprised by the unexpected features Day One developers come up with. I can't wait to see what else they do to make an already joyful journaling experience more joyful.

Of course, this can be used as a private journal but I find it useful as a kind of all encompassing reference journal allowing me to pull together various experiences, thoughts and references with hyperlinks, images and various Facebook and YouTube videos within my own cataloging system.  I include poetry and some matching art, as well as a collection of notes I made addressing certain anime series I follow or have followed.  It is probably extremely useful for any creative mind.

I've finally found the note taking / list keeping app for me. The interface is extremely intuitive. You can quickly change from long form journal entry to bulleted list. Having multiple journals lets you organize and name the journals according to how your brain works. This app keeps me efficient.
I really appreciate the reminder to journal as I tend to get bogged down in the day to day stuff. I like having the option of adding a picture to my entries.

DayOne is a good app with a team that now--unfortunately--  takes its customer base for granted. After promising to deliver end-to-end encryption on 2.1 version, releasing the app without this core functionality is merely ignoring user expectations. I will gladly revert my rating back to 5 stars once the team gets serious about deadlines.
Stable app that lets you document your days in an easy to use interface. Kudos to the developers for making such a nice journal app.

column9: Really well thought out and put together
column10:
Great way to capture thoughts, what happened during your day, and write.
They nailed all the little details.
Only thing missing is ability to publish to other platforms.

column9: Great app I love using it
column10: Great app I love using it - only suggestion is to maybe show users how protected/secure it is so users aren't hesitant to be fully open on it
Like Jewel the singer from the 2000's I remember when she was like a jaded song. Uhhh huh where is she now.
Thank you so much for Russian localization. ‚ù§Ô∏è Great new feature of social media activity, but doesn't work properly sometimes.
Now 5 üåü plus app after last update. Now no one never miss any entry in day one ‚òù

I'm a big fan of Day One for several years now. Although I've been journaling off and on for most of my life, it never really 'captured' me and caused me to turn it into an almost-daily habit like Day One.  Functionalities like being able to browse the photos from my journal like a photo gallery, seeing on a map where I made posts and how many, and seeing posts from that day in years past really make the difference between writing a journal on another program or on paper (if I could only read my own writing!).
Love the app and the update is great. I write in Markdown with bold text for headers, being able to visualize that while in edit mode is a great feature. Well done.

Pro:
Keep track of all important, or not, dates and photos.
Relive your thoughts and memories
Keep track of both random and recurring events, tagged with temperatures, and locations

Con: 
(with the newest update) Widget no longer displays when in time the photo displayed was saved. I enjoyed being able to see "2 years ago" or "1 month ago" beneath the photos shown on the current day. 
I liked being able to sync over the iCloud, not the day one cloud.
Separate app from the original, so I have 2 different apps between my computer and mobile devices. 

Overall a wonderful app, but still has some minor tweaks to make it back to the old app widget wise. 
I recommend it for anyone wanting to remember anything. 
My wife and I have used it since we started dating and have a perfect way to relive many of the excellent moments though our life so far, with all the details!

The latest update with the activity feed allows me to add in posts from FB and Instagram with ease. I like that I can choose which entries to keep in a journal. And the location history helps me to remember where I have been throughout the whole day. Great job.

UPDATE 9-16-2016. It's been months and numerous complaints about the missing iCloud Dropbox sync. The developer is clearly saying no and pointing to the classic version.Why? Why?  I question their long term motives.
  
Best journal app BUT critically missing iCloud Dropbox sync.This is the main complaint by everyone. Developers r u listening  Sticking with original for now
Sorry, entirely too awful of a decision was made and I can't recommend this.

column9: Amazing! Promotes anxiety relief / clears head before bed
column10:
What a great app. It's been proven for ages that writing out your thoughts helps with anxiety. While working in a public / office environment, on a bus on the way to work, or in a public area, writing pen and paper can come across as a little strange. 

This app allows you to automatically capture some of the metadata (like the weather, time of day, etc) while elegantly writing down events, people, occurrences, experiences, feelings, moods, and more. 

I'm a huge fan. Where was this 10 years ago? :)
this is the best journal App I have ever used. I like the simple layout and function that collect information automatically and accurately.

column9: Expensive but worth it on the long term
column10: I bought the app when it was 10$ or so. But I felt that it was not complete without the Mac version, which is quite expensive. With the 2.0 version, I bought both and am using it not only as journal but also for note tacking. The only time I wrote most about myself is when I used Day One. I hope its secure enough to hold all your secrets in it!

This app has changed the way I live my life. I record multiple entries everyday regarding multiple subjects. Everything from the weather, work entries, to personal experiments. The ability to tag out entries ensures that the subjects of your entries are easily traced and viewed again. 
The app has helped me in my job and has even resulted in me getting paid without argument. A journal with photos and notes is a powerful tool that should not be underestimated! 
I look forward to further updates and I am willing to pay for them as they pay ultimately for themselves!

This app is great to compile events in your life or just jot down your daily activities. I also am using it to note my fitness activity. Like how I'm feeling during the workout, what I did that day or goals I have. Plus adding photos is great. I'll would give it 5 stars when they add video functionality or the ability to direct link to Dropbox. Overall, though, it's a great app.

column9: I Love it more with every entry!
column10: I have been using Day One for a few months now and have found many details that I love.  My latest discovery of moving an entry to a different journal made me decide to write a review.
