Just download this app today for my iPhone and iPad so far it's a great app. The interface is crisp, user friendly, and easy to use. I have not tried the Apple Watch feature yet but will test it out later today. I like the ability to set a reminder because my day can get busy at times and this will help me wind down at the end of the day. 

Now, you are wondering why my title says slightly upset. Well that is because the Mac version is $30!!!!!! I work between all devices at any given time and it would be great to be able to journal on any device but not for $30!!!!! 

Apple really needs to work on this!!! I might have paid an additional $4.99 for the Mac version but $30?!?!?! No!!! 

Please fix.

column9: Best in class journaling app once again.
column10:
Update:

This app is more worn-in now and is a lot more reliable. Sure the sync is not always 100% but in general it is very good. The UX is maturing nicely and is enjoyable to use now. Some nerdy features like CLI and IFTTT are now implemented too. Encryption is on the way and I think this will bring in a few hold-outs. I don't know is if subscription is also on the way but as a customer I'm not in favour of that model. Honestly I don't know what the right solution is for developers but it's a trend I'm worried about, especially considering the number of apps I use. I usually upgrade to new versions whatever new features are there or not, but perhaps this is not enough for a viable business? Anyway DayOne is well worth the price of entry on all platforms. Best in class journaling app once again. 
-----------------

column9: Makes Gathering my world so simple!
column10:
I've long wanted a tool to gather all the bits and pieces of my world, from social, family, to work, and finance. I searched for a program of some sort and became extremely frustrated because I always ran into brick walls of limitations. Last year I resorted to creating a pen & paper version where I could log in each area of my life, jotting down memories, important dates/events while keeping up with other tidbits big and small. 
Then I found Day One. It has so many bells and whistles I'm amazed and thankful! I love how I can make quick entries, add photos and links, and even have location and weather automatically included! What's even better is I can manually change the date going back in time or adding an event in the future. What's even better (Big deal right here) is I can export my my entire bundle of journals in pdf file format!!  How awesome!  The More I Use It, The More I Love It!!
I originally used Day One when only one photo could be attached to each daily entry, now that I can add more than one I think the diary is perfect.
I have been very pleased with this app.

I've used so many different journals but this one is really different.

Simple, elegant, easy to use, easy to find what I want to remember, it's the only one I use now.

Since I travel every week, I always had a hard time remembering from week to week which city I'd been in a few weeks before.  Now, I have the information on my iPad and iPhone so I always know where I was on any given day.

This has made my expense reports so much easier to manage as well as my mileage logs.

I can't imagine ever changing to another journal.

this perfect App developed by you guys is awesome!

‚Äî‚Äîfrom a china user

So, my new journal program has a feature that I thought was dumb. A "you have two journal entries from this day in history, relive your memories" I considered it a nag alert & kept meaning to turn it off. But today, after I wrote something, I clicked the alert. And was taken back to 3 years ago, and apparently on that day I was, for some reason, waiting to hear from my partner. It was about how happy I was to get a text from him. What a fun reminder of my crush.

The second was a year later, a New York Times article I had saved about the guilt that comes from being in contact with families that abused you. It was really helpful, apparently again.  

I'm so happy, to be reminded by journaling of the rich spectrum that I am capable of feeling, highs and lows. It cuts the dominating strength of a current emotion to realize that the wheel will turn. Well played, Day one.
It is the best app that I have used.
It's stupid to disable the publish feature in this paid app.

column9: The most valuable app I own
column10:
So easy to use and once you get into the routine of doing it daily (or most day) it's so enjoyable to read back over your life and remember the good time and see how you have changed.
The new 'on this day' feature is an amazing addition and regularly brings a smile.
With the ability to add photos, locations, weather etc.  There has never been a better time to keep a journal.
I love Day One, it's a great app with a lovely interface. It runs pretty slowly on my ipad2, but the so do a lot of things!

column9: Excellent App for chronicling your life
column10: I love this app. It is great for taking small notes throughout my week about what I done. It's great to look back on past years and see what I done.
I love it.

Seriously, I consider Day One to be my favorite app ever. I use it on Mac and iPad, and each day I record a bit of my life to remember. 

My parents are both having memory issues (they're in their late 80s) and I see this as a way for me (in my late 50s) to keep a lifelong record of their gradual decline and to be able to keep those fond and sometime painful memories forever. Day One is perfect for being able to help me to capture my life and the lives of those I love and cherish.
I am enjoying the updated version which includes the multiple photo feature.
Love it. Easy and seamless, UI fades away and it just becomes about the journaling.

I like the simple interface, and the ability to add more photos per entry. More background colors would be nice for a change. I would also prefer to format the text without markdown. I maybe ignorant, but it seems we are going backward with that. I don't want to use another language to format. And the options are quite limited. Depending on the post, it does make me question writing it in another program. I like the ability to have multiple journals. Some for tracking things (I have a lot of health problems) and others for journaling different subjects. Overall, a pleasingly simply journaling app, maybe just add a few bells and whistles.
This is a great app and should help you really keep track of journaling in your life.

Do not understand the rave reviews unless you don't have Pages or Word. Or Google Docs where you can sync and save a file... I bought the iOS version first because I did like the idea of a reminder notification and templates and syncing.  Execution is horrible. First of all, reminders do not sync between devices.  Huh?  Secondly, you can only set up templates from within a reminder. So what if I want to make a journal entry without a reminder but use a template?  Sorry can't do that.  Finally, the reminders do not seem to be working.  I set several for 8:30pm this evening and no reminders popped up in notifications or within the app. A joke.

Day one is one of the few apps i use almost every day. The pro version is so worth it. I have 5 different Journals, one is recipes with my own touch. I love that i can attach more than one photo i a post. 
I recommend this app
Quality update. Designed to perfection, well polished and so smart. Wish every app in the store would look like this.
A great way to keep memories and not rely on your memory. I love this app.
Tried many apps but never came across any journaling app as good as Day one. Hooked for quite some time now
i like this app very much
First I love that I can sink it to my iPad from my phone. I find that an app is as good as you use it and you use it because it's easy to use. This one is worth the money. So happy I find it.

Simple to use, yet full of function and features. It's my soul e-journal, as I'm no FB'er, but I can still publish electronically to my peeps when I truly have something worthwhile to share with the world.

I do love this app, and went to record some audio in it, assuming that was an option in this otherwise awesome app. But it wasn't an option. Hard to believe an obvious feature isn't here. Will definitely shoot this up to 5 stars when that's added.
I have been using this App for several years and it keeps getting better.  If you want to keep a journal about anything, this is the App for you.

So many things about this app are great:
-Syncing between devices
-searching notes and ideas for common threads
- ability to attach pics
- simple straightforward and effect design (I have another app with sub folders and sub folders within that -- almost too much to keep track of whereas with this program I can just keyword entries -- great for consolidating writing ideas -- and if I forget to keyword - I just do a search of words or thoughts that I'm exploring.

Basically - love that it's a quick, easy and effective way of recording thoughts as they come - the program doesn't get in my way - I just open it up and go
Being easy I do journal more. Latest version adds a nice redesign. Fun to look back now for 1 to 2 years at things I've written in the past.
It's so easy to use and super convenient to have it on your phone. I find myself writing a lot more! I love that it has a pass code too.

Great App, 
Use it for journalling notes for work and it is second to none.
Can't recommend highly enough :)
Intuitive, easy to use. Makes regular journaling easy.
Easy to use for journaling. I have been using it for more than three years now and love it.

The app has crashed a few times & doesn't want to transfer the pictures over at times. I just make sure to save things often & hope they fix it. I do like that you can add many pictures, when it works. Still needs a little work but it's a good journal app.
This is a great app if you want to remember your life from your eyes over time. I highly recommend this app.
Hands down the best app of it's type
Excellent user interface, very easy and very quick to note down my thoughts.

column9: hands down the best journal app ever
column10:
been using day one for three years and always excited about new features 

hope it will support apple pencil someday! would love to handwrite my journals sometime
I have a work journal and a private journal. Day One is easy to use, has bags of functionality. I don't know how I every managed without it.

DayOne is my favourite. I allows me to get my thoughts down anywhere, keep them organized, save photos & more. I use it for my personal journal and for writing out blog posts. It's secure but also allows you to easily share entries with others. I just wish the desktop version wasn't so expensive.

Day One is the best journal app I've found. It has a rich set of features, is easy to use, and beautiful. I've grown to love having multiple journals - when I travel I create a new journal for the trip and this makes it easy to look back on each vacation.

column9: You've got the perfect tool now make it work!
column10: Superbly designed, intuitive and natural. What's missing is you using it!
Great photo diary.  I've tried so many others apps...this one is perfect.

It's beautiful. It has all the bells and whistles. I love using it. 

But when you invite people to journal their innermost thoughts, easy and strong encryption is a must. 

Four stars until the content is fully encrypted.

Such a great app. I sync with day one (AWS) and its seamless. Multiple photos is a great new addition. It's makes journal writing a breeze and I love knowing it's synced across my devices and backed up. 

One of my top apps of all time.
Awesome work! And very useful
I do so much better at keeping track of things with Day One!  It is convenient, easy to use and almost always at my side.
Very easy and function to use.
I can't remember anything, so it's testament to this app I've used it and the Mac counterpart to create an entry for every day of the last two and a half years :)
Been using Day One since 2011... The best journaling all out there. Plus it's just one of my all-time favorite apps, period.
ÂæàÂñúÊ¨¢Âú®ÈáåÈù¢ËÆ∞‰∫ãÔºåÂÜôÂÜôÂøÉÊÉÖ

So I loved the original version (now called Classic) and no longer for sale. I used it. Thought it was great. I yearned for features and enhancements like multiple photos and other smaller ones like additional metadata to the entry. 

I stopped using it once I realized those features would never come. They did appear but only as a paid purchase of the new 2.0 version. Naturally, I was thrilled about that. I felt like we were being hung out to dry. Classic was being 'sunsetted' and all users were asked to move up or move on. 

I understand that certain major changes need a full reboot and a new pay structure. Then again they also doubled the price. I paid my money and I'm happy with the new version, new features and such but I'm leery that I'm going to be left out in the cold again. Sadly if it does happen I'm not sure what I will do. Maybe just keep using 2.0 and go about my business. 

In all, an improvement over the first version but some of these features should have been added a while back.
This app has really come a long way in the last three years. Now it integrates with all my apple devices, really good user interface too.
Seriously easy to use, protected and allows you to organize your journal in anyway you would like.

When writing in Day One it records where you are, what you were listening to, weather, time, date, etc.

What's amazing is rereading old posts years later - those extra data points aid in truly reliving the experience. It's the closest I've come to time travel. Thanks Day One! Keep up the amazing work!

column9: Good app but missing a key feature
column10: This app should really have the option to write/draw in it. It's how I like to journal and it would make this app a lot better.

I was hesitant to pay for the app again (since I already had the previous version) but I'm glad I did. The app keeps getting better. One word for the developer... Don't think you can get away with charging for the app every time you want to upgrade it. You can wear that wagon out real quick.
Like a Facebook only for yourself. Love this format...really adds layers to my thoughts.
cannot upload to iCloud

This is awesome! I read their working on linking Facebook and other social media to upload pics and videos from there. That's the only thing I would like to see added. Really happy to be back into journaling, I tried other apps but they do not compare to this one!

My experience with Day One has been great. I've never been the type to write journals every day, but Day One's changed that and turned me into an obsessive journal person. Now I can't live a day without writing one.
I don't use this as intricate as others but for my type of journal and note keeping it works great! I have used others and prefer this one by far!

I have had Day One for a while and was so excited about the improvements in this new version. The ability to have multiple journals & add multiple photos made a good app into an awesome app. Simple to add entries, and the syncing across devices is very fast. Would love auto Dropbox backups but the ability to send backups to Dropbox is there, so not a huge deal. If you are looking for a great journal app - this is the one to buy!
Great UI and super easy to use. Great features. Well worth the money to keep my memories safe. Perfect for travelling too as I can't afford to carry a physical diary. Look forward to future updates.

It's exactly what i needed to put my mind at ease by writing my thoughts and the things that happen in my life. I love the fact that i can complement my entry with a photo and i love having everything so beautifully organised. 
Many thanks to the creators!
I very like using it every day because it helps me growning my awareness toward to my life.
You upped the already upped game already. Great flow and option to the journal. Makes reading past entries enjoyable.
iCloud, Dropbox Sync missing.
I bought 1st desktop version, but 2nd version too expensive, have discount?
I really enjoy using the app. It heaps with productivity during my day

It does everything I need, it's visually easy to look at‚Äînot too cluttered, not too stark, and it encourages me to write without being annoying by using messages and the way the days are laid out with a brief clip of text.

I'm a writer who journals constantly and has tons of entries from the past five years in my Notes app from when I didn't have pen and paper. This is so much better, I wish I discovered it sooner!

Simple, intuitive, easy, love having everything tracked in one place along with photos. Looking forward to eventually transferring everything to a scrapbook or printed out format one day.

For me this app doesn't replace pen and paper - simply supplements it.

This is a very powerful app. Well designed and conceived. It's a joy to use, it inspires me to write more.  Kudos for a major upgrade. I'm saving a fifth star for when they deliver encryption, which is supposed to come soon.

Love this journaling app. I wish it had the option of saving recorded journal audios. Sometimes sound has a way of connecting an entire experience, more than words ever could. 
Love that I can easily attach pics and add tags to journals. 
Easy to use and it motivates me to want to journal more often.
I think this is a great way to track thing you or your kids and family are doing without going to social media to remember it !

I have been a Day One user for several years and recently upgraded to the current version. I am very glad that I did. The interface is much more visually friendly. None of my favorite features were compromised. I have not yet tried inserting multiple photos. I do like the notifications for entries on prior years.
Use it all the time. Very nice app

User friendly - helps to document my life! Great app!

Best Buy! Good buy! MUST BUY!!!!!!

column9: Like it a lot. Very useful.
column10: Great app for journaling.  Adding photos is a wonderful feature

column9: Awesome way to keep track of my life
column10: I've been using this for about two weeks now. When used with the Mac App it is a great tool to keep the things I do in my life documented :)
A pleasure to use. Makes it easy to write down my life. Highly recommended.

Ok I downloaded this app due to a friends' recommendation. It took me a while last night to figure this app out for as putting the pic in the journal. I thought it would be a way for you to custom name your own different folders and choose the font colors that you want to use. That would be nice. Also I would like for the picture to stay small once I save it. Or at least give me the option to change the picture size to show when you open the journal page to read. Last and Most important feature I would like to have is the "Music or song loaded in the journal."  Once I place a song in the journal entry. "I would LOVE to have it AUTOMATICALLY play when I open that particular journal entry to read it. " This gives the reader direct emotion of what they were feeling while reading the journal entry.
This is a great app but sadly it insists on using the developer's own cloud syncing service, which is far less reliable than iCloud and Dropbox.
I use it as a journal and can add entries and see them easily
I am rather terse when journaling so the automatic placing of Instagram images gets me thinking about what to say. Would like a menu where I can choose set phrases to describe how I feel.
While I really wish it was an Evernote killer, I'm grateful for the simple, straightforward functions it does support.
This App makes writing a journal entry absolutely easy. The convenience of it makes it easy to do it whenever and wherever you are. Beautiful interface and easy to use. Highly recommended.

column9: After you get over the cost, it is really good
column10:
I can't say that I enjoyed paying for this app, however...

It is freggin amazing!!

Hands down it is the best journal app I have ever spent money on. I bought the mobile and Mac version of the app. In 300 days I have over 900 entries. I use this app a lot 

Things I like
-Touch ID
- reminders to write
-syncing between phone and Mac
- the user interface
- multiple journals
-tagging
-search feature
-location
- multiple pictures

Things I don't like/ would like to see
- price
- I want to add video to my entries
- Mac: I wish the formatting would appear as is instead of the stars, double stars (*, **)
- I can't email journal entries to myself.
- if I write in the wrong journal I want to be able to switch it quickly. 

Overall, this is really easy to use and a ton of work has been done under the hood since the previous version. If you had the last version ( "day one classic") of the app consider dropping the cash. You won't be disappointed. Note that all your old entries WILL port over if you choose to.
Having never journaled before I got this IOS app for free somewhere and now on a two month trip have started to use it.  Four days in and seems pretty useful especially and easy to use.
I wish I could disable the location, foot steps, and all that other un-necessary stuff. Not really needed in a journal application.
Amazing app for capturing the experience!
Classic is much better

I really like this app and use it frequently. It would be nice if it would upload videos...not just pics, or work with other apps so I could upload stuff to my entries. Other than that, it's very handy to have a journal right at my fingertips and I've started journaling a lot more due to accessibility

Ok I was fine with this non Dropbox syncing because they claimed that their sync was more secure and because it would enable us to journal from their site directly... Which is still not the case. I paid for the Mac OS version. I paid for both versions on iOS and unfortunately I guess I'm in the minority of people who own both a Windows and Mac computer and this app can't be used on Windows. 

Unfortunately for me I like my SP4 because it's much lighter and easier to carry and I was hoping that by now I could at least journal from it via the web. I don't expect a dedicated app. Just a site that was promised to us. We have been more than patient as fans and consumers.

I recommended this app (well the original) to lots of colleagues and family members. Never again. To promise a feature and then not deliver is the surest way to lose the word of mouth fan base. For what you currently are we can use Pages or Word which is cross compatible between all devices and online.(which I have to use when I'm on the road anyways)

This is surely the total diary/journal app for the serious writer. Making entries is an absolute pleasure with great tools to facilitate editing with Markdown. The option to create several separate journals is very welcome and exporting text and images to other media is a breeze. The environment is aesthetically pleasing and an incentive to regular writing and note taking. I cannot commend this too highly.

column9: An excellent diary - but photo upload does not work
column10: It does a great job encouraging you to write a little everyday. The new photo upload on my iPad does not work. The app crashes every time you try to upload a photo.
Great app but privacy should be better protected.

I love this app! I love journaling this way! I've always wanted to keep a good journal, but have never succeeded until that app came along. That being said, by the time you buy the Mac version and the iOS version, you've made quite the investment. Plus, I feel they didn't treat their initial customers (of which I was one) well by making them buy the updated version when the initial buy-in was so pricey to begin with-- hence the 4 stars. However, because the app works so well and I actually journal now, I've paid it. I may not pay again, however, if they do that to their customers in the future with a "new version." Or at least give the existing customers a discount (like $.99 or something rather than the full price)! All in all, a great product. I have and will continue to recommend.

I just recently re-downloaded this app, and the only suggestion I could make is to bring back the hashtags suggestions. I personally use long, stupid hashtags to organize my entires and it's kind of annoying having to typed them out each time instead of just typing the first letter and picking it like I did before! Otherwise, this app is totally flawless!

column9: Fabulous - Continues to be the best
column10: This is my "Go-To" app. I have always enjoyed this app. It just keeps getting better. This version makes it everything that I want in a daily journaling application. DayOne is really one of my all time favorite apps. It really lets my creative side come out. Perfection!

This app has everything I want as a customer:
- The developer maintains its high quality
- Every detail seems to have been taken into account with the UI/UX (shortcuts abound, pleasant sounds are thrown into the mix, the color palate feels fresh all the time, the app is always responsive, etc...)
- I can export my data how I like
- Much more I don't feel like writing now

This is my favorite app. It's not even close.

I've tried different journaling apps over the years. Some have more bells and whistles but I ended up settling on Day One because of its simple interface, easy of use, and seamless syncing. I use it for photos, for daily thoughts, to help record events, ideas and sketches for my children's books. Love it.

column9: This is my third journaling app...and my last
column10:
I've tried two other apps like this and although they were fine at the time I'm glad I invested in Day One. Everything that frustrated me about the others, and I didn't realize I wanted or would need, is in Day One. I use multiple journals, love the formatting options, and am actually pleased with the 10
Image limit per entry...creativity comes from constraint!
Clean, simple and easy to use. I love that it documents the song that your phone is playing.
Just don't let it get too feature laden!
I use it daily.

I have been using Day One for over three years now. It's so much fun each day when it cues up the previous years' entries for this day and you can reread what you were doing. I also love the fact that I can use the voice to text on my phone to do my journal entries. It makes it painless and efficient to make journal entries each day

This app is completely worth it - if you do it.  I've been making a photo entry every day for months, and I finally have a realistic and random journal of my life.  
One pic each day, then a sentence or two or ten. I no longer have to over-post just to try to document my life.
Great app. I wish I would have started using it earlier.
Great simple lovely interface - I love how easily it integrates stats from your phone like pictures, music, steps, location, etc. I really feel like it captures my day.
I've made 10 entries so far. It's the app I never knew I always wanted! More stars will be given with more use. So far I love it!

column9: I like it- simple and easy
column10: It's what I wanted... Just wish I could do a video instead of still images.
Simply the best and most beautiful diary app out there!

The latest version of DayOne is a great update. Easy to use, flexible and well built to take advantage of iOS and the touch screen. Makes writing easier since I can focus on the writing and not the app. Nice job, and worth the upgrade.
Love this app for remembering those important things in your life
I've been using DayOne since the beginning. It just keeps getting better with each revision. The developers focus on perfecting the experience without adding features that are superfluous.

I am new to Day One.  I bought it about 2 weeks ago to use as my journal to record the happenings on an extended Motor Home trip from So. Calif. to Northern Washington and back.  
I love it... Not only can I write about what's happened on the trip, but it also automatically record times, and locations.
I can also insert photos I have taken each day in the appropriate place in the days journal.  I highly recommend it.  
I have never used any other journal so I do not have any comparison, but I can't imagine any other being better.  
On past trips I have used a pen and paper journal, but have never kept up on a daily basis, and of course could not insert photos.  With Day One, I can insert any photo I take with my iPhone 6 ... Use AirDrop to transfer the photo to my iPad Pro and then insert easily.
It was worth every cent.  I love it.
I can write notes and prepare for my studies. Amazing!
Love it! Really useful and simple.
As simple as that, it works, it helps, it useful for me
This app is all you could ask for and worth having for all devices :) Easy to use,fun and it's use proves to be empowering.
Great application. Helps me get my morning pages done every morning. Reminders are great - I miss the daily quotes though.

column9: Fall back in love with journaling
column10: Journaling has never come naturally to me. Day One makes it easy, enjoyable and ultimately, rewarding.

column9: Does what it says on the tin... and beautifully
column10: Great app. I've had it since it's first release and it goes from strength to strength.

Over the last 25 years I have used various methods for keeping track of my day today activities. I didn't write a journal on a regular basis but I like to be able to look back and see what I have accomplished. With  Day One's tags, photos and GEO location keeping track of accomplishments and events has never been easier.

I use this for basic life event stuff and reminders.  I like the format and ability to add pictures.  I haven't used all the features yet though but based on what I've used so far I'm sure they'll be good and useful.
Over 3000 entries in two years. Day One took over from writing web pages as my diary. Just keeps getting better, and syncs between devices much easier.
Fleshed out with more features than most other journaling apps. Thorough & excellent
Easy to use. Record your daily activities the fast and convenient way.
Very simple but full of feature, clean interface, good syncing across devices. I really enjoy this app.
Intuitive and easy ready to use. Couldn't ask for more.
Needs to be platform agnostic - work on Windows - to be perfect. Otherwise, it's the best journaling app I've used.

After an entire year I am still unable to get a merge between the 1.X and 2.X versions of this app. And in addition, the 2.X app on my iPhone only syncs with the 1.X version on my laptop, the classic version. What a mess, and bloom support doesn't give a flying concerned about it, for the last year!
Obviously, I think this is a very risky place to put something as important as your diary information. There must be something interesting going on between bloom and apple for this to get the editors choice award.

I enjoy using this application.  It's nice that it nags you.  The writing surface is fairly no frills, but it works as a text editor.  I am still feeling out the more advanced features, like how to best use photos.  Especially now that more metadata support in the actual Photos app...  What else can I say...  It's an effective way to capture your experiences, and it's proven useful a few times since I write about my work a lot, and it's been useful for recreating timelines later on.  Otherwise it's a nice restful, almost transparent application, and that's about the nicest complement I can pay anything.
love it!
Been D1 fan for three years and love the new updates. Especially the reminder of what you were doing on the date years back. That shows real insight into what a journal is what helps you to do.

Just bought this app a couple of days ago so I could keep a journal as we travel. So far it is really great. I really like everything about it.  I like the ability to change the font, you can have more than one journal, add photos. My favorite part is how it keeps track of my location when I make an entry, great for traveling. Gave 4 stars only because I haven't used for long... I may revise later.
Good diary option. Go ahead and give a chance. I recommend it.
This app is highly recommended for anyone who wants to be will organized.
Use it a lot with (before update) no problem synchronizing. Update for Mac to expensive

I found Day One after trying out various diary apps only to find they were all rigidly lacking in features and were aesthetically awful, many being designed either for children with little regard for everyday users. I loved the first version. It was simple in style yet had a very nice style which makes it easy to use whilst making your entries easy to write, find and enjoy. I have both the Mac desktop app and the IOS and both complement one another wonderfully and I have never had syncing issues with either when using Dropbox or Day Ones new service. The 2.0 edition brings with it the ability to add multiple photos which is fantastic. The calendar view is a great feature allowing you to easily see when you have entries for and if you like to look back you can allow notifications that let you know when you have historic entries on the same day. I would absolutely recommend day one to anyone who wants to keep any semblance of a personal account of your days. Gorgeous app, very useable and feature rich!
Love the app it's fun and secure. Looking for a journal/ diary app look no further !
Nice to be able to get things off my chest.  Way to upload pictures and locations.

It is, simply, the best app for keeping a diary or journal.  If it could synch Twitter and Facebook etc it would be perfect, but as a previous momento devotee I can honestly say that day one is impossible to beat.  I'm loving the 'on this day...' feature!
Super easy to use, gorgeous ui
I use this every day to capture moments in the day. Even simple things from knowing where I am and what the weather is to more complicated thoughts complete with pictures :)

This is what keeps me writing in a journal.  I love it for so many reasons.  For one I can log on anywhere and get my journal, I can use hashtags to organize my entries, and I also use it on my computer.  Journal writing is an essential tool for personal growth and this is the best way to do it.

Useful app in keeping up with daily events or happenings that you need to (or just want to) have written/jotted down somewhere. Like that the new version allows for more than one photo to be added. 
I've found it useful for work- as a way to keep up with call-outs that I get, but have no better way (or "formal") way of keeping up with those calls; not just for call-outs, but for phone calls and texts from officers with questions regarding hearings, etc. 
It's a quick "reference" guide to checking my hours that we don't clock in and out for. Especially with the detailed info I can include.

column9: I write more thanks to Day One
column10: This app makes it quick and easy to write, so I've been writing a lot more since buying it. I love it!
Easy to use on the go.
Easy to use and great for a photo journal, love it!
Only just got the app and learning how to use it but the opportunities apear endless
My favorite journaling app.
hope add voice feature

column9: Excellent but still needs a few bugs squashed
column10:
My only gripe is that swiping out of an entry, that entry will remain highlighted. It's super annoying to me!! Please fix!!
Other than that, this is second to none.
Fast and easy. Version 2 allow for multiple photos per entry.
I  have been using this app for years now and I have always liked it.
I use Day One every day for my house, yard, cats, cars you name it. Very user friendly, I've recommended to several friends who gave me positive feedback

I have just started using this App on a regular basis. The ability to quickly attach photos and videos is great. The automatic record of location and time is an advantage as I don't have to think about where I am.
You need to use it regularly to benefit but better than writing the journal on paper as the records are backed up and saved for a long time. The ability to password protect is very useful. Just in case it falls into the wrong hands and you don't want anyone to read your inner  most thoughts and feelings!
I haven't had this for very long but I can say to this point it has been very user friendly. I like that I can add photos.

column9: 4.5 Stars. Movie Support would make it 5.
column10: Super solid. Just needs video support. But supposedly it's coming. Good on desktop/laptop too.

Good app for logging memorable trip details, journaling and capturing important memories. I like the change the date ability. I often need to log an event or memory that occurred a few days ago. I also like to occasionally tag the event with a picture and location.

Great and stable app, just how a journal should be. I've been using this for years and I appreciate its consistency. I learned from the developers that this app is getting big updates on features and security.
For me a great app to write down and combine / link all the thoughts and ideas to workable solutions.

I'm really glad that I picked up Day One for iOS. It has been great to note down thoughts and attach other memories of the day - photos, the location, the weather, etc.

Everything I wanted in a personal journal application!

column9: Has serious potential. A bit over priced
column10: I like this app but I do think it's a bit overpriced for what it is. I'd say 1.99 or 2.99 would be much better than 4.99. It just doesn't do enough to warrant that. I'd like to see them add the ability to incorporate video and audio clips as well as some type of compatibility for the Apple Pencil and sketching and handwriting. Also would like to maybe see some themes for different pages an entries. Boarders, colors, GFX's. There is so much potential here, hopefully they will add things.
I have a few journal type things but this one is the nicest for me to use
Absolutely great to write daily happenings, thoughts and memories!!!
I really enjoy using this app to record my memories and remember special events in my life.

First time ever I continue write both Diary and keep track of the notes from meetings. It is my tool for Reflections, reviews of literature, film, Tv-serien and much more. 
Highly recommend!

column9: Saved me from guilt of not journaling!!!
column10: This app is fantastic and will be 5 stars when it can attach videos
This is a great app for easy easy diary entries plus photos.
They got five stars because they still trying to deliver the best journal app.
TO SAY

Always wanted a journal.Aspirations to Samuel Pepysüòä. 
This is the best 21st century version. 
Highly recommend you buy this app.
Still getting used to the features and all. I like it overall. Better than the original.

Love this app! Using it regularly to document my ups and downs in life. Works like a charm. Which brings one little greedy detail to complain about ...why the crazy ass price for the next version?!?!!! I want it! But I ain't gonna pay the crazy amount you charge for it. It made my face do this üò±
I really enjoy it, even though I don't use it to its full potential.

Easily one of my fave apps. 

But PLEASE make a batch export for the photos/memories. Then I'd use this forever (knowing it's not all stuck in the app/or in sync)

In calendar view: 
- can you please make a toggle to show calendar days thumbnails of the photo, instead of the date number. 
- And also, when you tap the date, it should search that dated section of your camera roll. 

Thanks for this app devs!

Keep up the great work!

Since the release of Day One 2 it has improved considerably. Multiple journals and a good number of photographs in one entry make the journal far more useful. The 'what happened this time last year' feature/reminder is also a nice touch - if only to remind you how quickly the time passes and eternity approaches.
Since I've come down with a chronic illness keeping a journal is a necessity for proper treatment and for tracking change and hopefully improvements. I love this app.
Best Journal App out there hands down!! Each version only gets better and better!!!

I had used another app for years but it was rarely updated and not aesthetically pleasing (which for me is important). This app is unobtrusive and quickly syncs across all my devices. Keep the updates coming!

I write in it almost every day! Entries show up almost immediately between iPhone, iPad and Mac, so  I have no excuse not to use it. It is also easy to upload my pictures right on to the entries.
Some day I will probably want to print this out for my daughter and grandson and am curious what Day One plans for making my book.
Best app for journaling on the go so far

Update: Even better! Love the "On This Day" feature. Also looking forward to encrypted sync. I use this app every day to keep track of my memories and the things I do every day so I can look back on them.

Original: This app is great. I started journaling with the original app in 2013. Use it very often. Day One 2 is even better. It adds much awaited features such as multiple journals and multiple photos per entry. 

Ignore the bad reviews about their syncing, Day One Sync. There is nothing wrong with it. Who cares if you have to use something other than iCloud or Dropbox? I used iCloud up until Day One Sync was introduced in version 1 of the app. I did have some issues with iCloud, but Day One Sync works great and syncs in the background, something iCloud doesn't do.
An essential app for journaling. Uncluttered and easy to use.

I love this app ever since! It is so simple to use. It also has that zen feel in it. No fluff just the meat that you need. Though, I have to backup data when I upgrade phones. I lost my original "day one" and the entries when I switched to this new iPhone. Overall, highly recommended app!

What a disappointment:
1. They fired their designers and put features over elegance. That's the opposite of what made the app great. 
2. Using their own servers for cloud storage? Forget it, I'm not going to trust my most personal info to a small company like that. 
I'll continue to use Version 1 until it breaks. How sad.
This is one of the apps that make me feel so good when using it because of its great UI and UX.
Finally found a Journal app,I can stick with, well done!
Great balance of simplicity and power. Everything you need to capture memories in the moment and enjoy them in the years to come.
I just started using this app but I can already see that I will be journaling a lot more, hopefully everyday.

column9: I have used it almost every day for 4 years
column10: I had originally given it a one star rating due to no iCloud. The update has been great so I am not so butt hurt about them bailing on iCloud sync.
Day One has helped me to start and maintain a journaling habit for the past 2 years. It's a wonderful app! Try it for yourself :)

I've been wanting to use that app more frequently but never got the chance to do it. I just downloaded the new version and I love it. I'm traveling now and it's a great memory keeper. The fact that you can include 10 pics makes it very interesting. I'm already in love with it and get my motivation going to keep journaling every day.  Thank you!!
I can post my daily life as I see it

I have been using this app for several months. I love it. I used it while I was walking the Camino de Santiago. It was easy to add up to ten photos a day in a journal entry, which helped me remember all the wonderful happenings a long the way. I also am able to tag the entries. I'm slightly disappointed in the PDF export feature. The layout is inefficient and not that nice looking. 

I have been using this app for only six days. The first thing that strikes me is how many features it has. So I can see the potential. 
I would give this app five stars except I don't know how to stream line the writing screen. Right now while I'm writing half the screen is taken up by the calendar, and navigation features. It would be nice if I could get rid of that and just concentrate on the writing portion, the current journal entry.
I like the fact that they added the multiple journal feature.  Great stuff!!

I like the fact that this app comes in very handy. I use it to write down my thoughts, and reflections. I am planning on using it to Journal my travels and days along with pictures. I realize that my travel pictures are all over the place and so I think this app can help me organize and write a little something to remind me of the moments I have captured in photos.
Simple, elegant and so functional.  Thank you!
Does exactly what it promised without the fuss of other apps!
Enjoying the app to catalogue my holiday. Easy to use and looks good.

I've never found it easy to stick to journaling. With Day One it's so simple and easy to use on the iPad I actually look forward to journaling. I like that I can add in line pictures as well. Great app!

column9: Fantastic App! Well worth the money!
column10: I have been looking for a journal app for a few years. I'm glad I found Day One. I have different journals that allow me to keep up with different aspects of my life. Incredible job to the developers. If you are looking for a journal app that works great with your iPhone and iPad, this is the one!
I have been using Day One for years, and it's good to use.
I wasn't able to make journaling a habit until this app came along. It's perfect. Adding video would make it epic. ;)
For years-running, my favorite journaling app on iOS and Mac, and probably one of my favorite apps period.
I love this app. The only complaint I have is I wish I could add more pictures to my entries
I love this app.
Good for people who like to keep a daily journal!
Very secure and easy to use .
Latest improvements made Day One so very easy to use and also to sync between devices. The developers did their homework and came up with a real masterpiece. Bravo Day One! Definitely 5 Stars!!

column9: Just the darn best at what they do
column10:
I mean that. It is a very capable app and always has been, but like any app that is worth its salt, they make relevant and good advances regularly and squash bugs frequently. 

There are things I wish were done differently, but from what I understand it's Apple that is the problem.

I downloaded a  few journaling apps to record my daily activities. had to buy this app with lot of glorified internet reviews because there was no trial version. Unfortunately i would say this has the worst interface out of all . Having numerous microscopic fonts won‚Äôt make  the interface simpler. At least they don‚Äôt have a simple help file. This  was the most difficult app to figure out of the 3 apps i downloaded. Sad to say the best out of the three was the free app, ‚Äú My secret Diary‚Äù . You should have taken a leaf from them.
Day One is amazing and keeps getting better. It's really the best app I've used for journaling, recording thoughts, ideas, photos, and events. I use it for both my personal as well as business stuff.
I have been using Day One for journaling and keeping track of my goals, writing, research and documenting trips. Great app with flexibility to meet my needs for my many projects.

I got the app to try journaling digitally. Keeping a hand written journal is taxing for me since my handwriting is so bad I myself cannot make it out haha. This fixes that problem, and I'm loving the new methods and journaling in general. I haven't tried it yet but I really like having the option to export journals to PDF so I can make a hard copy if I need/want to. Locking my journal with the touchID is a very likable feature as well. Worth the 5 bucks it cost in my oppinion!

column9: Love this app so much, perfect.
column10:
I never realized how wonderful this app would be but it turns out its one of the most amazing apps I've ever had because it just throws me back and lets me remember, my life, thats a big thing.... Its my life, I wake up as myself every single day and its basically an enormous journey of such a grand magnitude from where I go to what I do so this is truly wonderful.
As a person, as a soul, as my own individual personality this app is indispensable.

Its your only life.

Cherish it.    Thank you Day one
So good and easy to use!

column9: Versatile, powerful, and somewhat simple way to record memories.
column10: One of my favorite and most used apps. It's easy to jot down your thoughts and memories. You can add multiple pictures to your journal, make multiple ones. The geo tracking of photos is good, and it's relatively easyto import photo from a camera to your phone. I've brought over a ton from my Nikon dslr. A complete improvement over version one with the exception of cloud storage. Before you could use iCloud, but now you have to use their proprietary cloud storage. It's a great product otherwise.
Fantastic app. Use it everyday.
Go further - your way is the right one -Thank you - I ‚ù§Ô∏è it
Very good app

This is great when you combine it with the IFTTT (location, contacts, songs on spotify etc)

I am using it for quite some time and I am really getting back to it and I am still exploring all the functionality.

Suggestion: it would be great if there was a similar thing that was in ohlife. That everyday you will send me and email and I will reply and the app will save it as an entry. I know that there is some email that you can send it to. But if DayOne would send me a reminder question on email it would be awesome!

Thanks the developers team
Little pricy to get all the versions of the app but really well done.

I appreciate the effort that's been put into this app. It's intuitive and well laid out. I'm using it to track symptoms as they relate to foods and so far it works much better than apps designed for that very purpose. Overall it's a great app.
Great app
Used it for over three years and no issues.  I bounce from my iPad to iPhone all the time. Best journaling app out there.

Amazing and handy diary with easy to use interface, search engine and multi media features

I have been using it since 2012
Love this app, it makes journaling on the go so much easier
Fast, easy to use, perfect cloud syncing. Worth every penny.
Great app. My favourite feature is the ability to export my journals (text, photos, and all) as PDFs.
I have never kept a journal or diary before.  I now see to it that I set aside time with Day 1 and it is enjoyable. I am very pleased now.
Love this app. It's easy to use, and I really like the ability to add pictures!!  The only thing that would make it better is if I could access my Journals from different devices.
My go to diary, there are other good ones but this is perfect for me. Still things I'd like to see, like the ability to insert a video, but for what it does it does it best.
Really enjoy weiting and reading back holiday stories. Being able to add more pics really increases the fun part of this. App works really well for me as-is. Would not know of any improvements.

column9: Can't think life without it now
column10:
Am not a big chronicle however since I've started using Day-One to capture all small and big events in my and my family's life it has become the most app on my iPhone. 

The ease it provides to capture those fleeting moments is invaluable and helps me store those precious moments of my growing kids. 

Thank you and keep up the great work!
I use Evernote for many things cut for some reason this app just works better to keep me in the habit of journaling.

This app is a lifechanger. Who could think that keeping a diary is so much fun. The developers from this app know what they do. It's clean, simple and yet full of features. I can recommend everyone to hold a journal online. It goes really fast and is so much fun.

This app is fantastic!  I write nearly every day, and using this app I don't have to worry about prying eyes of those who may snoop into my other personal accounts.  With Day One I can fingerprint protect my journals, add useful info into my entries like labels, weather, activities... And I can even add old writing with a backdate.  This app suits all of my journaling needs.
This was a truly 5 star app and then V2 fame and removed iCloud sync as a trade off for some nice features. Some that are worth it but some that done work correctly.

I've taken a break from all the Mac and iOS apps in regards to journaling and writing. But, so far this looks incredible! Just synced my fist note from desktop, and now on my phone. Looks incredible! Kudos to the whole app dev team!
Love this app!

column9: Love the app  love the update
column10:
I've used DayOne for about 3 years.  I'm just appreciating the notices of entries from one or more years ago.
From the beginning I've used DayOne on 3 machines (phone, iPad , computer).
User interface is excellent 
This is the first time I've kept a journal going for more than a few months.

column9: Nice app that syncs between all devices
column10: It does what it needs to do, has a clean interface and I haven't encoutered any bugs. On iPad and iPhone it has nice integration with iPhoto. On OSX this is not (yet?) implemented. Thats's about the only thing I miss.

If you rate this APP anything less than 5, I will be doing injustice !! Great product for those who have a habit of writing a journal. I am loving it.

Few Areas that I want to see in the next updates;

1. App for windows, come on I need to have a functionality to write something from my PC
2. More Formatting options, will help the writer to bring some colour to his/her writing
3. Pinch to zoon - this is a must have, I feel this should have been included already.

Thanks for a wonderful App
Great app. Love it!

I have never been very good at journaling.  I used to use a small pocket calendar as a diary to keep track of and remember my life's activities and experiences.  I use this app in much the same way, with the added bonus that it's digital and I can add pictures and short anecdotes.  Exactly what I wanted and perfect for my type of journaling.
Apart from journaling important occurrences and events, Day One also helps me plan, track progress. Love it, extremely useful!!!!

This is pretty good.  It is very convenient how you can upload pics on there.  I have been using this on my vacation, and it is nice to have an easy way to write in my journal with just my iPad.  I just figured out that there is also an option for a password so that is great!!
I use it to keep track of everything.  The step is really a nice feature.

I have been using this for 2+ years and I enjoy it very much. I have found it to be reliable--and I just switched over to the newest version and I like the format. Easy to use- syncs automatically between my iPad and iPhone so I have it wherever I am.  Right now I'm using DayOne backup but I may switch back to iCloud.  I have lots of iCloud space.

I'm not one to journal frequently as much as I would like to; I'm just not really good at doing it. 
This app makes it convenient and it motivates me by the features such as tagging and adding pics. I would definitely recommend this.
The best app for brainstorming.
So far it's great...will find out more down the road...

column9: Several Journals in the palm of my hand.
column10: I'm loving Day One. I have separate journals for several different topics. I can customize each one. I also like the different views, that I can add photos and it tracks several different "aspects" of the day like weather and steps.

So easy to use - extremely well designed. Helps me remember to make a little record of my son. Takes no time, but it's so fun to look back...and I've only used it for a couple months. Time passes far too fast with your kids, this app helps me take a moment to document the day and also have found myself taking more pictures to go along with my notes. I know I will treasure this and am sure my son will enjoy looking back at it one day too.

I absolutely love this app, it is by far the best journaling app experience I could ask for. I have been using it for a couple of years, and I love the new update. I enjoy that multiple photos can be used in one entry. I love the flashbacks from the past, when my journal informs me that a year ago I wrote something on this exact same date. It is a wonderful experience to see my personal growth or the growth of my children through the photos and memories recorded down. I have taken breaks and thought maybe journaling isn't for me and when I go back to it even if I have deleted the app I love that it's still there, all my past entries is kept save and secure while I continue my journaling journey. I rate it a 5star app, and look forward to continuing using it for years to come.
This is my journal of choice in my daily morning routine and is easy to use and dip into again at any stage of the day. Love it!

column9: 1 of the best apps in the store
column10: This is not only the best journal app I've used, but easily one of the best apps I've used. Very well designed. Thanks for thinking it through. Love the calendar view and export/import features. My only request would be I'd love to be able to set locations without granting location data access.
Quick easy and super functional design.

I'm so in love with Day One. It's brought back journalling to my life. I love how it looks and how simple it is to make entries, to edit, to add photos, etc etc.
One bonus feature I also love is the app flagging posts that were made exactly a year or more ago. It makes me smile or take stock when I see these precious memories.

If I had to make some suggestions for improvement, I would say: 1) how about working on the way exported PDFs look? 2) what about allowing embedded videos that are not on YouTube or Vimeo?

Excellent app! Allows me to organize my thoughts and into themes / categories. I am always getting ideas while in middle of something else and with this on my phone I can quickly jot down the idea and save it with a 'tag' that will help me retrieve my t and similar ideas/ thoughts later.
Combines photos, location, and writing to capture life's memorable moments. I may not log every day but Day One is there wherever I need it. Also have the macOS app üëç love the syncing

column9: I LOVE this App!!! Absolutely love it!
column10:
It's perfect for my mom notes on my kids- as they progress through growth & learning! It's amazing for my deep bible study notes and keeping all my sermons & podcasts! 

Love the updates too and great look!
The greatest journal app
After upgrading the app, I can add more photos in my dairy, and I have more choices when I use the app. Love it!
I just developed the habit of taking journals with DayOne App.

Such a great app to have! Where has this been, I've been looking for something very similar for some time and wanting to jot down my thoughts in one place and have it sync to the cloud. Hopefully they come out with an online version as well. Super excited

I really love using Day One for recording down long and short memories. 

It's the best platform for reflecting amidst a busy schedule.

I started this on a lark a few years ago to put a few little things down as I already 'journal' on my computer. This has been absolutely awesome with tags and photos etc to let me see the day to day stuff (the not heavy journal stuff) and get a slice of my past life. The tags have been really great to try to recall things - health issues, things with kids, sports, mood, etc. 

If you don't 'journal,' start with this and see that it doesn't have to be heavy- it can be a celebration, too.

I have been using this for about a year and it has been excellent and easy to use. A great way to keep track of your growing toddler. I am happy with the upgrade allow you to put more than one picture.

Super easy to use. Been using this version and the previous one for the past 8 months to journal about my kids. My only hope is that someday they will hook up with blurb or shutter fly to make an easy and good looking way to print the journal as a hard copy. The PDF version you can export isn't awful I just want something a little more finished.
This app makes you want to keep a journal. It's especially great for saving memories from your life by combing photos, writing, location and more.

column9: Great app with only a missing feature
column10: It should allow you to include small videos too as part of the day entry. Right now, it does not. Only problem with a fantastic app

I have to admit that originally I wasn't too fond of having to use the 'developers' servers to sync my journals, but with the updated app I have been given so many new features that this is no longer an issue (if it was at all)...

Really love the different journals I can create (at the moment I use 8!), the ability to export them wholly or a date range (yes, I am still a paper freak!), uploading multiple pictures etc. ...

The best feature for me is that you can use the app for simple, fun journaling or more complex activities...it's up to you! Easy and reliable to use...the only gripe I have that picture uploads still can cause an issue on the odd occasion. But please show me a perfect app... :)
Love the folders and how easy it is to use!

column9: Terrific for spur the moment notes and for long-term tracking
column10: I picked up this app on a whim, and I've used it far more than I thought I would. It's perfect for planning, general note taking, and especially for tracking projects. This is a truly useful app that does exactly what they say it will do

column9: Outstanding Digital Journal - especially for the busy life's we have
column10:
I have been journaling with Day One for a little over a year.  It has been an answer to logging my thoughts.  I write almost daily after I have read my scriptures and keep it in the same folder as my scriptures on my iPhone.

It helps me write my thoughts and feelings especially after scriptures that I have had a hard time doing.  Oh, I do have to say a huge Mahalo for including up to 10 pictures per entry.  One picture often doesn't do an experience justice.

25 Jul 16 Update:  I capture thoughts and pictures that make my journaling relevant.  I also found that I can have multiple journals as I start up focusing my finishing my dissertation.  Thank you again

Thank you,
Angus

I love using this to keep my travel journal. I use it to keep a diary of each day written were on trips. I like that the new version can have more than one diary too! I have one for our new puppy. It's great that you can put more than one photo in an entry. Wish we could add videos too.

column9: The best Journalling App there is
column10: I have a lot of productivity and other apps that makes life so much easier, but this is the App I would say is most important.  Ideal place to write down ideas and to write the story of my life!  Love it!

I have used Day One Journal app for about three years. Before the improvement that allowed up to 10 photos per entry, the application was limited, although arguably one of if not THE best on the market. I like being able to search by key word, tag or date, but love being able to combine a word journal with a pictorial history. As my wife and I are 'Grey Nomads' and over 60, Day One provides us with an excellent record of where we were and what we did on certain days. Day One fills the essential criteria of a stable, reliable app that fills a real need. I recommend it to all who are looking for this kind of a capability.

I've been using Day One for at least 4 years now. It's a stable app with a good amount of features. Due to their popularity it looks like they'll be around for a while so that's a bonus. I've tried many apps but none seem to be as established as this one with good cross platform capabilities.

Great way to keep track of memories. Once you get in the habit, your photo library grows with purpose. Looking back at years-old photos has meaning when you record your thoughts with it.

The app itself is intuitive and works great. 

I wish they would allow sharing a journal with a family √† la Apple family sharing for apps and music. They're good at adding features so I'll wait patiently.

column9: Can't use it at all on my iPhone SE
column10: The interface doesn't work and just crashes. Heard such good things. Going to be asking for a refund.

column9: Buggy and Not Ready for Prime Time
column10:
Very disappointed. This app looked great and was an "editor's choice", but I'm shocked at how unfinished and buggy it is. I'm on a newer iPad2. It should work fine with all the RAM and processing power I have.  Here's the list of issues and bugs I'm experiencing: 1.) The "back button" link when you're on a post (which is the name of your journal) works intermittently. Sometimes, when I'm finished writing a post it works. But other times it does nothing. I can't go back. The app sort of "freezes" for a second or two, is unresponsive, then does nothing.  2.) Scrolling doesn't work properly.  Sometimes it works smoothly, most times not.  It's jumpy, laggy and feels like the app is leaking memory. Gives the impression the app is on the verge of crashing and I'm going to lose my work.  Doesn't exactly inspire confidence.  3.) Words inexplicably break in the middle of sentences and I can't get them to re-join. I backspace, try to rejoin the word but the same thing keeps happening.  Ridiculous and frustrating.  4.) Copying and pasting text into a post is a nightmare, with jumbled words and illogical line breaks everywhere.  And, of course, breaks in the middle of words when there is plenty of room left on the line.  Just one letter in the middle of the page on the end of a line...then the rest of the word starting on the line below. And it can't be rejoined no matter what I do. Useless.

I've only been using this app for an hour. These issues are GLARINGLY OBVIOUS. It makes make me feel the developers rushed this version of DayOne out the door ("we gotta ship!") rather than test the app properly and release something solid. It's not solid. It's not ready for Prime Time.  It isn't ready for release at all.  Is this why it was 50% off?  Listen: if your software isn't ready, don't release it into the wild and rely on your USERS to be your quality control.  ANY person on the DayOne team (don't they have testers?) could have and SHOULD HAVE caught these issues if they had used the app or tested it before releasing it. I'm shocked. With all the good reviews (from earlier versions), I was confident I made the right choice, but obviously I didn't.  For some reason, this version was rushed out the door.  DayOne chose to jeapordize their good name by releasing a shoddy, half-finished app, rather than properly testing - or even using! - this version before releasing it. Again, I've only used the app for an HOUR and I have already found half a dozen serious bugs. Gee, thanks for charging me $4.99 and wasting my time for the "privilege" of being your software tester, DayOne!  What a waste.

This used to be my favourite app period. I was so excited about the new version and all it entailed. It was a pricey update that I was comfortable with because I had been using this app for four years and, at the time, I deemed it worthy. 

Oh surprise. The app is slower than ever, almost six months since the update and I still can't switch apps while editing an entry without having to relaunch the app to the main screen, photos take an eternity to sync, the "on this day" feature that cannot be turned off and makes Day One feel like Facebook. 

This app is such a disappointment and I find myself using it less and less. It looks pretty, sure, but that's about the only positive thing I can say about this update. Shame.
I started using Day One to document my bulldog's cancer treatment. Now I use it to document daily life; good times and bad. The UI is clean and beautiful. I use it on my iPhone and my iMac.

Love the simplicity of the app design and interface while still very clean and elegant.  Very easy to use.  For those who wants to keep s dairy for work/study/personal or even blogging ( as you can export html and pdf) . This might not be a bad app to try :)

I really enjoy using this app. I use it as a diary and find that it has helped me to sort my thoughts out. I have AS and GAD so sometimes I find that the thoughts inside me are overwhelming me. So when that happens I always write them down and feel somewhat better afterwards.

I am enjoying this app a great deal.  I'm an inconsistent journal-keeper - probably always will be - but DayOne helps a great deal.  Also good to be able to add photos to my journal.  (Probably a lot of other data too but I have not figured that out yet.)

I love to write in my diary and although that may never end, I have a new love of capturing my thoughts digitally. It's a gorgeous app that inspires me to capture all aspects of my senses. My favorite thing is the notification I receive to prompt me to read something I wrote 1 year ago that day. It simple way to remind me of the progress of made. Thanks team for this great app.

I thoroughly enjoy this app. I use it to chronicle a systemic illness. I am able to print out the selected month and bring a copy for the doc to review. It enables me to be more proactive with my healthcare. Thank you Day One.
This is the best journal I have ever used. I love it. I use it everyday. My daughters use it everyday. Just get it.

column9: Long haul journal that fits into my life
column10:
I suppose I'd say I love Day One because I use it. Very intimately. I feel safe and free to communicate and express myself to it. How often can you say that about a journal? An app? Day One has been the simplest integration of the journal habit into my regular life. 

I REALLY like the geotagging. I appreciate some of the IFTTT integrations. 

Most of the important buttons are all in the right place. Touch ID locking is fabulous. Ability to craft a post on the fly without unlocking the journal is also a fantastic time saver. Shaving milliseconds from the points of idea creation to idea expression is important to me. I think a thousandmilesaminute. Ideas are fleeting. Time is important. DO thought of this. They should keep thinking of that. Improving upon that.  

What I don't like: 

DO2's lack of iCloud syncing. I'd like to sync to iCloud.

What I'd like to see improved: 

- Stick the hash button on the main keyboard. Instagram and Twitter position this convenience right next to a (smaller) "return" button. 

- Mild image editing would be much appreciated. I don't need a the 64 color crayon box of unnecessary filters, but a handy square/crop/reposition would be deeply appreciated. Even though I'm simply journaling for myself, sometimes the 3:4 orientation of my photos just fall flat. Weaving trails from various apps I think just deflates a little momentum, honesty, and intimacy I hold with DO. A little fleeting momentum adds to a lot of misplaced passion over time. 

- Shift day start option. Some other apps have this feature and I found it surprisingly useful! It would be helpful for night workers and others who keep non conventional hours. Sometimes, when I find myself awake after midnight, the post fits better with the cadence of the previous day, not the current. It would be helpful to optionally manipulate the timeline in those cases. 

-

The ability to centralize both original and public content via dedicated journals is very useful. I've tried many other apps for this purpose but Day One's intuitive and functional interface is the best I've seen. Well done!
Simple and convenient. Multiple journals is major asset. Markdown allows adequate formatting. Goo integration of metadata.

I have been a journal keeper for years, but not on a regular basis. The features and cross device sync makes this the perfect journaling app and makes me a keep a better record of my life. 

The features that I find most useful are
- reminders 
- photos 
- location & weather of the post
- physical activity for the day
- tags
- journal entry suggestions 
- multiple journals 

Being able to use it on my phone allows me to jot down ideas and feeling at any time. The desktop app allows longer, more contemplative entries. It is well worth the small investment.
I love having separate journals and being able to upload photos.

That's what it took for me to figure out how good this program works. I'm not here to talk of security and privacy issues, don't know enough to comment. What I do know about is the program itself.

I have used it since the first release for my PTSD/diabetes journal. I currently have over 2000+ entries that get synced every day so I don't lose anything. It has tracked times, places and a bunch of over things that aren't as important to me. I've never lost a journal or anything when the sync happens. In fact I haven't had any problems out of this app in a long long time. 

So I guess to sum it all up, just start using the program and you like me will discover the  ease and convenience of all this program can offer.

Along with basic journaling, which is awesome, I use it for dream journaling. Often waking up and recording the fleeting memory of the night's journey. Tagging it as a dream so I can review my dream content easily. I also use the tags for recording ppl I meet, their names; circumstances; details that stand out. It helps to recall people who I don't run into often enough to remember their name, etc. I have a "medical" tag that I use for any issues, viruses or kinks that come up throughout the year. I review these when I get my annual checkups to make sure I'm covering everything. The uses are boundless and the app itself is stunning and flexible. I'd love to see a we-app to complement this someday (not a Mac user so no desktop client) but I love it. Well maintained, easy to use, and practical. Worth the expense.
I love this app! I use it in the mornings to map out my day, and then at night to reflect on the days accomplishments. This is an app for top performers.
Was waiting for the ability to upload multiple photos for a single day, and it is now here!

I've just downloaded the app to record my daughter's baby milestones. So good so far. Good looking layout but would love to see the ability to insert short videos. Other than that it seems to have everything i would like to use.

I've been using Day One for years now, and it's become such a treasure trove of my life. I love how easy it is to add little bits of extra flavor to my posts, but the focus stays on the writing.

The application is stable, beautiful, and a joy to use.
For real. I use this religiously! I can't sleep without writing in my journal.

Such a beautiful app that makes journaling so convenient and organized. Every morning I start my day with a gratitude entry and it makes such a difference. Thank you day one your design and efficiency is worth every penny!
So well designed, this app is beautiful. It is such a great way to capture lights great moments and revisit them throughout the year.
I've used this for 2 days and I like to it so far. Easy to add thoughts to. I like it.
I love everything about it. Still discovering new stuff as I use day-to-day.
Top class app. I've been using this on a daily basis for years now. Really cool feature of memories in the recent update. Anyone who wants to capture notes memories, must give it a go.
Not sure what all the privacy concerns are. I'll have to research that. Otherwise, I love this app. It meets all my needs and more! Will update if anything changes.

column9: Great app for the budding minimalist!
column10: I love Day One! I am in the first stages of minimalizing my life, and this app is absolutely perfect for journaling without actual stickers, gel pens and all the things I no longer possess. I love the ability to add photos to each day, and I love that the app tells me about entries from the same day in previous years!

This application is a great journaling app does want to keep a record of various things that happen in your life. It is very easy to use and has a lot of great features, the only drawback is it's price. I use it regularly and find that it motivates me to record happenings.

I should have thought, and did, that this App (and desktop application) would be unnecessary, for one could always use Word or Evernote or some other text app. 
But after years of ambivalence I concluded that other options just weren't working and picked DayOne up again. And it is working for me. 
I have not had occasion to test whether it's possible to get entries out of it and over to another program, which I will do presently. If that doesn't work, that's a deal-breaker, and I'll have to get out of it and cut and paste the 10 days or so where I've made entries. 
I'm puzzled that the set of fonts in the app is so restricted, and for the most to odd fonts. For a diary, one would expect, if not access to all installed fonts, at least a robust selection of serif fonts. But no. I wrote customer service and they promptly replied that they would keep that it mind for future iterations.  Surprising.  Why not Calibri and a Garamond, if not Janson or Sabon or a Baskerville?
Licensing issues?  I would have thought Apple system fonts would be available.  Few people seem to know that nonserif fonts were not intended for text but designed for signage.  There is even a movie, called Helvetica, that speaks to the barbarity of that nonserif font. 
I'm not aware of any workarounds as with the Kindle.
