Not working export Facebook üëéüèºüëéüèºüëéüèºüëéüèºüëéüèºüëéüèº

It does what I need it to do. I type things in and it saves it, dated and filed. The organization is intuitive and clear. I've seen some complaints about the change in syncing options from the original app, but it works well for me so far.
Much better than the free diary apps I tried. Love to add photos in line with the text to remind me how I was feeling that day or where I was.
This app is the best app that has ever happened to me.

column9: Love this app. Only one enhancement request
column10:
I love this app and how it is set up. It's quick and easy to put down a thought. I bought the desktop app and love the syncing between my Mac & phone. 

My only request is the option to record audio. I understand that would take up bandwidth for syncing but that would make it the most perfect app in this area.
I love that you can attach multiple pictures to each journal post!
Been using this for a month and love it! Best iPhone app hour a I have used to date. Hope to see more solid format and layout functions in future release to make to even better!

I've tried a lot of journaling apps, but Day One continues to rise to the top. Quick, flawless sync, so easy to add an entry, automatically brings in weather and location info (with permission), gorgeous interface for browsing through entries. Love it!

Much the best of the diary/journal apps out there - which is why it features on the Essentials list. There seem to be quite a lot of grumbles amongst other reviewers; in part because Day One have walked away from iCloud and Dropbox. I like Dropbox, but it is clunky and occasionally problematic when you delete things - and iCloud can be very erratic indeed, so Day One's decision is right in my book, even if there are hiccups from time to time.  Highly recommended.

column9: Infuses My Life with A Deep Sense of Significance
column10:
The thumb-passcode lock makes this space for preserving experiences and ideas truly private.  In this privacy, I can at last explore my inner-most self without fear of discovery and misunderstanding of others.  This kind of opportunity to be completely honest with myself is rare, and is helping me to make better decisions and consequently live a better life.

The calendar structure that holds organizes all of the entries grounds my thoughts within the context of my daily existence, integrating my intellectual self with my social and generally experiential self.

I am a constant user of the v1.0 of this app (sold separately), and was very excited when Day One announced a major update. 

That excitement quickly dissipated, however, when I saw that they actually removed features from their new app, most importantly the ability to use your own sync services like Dropbox or iCloud. Now, you're forced to use their servers, which is not a good option for me. I prefer to have full control over my data in any app, but especially for an app that houses my personal thoughts. 

I've contacted Day One and they have no plans of changing this policy. Vote with your wallet, folks. Do you want to vote against removing features and against a company forcing you to give control of your data to them? If so, pass on this app.
I love this I am keeping a day by day journal for my son. This is so easy and quick. Such a great app
ƒ∞ cant sync day one classic from icloud

Have been using Day One for quite awhile and loved it.  Was hesitant to go to Day One2 originally but after reading all the positive reviews took the plunge and installed.
I am a little annoyed at myself for not installing it sooner. It is fantastic with lots of new features as well.  Can certainly recommend it.
10 out of 10 would recommend. Easy interface that looks amazing. Great for people like me who struggle writing in a journal consistently.
Fun way to document your days so you can remember them.
Great app, I had the classic one and loved it and this one is even better. It's very easy to use and has a smooth look that you can personalize. I've never had any problems with it.
Please add a possibility to catch a music from spottily or others services also

The latest version of Day One has a lot of great new features. I love having several photos and several separate journals. I can now use Day One to keep records of many things. If they just add a few more features, I will give it 5 stars. For example, I want to be able to rearrange photos once they are uploaded to an entry. I am told that this feature is coming. I'd also like to be able to share an online version of an entry on Facebook. They have good customer support, and I love it that my entries are automatically synced to their cloud and between my devices.

column9: Horrible - this app has fallen a long way
column10: I have loved and used this app for years. It is now useless if you want to sync between two devices. Sync with Dropbox and iCloud is no more. Sync with the so-called Day One sync is worthless. I've tried multiple times, each with a different error but all leading to the same disappointing conclusion. Very sad, but this app now goes onto the junkpile of apps that have been ruined by overdevelopment.
Love how it syncs with my Mac and iPad. It's a great and easy to use journal and I love the design and UX. Much better for personal journaling than other note taking apps.
Great way to record notes, thoughts, and ideas. I love the fact that I can see information such as location and weather. I also love the cross functionality between i devices
Please night mode is missing.This feature is very important for those that it.

column9: Excellent App - I use it every day
column10: Using the Day One app has become woven into the fabric of my daily life. It integrates so well with how I think and how I try to record and ponder my life and my interactions with other people and the world around me. I highly recommend it.

I try to use this everyday, it's really phenomenal!  I've been using it for 6 months and it's so much fun to look back to review your days that you spent.  I love that it's private, opposed to Facebook.  They have made many improvements that make it better.  Well worth the money.
Used for two years, keep improving with more functions, nice!

Exporting the entries in a pdf doesn't works with day one classic. So buying the new version to generate a pdf. In case of version one where the app generates a corrupted pdf, the new version of the app crushes. Contacting the developer is like communicating with a black hole - NO ANSWER! This app is the money not worth cause basic functions doesn't work. Although the app ist greatly designed and would fit me needs if it would work ... So good idea, very bad realization!
Any tool can be unusable if it is loading about 10 seconds.... It's time to performance optimization
I have been using this app for a while.  The upgraded version makes it even better.  I love that I can add more than one photo now.  I also love that you can create different journals.
Tons of functions, good privacy options, frequent and useful updates, and of course, it helps me keep my thoughts in order. Really, really worth it!
I enjoy this app. It's extremely easy to use. Simple. Easy to post pics and write daily logs.

I find this an excellent app, you can add up to 10 photos a day, and if that's not enough, you can create another page to use for the same day. Use the date inherent in the photo, or create your own date. If you hold your iPad in a portrait position, you have the whole blank page to create on; if you hold it in a landscape position, you have a toolbar on the side with snapshot snippets of your previous entries, which can be easily referred to. I have created such a masterpiece, I try not to think about how much memory I have left on it or if it can be made into book form (I don't want it to end up on the Internet), but this app really DOES have it all!!!
Please focus more on basic performance. Loading time is very slow and the speed of scroll down is terrible. Stability and speedy performance are far far more important than sexy feature set.
Won't sync up everything from my iPhone between my iPad, iPad is missing heaps of enteries. Has heaps of potential but it's just lacking a few things

column9: Brought back the joy of writing
column10: I recently happened to open my old, three year old, MacBook, to find an old collection of scribbles I've written on occasion in Day One. I must say that nostalgia was a force to be reckoned with, and after a two year break, I found myself eager to seize my iPad and start writing again. While the pace is low, I do enjoy a locked and private platform where I can share my deepest secrets. The app is great, and never fumbles or forgets. The option to add pictures is awesome and makes for interesting posts, that I will gladly visit again in three years or so. Just hopefully this time I'll be writing all the way to that point.

Yesterday, Day One suggested I look at posts from a year ago. Love that feature. I'm finding myself writing on a more regular basis, because the app is such a pleasure to use. And since I have an Apple Watch now, it's one more reason to use Day One more often.

Nice work!

Beautifully designed and packed with features, Day One really gets the juices flowing. It's a very simple interface that just allows you to write and write and write. I recommend it to any and everyone.
What a way of recording life!

It's kind of funny. I really like this app and have been using it for years but they have removed Dropbox and iCloud sync so their new server can take over. 

While I agree with others saying they may be transitioning to a subscription base model. The part I dislike is I can't use my trusted Dropbox or iCloud server with my personal stories.

Otherwise I love this app. It makes it easy to go and relive important memories.
Love the multiple image and journal capability now. Color coding the journals is great too.

column9: Get this app!! Especially if you're a beginner
column10: Before getting Day One, I never journaled but would try it out every once in a while and failed after a couple days. It took my a couple months to start regularly journaling and making it a habit but now I write in my journal almost every day, no matter how small the entry is. I currently have 5 journals in Day One: My thoughts/memories, dream journal, my accomplishments (big and small), fitness/health, and my gratitude journal. Obviously if you're first starting you don't need to go that big but it is definitely rewarding especially since this app has the feature to look back at entries from today in different years to show how much you've grown and improved. This app is awesome!!
Nothing else out there compares. The best app I've found in its category.
Nice tool to capture my memories!
Awesome app!
This app has been getting me I the habit of capturing my life. I am very grateful for this app.

column9: Long time user, first time reviewer
column10: Been using Day One since it first came out a few years ago. I seem to go in spurts on journaling and not, but with the the latest upgrade, I seem to be on a streak. I travel a lot for work and was starting have trouble separating my trip entries from my personal entries. The ability to have multiple journals has been a real winner in my book. I also love the new "day in history" feature as it reminds me of what we have done in the past. We usually take a few summer vacations, and it's nice to reflect on where we have been and what we have done.
Why waste your time on any other apps? Day One is the best option for tracking all moments in your life, whether great or small.
Easy to use... Nothing not to like!!

column9: Works great! Easy share on this version
column10: Two thumbs up.

I love the UI. I find it intuitive and helpful. I use it as a simple journal. I use some of the add-on features such as pictures and location data. I'm sure I'm underutilizing this app, though. I know it has more potential that I just haven't taken advantage of yet. BUT. I do not find it overwhelming at all like some other apps. If you want more, it has that. But if you want to keep it simple, it doesn't that and does it beautifully.
Near perfect. The only thing I would truly like included is the option to use audio. If that, 5 stars easily.

I really hope I have more time to use this app more often. It's a beautiful app and got a lot of great updates from the original. I tell you it's really worth the money, if you want to record your memories in a refined way. Keep it up!
This app is the best beautiful design that I know, very easy, simple, work very well. I like this app.
Love the update, but why did I have to pay again for this app?
A bit expensive but perfect in whole iOS diary app ^_^
Great interface and features. Color-coded journals, hash tags, photos, import and export feature, slick navigation. Lags a little at times but overall a sweet app.

I'm a journaler, I love to write, it keeps me sane. I had the classic Day one and loved it. I was not too thrilled when I had to pay $30 to upgrade to DO2 but I did it. I still think the devs should have offered a free (or lower cost) upgrade to current users, but I do get it. The bottom line is that the journal is awesome, it works and syncs seamlessly between my Mac, iPad and iPhone. I can journal anywhere, anytime, and I love this app! I totally recommend.

I have been using this app a long time and it is the best one of many that I have tried. You can know use multiple journals & add multiple pics to each entry which are great improvements. 

My only criticism is, if you want to export any entries to pdf the app sends you every single entry from all journals. If they can change this then it would perfection. 

Definitely give it a try.  You won't be disappointed.

column9: Never had a diary before but ...........
column10: Now I love it, great way of keeping memories in chronological order with the information used from photographs it makes even easier, weather, date, time and location automatically filled.

column9: The best journaling app I've found
column10: Fur sure

I don't usually write reviews, but I just had to for this app. Amazing, amazing, amazing app, ground breaking not in its features but it's simplicity and user experience. 

Makes journaling every day fun and easy. Love that it syncs with the Mac app, and love the ability to include pictures/gifs. Love the multiple journals feature.

Worth every penny.
I caved and got this upgrade after using the original Day one app. So far I like it a lot. Keep improving and fixing bug. You guys have something good here.

I was initially hesitant about leaving behind the old Day One app, but after a day I found the extra features unexpectedly made my journaling easier and more organized. My systems for doing my daily review have been much better. Writing regularly is also extra easier and more convenient now. Thank you!
I didn't think I would enjoy journaling but this has been great for me!

I have kept a paper journal since I was 9 years old but this app has changed my journaling practice from a once-in-a-while practice to almost daily. I absolutely love all the features , especially the ability now to have several photos to accompany each entry. It's nearly perfect!  I would really love the ability to print the pages out with several entries per page and small photos.  Other than that, this is the best app ever. I am a playwright, and since you can now create several journals within Day One, I have made a separate journal for my current playwriting project. When the project is over, I can delete that one.  Love love love Day One!
Snap a picture and type a memory! It's that simple

column9: An amazing app that got me into journalling!
column10: This app makes it easy to start jounalling and to continue across all your apple platforms.  The app works on Mac, and iOS nand it doesnt take much to get going with it.  Much like ulyses it gets out of the way and let's you go about the business of writing a journal.

I've always had a challenge with keeping a journal. This app has, amazingly, been a godsend. I don't really know why, but I have found it easy to go to the app, often, to record happenings, feelings, and plans.  I love it!

I started using Day One as my electronic journal. I am able to sync with my iPad and iPhone. So the journal entries I record on one, sync to the other. I'm interested to test the Apple Watch app. I sent in a support request and received a prompt reply. So far, this has been the best journaling app for me.
Like the multiple journals and multiple picture entries.
Such a great app! Love the notification option.

I enjoy writing with DayOne, it has encouraged me to journal, which is something I could never get into. I really appreciate being able to go back in time and see where my life was at during different times. The app is easy and friendly. I have a personal Journal, one for my business (that's where my blog posts come from) and one for my unborn son. I'll write to him until he is grown then give it to him as he moves out on his own. The app is beautifully designed and has worked well for me.

After paying for the first version of the app and then being forced to party again for the update I wish I hadn't. The new version 2 is painfully slow to sync. It will sit for several minutes being unresponsive and useless thanks to its horrible sync service. Even on my 12.9 iPad Pro it's painfully slow. The UI is poor as well. Unfortunately since you cannot export I am stuck with those horrible app.

Avoid if you can!

I'm using to keep a log of our Baltic vacation. So nice to take quick pictures, have so much metadata captured automatically, then I add a few notes. I'll use later to help organize the pics I'm taking with my other camera. Wonderful!

Very simple and easy to use but with lots of features if you want them. I used many other journaling apps and the interface wasn't user friendly. I like how you can have separate entries in the same day. I like that the headings are automatically in bold. You can add photos which is cool. Highly recommended.

I broke my right arm and was lost without the ability to journal. I found Day One and thought I'd try it even though it wouldn't be the same. It has been so fun to use and easy to share other parts of my life to from other apps, so it actually creates a richer (in a different way) journaling experience for me. Highly recommend. I have been using it about two weeks and so far haven't run into any bugs or gaps.
Best UI. Really enjoy with this app
Meets and in some aspects exceeds my expectations for a journaling app.
An outstanding app which helps document ones life ; technology at its optimum utilisation

column9: Loving it but more would be nice
column10:
June 30 2016 update
Love it and I am using it to record my work and personal journal. Wish there is a way to share certain parts of journal with another account. 

I wish it had voice recording as well

Love it love it. I am trying to keep a journal for business and personal and I can do it with this app. I just don't know if I can export snd import to another Day One Journal Account to be shared with my company Day One Account without them seeing my personal journal.

I've had this not so very long but I was writing in a journal a few months ago when I thought I'd look up an app for journaling. Well I ran across this and I love it!!  As someone who in love with Jesus, I love to show where I see God work in my life that day and things that happen.  I also use it as a prayer journal.

Used macjournal before. Day One is simply better. Easy, fast and beautiful. They keep adding smart features. 

Swedish: b√§sta appen f√∂r att skriva journal/dagbok

I have been debating on a journalling app for some time.  I like to record everything and used a spreadsheet before for notes.  I like the automated features that come with the app as well as the ability to add photos.  I hope that additional export and integration with other apps will continue to develop.

I got this app to have a way to just jot journal entries on the go and love that it lets me add pictures with captions or info about where I took them! I too often bump the tag icon while I am typing, but maybe the keyboard is slightly smaller on the app than in texting and I just hit a little too high on the screen? It's definitely not a deal breaker for my recommending this app!

column9: This is the app I enjoy most!
column10:
Only one thing lacking in this superb app: The ability to add several photos to create separate posts for each image.

I know you can add multiple images to one post, and that is great, but batch adding photos to create several posts would be awesome.
Best journal app there is - PERIOD!

This app works great for me. I often want to keep a diary of events while on vacation. I can post pictures from my iPhone and it gives the GPS locations as well. 

Also keep a record of my cooking adventures or misadventures with my new pressure cooker. 

A good app.
I've had this app for a few years now. It completely works for me. I can write entries whenever I want and I can also attach photos. Best app! Download and upgrade it, you won't regret it:)
It's my digital memory book:) I love it. I really enjoy scrolling back through the years and reading little quotes from my little ones.
Love it.
An intuitive app that encourages me to write. My only gripe is that I can't sync this version with iCloud.

This little app is great. I had day one which I found straightforward to use. Day One 2 improves on the original, letting you upload multiple photos per entry, for example. But, it doesn't sync from iCloud, a glaring, frustrating omission. My iPhone sits as it was in May when I transferred my original diary. Sort that and it will be five stars!
Excellent app enabling you to put all your memories and experiences down with ease.

I have been using this app for three years as my journal and I love it! If I'm sitting in a doctor's office waiting on an appointment to begin or if I'm anywhere really, and I have a thought, feeling, or observation that I want to write down, I no longer have to carry a notebook that is my journal or a pen and try to find a hard space to set my journal down on to write down whatever I wanted to write down while watching to see if anyone is looking over my shoulder to see what I'm writing(I am referring to my very inquisitive and sneaky children lol) or wondering if I can write fast enough before they call me into my appointment without getting a chance to finish my thought.

This app allows me to journal from my computer, from my iPad, and also from my phone. I love that I can journal from anywhere with this app! I absolutely love that I can add pictures to my journal entries since I also write poetry and am able to find a picture that somewhat, if not completely, captures and expresses my poem in a visual form and the same can be said for finding images and pictures and being able to load them into the same journal to help express thoughts that are not written as poetry but just as a regular journal entry.

My last absolutely favorite thing about this app is that you can back up your entries to the Day One server, ICloud, Dropbox(my personal favorite) or to a custom location of your choice. This ensures that even if your computer, iPad, iPod, or iPhone all crash and burn(not that all of them doing that at the same time seems likely) you don't have to worry that you just basically lost your journal period because the entries in DayOne, as long as they are backed up regularly, maybe a few times a week, you won't have lost any of your journal entries at all. 

All in all, I consider myself lucky the day I stumbled across this app and paid for it and then began using it regularly. I have had other journal apps but none of them even came close to this app. I definitely recommend this app to anyone looking for a journal app that can keep up with you!!
I have downloaded several other journals, but DayOne has it all.  And is easy to use.  Love being able to add the photos, the calendar and editing.
This app is perfect. Thank you maddy moon for the recommendation !
I'd been looking for an app that would allow me to easily write in my journal,upload photos and share or print journal entries easily. Day One has exceeded all of my expectations! Outstanding!
Have been using day one for three years now and I love it.
Awesome app! Can't get enough!

I've been using DayOne Classic for some time now, upgraded this weekend to DayOne 2 on my mac, iphone, and ipad. I had some trouble getting them all to sync up but Adam from customer support guided me through the entire process. Super responsive and helpful! Love that I can add multiple photos per entry now, and they're syncing seamlessly across all my 3 devices.

I thought it was a bit sad to see the old Day One reach it's end of life. But I had come to not enjoy it's look anymore. With all the advancements in APIs, I thought it was high time. Simply put, DO2 just so much more intuitive and easier on the eyes. Only thing that's stopping me from giving it a 5-star rating is that neither the Mac or iOS version take advantage of Handoff/Continuity, something I'd like to see in future updates, but at least syncing is seamless and near instant.
Simple and easy, write and find!

column9: "This day" feature is a great way to walk down memory lane
column10: I love being able to quickly see entries from the current date back through all my entries.

column9: TOP OF BEST APPS I HAVE OWNED
column10: Finally a great journal/diary app that has all what you need and most importantly, it's convertible for future apps or other types.  I worry about what happens when you write for years but then can't transfer anything. This has that. Tags are so helpful for pulling stuff up or leaving messages for people. It's just one of the best apps I've owned. Had it for about 4 years now and still happy with it.

This app is great.  It's organized and very easy to use.  It has great features.  4 stars only as I feel we shouldn't be limited to 10 pictures per journal entry.  Overall, best journal app I've tried out so far.
I love the Markdown support and multiple images feature. I thought I'd miss the Dropbox integration but the cloud distribution works flawlessly.
A great way to journal, but also a powerful thought collector and organizer. Love it!
...and my go to app for my thoughts and inward reflections. I am really enjoying the improvements to the app in the latest version.

column9: Well Designed App That Consistently Works
column10: I've been using Day One for a long time and there really isn't much more you can ask from a journaling app. The app works smoothly, has a beautiful interface, and syncs reliably. It does all the things a journal app should do and it does them well.
best dairy app

I'm not sure why I decided to try this, but it's kind of nice. I use dictation so I don't have to type. I also like that I can capture moments that maybe successes or failures to push my growth. Try it out. üòÄ
I don't write in paper books any longer!

column9: Handy to keep the dairy everyday
column10: Hope I can keep on writing diary for my daughter everyday!

column9: Great app - I don't use it enough though
column10:
Great journaling app, I use for both business and personal journals in two separate 'books'.

I just don't use it enough - and am aiming to write in it every single morning. 

All the best to other users!

column9: Awesome, and better the more you use it
column10:
I have used day one for several years now. Keeps getting better, and having those years full of memories written down is wonderful. 

Highly recommended.
It just works. It does what it says it will, and you can't beat that. Nice visuals and useful features. Recommended to friends.
I use this app all the time: I cannot recommend it enough. Have used for two years and it's so neat to go back and read things from way back.
Great app and if they include audio and video in the entries it will be a greater app.

I use this app everyday. Its easy to use and back up journals. I like having multiple journals for different subjects and thoughts. It was an improvement being able to add up to 10 photos per entry, makes it easier to document the day.
A good app

column9: Day One Just Has Gotten Better
column10:
These new needed changes are great.  I like DayOne for many reasons, but keeping journals on my family is wonderful. 

If you decide to purchase the app I don't think you will be disappointed, but then again I don't know your need either.But for journaling with photos and keep track of thing is wonderful.
Anytime I get a moment, this is my go to app. Love all the features it has since the iPhone 4S version. Keep it up
Works well!

I am fortunate enough to live an eventful life. This app enables me to track all the amazing places I visit with friends and family, all the things that are significant in our lives. Now that I can insert more than one photo per day it is even sweeter. I love this app. Easy to use and invaluable.
New upgrade is great having more photos we can include. I would love to be able to capture short videos and save them too like a video log too. Just a suggestion but love it anyway.

If you're a new user then this probably won't affect you. I really like the new interface but the sync feature between devices does not work. Also, I had old writings from the original app and they will not sync onto my phone the right way. 

The support people have not gotten back to me and it's been almost a full work week. If they fix that I'd give 5 stars, but it's such an important flaw for me.
Excellent app. Very useful and friendly.

I use it to keep my workouts organized and also to keep a journal for my daughter as she grows up. It syncs to all devices, is easily exported, intuitive to use and allows multiple pictures to be added. Only thing that would make it better is if you could upload videos.

Enjoying the app a lot. Easy to use. Easy to access and I like the password lock, it makes me feel more comfortable to leave my notes and thoughts and not to worry that someone can read. Had to issues with this app so far and will keep using. Highly recommend

Finding this a far better product with the upgrade. Having the multiple journals is really handy. Far more than I thought. So far can't find fault. The diminished star rating is just relating to price.
I love using this app as a record of wines I try, food I make, and as a photo journal of the year üòç
Love this app. Been a Day One user for a few years now.

The app keeps freezing frequently on my iPad Pro 9.7. Tap on camera icon. It opens my album. Then freeze. Cannot choose any photo. 

Tapping top left "Journal" button to open the left panel takes ~ 4-5 seconds *everytime*.

Also experienced occasional freezes while browsing journals with photo.
Now even better. I've tried others but keep coming back to Day One
This is a great improvement over the previous version. I rally like being able to add more photos. The export option is very good too.
Great way journal.  The multiple pics are easy to use.  Would be great to be able to import FB posts
Very good
This app makes journaling way to easy. It automates features like geo tagging and weather. Absolute gold
Get this app if you are interested in capturing your private and intimate daily evolution.
Great!

column9: There's a reason it's top rated!
column10:
Yep, DayOne is amazing. It consistently gets top notch reviews and ratings. 
It's THE journal app. I wouldn't be much of a journal person if it wasn't for DayOne.
I did upgrade both iOS and macOS to the new versions. A little pricey since I had purchased the previous versions but well worth the upgrade.
Plus it's a rock solid app that doesn't crash.
I just hope they don't get too feature crazy in the future.
Such an amazing app. Motivates me to keep writing every day, and the automatic metadata features are awesome if you like to geek out on that kind of stuff :)

column9: They listen to users, and this update proves that
column10: We can now import multiple pictures per post. Also, I love the 'this day in history' feature, that makes reminiscing good memories easy, and actually makes me want to journal more.

Need semantic, emotional mood analysis and more key valuable insights from the journals of metadata to realize one's thinking and personal mindset. Knowing oneself is invaluable knowledge and I bet myself and others would be more than happy to spend more for this key missing feature!
This is by far my favorite app for taking notes and journaling. Love all the features for keeping photos and marking my location.
üëçüèæ

Somehow the original was improved upon and things just got better. Day One is a great baby book, travelogue, food diary, personal journal, note app and more. It really seems like it's functionality is only limited by your imagination.
I like the design. The functionality is great.
I use it often. Love the v2 features. Started me journaling.
This is the best app I ever have
Day One is the best journal app there is.

I love this app for daily journaling. The reminder feature is great for getting me to check in daily and the photo feature makes it really easy to capture snaps from my day quickly and unobtrusively. 

I haven't played much with the tagging or other features. They stay nicely out of my way and just let me enjoy the basics that I need daily.

I've tried a number of other journaling apps and I keep coming back to Day One. It's not perfect (although the 2.0 "update" brought it a lot closer) but it's simple, straight forward, secure, and flexible. I've even purchased the OSX app so I can use them together. I do wish there were a web-based option, too, but maybe someday.
Helps me be disciplined in writing everyday!

I've been keeping a journal for some three to four years, and I find it a very useful reminder. By journaling, I don't allow myself to wander into any "zone."
The best thing about the process is that it keeps me on track and enables me to look back and see where I have been regular with my entries. In a way, that is a self-regulating process. When I can look back to a year ago on the same date, I have a real sense of trust.
Thgank you for the invention!!
I love this app, it has helped me personally and emotionally. So practical and has allowed me to enjoy more of life by reflecting on it.
Love this app. Didn't think a journal would help a lot to vent out but it does. It's really therapeutic.

I love Day One - and after trying out several similar apps, this is now the only journal I use. Making entries is quick and easy, up to 10 photos can be imported for each day, and unlike with some similar apps, it's very easy to change the time and date of entries if you need to. Also, if you import a photo, it gives you the option to automatically change the date and time of the entry to match those of the photo. Brilliant! üòä

Start improving your life today and buy this app. There aren't too many apps in the App Store that's will truly change your life and give you the opportunity to record it in a way that will benefit you for years. 
Stop remembering the negative events in your head and start documenting the positive in images and writing. 
Thanks to the team for creating this app.
Great to enjoy it and use it to record down both photo and words to keep my memory fresh and easy to track, will definitely use more and support to developer!

A great app. It works easily, nice to add extra info when ik on the way. 
Finding something I wrote I don't know when is also easy with the search tab
It's a pity that syncing with the earlier version on my iMac doesn't work.
This is awesome.  I use it between both my iPhone and iPad seamlessly.

Day One is the best journaling app I've ever tested. Simply it is beautifully crafted, the experience when you start to use enhances you to keep writing and writing and writing.

No doubt that with it's amazing bunch of features, this app leads in innovation, utility and aesthetics. 

Is just the best, hands down period.

This app epitomizes what I love most about the Apple platform: technology seams to disappear and what you really want to do somehow just naturally happens. I love that the interface feels intuitive and the features are rich, but that I only notice the depth of the features after I have accomplished what my primary goal was in the first place. Yes, it tracks all kinds of data around entries; yes, the data can be exported and shared in many ways; but to me the power of this app is in the fact that the many features are exciting to see after I have already created what I desired: a set of memories. These memories have a richness from the media that can be included and the metadata that is automatically gathered. Now I not only have the memories, but I also have a story behind the memories as well. Thank you Day One.

column9: using it as a gratitude journal
column10: particularly because its usability and lovely design allow it to be image-intensive, I find this to be an eminently suitable gratitude journal.
I caved and bought the Mac app as well. Delightful as expected.

The greatest diary app I've ever used!
Wish u guys better in the following versions(‚Ä¢ÃÄœâ‚Ä¢ÃÅ)‚úß
Easy to use and effective

Writing down my thoughts in a way that isn't edited for Facebook or on a blog is very freeing. I really enjoy sharing my thoughts without fear of being judged. I can write it down without filtering my true feelings.

Love this app! The interface is beautiful, I don't think it's ever crashed, and being able to unlock it with Touch ID is an extremely smart feature, among its many others. Price is a bit high, but if you want an app for journaling or anything like that, Day One is the very best.

Nice application
Easy to use

I have been using Day One for over a year now, so I've been through both the old and the new versions. This one is absolutely an upgrade and worth the couple of bucks it costs. Let's be honest, journaling is hard! Especially in this day and age when people are constantly moving or can't be torn away from their smartphones. And who wants to write by hand anymore?! That takes time and energy that a few little taps of the thumbs could mitigate significantly. So we're left with a few options: A) never think about how you feel and are processing the events of your life B) tell everyone you've ever met on Facebook and Twitter or C) buy this app and start thinking more deeply about your life and how you're living it.

Maybe I stilted those options a little, but I'm just trying to make a point and help YOU, dear reader, understand that if you're even on this page (meaning you have some kind of interest in journaling) you should go ahead and buy this app.

You can even put things in italics and bold!! Which is amazing.

column9: I like it more and more.
column10:
Okay. It's not perfect. There is no way to make TODO lists and not a lot of formatting options, but what I love about this app is the ability to share things as they happen and have different journals for different things. 

I share photos of memorable moments with DayOne and it files it under the location and date of the photo, and I add a short excerpt of my experience.

When I workout to an exercise video, I share the link to that video to my training journal. When I go on an outdoor training adventure, I take a pic, and share the pic with my training journal. 

I have a travel journal for sharing my trip pics.

I also like the ability to tag things, but not sure I will use this feature much when reviewing past notes. We'll see.
Works brilliantly. Syncs well. Just the right amount of functionality. A pleasure to use, which is essential when it's prompting you every day to write in it.
Best feature I believe is the added ability to put more photos to your Journal. Keep up the good work Guys and Girls. May God bless you greatly, in Jesus name.
nice app
Den perfekte dagbogs-app. Day One er Number One!

I am typically a pen-to-paper kind of gal when it comes to journaling, but I adore this app. It's easy to use and easy to reference. It has saved me from throat punching individuals by using my words to communicate trials and frustrations... While keeping it private. 

I am impressed with the layout and design. I love the "uploading multiple photos" feature. 

I do wish it had more functions with text style and colors. I believe adding these features will assist with creating more emphasis and colorful adjectives in my writing. 

Overall, it's a worthy purchase.
One of the best apps!!
I use this app for all my assessing needs love it
I love this app, but after the last update it's constantly crashing when I try to add multiple pictures...

I've been using Day One for four years and I've enjoyed it from the start. I love it's simple yet elegant design and its ease of use. The newer volume 2 version is a joy; I love having multiple journals - it's something I'd always wanted. I got Day One for my Mac and now I can pick up right where I left off on my iPhone. It's a joy to use and worth every penny.
Awesome app, I've finally found a place, where can I write down all my thoughts, stories, experiences a notices. Love it!
Love the app. Easy to use. I'd love to be able to add video too though....?????

Haven't kept a diary for years but have been using Day One in both this and the last incarnation. Really enjoy it. The desktop app is expensive but worth it for the extremely efficient sync. Good support as well.

column9: A well designed journaling app. Just needs a few tweaks!
column10: I'm really happy and impressed with the work done with this app, I use it almost everyday and I'm enjoying the new changes compared to the Classic. I own both the Classic and this edition and the only complaint I can think of is the fact that it is quite delayed, so whenever I open up the app it takes a while to load and once I've initiated a new post it pauses and so I end up with two or even three empty posts waiting for the app to catch up. I use it on my iPad Air 2 and my iPhone 6s Plus.

Beautifully designed app which focuses on the essentials and makes it easy and enjoyable to keep your journal up to date. The "memories" from this day in earlier years feature is great. Also has a Mac app which syncs.
I love the ability to add pictures to our daily thoughts. Would love to be able to add music as well. Maybe in the update? Otherwise love this app.
I have been diagnosed with MS. Day One has been a godsend for keeping logs of my day to day activities. The value of an easy means of logging is beyond measure.

An outstanding and well thought out application with every technological tool included for the most comprehensive journaling of my thoughts and daily experiences in a convenient and ubiquitous cross platform synced vehicle for getting what's "on my stage" (David Rock) off the stage so that I can process only the high value actionable thoughts deemed of value without the confusion of too many actors on stage.  It is critical to get all of this barrage of data, thoughts, feelings and concerns out of my head and processed through my conscience to a journal and then to my task management vehicles(Pocket Informant/OneNote) where action items are identified, prioritized and tracked.  The cross platform sync allows access anyplace/anytime.  As one who has always thought through the tip of a pen it takes some effort to trust that the keyboard or the dictated word actually does a better and more effective transcription of my thoughts to hardcopy(I print out my thoughts to a paper journal notebook for mark up and review).  Highly recommend this product.

column9: Superb app to keep your memories
column10: I have loved it from day one! ;)

column9: Great app ignore the tin foil hat brigade
column10: All those people complaining about the security of the cloud - get real - if you don't want the authorities to see you thoughts then don't use ANY cloud system - they are ALL relatively insecure when it comes to government access.
This app is awesome.
I use day one for iOS and on the desktop to keep both journals and notes. It's reliable and pretty and, perhaps most importantly, supports markdown!

The programmers did a nice job on this one.  I can start taking notes and pictures on my iPhone and then switch to my iPad Pro and back again.  It is as seamless as using one device.  I never have any crashes or programming glitches.  The search feature is also excellent.  It is location aware and allows me to search for past notes.  Actually, this may be better than using the Note App.  

Again, just a great program.

Extremely disappointed that Dropbox and iCloud backups don't sync the first app to the 2.0 version. 
I can't take 6 years worth of entries from my previous phone onto my new phone with only the new '2.0' version being available from the App Store. 

I have hundreds of entries from a span of 6 years of my life where I've documented my travels, my loves, my losses, my feelings, highs and lows, conquering life's obstacles and random adventures which are now stuck in a iCloud limbo.

Very disappointed.
Best app ever for journaling. Has every feature you need. I only wish it allowed you to add videos in addition to pictures.
Like this app very much. Especially as a travel diary and being able to add multiple photos.

column9: The best journaling app on iOS
column10: The addition of multiple journals and multiple photos per entry makes this an even more useful app.
Great diary app ever

My favorite app. Use it nearly every day. It simplicity keeps me from getting distracted. Beautiful design. 
Like the upgrade, like Being able to add more foto's, like the different journals option. Mis the borderless pictures from version one, am a bit more distracted. 

To my surprise the "history" option adds value
I am very happy with it. Helps me a lot!

I've just returned to word-journaling (I am a documentary photographer), and this app is just what the doctor ordered, so to speak.  Joy to use, nice and clean, syncs between my devices, allows me to add as many as 10 images per post.  Tics all the boxes for me.
I try to complete a journal entry every day with photos. I love that it syncs with my iPad and Mac
Day One has been my favorite app for years. The new version vastly improves on the original. Highly recommended!
My boyfriend and I are sharing a journal. We both post pictures and comments about our time together and apart. It's been absolutely wonderful.

This app is ok for my use, which the Day One version 1 does as well, just looks different. The problem I've found so far is the toggle to turn off, "This day in history", doesn't work, as I always get the notice. It's something the should and can fix.
Love this electronic diary, especially since the latest update. So easy to use,

column9: Best Journal for the digital age...
column10: Have to say I was never for writing a journal but got this for my trips and outings and found writing one fun as well as a great way to remember where I have been in the world. This is a definite must have app to get!
I really like this app. I have been a poor journal writer for many years. I have been fairly regular about writing recently. Thank you!
Would like to add music in the future.
This app is my notes, journal, everything app, I don't know what I'd do without it!

I was having issues syncing my day one entries, and when I went online to seek solutions, I saw there was an entirely new version.
This new version seems very stable, and syncs well. It also supports multiple pics, which was a feature I long desired.
I do hope they restore the ability to publish select entries.
Best journal app I've ever used. Hands down.

I may have not tried to use ALL the other apps out there but I think I have given most of them a good long pull.

Note 1 is simply...the best one out there. Its easy to use and does it all with no hang-ups or problems for me. 

If I could figure out how to use the Italics and other editing tools..I would give it 7 Stars.

column9: My favorite journal program of all time!
column10: I love this program.  I don't write in it every day, but it turns out I've been using it for a little more than two years and every once in awhile when I pull it up it informs me that I have a journal entry for the same day one or two years ago.  I usually read them, and it's amazing how fascinating it is to know what I was doing on the same day that long ago.  (Seems like two weeks or two months ago instead of a year or two!). It reminds me that I've accomplished a lot, and I love it.
best app to save your memories in

I am a writer but I never kept a journal. My old composition books are where I use to write my raps, that was it. Now with this app, I find it easier to write my thoughts and observations down. 

Please keep improving this app and I will continue to use it forever. Thank you!

column9: Use every day, multiple times a day
column10: I've been a fan of this app for a while but the recent reboot made it even more useful. I like keeping separate journals, with pictures, to keep track of my goals, random thoughts, quotes. Better than tags because I can then see my entries in list view by subject. Overall an excellent app.

I've downloaded several other apps in an attempt to add an online component to my journaling practice. This app is simply one of the best! I turned on the notifications, and like the once a day gentle reminder. I've set up my app with features that are similar to my paper journal. I love that I can add a photo or video clip, and the daily quote is awesome!
Thanks for keeping all my memory

A joy to use each morning. 

I wish it had a template feature.
Really quick and very flexible. Syncs between all devices and if you're someone who wants to keep short notes or write a novel everyday then this IS the app!
capture your life as you live it.
I've been using Day One for years now, and it's the best journaling app out there. I have no complaints. Worth the investment!
I love this app. Have been using it like a baby album in my pocket to record all the firsts, funny quotes, and events of my daughter's life. It's so fun and convenient!

'Day One' is my right-hand tool in the journey of life. Whenever I have a moment, I 'pen' my thoughts, memories and record of events for safe-keeping in this timeless capsule. If I'm traveling I log my entries in my travel journal and my regular journal is a chronicle through life's itinerary. They say, 'A picture tells a thousand words', and I love the way I'm able to capture a visual array of memory-joggers and apt snapshots that portray the essence of my story. I never need to fear that I'll spill water on my precious artifact or mislay it in the business of life. It is user-friendly and dummy-proof, yet sophisticated enough in its innumerable handy features to enhance my record-keeping with interesting information such as weather, location and more. When I scroll down through the visual display of my timeline, I have a sense of achievement which inspires me to keep on writing. I always recommend this app as my, 'best find'. Thank you for developing such a useful toolbox for use in crafting a collection of cherished memories for posterity!
really good
Good to keep an up to date diary with a few photos
Great App; easy to use and synchronized between my various Apple devices. I religiously utilize the journal app and an now starting the other functions.

I've kept a pen and paper journal all my life and only recently have I been too busy to do so, but with this app it's possible.

It's the Simplest and best app I have ever found to keep track of what goes on every day! I love how it reminds me every day to write in my journal! And with the speech dictation I can do it in a couple minutes!

I also love that I can attach photos with ever day.

Day One is one of my most-used apps, great for daily journaling or just the occasional moments or memories you want to save. I love the integration with other apps, clean design and quick syncing. And the addition of multiple journals is a bonus! Highly recommended.
Just the perfect app for journaling. So many options and great design

column9: Great App for a baby journal!
column10: I use the app to track my babies milestones. Very convenient to post pictures with short descriptions! Later I will turn it into a book. Love it!
A really handy little app !
Love the app, it does everything I want it to do! Only suggestion is it would be great if you could import music from Spotify instead of just the Apple Music App.
Just a great app altogether!
This is the best way to keep my thought together.
...and beautiful app :) Very enjoyable ;)
Love it!   Crashed once so just short of the fifth star.
Very nice
I took time to write this review. I very rarely write reviews.
If you want to keep a journal and use photos as a reminder of the event this app is for you. To date I have over 500 entries and am still as happy as the first time I down loaded the app.

Love the integration with Mac and iPhone.  

Easy to use.  Things private - but can easily share out an event.

I use it to track lots of group activities like golf.
No issues so far.  Love the app.  Was hesitant at the beginning to go to the new version due to security concerns.  Once past that, find the new version much better with the added features.
I absolutely love this app! Great for daily diary, vacation journals.

I've kept a journal for about eight years now, but it's been very inconsistent. (I've only used up two notebooks in that time.) The inconsistency wasn't a lack of desire to journal, but rather a lack of time that I was willing to set aside to pull out the book and sit down and write at length. 

This app is the perfect solution. I can pull out my phone whenever I have a spare minute and make note of anything. I love the fact that it can contain a photo, and all of the little details like location and weather and even step count are just super neat. The ability to sync it with the computer version adds the ability to sit down and write at length if I want to, and the tags can separate out long ramblings of nonsense from small anecdotes and daily musings. 

I've only had the app for four days and I already have ten entries. I have a feeling I'm never going to forget a piece of my life again, and there's something wonderful about that.

column9: Still the best, even after years!
column10: Not only is this the best journaling app, it's exclusively the only app of its kind that I recommend to all my coaching clients.
Not one to keep a diary in the past, I finally married Day One to Drafts 4 to keep a daily journal, work journal, and begin editing a blog series. Beautifully designed!!
This app is great! I love the tag feature and use it daily. I also love the export feature. I periodically export a PDF that I save so I can view my journal page by page.

Better than Classic in every way but one. Please bring back the easy swipe down on post to allow tagging. 

Other than that (admittedly) small issue, this is the best journaling app I've used.

column9: Purchased but won't use without iCloud
column10:
Day One is an amazing app that I use nearly every day.

After reading the reviews, I decided to purchase the app to see for myself whether I was comfortable using their sync services as opposed to iCloud. After reading through the Terms of Service I decided against it.

The problem comes down to the question of data security. Is my data more likely to be safer with Apple iCloud or DayOne. Personally, I'm going with Apple.

I wish I could use this beautiful new app but I'll be using DayOne classic until iCloud sync is available.

Devs: Please re-add iCloud support. Your fans will be grateful even if there are some DayOne Sync only features.

column9: It's only flaw is the deal breaker
column10: I love ever feature and the beautiful layout, but why would they make such a gorgeous app for an iPad without any capability to write within the app? I love writing with pencil in hand, and that's why I was so eager to use the Apple Pencil on my iPad Pro to journal, but this perfect-in-every-other-way app has no such feature. Seems like an easy update to me... I hope to see this in the future. Then my 3 star review would instantly jump to a 5! Until then, I will remain highly disappointed.

I haven't had the app too long but from what I've seen it is exactly what I was looking for. It records the current weather, It has a daily reminder which is a huge helper, and it's so much easier than having to write on an actual journal because I carry my phone 24/7 so I can make an entry anytime I want. I tried to start on an actual journal but I didn't have as much freedom.
Reading the other reviews makes me think I need to use it for more journaling and use the tags more.  Love having a history of significant events with my family!!!
Work perfectly and serve the purpose. Only crash when uploading several pics
Great app to records thoughts and what goes on.

column9: So Good... I might actually journal!

I use it every day as a journal and make photo albums of significant life events. I love that combination.
Dues everything I need in a journaling app.
They destroyed a good app - can't believe how much it cost to upgrade the pair of apps only to be seriously disappointed

cannot love moreÔΩû

column9: Great app, but there's still room to improve

Day One has been a great tool for chronicling things and has great UX and design - I highly recommend it!
I have used since first came out and upgraded to, I love it and how it can be used across all my devices and when I get a new phone it just syncs to that
I have used DayOne since August 2014 daily. Never had an issue. Does what it needs to do and serves the purpose I need it to serve.

If you use the previous version, don't move. This newer version has a lot of annoying bugs, slow, and I don't even see what was changed.

I've been a huge fan of this for five years, but this "major" update is so disappointing.
I love that you can put more than one picture in an entry for each day!

column9: the scroll bars are not fluency
column10: it feels the scroll bars are delaied.

Now that the new version supports multiple journals, this is by far my favorite app. It keeps me organized and productive, is intelligently designed, and easy to use and look at. I was happy to pay for the new version and support this company, which is a rare feeling for me. Keep up the good work!
Makes keeping a journal easier because it's always with me. The features are easy to use and being able to make more than one journal is fantastic!
I love this but am waiting for being able to load more than one picture to the web.  Love being able to sync between devices!
I've moved from classic to this one and whilst no major difference in use by me I still enjoy the newer version.

I have been using this app for about 4 years. I use it to do daily journal and as a tool to prepare a sort of life history.  
I can write about today and then add photos from Photos related to a time in my past and writ about that as well.   
I can take a photo with phone or iPad and begin an entry and finish it later in my Mac.  
I can create more than one journal which is a powerful feature for self examination and reflection and keep it separate and password protected
I love it and use it several times a week
Great app that delivers everything it says it will ... I use it daily for capturing my thoughts and observations. I love the ability to add multiple  photos to enhance the days writings.

column9: Go from infrequent to frequent journaling
column10: This app is so easy to use.  It helps me to be more consistent about my journaling.  I love the easy by which I can add photos and locations.  Keep up the great work, and the frequent updates.

I use DayOne every day and really enjoy every minute. 
Great app getting better and better.
Won't import any files from other journal apps. Why it is such a problem is beyond me... Useless app.
I like the new feature where you can put more than one photo. Layout is also five stars :)
I love the new update where I get to see what I thought and did years ago. Really encouraged me to write more. Great job guys!

column9: Does what I want it to do
column10: I haven't tried any similar apps but I bought this one based on App Store reviews. It does everything that I want it to do and the developers seem keen to improve and add value unlike other apps I have bought which are never improved
Good app to keep your memories!
This is a good app but I wish I could add videos and Live Photos. Thanks!

The reality good part is defining my own tags.

The layout and friendly reminders just keep me wanting to contribute.

I use Day One's multiple notebooks option. I have a primary journal, kids journal, & work journal.  You can view them separately or as one master journal. Each journal can be locked too. 

Sync works well across my iPhone, iPad, & Mac Pro. The developer listens to customers and Day One keeps improving.

I'm committed to writing 30minutes/day and Day One's gorgeous UI and great export to PDF is great too!

column9: Does everything you want it to

I have really enjoyed using Day 1 and hooking it into IF and collecting check ins, drives and contacts. Give it a try as it creates a great bread crumb trail of your activities.

column9: Can't imagine a more beautiful journal
column10: Perfect in every way. I use it for work as well as for personal use. The tagging is helpful and the export is also beautifully executed

I love this app it great for jotting down your thoughts and memories.

very GOOD

I am writing like crazy since installing Day One. I'm using it to store ideas for a novel, blogging, and as a journal. The best thing is that I can easily capture my ideas. I have a bad memory, so have an app that is easy to use and allows tagging is a huge help.

column9: Recommend highly.  I use it every day.
column10: Powerful app with many more features that I have yet to use. Great for journaling or keeping and syncing important information.
Great journal, easy to use, love the picture features. It's a treat to write in it.

After using the original Day One app on and off I decided to try out the second coming of Day One because the features were just so inline to how I would like to journal my life and create a library of notes. Great job implementing the new features that really create a finely tuned app. Hi Five!
User friendly and nice design. Whorth ever penny!üôåüèº

Love the new "on this day" type feature. And the simplicity. And the ease of entering previously dated entries. And reminders. I've had this app since the early days, and I think they've done a great job improving it.
A nice application for keeping a journal. Multiple journals in this release is a nice feature. I now keep a work journal and a personal journal.

I've never been great at keeping a regular journal, sporadic at best. But when I feel inspired to do it, this app is awesome at allowing you to do it quickly and with related pics.  Things are nicely organized and it's easy to go back and see what's been entered in a calendar form. It is inspiring me to become a more regular journal keeper.
This is easy to use and great to document life. üòçüëçüèæüòçüëçüèæ.
This is by far my favorite journaling app I have ever used. Now if only they lower the ridiculous price of the app for Mac's so I could enjoy it there as well...

This is a beautiful, thoughtfully conceived, and well-implemented journaling app. The features are genuinely useful and add a whole new element to journaling. The use of multiple journals is also a brilliant new addition. Well done!
I'm impressed with the app, keeps me in check and easy to use with a nice interface
I use Day One for all sorts of things: tracking health, meetings, life events, photos and adventures. It works brilliantly, and updates always add value. Highly recommended.

column9: Helps me keep track of myself.

column9: Works great as a log for classes taught.

Update 20160609: I like being able to have two distinct journals I can use for two different work environments. I use one for the college where I teach and the other form my own programming school.

This app makes journaling so much easier and more fun than ever. I love the thought of having a journal, but it's easy to do so when you're in the moment or have your journal right there with you. But, when you don't, it's easy to forget. With this app it reminds you when you haven't written anything for the day, and it's conveniently right there on your phone which means you always have it with you to jot down what experiences you've had. Not to mention the fact you can log your location and add photos to your entries. I highly recommend this app to anyone who likes to journal.

I use this app to write down what I did during the day. Easy to add another entry and fun that it records a handful of the day's statistics (weather, steps, location). However, I wish it were a little more customizable, but it does a good job at what I use it for.

column9: Best in it's class, hands down.

We've been using this for years now to record all our travel adventures. Very easy to use, love the addition of multiple photos, and the daily reminder of where we were and what we were doing on this day in previous years. Does everything we would want seamlessly and with a slick interface.

'Classic' Day One has been my companion on trips, holidays and just everyday life for over five years now. It's been there, reliably, when I had something to note. 
The 'new, improved' 2.0 imported my old entries... then crashed whenever I tried to review more than two or three entries. I was very, very sad because there were some new features I really wanted to use. 
Fast forward a couple of months and 2.0 gets another chance....and delivers! My rating goes from one star to five stars and I get all the features I longed for. 
I particularly like the "On this day..." option - today just happens to be my son's 18th birthday and choosing this shows me his picture 'on this (special) day' over the last six years. (Huge 'ahhhh'!). It's nostalgia that I just couldn't get anywhere else - and I'm a sucker for nostalgia. 
Being able to add more than one picture to an entry is also a new feature I like. It was always tough choosing just one pic for an event - or otherwise having to make two or the entries just to be able to add the pics. His birthday this year will have loads of pics!!
I could go on but I'll stop - birthday duties call. I'll just say, for the money it's the best app I ever bought.

column9: One of the best apps out there

This is, in my opinion, for whatever that is worth, the best journal app, ever. There are good apps for planning the future, but sometimes what you really need is reliable information on the past, and that is where a journal is invaluable. The feature set and functionality in DayOne are unmatched. I highly recommend it.

column9: App is great, lack of sync options is a bummer
column10: This is a fantastic app for journaling. However, I can get v2 to crash pretty easily for me, and the lack of Dropbox and iCloud Drive syncing is definitely an issue. I am very happy with the ability to create daily "diary" notes & to assign them tags that group themes I discussed. A recent improvement allowing more than one photo to be attached to each note was a winner with me, since I take a lot of daily photos! 
I also use it for miscellaneous notes that track various things, such as books I recently finished reading and ongoing weigh-ins on the bathroom scale! It is useful to be able to change the creation dates on these to current and thus return them to the top of the "newest-first" array.
App is stylish, well-embellished with functionality, and technically sound (it synchs well among my 3 Apple devices). It continues to please the librarian in me! - my profession before retirement. Thank you, Day One!!

I purchased Day One in January 2012. I was about to embark on an 11 month journey to 11 countries around the world. I wanted a way to categorize and document my travels. My intent was to become a better writer with this journal app. I used the app on my Mac back then, but much more on my phone today.

In the years since my first entry I realized that I've become a much better reader. It's important for me to remember the little moments in life, however wondrous or mundane they may be. The ability to look into a single interface to find that one quote or picture from that one moment of inspiration I had in Thailand, India, or my car back home.

I love the being able to take pictures and add them to the entry. And I love the way I can tag entries, it makes organizers like myself happy. This journal allowed to me to record seasons of life that I really needed to remember for those moments when battling against depression became much more difficult. I'm thankful to be able to look back and read the ways the lies in my head seeped in and affected my life. It gives me power today to walk in a way that leads me where I want to go, not where my emotions or feelings lead. Not to where negative tendencies and habits lead to old ruts in my present life. Looking through old Day One entries had become like a tool for me to move forward in passion and purpose. 

Day One Journal has been a gift to myself. There's no way for me to have known the impact it would have on me when I made the purchase in 2012.

Life is a journey worth remembering. Much like life where a new chapter can start any moment, Day One gives users the ability to write new chapters while also remember old ones in a simple, beautiful and categorical way. This app is wonderful and I've finally found a way to remember the valleys and the mountains of my own journey.

Have been using the iPhone and MacOS versions. IMHO this has been the best journaling app. It's got a great interface, great features in MacOS like menu option for quick notes. Has security for privacy. Allows photos and locations to help remember what and why wrote something. Highly recommended :)

Like for example the app's performance isn't optimized on an iphone 6plus. I know this isn't the latest device. But being just one generation old it stutters while scrolling through my notes. 

Secondly the app will get stuck occasionally when i finish writing a journal entry. It just becomes unresponsive for don't know what reason. And the only way out is to quit the app from the multitasking and launch it again. This is something you don't want when you pay 5$ for an app. 

Other than that i love the app. And i think it will keep me writing my diary for years to come. I just wish the app was more fluid.
