column9: Great Overall, but still needs Encryption!
column10: Day One is my favorite journal app for writing everyday, version 2 is still wonderful, but the direction they're moving in brought some concerns with it.  I was extremely worried when the developer rolled out the new version because of the trend of all iOS apps moving towards subscription models (for now that doesn't seem the case, but it is still a future concern).   The extra logging features can give a lot of great insight, but I'm wary of using them until they put in a better encryption setup (which should be arriving with the 2.1 update down the road).  The different journals are a great feature that has opened this app up to a wide variety of uses, but at the end of the day I want a journaling app that I can trust with details of my life.  I really enjoy the "on this day" feature in the newest update, so it's clear the dev team is hard at work.  Once encryption is at a better place this app will be an easy five stars.

I've been a very happy user for a few years. The attention to detail in Day One is something that separates it from other apps. Beautiful UI combined with a great user experience. Such a great product. Perfect for a personal journal.

What the hell is it? You want to do big data biz? Using users' dairy to make money?
I am sure it will worth fortune.
A few bugs but nothing else is as good as this for quick diary entries.

While ¬£3.99 is not a lot of money, it's still more than I've paid for any other App and so expected more. I've used Day One Classic for two years and loved it. Day One 2 leaves me slightly underwhelmed. Some nice new features such as multiple journals, but it's not different enough to justify charging me again and it's crashed a few times in the first week. The main problem for me is that iCloud sync has been taken away. I have around 50 apps on my iOS devices. Am I going to have to create accounts for every app in order to sync data? I absolutely refuse to do this. I don't want my personal data stored on multiple servers around the world. In two years using iCloud to sync day one classic I never had a single problem, but in one week of the new version I notice already that the servers have been down. iCloud sync should at least be given as an option. How hard would that be?
Enjoy using it. The only thing doesn't work properly is that it doesn't recognize Spotify as a source for music

Day One 2 is one of my favourites apps ever. Really like it. It's better than the first one for sure and I recommend Day One 2 if u used to have a Day One. This app is really great. I don't have any problems with my data from Day One app when I started using Day One 2. All was synchronized perfectly and it's impressed me for real. So this app is great.
Really enjoy this app for note taking and reflecting about things. Very easy to use.

I find this a great way of keeping journals/diaries. You can have multiple journals for different topics, tag entries and add multiple photos to entries if you want.  It captures what's happening, where you are and the weather as well. 

I think this is one of the best journaling apps out there having tried quite a few.  I'd highly recommend trying Day One.

The app: Thoughtfully designed, elegant and powerful. I keep three journals and enjoy being able to add pictures, use markdown and generally journal with ease.

Sync: The occasional sync issues need to be fixed but they've never directly affected me. I almost always journal on my iPhone. 

Journaling: I've found keeping a daily journal helps me remain more mindful. I try to reflect on and reframe daily events in the most useful way which is good for keeping negative self talk at bay. On a practical level, as I have a number of medical conditions that I need to monitor, I've been able to use Day One to make notes on my physical state and track how medications are affecting me. This is useful to review just before seeing doctors or just for my own awareness. 

I know this seems crazy but I've also realised that journaling lets me avoid sharing thoughts on social media that are really just for me. Sometimes it's helpful just to write them down.

I loved the first version of this app, OneDay Journal (Not OneDay 2). Because I enjoyed the app I bought the second one, to contribute to the developers as a thank you. But the second app has many bugs. It crashes frequently, resulting in lost entries, it is incredibly slow to write an journal entry as the keyboard gets stuck very often.

Although the available pics in an entry was increased to 10, I do not understand why its not unlimited. The functionality of adding videos is also still not available.

Very easy and natural to use on iOS and laptop. The price is worthwhile to have an easy journal app. I love how the date/time/location of entry can snap to phot. Tags are nice. I can't think of anything else I would really want.
Using it as a way to end the low lows.
I love this app! I gave it 4 stars because I wish I could upload video to it. Here's hoping that comes out in a future update.
I use this app everyday, and it helps keep me consistent with my writing

column9: Great update to an already great app
column10:
5/30/16 update: absolutely loving the "on this day" feature that was just added. I us something similar on a previous web based journaling app and really missed it.

I've been using day one for about three years and have loved it from the start. This update is so great. Love the ability to have multiple journals and the new interface. To all those complaining about no iCloud sync, you should try it anyway. You don't have to use their sync service if you don't use the Mac app. Plus you can export the data if you want.
Great journaling app! I love that I can have different journals at any time.

I was looking for a place to write my thoughts about each day. Just a simple journal. Well, it is that! Then I needed a place to keep notes during an ongoing project that could be searched and categorized in several ways. Day One was that too. Great app and very flexible.

The only reason I'm not giving Day One 2 five stars yet is that we're still missing the Publish function. In every other way, it is a near perfect piece of software. The ability to add more than one image was missing from the original Day One app, and the way they've implemented it in Day One 2 is perfect.

I use it for a daily journal, and a replacement for the now extinct Evernote Food app.
Memories can be captured quickly so it's really suitable for a fast paced life
I love everything about it especially the "On this day" feature. There's just one thing I wish it had: the ability to save videos :( Maybe in a future update.
Best journaling app hands down.

column9: Version 2 is the best Journal App by Far
column10: Best Journal App by far.
New features are great. But they don't overcome the app's slowness.
Keep up the good work. Day one is always the best for my journals
I love all the new modifications and the ease to keep everything organized!!
I like this app.  Just started using it yesterday. I need it to keep track of my days since my memory seems to fail me a lot.  Journaling is great!
This app is my 1st diary apps. Many feature support.

This app makes it easy to add daily status updates. I mostly use the desktop version for long-form posts, but mobile is good for short posts and sharing pictures. Great how everything is synced seamlessly though (and secure via Touch ID).

Markdown support could be better, with poor editing support for numbered lists and footnotes. Although rendering is mostly fine, so using another interim MD editor is a possibility.

Star off for bugs remaining in the latest update, reported and otherwise. Line spacing is not uniform in paragraphs, large whitespace block is inserted after Spotify links, etc.
Even supports markdown. What's not to love?

I wanted an app for just journaling and I found Day One and absolutely love it!  I use One Note for everything else, but I wanted my journal to be separate; and Wa La!  I really like that I can add emoticons and photos to spice things up and help show how I'm feeling.  Wonderful app, much appreciated.  Thank you. ü§ó

The latest version keeps crashing when you try to add photos from the camera roll. Whatever they have done in the latest version, renders this app more or less unusable. Please sort this out immediately!
Never have I journaled more in my life, keep it up!

Don't Trust a sync 
We want syncing to dropbox & iCloud back
The ultimate journalling app. I use it on all my Apple devices and it just works. Get it!
Start up so slow was faster before update please fix
V v good certainly v good indeed yes

I have done more journaling in the last couple of months since buying the app than I have ever done before, despite always understanding the importance of doing so. The app is elegant and becomes an incentive to keep a journal all by itself. The support for the app is great. I received a response within 12 hours after a recent sync issue.

Great journal app marred by unreliable sync services that you have no control over. The old version let you sync with iCloud or Dropbox, but now you're stuck with the company's own service. I can only assume this was done for $$$ money because it sure wasn't done for their customers benefit.
Works as it should

As a life-long daydreamer and list-maker, I've found Day One the perfect tool to write down ideas when they hit me. Instead of having to constantly wait or scrounge around to find any writing utensil and scrap of paper I can find, I'm able to use this app to allow me to jot down any thoughts or ideas I have, so that they are easier to recall later on when I want to type them up. I've even been able to put down dozen of story ideas I've had floating around in my head for ages by utilizing it for a few minutes before I go to bed. Still haven't utilized all the features yet, but all-in-all, fantastic app!
I first started using it a couple of years ago and now it's better than ever!  Love it!
Very good
It is the journal app I loves with its simple interface and functions.

I've been using this app since the original version was released, and I have yet to be dissappointed. It's still my favorite, made better by multiple journals and enhanced sharing, which I known will only get better! Definitely recommend this app

I have used classic Day One Classic since 2012  and didn't hesitate to buy and upgrade both my iMac and iPad. I wish I had waited as nothing but problems syncing between platforms. Extremely slow adding entires. I love Day One and will tough it out with the hope that problems will be resolved. Support had tried to help but it is still buggy. I hope it gets better soon.

column9: Crashes over and over do t trust it for a journal
column10:
I uploaded several post and photos seemed is not show up after. Trying to sync with the older version also left me missing dozens of photos. 
This new one is a buggy mess. Just scrolling through the app causes it to crash. Uploading more then one photo at a time causes it to crash. 
If you want a reliable journal, and I am sure you would, this is not the one. 
First version worked great. Sorry for the people who can't get that one anymore.
Will rate higher when auto synch possible. Or have I missed the point?

I use this and another journaling app, but DayOne allows for the most flexibility with text formatting, and quite frankly, looks the prettiest. My needs are pretty simple, so some of the comments regarding the OS X version do not apply to me. I suppose I ought to care more about the afore mentioned privacy issues- but I don't. If I want something to be kept completely private, it doesn't go online‚Äîperiod. 

I have adjusted to the big update and like the photo improvements. I  can't  complain here- I've been using DayOne for three years and see no reason to stop now!
It works. The features are rich and useful.

column9: DayOne 1 was great, D2 not so much.
column10:
The DayOne Devs decided to focus their efforts EXCLUSIVELY on a cloud service that seems to have "outage" as a major feature. They dropped all the other sync altenatives to focus on their own, very janky cloud "service".

The editor itself is mediocre. Can't merge journal entries nor copy & paste between without repeated operations. Bloom took DayOne and made it "Day Outage". Two stars is charity for this former 5 star App.

column9: Sync server down most of the time
column10: I'd wait to get this until they have a more reliable sync.  Been down a lot since I installed it last week.

Since owning the original day one, and now the upgraded version, this is by far and away my favourite and most useful app.

The only thing the original had that this lacks is the ability to choose where your backup file is stored.

One more thing to make it perfect. Videos!!

This feels like a beta version that has weekly issues with sync. Expect to have no sync for 1 day every week. 
iCloud or Dropbox sync was much better. Not recommended until they reimplement stable sync options.
I've just started using the app but quickly fell in love with it. It is easy to use and I really like that I can add photos to my journal.

Since the release of the upgraded app there have been problems with syncing...The older version had a choice of Dropbox sync or iCloud but now only their own Day One sync system which is less than perfect. Whilst I like this app tremendously, like so many apps that start out great, it has sadly gone down hill...What next, a subscription only version? I hope not. One app that should have learnt that less is more.

Buggy, and unreliable sync that has gone down numerous times. You are now forced to store data on their servers, and they have shown little reason to be trusted with one's private thoughts, nor does this small company have much experience of this.

When contacting them about why they removed Dropbox and iCloud sync, I was given a disingenuous response claiming that they are able to offer even more security than what Dropbox or iCloud have to offer, which is a laughable claim and gives even more reason to not trust this company with your data.

I like the ability to have multiple journals and the auto capabilities to add location and weather to entries.

My only real "want" at this point is to add templates. Right now I have to use a Snippet keyboard that allows me to paste blocks of text. It's a bit unwieldy and I'd really rather have that available in the app itself.
Excellent app! It has revived my passion for journal writing. Keep up the good work!
I always write my traveling in this app. It is easily to use this app.
Brilliant application, easy to use, designed perfectly. Highly recommended.

I have downloaded almost all the available apps in this category and after over a year of flirting with one or the other, have settled with Day One. It's a great little app, really well designed, does what is required and functions real smooth. I would highly recommend the app to anyone looking for a hassle free journaling app!

UPDATE. The new update fixed the sharing problem. Back to 5 stars! 

Since the last two updates the sharing to Day one from a web site or other app has stopped working. Would like to have this back, otherwise I do like the app with the smooth organization functions it provides.

column9: This app almost but replaced Evernote on my phone.
column10: There's not much more I can say. It's my sole app for writing, note taking, journaling, thinking, tracking, etc.

column9: Still no support for Live Photos
column10:
Update: Still doesn't support Live Photos. There's simply no excuse that an app whose principle purpose is to capture magical moments doesn't support said feature of iOS.

I upgraded to Day One 2 only to find out that you don't support Live Photos. Said photos are extremely emotive and make for great journal entries.

Releasing a major upgrade and not supporting a core feature of iOS 9 is worthy of a 2 star rating.

column9: Great update to an amazing app
column10:
I loved Day One 1, and Day One 2 is even better. The syncing is great, and I don't miss Dropbox, and love the fact it gives me things like IFTTT integration. Awesome. 

Wouldn't "Day Two" have been a better name though?? üòä

I can write a little or a lot. I don't have to make it a blog if I don't want to share. And my favorite part is that I can seamlessly add pictures from Photos, including GPS data and my step count from Health into my daily journal!

I am happy with it and it can be linked by other family member

Need to enable video and panoramic pict.
Great application

column9: Was great, new version serious down grade
column10:
With all that has come out over the last few years of problems with cloud files being hacked or falling prey bad custom software, the elimination of sync options like Dropbox, etc. to only have the one proprietary day one mechanism is a total show stopper for me.  

I would think people would seriously ask how much trust they want to place with their personal journal without controlling where the data is stored.  And this wasn't clear until after I purchased.  Waste of a great program which the original one was.
I absolutely love this app. Not only does it allow mento express my self but also it adds the steps i took that day i wrote and my location.
I return to this app over and over and over. I want to be better at journaling, but despite my lack of discipline, I find it very easy to continue using this app year after year.
I just love this app! Great interface, simple to use and works across all my devices. No matter where I am or what I am doing I can take notes, journal, or just remind myself of what I need to do!

Great app! I've tried for years to keep a daily journal and I'm now on top of my journaling because the app is easy to use and always on my devices. I also love the ability to put multiple photos in a single entry.
That's kind of the best review I can give for this type of app. The fact that it's easy to use across all my devices and it's simple and elegant makes it part of my daily routine.

column9: Best App for doing Journal ever!
column10: This App its great!

column9: I like it but hope it add the quick entry in notification
column10: The app is very good. I like it. I keep writing my daily life. But I hope you can add the quick entry in the notification just like the classic version. It could me more motivated to use this app
EASY TO USE AND LOOKS BEAUTIFUL
It is slow...

Sure, Day One 2 is full of some neat new features. But none are groundbreaking enough to warrant a whole new app separate from the original.

I bought DO2, mainly for the multiple photo feature (again, something they could've done with the original). The multiple journal feature is pretty useful, too, though I wouldn't recommend buying it for that.

I find the app itself to be slow, clunky and laggy. It's not as snappy as one might hope it'd be, which is rather a disappointment. By the time an entry is ready to be typed, I'm already a little frustrated at how long it had taken to load up. Not exactly a great motivator for someone who wants to write short, yet consistent journal entries when the app saps a bit of your patience each time you want to write something. Or completely crashes.

On another note, I've seen a lot of people talk about synchronisation issues, but I encountered no issues there‚ÄîDO2 synced just fine through their private servers.

Overall, DO2 would be an excellent purchase for those who haven't got the original‚Äîas long as they fix all the lagging and crashing issues, which I'm sure they will at some point.

For many existing DO2 users, I'd say it wasn't worth the switch. I would, however, be concerned that they'd stop supporting and updating the classic version completely. If that is/becomes the case, then DO2 is just an underhanded way to get you to upgrade for something you paid for in the first place.
love it so much
Good app for journaling, but I wish there was audio support!
Helps me keep track of my life and loves :)
Works great!

column9: Get this app if you need multiple diaries
column10: Love the app! Exactly what I needed! You can make multiple journals for different purposes. It allows you to insert pictures. It's great!

I like the app itself and as a journaling app, it's as good as any BUT the syncing is where it becomes so terrible that I'm considering switching to another app... Every time I close an entry, the app freezes for many seconds and become completely unresponsive. It even quits sometimes and has to be restarted. For the purpose of journaling where capturing your thoughts is the main idea of the whole process, this flaw makes this app unusable for that purpose!!! Fix the sync issue and add other syncing options such as iCloud and Dropbox as soon as possible. I'm running out of patience to put up with this...

I've used this app for four years now.  It is one of my favorites.  

The new program, Day One 2 has some changes from the Classic, but the two programs aren't different enough to require me to buy it a second time.  It is an update that they have named a "new, separate" app to milk more money out of their clientele.  That was disappointing to me.

I've had no problem with the change in syncing.  Both worked fine.  Being able to post more than one picture per entry is something that should have been in Day One Classic in the first place.  I miss the function of being able to scroll through all the pictures without opening and closing each entry separately.

I would also like to be able to chose what portion, or which entries I export rather than have to export the whole journal each time.

Audio selections would also be appreciated, in addition to the photos.

The price point is so much higher than other journal apps I have and having to purchase separate programs for the Mac and my other devices is an additional slap.  There are no other programmers that nickel and dime me so deeply.

All in all, though, I spend time in this app everyday.  It's wonderful to have something across my iPad, iPhone and Mac.

column9: Love the app, more integrations please
column10:
I love Day One's interface, both for writing and for browsing past journal entries. And v2 is a step up from v1, who's was already great. 

I do wish there were integrations for Evernote and/or Google Drive. I use Evernote as my "vault" for all of my personal data. This is both for searching through my archived data, as well as a form of backup (but don't rely on Evernote as your only backup). 

I also wish you could attach PDFs to journal entries. For example, sometimes I will write or receive a letter and I would like to attach the PDF of it to a journal.

The IFTTT integrations are fantastic. I use Todoist, and when I complete a task, IFTTT records it to my productivity journal. When I wake up, IFTTT records my sleep from my health journal.

Love what you are doing, please keep it up!
This journal app is awesome. One of the thing is like best is it doesn't ask you to give it a review until you are about to leave it. Instead of asking you just as you are about to use it.
This journal just keeps getting better. You can not go wrong with it.

Finally there's a way to journal about your life in an elegant powerful and amazing way. 

The day one at encompasses all of the tools you need to capture that special moment throughout your day. The UI is simple and pleasing to the eyes, while it's feature set superb and powerful.

Really good app, enjoying much it makes me want to journal about my life. I'm generally a private person, but to have some an encouraging app to push me into keeping track of the important moments really makes me feel good. Thanks!

The is by far the best way to stay organized with your personal writing. I have been using it for several years now and it has been completely worth it. My only hope is for typewriter mode in the future.
I've been using this app for three years and love it. I would consider no other.
great app absolutely
One of my favorite things to do is write my entries on my iPad. It's a great daily habit!
Good App
What an easy app to capture life's events! I started using a year ago and am overjoyed at how many moments I documented so easily.
Really great app with cool features. Hope they would add video log feature also. Love it.

This is a fun and well-designed app.  It makes it easy to write and review the journal.  The interface is excellent.  My biggest concern is the way data is stored.  In previous versions, the user had multiple options for storage including syncing among multiple devices or keeping the data private on just one computer.  The default now is to sync via the Day One service.  It is possible to keep entries on a Mac without syncing, but this option has become cryptic- unlike the very transparent data handling in the previous version.  This is the reason I am not giving 5 stars.
Great help keeping track of notes, actions, and easily shared will all other Apple gadgets ....
Great app. If it wasn't there I would simply not write a journal at all. Elegant interface.  Pleasure to use.

I was hoping to be able to change the background. That would be cool to have my thoughts against a picture or color that's reflecting my mood at the moment. If I am feeling relaxed, I want a background picture of a hammock on the beach or something. The white background is just, BLAH!

i tell everyone to have this app

i cant imagine my life without it

column9: App is good; Tech support not so much
column10: The app worked seamlessly across all my devices for a while.  However when I needed to replace my IPad and had trouble syncing my journal to the new IPad, the process was not so seamless.  I emailed support and did not get a response.  Figured it out on my own after some trial and error.  Thanks guys!  ;-<

column9: Easy to use and good export, PDF needs improvements
column10:
This app is easy to use and has a beautiful UI. To me the most important feature is export. I've written a journal in electronic media for decades and I've learned that no format stays around forever so the ability to export to plain text or PDF is a must. 

The PDF would be great if it had two columns and a bit more careful calculation to place headers on a new page if they are too close to the bottom. I think that would make it look more like it does on a device.  Right now photos in the PDF take about half the width of the page but the space to the right remains empty.
Âè™Áî®day one
I using this app for work and I love it.

column9: truly the best journal out there
column10: I've tried and compared so many digital journals but have found nothing better than Day One. No other app looks this sleek, works this easily and feels so 'complete'. I was a little bemused at first when having to buy the new version, but that was completely worth it. One of my biggest Day One 'wishes' came true when they introduced the option for multiple journals - you can now keep several kinds of journals (for example travel journals and life journals) apart. Syncing across all devices (I use iMac, iPhone and iPad for journaling) works like a charm, never a glitch. I can't really describe why, but something about this app made me actually want to start journaling more - I initially bought it for trips, but have started a regular journal as well, because the app made me want to. Impressive stuff.
Great that you can now upload multiple pictures.  I wish you could upload videos.  Also wish the PDF would allow for multiple entries per page.

I've been using Day One on and off for years now but have never quite managed to be consistent and committed. The new features in this updated version - particularly multiple journals, the map view and massively improved tagging features - have wholly enmeshed me. What was once already an excellent product has become brilliantly compelling. Happy to pay for an update every year to keep the Day One team committed.

I waited to get this app. When the update dropped it had very bad reviews. However over time the reviews got better so I took the plunge. And so far it has been great. The portability allows me to journal whenever the moment strikes and the sync is working well so far. For those just wanting a portable journal, this is the best.
Day One makes saving memories incredibly easy. I love it.
Simple to use and locks with your normal thumb print. Great for capturing ideas and thoughts throughout ur day.

column9: You pay for what you get
column10:
I deliberated on the purchase cost for a long time but have been delighted with the app and prompt tech support response from the developers.

I hope they will soon be able to achieve what I've requested (and the advised they are working on it); that being able to privately share certain journals with family and friends.

I am wrapped with Day One so far and although am still a 'newbie', delighted in the investment...hope the developers can achieve private 'sharing' soon but it is fantastic when you need to record and document personal matters.

Highly recommend it!
Day one is the reason I've been journaling for three years every day. It's turned into an awesome habit.

This is a great app. It's worth it. For the memories and the archive that my children can look back at their weird papa. The things I would change would be to be able to add videos, do more than ten pictures on a day and to have the option to have day one pull the photos of the day and make an entry with the photos then if I forget a day all I have to do is look at the photo entry and write.

column9: Great app for keeping ab journal
column10: Highly recommended

I've always enjoyed the aesthetics of a vintage journal and the satisfaction of handwriting my journal entries. However, it was frustrating knowing that I had a great journal entry but writing it out would take more time than what I could afford. I would end up writing nothing instead. This app has allowed me to write on the go, and typing has allowed me to write faster and longer entries for half the time. I write while drinking a cup of coffee, waiting in b/w classes, or just about anywhere I bring my phone or iPad.  The feature that I love the most is that you can capture photos, and sometimes you don't want to write but as the saying goes, a picture is worth a thousand words. One last thing. The quotes that are in the background have often brought a different perspective to the journal entry for that day. I've always found them fascinating.

column9: It's Simple and Available on All Platforms
column10: I came to this app from Momento. I left them because they were taking too long to be available on both iPad and Mac. I have not turned back because you guys are constantly improving the app. I am fine with the iCloud sync as long as it stays up but would rather you leave Dropbox as an option. Four stars because I think you ran short on the Social Media feeds.

This new version of Day One is well worth paying for. I now have 5 different journals going for different aspects of my life, and love being able to add multiple photos. Use it nearly every day, it has really encouraged me to write more.
The syncing between devices is unnoticeable. It works without having to work at it.
Excellent app to keep track of thoughts and events in ministry. Highly recommend it.

DayOne is the best. It is focused and it doesn't distract you with a million possibilities, just like a paper journal wouldn't.

The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the sync options.

My main issue is this, I'm okay using a customer sync engine. It makes this easier for support and longer term customizability. However, you need to make sure your users understand the security and the reasons behind this beyond just a simple statement. Level one of communication is the What. This has been addressed. You need to communicate the How and the Why. But first, you need to start with the Why, then talk about the How, then the What will follow. Why could simply be it allows you to support customers better, including the increased number of customers. How, this is where you need to explain more about security and create a simple info graphic to tell me that my private journal entries are indeed secure. The What simply will follow as increased security, system stability and support is better for everyone in the relationship (developer and customer). 

Other than that, keep up the great work. Big changes often require big explanations that speak to the person like my sister who uses this to the very technically adept user like me who wants to make sure that sever side data is encrypted and stored with private keys that only I have.
It has enough feature to make it reasonably versatile but simple enough to be usable everyday - which I do.

This app has changed my life! -most powerful journaling app ever!! From tracking events, dictating ideas & discoveries, keeping things categorized, backdating entries to when they really happened ...

Keep up the great work guys! I tell all my associates about this super-app.
Such a great app. I've used it for years and the new updates haven't steered me wrong yet. I will use DayOne for years.

I love this app. I've used a lot of other apps, and this one is not just my favorite, but I can objectively say it's the best. and most of all, for me at least, it's been reliable. it's incredibly important for a journal app to not just lose all of my stuff, or even just some of my stuff. it happened before to me with other apps, and it drove me insane.

Been using day one for about a year now. Initially didn't see the appeal in recording something everyday. But now it feels enjoyable to go back through my journal. Kudos to the day one team for making the app so easy and convenient to use.

column9: Exactly what I was looking for!
column10: Finally I found an easy to use app that let's me write down memories, add pictures, places of everyday life and create separate journals for my travels!
It took me a while to get into the habit of journaling but once I got rolling it has changed my life. There's nothing like writing things down to get to the truth of what you're thinking/feeling.

column9: Great app but too many features
column10:
Please fix Search again. Currently not showing any results.

Also, developers are adding too many features at the expense of ease of use. The app is becoming very cluttered and sluggish. 

Additionally the app cannot handle time and date well which is tragic since it's a diary app and should be the core functionality. In particular will you notice a lot of bugs with your entries not showing on the correct date even if you attempt correcting it. And once you travel into a different time zone it will happen that your entries will show at different days than initially placed since the clock of your clock has updated to your current time zone. This kind of thing should be handled better.

I'm new to journaling so don't have the history with Day One that other reviewers do.  I've read their concerns but can only speak to my own experience with the app thus far. 

Day One 2 is easy to use, including making entries, uploading multiple photos, and editing entries.  Since it's so easy, I'm enjoying regular journaling for the first time in my life. 

The only complaint I have is syncing between my iPad and iPhone, which I've not yet successfully done. I had an old account on my phone and downloaded the new app to my iPad and they have yet to find each other. I'm hoping to remove that this week.
This is one of the most useful apps on the App Store. It's the best journaling app and never ceases to impress.

Have been a fan for over 12 months now, with the update falling 2/3rds of the way through. Find it really helps not to need to log in to make an entry. Makes the journaling habit really straightforward and painless.
I started using this app when my grandson was born. He is now 2 1/2 and I have not missed a day since. I love having a record of my life.

I got this not to journal exactly, but to save beers in conjunction with the Untappd iPhone app. 

It has been working really well. I love how it can pull metadata from my iPhone photos when I add them to a new journal. The event auto-populates with the weather/time/location/etc from that day which can then be further edited or removed if desired. 

This app does so much and has such a great interface. I'm highly impressed and am thinking about buying the Mac app.  

$5 is seriously a bargain with all the features this app has.

column9: Good journal, good for posting to
column10:
I have been using Day One as a journal since I first heard about it. With this latest version, I also use it separately to keep track of vocabulary, idioms, and irregular verbs from foreign languages. Day One keeps track of my favorite photos, and of various web clippings that I haven't quite decided how to use. 
(Imagine a physical journal with a lot of odd bits of paper, notes, file cards, and a stray candy-wrapper sticking out from between its pages.) I like apps that don't try to enforce one-way-only structures.

The theory is sound, multiple pictures per day was a great step forward. I just find sometimes the calendar on my iPhone is blank (no entry) when I can see it in the wrong chronically order sometimes below because I've just entered a few days. I do like the app though for its ability to sync across devices but its inability to sync using iCloud or Dropbox is wrong.

I am very pleased with Day One. I enjoy typing up my journal. I find it very useful to look back through to find specific data. I don't use it on other platforms, so haven't experienced any syncing problems. Well done on a useful app.
Elegant, fun, and easy to use.

I use Day One to record my travels and I absolutely love the way it allows me to insert pictures, quotes, links, etc. it also records the weather, the music I'm listening to, and other information that is fun to look back on and see. Thank you Day One for making your app so beautiful and easy to use!

column9: Upgrade = loss of features for me
column10:
I bought this Day One upgrade without fully realizing the impact of my decision. In the previous version, I paid the extra few dollars to have the application also on my MacBook... It's nice to use when I have a thought and I am sitting at a computer, instead of trying to type on my phone.

So I bought the upgrade on iOS first, then found out that the new Mac OS version is currently priced $30. While this is a nice application to use, I can't see paying $30 for the desktop version. This is not a critical must have app for me, so that feels like a rip off. 

Also, I am disappointed with being forced into using their sync service, instead of having access to Dropbox or iCloud. So I am really going to look for something else. In the meantime, I am just going no continue to use the "classic" version.

Just another example of a company running a hugely popular and successful app into the ground because of greed.

column9: As Life Coach I suggest This Diary App
column10: Writing down small moments of life helps you to improve your life in meaningful ways. This Diary app helps you to just the same. Easy, Simplistic yet Comprehensive with power of cloud, I use it on iOS and Mac.
Pretty simple to use and offers a great many details you can add to each entry
this is a very useful app which can makes you keep ing a positive spirit everyday
It is going to be exciting to read all about my stuff in 40 years when I'm retired üòé

column9: It was the best, but the new app is even better!
column10:
Been a Day One user for years. And it's a great great app! I love the new one so much!! It creates even more layers in my journals aka my life. 
This is hands down, the best!!

column9: Love it BUT need more security
column10: Wish I had the ability to add further security and/or hide more intimate entries!
At this point, after a week using Day One, I'm happy. I needed a no nonsense app to jot down and organize observations throught the day. The app does that in the simplest possible way.
I use this for my gratitude journal and have found it to be a reliable app with a rich feature set!
Best I've used and so much better than the 1st one , would highly recommend it

I'm a huge fan of the original Apple. But this new version makes me very suspicious. Why can't we choose how we want to sync? The developer is clearly preparing a subscription model that will be much more expensive if we want to access to our journals. I would be fine paying for an upgrade if I weren't also paying to eventually have my data protected by a subscription fee.
This is one of my favorite apps. Super journaling tool.
The recent versions of the Day One app have been amazing, especially with the new feature allowing for posting of multiple photos inline.

The app interface and ubiquitous presence on my devices has made it easy for me to journal. I have found it insightful to review entries every once in a while. I really like the new update where you can include pictures. This is so worth getting.
This app has enabled me to keep a record of my daily events. The picture feature is particularly useful.
I use this everyday . Its great to clear all the rubbish that invades my brain and needs to be purged, and thats only one of the Journals.
Works for me, a casual journaler.

I have Day One (version 2) for iOS and for Mac. The entries I create in iOS do not sync over to my Mac. Defeats the purpose of purchasing both. I have reached out to Day One support, and they have not provided a resolution.

column9: Great way to journal my life
column10: Since two years I am using day one now and I really love its functionality and the way I can update using all my devices with its iCloud functionality.

column9: Great app! Please add Swarm syncing
column10: I've used Day One for about a year and just downloaded Day One 2. Love the app, just one request--please offer an option to sync with Swarm/Foursquare. This would make journaling so much easier as it would automatically log the places I check in. Seeing where you've been is one of the easiest ways to trigger memory, and it would be an excellent feature for this app.  Keep up the good work!
I wish there was a Windows and a web version.

column9: Great app for those looking for a no fuss journal.
column10: I am going through a rough spot in my life right now and the ease of use that Day One offers makes it really easy for me to just jump in and get my thoughts out with little friction.

column9: Almost perfect for our use case, the best by far
column10: Would love the ability to share journals with others or have password protected journals. Otherwise great app!
Great app helps, to make goals and keep a track of progress and journey- Great App
It's perfect. I use it everyday. This app is a godsend. Well done developers! Amazing work!

I take a lot of family and personal interest photos, and I love the way these can be so easily sent over to the Day One journal and then text added.  Location, weather, etc. are also brought along for the ride.  Nicely thought out and executed program!
I love this Journal app. It has gotten better over time. I am using this app to jot down my thoughts and events of the day. Now that it features multiple journals, I use it for work and school too.
An incredible app that should be used daily!
Talking to yourself clearing things up for yourself can change your life! This is a great medium to do it, plus the UI and all the features are amazing!

I really liked the first version and was a bit worried about updating and whether everything would come across. The developer has done a great job at making it really easy. The new update is very nice and the maps function is great fun as are the tags some of which are auto like music. Go for it!
I never wrote a journal before, but this app makes it easy to write a line or two and attach a picture
ÂÄºÂæó‰∏Ä‰∏ãÂì¶
nice app. hope they keep making better

I cannot live without this app , I write down everything in it , such a happy place for me :") , I would like to be able to sketch or draw in it since I like to draw a lot ! , please consider this idea , thank you so much
It's great to have your journal in a focused and pretty app across all devices.

The app itself if a step up from the first version . However it does arm twist you into using their own sync service and therefore force you into sharing your most private moments with them and trust yet an other company ( and this time a much smaller ) to keep your data safe . I'll be turning the sync off and won't buy the desktop version until Dropbox/iCloud are back .
Great App!

So, I‚Äôm not really an experienced journal-keeper, but Day One really helped me getting my journaling done with its pleasant and easy-to-use interface that gets out of the way. The support is also top-notch. I had months ago deleted a journal with one entry due to a glitch with the app, and didn‚Äôt have any backups, but the Day One support team never gave up until they recovered that journal for me. Highly recommended!

column9: Used to be a gotta-have app.
column10: Update: Sync is now working again, but it will be a long time before I five-star this app again. They've broken my trust in them. Previous review: I loved and supported this app since it first arrived. Used it on my iMac, MacBook Pro, iPad, iPhone, and iPad Pro. Trusted it. But now, it no longer synchs, except through them, except that the synch through them is not working for me, at all, on any platform. You try to synch and you get a cute message about how they're working to fix the problem, and don't worry, everything will synch just fine once it's fixed. Except that it's been at least a week, probably more, and I'm getting the message, zero synching. They took away Dropbox and iCloud synching options and replaced it with something that doesn't even work! I'm looking for a new journaling app.
I loved the original, used it almost every day. The new one is even better. I'm very pleased.

I removed myself from the poison that is social media and am now using this in a similar way. I take a photo, edit it with whatever app I like using and then write about my experience. My memories are my own and I don't care about what other people are doing. Seeing only the highlights of other peoples' lives make everyone feel inadequate. Live for yourself. Do what makes you happy and remove toxic stuff from your life.
I love Day One. I only wish I could get myself to write in it more, but when I do, I think it will be something good for my family later in their life.

Don‚Äôt trust your personal stories, events, memories to this app. It deleted my past entries when going from Day One to Day One 2 and using their sync system. I never had problems before they started forcing users to use their in-house sync system.

Day One cannot do anything about it, nor can I, so I‚Äôm going to forget about this app, and you should, too. There are other ways of keeping track of our moments.
Best diary app with great design

column9: Works well, but design is kinda clunky
column10: Does its job well. Love the 3DTouch quick actions and use them all the time. Huge buttons for adding a note or a photo are kinda ugly.

column9: Day One Journal - Great Place To Write!
column10:
I have been using Day One for the better part of a year now, and I have had no performance issues with the app.

More importantly, it is an aesthetically pleasing experience to use this journal. I have tried all the other journals, and they don't even come close.

Journal writing for me is critical to my own mental health. I need to get out of what is in my head and Day One plays a critical part in that journey

Chris Davey
Toronto, Ontario
Canada

A great app, that actually make me do the hardest thing - write down my own memories :)
Love it, thanks guys
Works pretty good for me. Great feedback service.

Found this app recently as I've been trying to transition to digital journaling but was not enjoying the interface of other apps. I actually enjoy using this app and how quickly I can gather my ideas and be satisfied with the structure it saves things!
The interface is kind. And this is the best dairy APP in Those I've downloaded.
I enjoy the new look and style. It's a great tool for jotting down daily memories and events
This is a perfect app to use as a digital journal, and the privacy and sync features are the icing on the cake.
A model for iOS app development.

I only do journaling on my iPhone6+, and occasionally from my watch. No sync issue between the 2 so far. Simple and easy interface, with multiple tagging available for future reference, love love love!

column9: Great app, use it every day
column10: Great of journaling and note taking app. Minor UX issues with version 2.0 but the additional functionality is worth it and they are being addressed.

column9: Excellent App with a few quirks
column10:
I use this app quite a lot, keep track of what's going on. I also used it before this updated version came out.

There are a lot of features I find useful including the share option into DayOne and Touch ID password. However there also bits I don't like, such as after logging in on iPad you get a huge screen with a single plus. No list of previous entries etc. With so much screen real estate you think they'd come up with something. 

Overall, it does function very well. I've found DayOne sync fast and reliable when using a sing,e journal across multiple devices. I'm not convinced yet by the quality of the sync service in terms of keeping data secure but only time will tell.

Multiple entries in a single day is something which I always wanted rather than sit down at the end of the day and try to remember everything that I wants to write down in the journal. Wish fulfilled.
Love the app to bits. Get it!!

I love the app! The newest version is a work in progress but I am embracing the changes! I kept the old app on two of my devices to maintain publishing capabilities - please bring it back soon! I believe that on the road to making this an even better app, we will endure some growing pains...

I use Day One very simply as a productivity journal.
I record four things in each entry.
-accomplishments
-challenges
-things I'm thankful for
-imperative tasks to finish the next day 

It works great and I'm able to look back and reflect on how well I'm using my time. I can also monitor whether I spent my day doing activities that moved me closer to my goals or just killed time being busy.

column9: A great way to decompress from the day and to remember past things
column10:
I find the day one gives me the ability to decompress my day. Some days are hard days that need attention and time to understand and learn from, by placing the events of the day in to "day one" this process happens naturally.

Of all the diary systems that I have had this one is the easiest to use and has many features that others don't.

Updated to add:  I love the new location function in the latest update, it was just what I was hoping for.  The developers are obviously trying hard to be responsive to users.  

They did not "abandon iCloud" here or charge money for an update.  This is a NEW VERSION of Day One, and if you want to use it you will have to pay all of $5 - $10 (!), and learn to live with their excellent sync service.  If you love the classic Day One, keep using it.  It is not going away, or being abandoned.  If you want iCloud sync, stick with the Classic version, do not expect this version to meet that need.  The developers have done everything possible to communicate the fact that iCloud and Dropbox would not be available in v2, and why.  It makes sense to me, and if I really want to keep using iCloud sync I can stick with Day One Classic.  I recommend going to the developer website and reading their blog post from a week or so ago, which outlines why the changes and what they see as the benefit of using Day One Sync instead of iCloud.

I have used Day One for a few years now,  and I have always loved it.  Journaling is very important in my life, I have done it since I was a kid and I have boxes of paper journals archived away.  The original Day One was my go-to journal from the first day I downloaded it.  I was a bit worried about the impending upgrade,  I tip my hat to the developers of Day One for doing it right.
Downloaded new app - and now I have no ability to search my entries. Several attempts resulted in blank screen!
Extremely thoughtful, useful and frankly just one impeccable dairy app! Can record anything of the moments that you cherish.

I think this app was FABULOUS until the update came and I had to purchase the app all over again! With that disappeared sync with iCloud, between my devices and the ability to add extra journals without having to do it all over again in every app on every device! What kind of service is that and on top that repurchase it all to stay synced and connected? The joy writing a journal about personal and fitness progressed was stumped and I had to return to pen and paper again. I thought I was done with pen and paper with this app. Guess not... You can do better, Day One creators! Sorry, mate, better up your game next time.

If you choose a software journal or diary, this is the best due to:
Full of features to help you express your self
Elegant, simple and customizable design
Constantly updates and sync feature with Mac works perfect.

column9: Please give us iCloud sync back
column10:
Give us iCloud sync back.
Give us the ownership of our data back.
More private than FB ever will be.

column9: Makes it so easy to keep a journal that I actually do
column10:
This app makes it so easy to keep a journal that I actually do. I have never before even attempted to keep a diary but this app is making it easy and enjoyable. The way it grabs all of your metadata to stick with the entry and so simple to integrate pictures saves time that would otherwise be spent on capturing the context. 

For once, I feel safe (rare for someone who has seen the worst in so many apps) about having an app know and collect so much about me because I control my data. I look forward to their client-side private key encryption sync feature (which they expect to release in the near future).

My initial hesitancy for buying this app was the price and the idea I could mediate my own journaling better. Also that my privacy and data were at risk somehow or can be mined or manipulated. 

I enjoy it though. I think the developers gave close attention  to the art of journaling. As for my privacy, I really don't know what measures are being taken to preserve it or respect one might at home.

But okay! Enjoy it.

Hadn't used a diary application before this. I found that this one puts a minimum of overhead in your way, lets you get down to getting down your thoughts without getting in the way too much. If it asked for an app review after getting your thoughts down, it would be better; when I fire it up, I want to write down my journal entry, not review the app. Afterwords I'm quite happy to write the review.
I very much like the text font they chose. Very clean.

I love Day One and have been using both iOS and OSX versions. 

But this one is too slow and buggy on iPhone 5. The passcode interface is really slow, every touch and swipe is sluggish and keyboard cursor is jumpy. 

All in all, this upgrade provides few new functions (almost identical to Classic version) at a huge price. This single app motivates me to upgrade my iPhone which is not a cheap solution.

column9: Made to pay for Slightly upgrades first version?, buggy
column10: Although I love this app immensely , I'm not sure why we were forced to rebuy it as a version 2 when most of the features are just upgrades to version one. Although the app is great for journaling , it is very buggy .  You cannot select albums in the photo attachment screen AND it continuously crashes when searching through photos which is a huge pain.  Hopefully they will fix the bugs and get it working smoothly again.
I've tried several and this is the best journaling app I've found so far. A lot of functionality and cross platform uses. The only thing missing is a web-based journal entry process.

Best journaling app ever. Beautiful UI. I was using the original Day One and then upgraded to this. No regrets - when I had to deal with some glitches customer support was quick to help as well. Very happy customer! Keeps me journaling everyday. Would be perfect if there was some easy way to print out every year's worth of journals in some beautiful hard-cover book for keeps.
I have been using this app for several years and have found it a great way to journal. Love being able to use pictures as well as write my thoughts.

My mom kept a family log for decades, ending up with 25+ volumes filled with entries and images. 

This is the closest thing to it in the digital age and I got it just in time to record my experiences as a grandmother! Love it!!!

I'm a regular but not heavy user of this app and I haven't had the synch problems that so frustrate others. Unless I'm missing something I have no visible tagging which frustrated a user/reviewer. I think you can turn this stuff off, maybe I'm missing what the complaint is. Personally I don't use location tagging or any tags. I keep several journals for my various interests. I frequently add photos and web stuff during the day as I read or photograph something as a note or reminder as well as journaling directly into the app and it does those things easily. I run the app on both my iPhone and my iPad without issue.

column9: One of only a few truly every day use apps.
column10: Love the new design and features. Very well thought out and executed.

After I started with DayOne, I seldom skipped journaling on daily basis. Upgrading to DayOne 2 has given me clear categories to capture my intuitions, happenings and business progress in separate journals. For a GTD practitioner like me, this app has made a huge difference in my weekly review and helps me gain the right perspective. Thanks to the entire team. Keep up the good work.
I really just enjoy using this app. A great journaling tool!

I love the multiple photo ability and also the multiple journals. I like documenting major events over the year and having an easy interface to review the multiple entry titles
And snippets.

Having always intended keeping a diary but never getting round to it - discovery of this app has made the job so easy. I now have personal and work journals and it helps me keep on top of those nuisance memories or activities that you should have captured some detail against for future reference. Loving it up to now.

I love this app, I've made New Years resolutions to write a journal every day before and failed until I found this app. The only thing that would make me give this app 5 stars is if they support the use of the Apple Pencil so handwritten journals can be made. Perhaps even handwriting recognition software to convert it into text.
nice
I've tried other journals and eventually deleted them. I like the format and the upgrades they've added.
Best journaling app ever
By far the best journaling app. It doesn't have very many bells and whistles but that actually helps to focus on the writing.
Like the new version & more pics to add. But I hate that you can't pick photos by date anymore - it's how I remembered what happened days I forgot to write!
Lots of comments on syncing issue here but what can I say, rock solid for me. And looks gorgeous
Only disappointment is that i don t use it as much as it is entitled to

column9: The easiest way to a beautiful journal.
column10: I never thought I would actually keep a journal, but this makes it effortless. Thank you.
I like that it has multiple journals in one location so you can separate things you are journaling. I like the idea of being able to use the app on my iMac but the pricing of that app is to high.
Super great app, which collects everything in my life
Professional one!

I have kept journals for many years on my computer and have be frustrated by not to be able to sync with my iPad and iPhone. Danone has made all of my pix, journal, etc available and sync flawlessly. Being not so young, I had assistance from the incredible staff at Day One who helped me through  my issue. I have been an avid Mac user since 1985 and have used most of their products and many apps. I give this my highest rating. Not only should you get it but also have your friends get ir. Than you DAYONE for bringing important information to me no matter which apple product I use.
Fantastic - offers an opportunity to journal in the modern style at your instant service.

column9: A great app for my work
column10: I work for Oil & Gas Industry, and this app is absolutly important for controlling every thing we have to do here. Buy it without thinking twice.

column9: The best journal for you except it lacks...
column10:
I have been an on-off user of Day One along with countless others like Grid and Evernote. The beauty of Day One is that you never feel like it's a chore to add another entry. The typing experience is optimal however I would recommend a night-time mode.

It empowers your journals with excellent features such as Tags, locations, weathers, pictures and now even with the music that you are currently listening to. 

The only gripe I have it with so far is the app doesn't have a list of "emotions" I might want to add. Imagine sorting your journals with "happiness" or "sadness". This feature would make it my primary app even for dream journaling which is now reserved to the app- Dreamboard. 

Day One, again is an excellent replacement for Evernote, stocks Note app and other writing apps. It has backup and export features all you to lock the journal via TouchId. 

A worthwhile purchase.
ÂÄºÂæó‰∏ÄËØï

This is probably the most used application on my iPhone other than my calendar. It is exceptional in all respects. I can't think of nothing that would improve this app. The developers have apparently thought of everything. It is flawless and easy to use. After having use this for about two years I don't know what I would do without it. It is especially useful now that I can use multiple photos.

I have been using this app for several years and just added it to my apple watch.  I signed up for a Day One account for syncing purposes and had some syncing problems between Mac, IPhone and my apple watch.  Email to support was answered promptly and Stephen was persistent, asking the right questions and keeping me in the loop until everything was working perfectly. It turned out to be an error on my part.  Great experience all around.  Cannot recommend enough.

column9: Cute and simple way to let out your thoughts.
column10: Not bad for an app.

I have been using this app for more than 2 years. Having tried other journaling apps, I feel this is the best journaling app that I have used. The current update has added a lot of features like maintaining multiple journals etc.

I reviewed Day One Classic before Day One 2 existed. I loved the app and it made journaling easy enough for me that I started using it on a daily basis. 

However, ever since the app was upgraded to Day One 2, I felt that it lost its best feature, which was its simplicity and economy of design. This app now has way more icons, small enough to need care when tapping on them. In addition, I don't think the cloud sync feature works as reliably as it used to, since sometimes entries don't match between iPad, iPhone and Mac versions. It may be that my file is already too large, but formerly I didn't feel insecure about losing entries. I do now.

I don't really care about being able to use more than one photo per entry, as I do feel that the purpose of journaling in the first place is to set everything into words, and many photos can kill this purpose, losing all the psychological benefits of doing so.

Solid, never failed me. I too would like sync backend options, or at least not to have to worry about formats or services going away. But at least there are many export options, and the app does what it does well.

column9: So far, so good with the newest version
column10: I love that I can have this app on Mac , iPad, iPhone and iWatch.  So far, everything has synced as it is suppose to, and all my entries from Classic migrated to Day One 2.  I am very pleased to have my journal available on all 4 tools as I use them all.
Amazing journaling all. Use it most days.

column9: Stubborn Devs Ruining an Otherwise Great App
column10: Despite the high quality of the app itself, the stubbornness of the developers refusing to bring back the ability to sync via third-party services makes it impossible to recommend the app. Even after a THREE DAY sync outage (according to their own blog post about the outage they failed to understand how Amazon A3 works or at the very least failed to read the terms and conditions) they refuse to see the fallacy of running their own sync service.
Really like the way to record my daily love story!
One of My Favourite app!

column9: Great app for journaling or drafting on the go.
column10: I use this on the bus during my morning commute, and I have been amazed at how much writing I have gotten done.  There is also a great feature to export to pdf file.
The ability to type my thoughts and have it sync to all my devices is perfect I love this journaling app.

Things I have loved since day one:
1) Captures so many important details you wouldn't think to write - current song, weather, location, current activity etc. 
2) Ability to organize entries by tag. 

Things I love in Day One 2:
3) Format manipulation (quotes)
4) Day One sync
5) Multiple photos and embedded in entry 

Things I love in update:
6) Favorite places - so when my phone didn't record the location while on subway, I don't have to wait for Internet to tell it where I am (assuming I'm at a place I've saved)

Things I hope to see in the near future:
1) Live photo integration
2) Make it easier to manage tag system - to change a tag across entries and have tags within tags.
3) Audio files. 

Things I hope to see in the future:
4) A way to track changes made after initial saving of entry - for instance, to comment on and annotate past entries.
Love the new features.
I treat Day One as my personal Twitter and live headspace!
It is slow and lags badly.

I don't see any statement regarding compatibility with iPad Mini 1, but I can't seem to get the app past the splash screen on said iPad before it crashes.

I have a newer iPhone and the app works fine on that, but I really wanted to be able to write my entries on a bigger screen.

I really like this upgrade, however I had the previous version of Day One for iOS and MacOS, unfortunately the the original MacOS version isn't compatible with this version of Day One for iOS (where I'm using iCloud). I don't want to buy the Mac App again (which is quite expensive) so I guess I'm just gonna stick with the iOS version for now...
Like this app a lot and also one of the main reason i keep using my 6S Plus, and i hope can insert more pictures and quite lag when sometimes i open the app.Thank you.
Perfect for recording my day to day work diary along with taking photos to help you jog your memory of what was completed that day

Recording thoughts, actions, what you do, feels good.  And it's fun.  

I really enjoy this app.  I track my goals, where I travel, special / different encounters etc.   

Very savvy design.   

It's not perfect.  It's somewhere btwn a 4 and 5.   But I'll round up.

column9: Developers deserve to get paid for great app
column10:
Multi-photo posts are a wonderful addition. New app is clean and smooth. I've run into a few crashes and bugs, but even the biggest apps have those issues after a major upgrade. 

I gladly paid for an upgrade to this wonderful new app. I had no qualms because the app is extremely valuable to me as a record of my life and of priceless memories with my children that are so easy to forget. I also use Evernote to keep a journal, but I keep coming back to Day One because of its simplicity and powerful features for combining photos with my notes and other metadata.

I switched to Day One's in-house sync a few weeks ago when I saw it would be necessary for multi-photo posts etc, so the lack of support for other services doesn't present a problem for me. I export my posts as PDFs at the end of every month, so I'm okay using their newer service despite its short track record. 

Looking forward to when they add online post creation (or a Windows 10 app). I'd pay for that too.

I've been singing the praises of Day One for five years now. Keeping a journal has benefits for anyone, but I'd REALLY recommend it if you're about to embark on something new: moving overseas, becoming a parent, travelling to Mars etc. 

Day One makes journaling easy. It's worth every cent.

Fine, pitch yours as the ‚Äúmost secure‚Äù but let the customer decide.

The new version of dayone is great. Loving the multiple journals.

Would like the option of dropbox sync again too though. 

 Thanks!
that is what I want

I loved using Day One Classic, but was inconsistent in my use of it. Only having one journal for all my thoughts limited my desire to want to use the app. Only being able to upload one picture per post was something I found bizarrely limiting. 

These two features have changed in the new app, which is weirdly named Day One 2. Having multiple journals is a game changer. And now you can upload up to 10 pics. That's a great improvement. 

The UI is slick and overall intuitive. 

It seems like they have lots of improvements on the horizon, although the iPhone, iPad, and Mac additions all update differently. It seems the iPhone app is given the first priority. 

People's biggest complaint thus far? Their sync is now limited to only them. No Dropbox or iCloud option because of flaws they ran into in the Classic version. Recently they had an outage of their sync function for over a day and a half. Not good. Hopefully they work out the kinks. It doesn't seem they have any interest in reinstating Dropbox or iCloud sync options. 

But all that being said, I've found myself journaling and taking notes more than ever. It really is a great app and I look forward to the new features and updates down the road. 

Four stars instead of five for lack of consistency of features between the versions (iPad, Mac, iPhone). And the major hiccups with the sync.
I have had a great time with this.  No problems.
Enjoyed getting back into journaling with this
Really enjoying daily journaling with this app!

column9: I used to love this app
column10:
The first version of the Day One app was... A revelation. It was the first time I felt any journaling app could be worth my time (and money). Before then, I didn't trust journaling apps, preferring instead to simply making my own solution: Markdown pages saved in Dropbox. I could then post these to Wordpress if I so wished. 

Then the original Day One came out and, again, revelation. Suddenly I could post my journals publicly if I wanted; I could save my posts to Dropbox; I could write in a clean environment that was, largely, free of bugs. My only complaints were the one-picture limitation, and the lack of notebooks. The later was a good thing, in some ways, because it taught me the value of effective tagging. The former... Well, that could be added, right? 

Then Day One 2 came out. It promised notebooks, with the same clean interface. It was everything I wanted! So without a moment's hesitation, I plunked down the cash for both the iPhone app and the desktop app. I wanted to support this developer. 

For a while, things were OK. There were some bugs here and there, I could no longer save my stuff to Dropbox, and I could no longer publish my writings. (This was a huge disappointment.) But the overall experience was still OK. The multi-images meant the way that posts were displayed on my phone changed in a way I didn't like, but I was still willing to work with it. And the notebooks meant more information, which meant more tags. Not bad. That's a "me" thing, not a DayOne thing. 

But then stability issues crept in. The app would crash once in a while, more so than before. (The iPad app was rock solid. The desktop app, not so much.) This would interrupt my workflow and, sometimes, lead to data loss. After that, I noticed that when working on longer journal entries, the screen would seem to skip randomly, particularly if I was editing a completed journal, so that it would take a second to know what I was doing. 

What was once a fun experience now turned into a chore. 

And so, while I *WANT* to give this app a higher rating, while I *WANT* to give this developer all my support... I just can't. I'm thinking about moving all my stuff over. Maybe I'll do what I was doing before. Maybe I'll move to Evernote, instead. Maybe... I don't know. But I'm not happy with DayOne2. Maybe I should switch back to the original DayOne.
It's awesome, helps keep me organized
Good app but the syncing issues through their server is a major pain point. The app needs a alternative sync mechanism.
It's a great app! I'm finally making daily diary entries.  It's so simple to use!. Love it!

column9: Love the app but not the sync
column10: I've used different versions of Day One since 2012 and have always liked the "feel" and ease of use of the app. I was concerned when we had to use Day One's own syncing servers in order to get all the options, such as multiple photos, but outage of the servers seems to be a daily occurrence right now. This really weakens the appeal of the app. Reliable syncing and data security are essential.

Great

A lovely app but unfortunately Bloom Built simple don't have the knowledge in house to keep their sync service up and reliable.

Hopefully they migrate to using iCloud or Dropbox or learn quickly how to run a cloud service.

I love this app and can't say enough. It syncs nicely between my devices, and I like the option to create different journals. I keep a work day book and a personal book, and also a writing resources journal where I can drop pieces of research into a timeline for a project that I am working on.

With them not using iCloud, the convenience of updating relevant facts onto whichever machine I'm using at the time has disappeared. It not fixed soon, I'll cut my losses and go elsewhere

Keeping a daily journal and referring back to it occasionally is a great way to keep perspective on how life is going. The ability to keep separate journals for different areas of life like work, hobbies, and personal make it even better.

The app itself is great but it lives or dies by the quality of the sync service. Most users will be using it on two or more devices so fast sync is essential. Version 2 only a allows syncing via Day One sync service so if that fails, the app is rendered almost useless. The service had been good for about four months but now seems to be subject to unannounced downtime for maintenance and then fails to come back correctly. You can get stuck with sync in a circle of 'disabled', 'in progress' (but actually doing nothing for ages) then 'error', usually because of gateway problems. Oh and updates in the Mac version sometimes sign you out of your sync account but you only discover that when you open Preferences by chance. All in all, April appears to be a month when Day One grinds to a halt. If you only use it on one device then I have no hesitation in recommending it but otherwise, think very, very carefully about putting your data at the mercy of the sync service. Needs fixing urgently to restore any confidence.
Very enjoyable to use

The original Day One is a great app.  With this new version, the devs eliminated the ability to sync with Dropbox and iCloud.  Their own sync service has gone down multiple times (including "scheduled downtime") and as reported by others, the data is not stored in encrypted form on their servers.  Avoid this "upgrade".

column9: My Favorite App, Slightly Downgraded by Update
column10:
Please add autocompletion to tags!!!

First of all, thank you for creating such a beautiful and wonderful app. I have been a user since 2012 and I love reminiscing on old memories as well as spending Time capture new memories. The major issues with this upgrade are: the lack of tag autocompletion & being able to tap on a tag in an entry text to see others, the over-crowded interface, and the lack of today widget similar to the old one. I'm gonna stop typing so you can go download Day One 2. You won't regret it.

column9: AVOID if you value your privacy!!
column10:

Really disgusted by their effort to take a hold of all the private information that any user would keep in a journal-like app.

Developers simply killed the goose that bears the golden eggs

column9: Very good, but could be improved
column10: This an excellent app for keeping a record of day to day activities and memories. However, I would like to suggest one improvement, which was present in the previous Day One app, which now has been discarded. When editing or commencing a diary entry in portrait mode and then turning the iPhone so that it is in landscape mode, the diary entry vanishes. Is there any way this can be improved?

I enjoy the app but I feel like it's missing something. I'll add it when I figure it out. 

Also the bottom controls are very annoying to work with, strictly from a visual tension and anxiety. The bar is too thin and the buttons too small, yet I tap the right ones everytime.

There is no better journalizing app than DayOne.  The updates to saved locations are excellent.  I was able to search and find all the entries that pegged my home as somewhere within a two block radius of where it actually is and change hundreds of entries to my saved Home locale in an instant.

I've been writing physical journals in nice leather bound notebooks for years. I happened to search for digital journals soon after this latest update to Day One. I remember not being interested in the original version, but now I have purchased it for iOS and Mac because I have fell in love. 

The syncing is flawless. The app is beautiful on iOS and Mac. The features are perfect. I love that I can export everything in seconds, and share it if I wanted to. The timeline, the editor, adding pictures, editing entries, it's all wonderful. 

I had been slacking in journal writing lately because I simply didn't have my journal with me at all times, and often it was inconvenient and burdensome to grab a pen and journal and write at odd moments in the day.

I figured, I've always got my phone on me, so I'll give the new version of DayOne a try, and now I can say I will probably never go back to physical journaling. Yes, it's sad and there is so much I will miss about it. But now with this update and features, it has everything I required to make the switch. Now, the benefits of a digital journal out weight the cons.

Thank you DayOne. I hope your business lasts forever. Never drop your integrity, or lower your standards for evil. Be good, keep my trust, and you will have had yourself a lifetime customer.

column9: My favorite app got even better and more powerful
column10:
