Day one 2 is even more powerful and yet the developer managed to retain the same elegance and ease of use from day one classic. Everything got better:  the new buttons/lay outs makes it easier than ever to do tagging and navigating between different entries. The new features like having multiple journals, multiple pictures, and batch-editing are implemented beautifully. There's a lot of thoughts that went into this app, and you'll experience it the more you use the app. I have over 3,000 entries so far and it's even easier for me to organize and make good use of my data than ever in day one 2.  Try it and it'll be one of the best investment you can make on your iPhone.

Update 3/22/16: still loving it. A few quirks and glitches with 3D Touch shortcut(shortcut to new entries will create the entry but won't stay in editing mode, for example) but overall the app is excellent.  3,000 entries and counting üôÇ

The updated app is nice, but I can't tell much difference from the old ones.  There are a few more customizable settings which I enjoy.  Still love it though.
could be a little faster and snappier though

It's a great setup and they have improved on the first version massively .. Only draw back is its ¬£22 on the iMac üòî that's a lot of money . If I could afford it though I would ... I just cannot justify ¬£22 for something I got at 3.99 for iPad .
Shame it's a great setup and definitely worth the money
This journal app has everything you could ever need or want In a digital journal. It's the best and helps keep me on track with my goals.
Before this I never wrote a diary... It's a good app and I have it on my Mac too. But I want native integration into IFTTT.
I use it for my gratitude journal every night. The tags are useful to track trends. The picture insertion is smoothly integrated. It does everything I want.

Best I have seen and I have seen a few. Love this one!! Does everything I need it to. Very pleased!
Use Day One everyday. Love this App so much

column9: Best tool to jot down things!
column10:
I happened to download this app when I was visiting Apple Store. Apple offered me the gift card, that's to say, it's totally free! Thanks Apple and the developers of this app.

Day One can automatically record things like location, weather, etc. Besides, it provides the feature that enable us to export the data into various formats (plain text, JSON). As for the UI, it's elegant and easy to use! 

In all, you deserve this great app! ;)
Wonderful! Definitely recommend!

column9: No iCloud Sync is a Huge Step Backward
column10: The original Day One app is one of my favorite, most used apps. I gladly upgraded to the new version. I am disappointed, however, that iCloud sync isn't supported in the new version. It's not even an option. For this reason, I'm sorely disappointed.
They finally allowed for multiple journals which was exactly what I needed but you are required to sync thru them to use.  5 stars if multiple journals and Dropbox sync.
One of the best for keeping a diary!

Whatever the issues of iCloud sync and my dismay at having to be forced into submission, I love this app more and more. It does everything I want in a journal and the pleasure and usefulness keep growing.
Very good, thanks for making it, definitely worth the money

I like the app, but I think there should be a few improvements. For example, I would like to remove location data from certain or all entries. Overall, it's a good app. If I am able to remove location data from most or all entries in a journal, I'll change my rating.
I have found this app to be great answer to how do I carry my journal with me at all times. However I would like to have access to my journal from multiple operating systems.

For the last three months I've been doing Miracle Mornings. Look it up.

Journalling is a key part of it and Day One is a a brilliant tool for journalling. 

The rebuild for version 2 has been excellent: improved functionality, usability and a painless transition.

column9: Great - but why not five stars?
column10:
With all the things - little ones only - I feed DayOne it works stable for me.
But I think because of the precious information that a personalized journal keeps & to be able to using it more on all iOS, OS X platforms = syncing - End-to-end encryption is a must these days and that is still the one thing I'm waiting for seeing realized in Ver. 2.xx!
Team, pls. don't give up on that and keep the good work going! :-)

I love the way this app syncs so quickly between my Apple devices. In addition to making notes on a regular basis as to what I've been up to I use it to document telephone conversations I've had with others. It has come in handy when I need to follow up with that company. It's also a nice reminder as to what that conversation actually involved.

The only thing that would make it perfect for my workflow would be if it had an app available for Windows that I could sync.

I adore DayOne. I started journaling with it about 9 months ago and it's the only time I've kept to it in my entire life. The main reason is this app is intuitive and easy to use.  I love putting my photos in to illustrate my entries.  I was delighted to see the new app with multiple photos allowed per entry.  It's a fantastic app and the team behind it listens to feedback. Keep focusing on mega security DayOne team. Thank you!
Awesome app! Love it. Only if I could remember to do daily entries haha oops
design good!
This app got me back journaling. Easy to use
Like it a lot.

It's a full featured journaling app that's pretty nice to use. I've got it set up to remind me to jot something down each day and I've kept up with it every day since downloading the app. It's very easy to get and keep going.
Awesome app, love it!
App is helping me keep track of my weight loss journey. I love the fact that you can add pictures into each entry.
Finally, with this version, they seem to have checked all of the boxes for a complete Journal !

column9: Best Journal, writing and many other things app out there
column10:
Can't really say more than what's already been said about this great app. Have been with it since the beginning and they just keep making it better. 

I will say this, DayOne is as important to the iOS environment as any app out there. Can't imagine an iPad or iPhone without it. Also great it syncs with the desktop version seamlessly.

column9: A Good App to Take Daily
column10: This app is beautiful and easy-used. It invites you to write something down everyday.

I love this app. It has put me back in the habit of daily journal. It's great stress relief and I love that you can add pictures. You can adjust font type and size but not color. That's my only suggestion

This product has become a frequently used product. The ability to drop just about anything and then write about it is very helpful. Easy to find things and with multiple journals, can easily organize. Keep up keeping up developers. Bravo!
Amazing for introspection.

Not perfect, but what is? This program tries to put in order the chaotic ramblings of the raindrop thumb-stamping. I like it. I like its seamless connection to the desktop app. I like the new multi-journal function. There are still plenty of problems and things I would change. Just like life.

column9: An essential part of my life!
column10:
I admit I was initially skeptical of the new day one when I purchased the iOS and Mac versions but I have been absolutely thrilled with the results.  

The new sync feature is seamless and the multiple journals, photos and search features enable me to chronicle not just personal but also work, travel and even passages  of books I want to remember.  

One request is the ability to save movie and audio files.  Once that exists along with the the two way encryption- this is journaling perfection.  

Thanks Dayone!

This app is great for keeping a journal or diary with a lot of nice features! Version 2 is even better, although it's a pity that Dropbox is no longer an option to sync your journal. On my personal wishlist: support for videos!
Very happy with the improvements

Home made sync services are hard, which is why you should offer options that do work.

Alas this is not the case here, makes it unusable.

Day One has taken me down a path whereby I, on a daily basis, write down whatever comes to mind. This sounds trivial but, really, it's helped me so much in understanding what it is that I want for myself. Externalizing the thoughts that flit in and out of my mind and reaffirming my needs/desires has been simply life-changing habit. Can't recommend it enough!
The old classic app's look way better than this...
A very good app to write diaries.
I think the Day One need the money to buy, but it is ordinary. I used before Heyday, it was free, but it is good app.I like to use slides, hope Day one have too
Great for keeping track of physical progress of tasks.
I'm almost three years in and the app still meets all my journaling needs. The recent improvements have not disappointed. Markdown support super nice.
Has brought so much order to my life! No complaints from over here.
It's so much fun to look back and remember the things I've done. And the update has made it even more of a memory book!
I dont need more feature with dayone2. good app but not simple anymore

column9: Great app and easy to use
column10:
I've journaled all of my life. About 4 months ago I had a stroke which left me with difficulty writing well. I discovered this app and love it.
It's easy to use and I love that it syncs with all of my devices, IPad mini, iPhone and my MacBook Pro with no problems.

I love that I can not only write my thought and events of the day, but can also easily add photos to really bring the events to life. 

'The only thing I wish for is that I could add video clips to my journal which would make it even more sweet.

David Shiva Das
I like the convenience and security - nice update!
Started using it as a way to get words out of my head. Great app. Get it.
I love this app it... Journaling is amazing.

column9: Love it for over a year now
column10: I've been journaling using Day One for over a year now and I love it. I bought the upgraded app even though it wasn't really necessary. I like the multiple pictures but I'm worried about space. Are these being stored on Day One servers or on my cloud? The backup is quite large (hence the 4 stars). I also can't delete a tag in the new app if I enter one incorrectly. Otherwise beautiful interface. The Apple Watch app is useless. Creates a new entry each time.
This app is elegant, comprehensive, password-TouchID protected, and shareable across all your Mac devices.  What's not to love?
A very pleasant and sophisticated App helps me to put down my thoughts and doings into text and pictures, during my laminar stream of  retirement days.

I have been using this app since it was originally released. Even before pictures were part of the experience. I have seen them come a very long way. Of course there is always room for improvement but the app is solid. I love keeping separate journals for life & work. Keep up the great work!

I simply cannot believe all these positive reviews are true, because basically nothing works. Synchronization does not work, IFTTT integration does not work, formatting does not work, even authentication sometimes does not work. Need I say that support does not even reply.
I use this app pretty much daily. Fun to capture thoughts and feelings about my day. Pictures websites locations everything üòä

While not perfect, day one is a fantastic app. I use it to track daily runs, films watched, my work, and as a standard journal. There are a few things that I wish it did better, like handle multiple images. While the capability is there, it still seems a bit clunky.

I've been using Evernote as my digital journal for years but finally decided to make the switch to a more dedicated journal app. It was well worth it, and I even purchased the desktop app to compliment the iOS app! It still cost me less than an Evernote premium subscription. The added features in this version really sealed the deal and I find the only thing I am missing is the ability to lightly edit photos from within the app (mostly cropping). I miss this feature as the photos I take in the journal I don't want shared with my camera/photos in iOS so it eliminates the need to take photos, edit them and then delete them after adding them to a journal entry.

Keeping this short. Having used Day One (the first) for hundreds of entries I thought I'd try 2 to see what has been improved. Btw, you can try Day One 2 for free via the Apple Store iOS App - there's an ad link. 

The sync drama aside, which has been well covered by other reviews, the app itself from a UX perspective is bad. Weak. It's not as fluid and as easy to use as a journaling app as the first version. Tho not much feels like it has changed it seems design elements have been lightened for sake of design trend, which causes the overall experience to suffer. My opinion on this holds little weight, but I can say with confidence that when something just doesn't feel like it works: it doesn't work. Day One 2 could have been great. A real step forward where users where willing to pay the same again (no upgrade options guys?) for a much better improved piece of app. But instead you've got this weak, awkward and offensively priced against its perfectly working predecessor app that has done nothing but embarrass the developer. 

Oh, and the excuses around other services servers not being secure enough for the data? Give over. You're trying to move towards a subscription model and it's horribly obvious. I'll put a good bet on Day One 3 being a per-month sub app. 

Weak guys. Really weak. And I loved Day One so much.

I just love this! I love to write my private notes in day one. It's a tad expensive, but aligns and sync with iOS and Mac. 

Go for it.

Plz support traditional Chinese
It's the comment I wrote last time 
Now it's supporters
Nice!!!!
The transfer to "2" felt like a beta test. Once the dust settled, works fine.

I've been using Day One for a while and it is great. I can write multiple entries per day and tag them differently depending on what is going on. I like the security features and the interface is very easy to navigate.

Really nice diary app. Especially after the new update to .2
I am not really disturbed by synchronizing to their service but it would be nicer if we could use iCloud or Dropbox.
The overall design is nice and clean. Beautiful features to see either the entries as a general or picture timeline, pinned on a map or on a calendar. I love the additional different journals as well as the metadata that you can attach to your post like activity, tags, weather, altitude, etc.
I am missing however some sort of general mood and integration with other music player since I do not use the Apple music player to add the song playing to the meta tags.

Though dayone.2 stepped forward with integration of iftt to import Facebook posts (which was the reason for me to purchase the update), I am missing the ability to add DayOne entries to my WordPress blog, since some of my post are virtually the same.
Has everything you'd want in an online journal.
I've enjoyed this app and originally used it on my iPad and Mac. Got rid of all devices except my iPhone 6s. The app keeps being improved.
Great and easy App/Diary to use. Full of function and features

Really enjoying this app, I tried a journal app before but gave up after finding the earlier app too tiresome to use. Day One is very different a joy to use, I have made entry's every day since downloading. I keep photos and notes of everyday stuff as a record for the future.
Their new sync system deleted five of my entries right before my eyes. I contacted customer support but they're apparently worthless at their jobs. They never got back to me. It's been THREE WEEKS.
I love this app! So easy to use and keeps a great photographic diary to help me document how quickly my little boy is growing up!

column9: Everything you would want in a journaling app. And more.
column10: Love this app.

Finally, this amazing app is nearly perfect.  They've added all sorts of deeply needed features while keeping the things that made it great in the first place. The things it lacks now, are on the roadmap, so I am very pleased!
Completely new interface and yet completely familiar. Easier to use now, feels slicker, love it.

I've been keeping a paper journal for quite some time. A friend recommended that I change over to Day One and give it a try. I would never change back. Absolutely amazing app. Really captures everything you are doing during an entry. So that when you look back on in the future it really highlights what was going on in your head at that point in time.
Can I redim the previous one? hahaha

I am enjoying using Day One 2.0 after using Day One for many years. With the addition of multiple notebooks and pictures I can now use it for more things in my life. I think the experience is really solid, and most of all it is reliable.
Nice app

Pretty much my favourite app on my iOS devices.

I've been a user of DayOne for a few years and this update is excellent. I find the syncing across my computer, iPad and iPhone to be robust and reliable. I've read up on their security and I'm satisfied it's suitable for my needs.

The latest version of the app includes many of the features which people have long been requesting, such as multiple photos. It's slick and easy to use. Worth the price I paid.
Day One is one of the few apps that I have consistently used since it was first released. And it keeps getting better.

I use this app for many things. I monitor my own health and medical questions, and also my husband's health and the health of many pets. Having multiple journals makes it easy to document all of our health issues. I also use a personal journal for thoughts, memories, poems and so forth. Recent I've learned how to use photographs to document both medical and personal events. I like using Siri on both an iPad and iPhone to make notes. This app has made charting health and family issues very easy, accurate, and pleasurable.

column9: good but laggy and poor support
column10: i purchased this app for both iPad and iPhone. this app is a nice tool for organizing daily and personal notes and journals.  but the UI is very laggy. showing entry list, showing password panel, loading app when it runs, ... are very slow and laggy. for example when i scroll entry list, i see movings with full of lags. i wrote some notes for app support team, but there is no any reply after days. i use ipad air and iphone 6. the app works better in iphone compare with my ipad air.
Everything I could ask for in a journal.
I use the journal daily and it's ease of use is wonderful!!!

Much better than expected. A journal on an iPhone?? That was my initial reaction to the Day One. Figuring such things should be left to either a full keyboard or the old fashioned pen. But surprise surprise while it is still clunky to use with the iPad it shines on the iPhone. 

The multiple color coded journals are a wonderful feature. Syncing across devices means your journal is always with you. This is great for capturing ideas on a subject or a more tradition day in the life journal.

Enjoy!

Enjoyable to use, especially good is how you can combine photos, text, weather, location etc. But there are a couple of things I don't like, one minor, one major, hence why I knocked off 3 stars. 

The first is that it is rather fiddly amending the location data. It doesn't seem to remember frequently used places and it's a bit annoying having to fix it every time. 

The second is more serious, and I'm echoing what has been stated before. Going through the settings, I can find no way to either stop this app syncing with its own server, or changing the destination e.g. Dropbox, Drive etc. I'm not comfortable with a diary syncing to an unknown destination.

Version 2 is awesome. Being able to create multiple journals is fantastic. The feature I love the most is being able to move entries between journals. I use the "main" journal as an inbox of sorts. I just type whatever I feel like (similar to how people used to use Facebook, posting everything they did during the day and "checking in" places) then in the evening I go through and elaborate a little and move it to the appropriate journal to keep things organized and help me get into a good journaling habit. It's also great to be able to embed multiple pictures in each entry.

Works seamlessly.....not worried about where this syncs- you can make a backup so why worry?....if you are that bothered stick to a notepad and pen....anyway this works very well for my personal diary of general things I get up to - it's simple and easy to just dip in and write a bit and attach the odd photo here and there... I would recommend to anyone who likes to record the moment- and then look back and enjoy stuff they have forgot about!!...lol...

Please allow "pencil support". 

Thanks

It would be a true diary.
The app is so easy to use and I love that you can add pictures to entries. And it also will log the location and weather of that day! Great app! Works flawlessly and never crashes!

Great app 
Beautiful 
Simple 
Highly recommend
That's right. Day One is more than a tool. It's something good. It enables, it elicits the writing.

column9: Love it... Want a bit more
column10: I do love this app and splurged on both IOS and Mac versions. Still experimenting with what I want to cover. Which leads me to a request: would like more flexibility in getting images and other connected files in an entry. Tried IFTT but not quite right. Would also like to be able to add photos after I've started an entry. (When I do this now it creates a new entry for the photos. )
I use it everyday.  Love it!

I too was originally skeptical of being forced into their sync system.  I read their terms of service and frankly some of the language was frightening, but I had a couple email exchanges with their extremely responsive customer service and I was satisfied they could not use my private entries in the future.  I've been using for two months now and their sync service is fantastic.  I had period issues with iCloud with Day One Classic, but I've never had an issue so far syncing between my iMac, iPhone, and iPad.  

The bottom line is that for YEARS I struggled to consistently journal - since getting Dayone in 2012, and now Dayone 2 - I journal more than I have in my entire life.  It is awesome for capturing moments and recording my life.  I know some day there won't be a price you can put on having these entries.  It's so easy to capture photos in DayOne 2 and being able to have multiple photos in an entry is awesome.  

If your nervous about their sync, just read the news, it's a risk we all take using the cloud, but to me the trade off is that I'm building a lifetime of memories with this app.
Cool app

column9: Probably the best journaling app on the App Store

Version 2 brings it to a new level. I have one journal that's just for me, and one journal that I share with others. Since it is so easy to use it allows me to be timely with my journal entries which is exactly what I want in journaling software.

column9: By Far the Best in its Genre
column10:
I'd love to write a ton of paragraphs about how much I love Day One 2 (as well as the original). But let's just say it is by far the most advanced and high quality Journal type application. More like a really dope blogging app that grabs a handful of your photos from your best and worst days and let's you vent, praise, laugh, cry. Whatever you need. 

So many apps have come out like this over the years and platforms. Few have been great. But Day One is superb. If your teetering on the $4.99 price tag (more on Mac) then just ask yourself if this is an app you'll see yourself using. If it is then buy it. You won't regret it.

column9: A place for thoughts, for work and life

We've used Day One for several years.  The new version is even better -- the multiple journals are very handy for us: regular items, landscaping entries, health entries.

It was particularly great during our recent three-week cruise in Southeast Asia.  We could keep a good journal of our trip, since it was hard to remember where we had been day to day.  It worked very well to share with traveling companions and family.

I have purchased every version. I would pay more if I could. Use it to keep track of daily purchases (lunch, hobby buys, pet & car supplies). New multiple journals make it even more essential to my needs. Thank you!

column9: By far one of my favorite apps

a little bit expensive imo, it is a great journal app. 

maybe the best till now.
This app is worth every penny!! I love it. Great job

column9: Really nice app! Super clean & a delight to use.
column10: This app is well made and well thought out. Hats off to the developers. Super simple and a delight to use.
I've tried many journals and this is the one I really enjoy using. User friendly and eye appealing.

I've been using Day One since early 2010 and have kept a daily journal since I started. If you are wanting an easy way to document your life and provide a record for your posterity, then look no further. The app developers listen to feedback and this most recent version is so wonderful. There is only one feature which I wish they would bring to the app and that is the ability to have your journals printed so that I can have actual books to give to my kids and other family members. Keeping a daily journal is great for myself but I want others to be able to read them once I am no longer here. But all in all, Day One is the best journaling app there is. Don't debate if you should buy it or not. Just do it and start recording your life seamlessly.

column9: Great way to keep track of memories.
column10: Has been really interesting converting from my traditional journal (paper) to a digital version. Wasn't sure I'd like it, however I have to say it's great. Being able to add photos, sketches, locations really nailed it for me. Also having the ability to use it on my phone as well as iPad adds flexibility. My journal is always with me.

column9: Format helps me focus on my writing
column10:
The clean, no fuss format clears the clutter and helps me focus on my writing. That is, after all, why I am here, right? I have a beautiful and clean interface, and features I need and use to save, tag, and publish my work. I also appreciate the sync with my other devices so I can keep working where ever I am.

The Apple Watch interface is nice when I need to save a quick thought - this usually happens when I'm driving, and at a red light, it's lightning fast to dictate a sentence or two, and then polish it up when I've arrived safe and sound.

This is a fantastic app.  Easy to
Use - easy to upload and lovely to review!!

column9: The best diary I've ever had.
column10: I used Evernote before, but now I love this app.
I write once in a while, but since using DayOne, I write more often. A great way to keep your journal with me all the time, and it syncs to my desktop app too.
I use it as a diary, and as a notebook for my work.  Tagging keeps ideas apart, and the ability to add images is great.
This app got me journaling consistently. Love everything about it!

When i scroll over the entries in the pane, it's get so lagged and sometimes not responding. I use ip6s. 

I don't want this app to know my location. However, by default, it shows 0.00N 0.00S under my new entry which is really annoying.  I can only delete this useless location info by permitting this app know my location. This is non sense and not acceptable. 

This app is not stable and gets really complicated. I'm thinking to get back to Classic Day One which is more reliable and easy to use.
Day One is the only way to easily record a digital journal.
I am not sure you could make this app any better. Top notch and worth every cent.
Good app, if I could add to journal thru voice to text

It's a great app and it works well. I like that it records much information like weather conditions and locations automatically. Everything is searchable and taggable making keeping track of things a cinch. 

I'd really love to see them put some templates into the app for recording repetitive informally like food or sleep journals.
Thanks. It's easy and straight forward.
I'm enjoying it
Of you like journaling i highly recommend the app. It stores pictures nd your story. Love it!!!
Great app, I used Classic for 3+ years and recently upgraded to 2.0...I am waiting on per journal collaboration though.
Dayone makes your dairy experience a delightful one!
This app is going to organize me and make my life real for the last time :)

I've always stored notes in simple Evernote docs or on Google Drive, but Day One provides a cleaner, prettier alternative. Using markup is a little cumbersome at first and unnecessary on much of the note-taking I do, but I like having the option to make notes look good. Attaching photos and a simple setup process are the bonuses that make the app price worth it.
Keeps things simple and clean

New to journaling I bought this App because of the good reviews and since it was on sale. I so far found myself writing a daily entry ... possibly just because I don't want to have gaps in the journal. There are a few thing that need improvement, like Geo coordinates, syncing and output formats.
I love all the features!
I think it's great! I have had zero problems and I love how handy it is. I love that I can add a photo easily. I love that it records my daily steps and weather etc...

I am loving the enhancements with the new version. It made a good app even better. Would like to be able to go full screen with diary without side bar. Also would like map to change automatically in line with your diary entries. Fantastic though! Great job!
Recently started using this. Makes keeping a journal a breeze.

column9: Must have for those who ruminate
column10: I love this app. I jot down random thoughts, pleas for help, whatever enter my head. I love this app and in sure you will too.

I am not particularly organized by nature, but was not altogether sure that I needed this app at all. However, I have now found that it is absolutely imperative to my record keeping and just about every area. No more wondering exactly when I ran into an old friend, called about an insurance claim or started giving the dog his antibiotics! I have it all down at one place. I really do love that I don't have to sit down at my computer to record things  (which, chances are really good that I won't do). All I have to do is speak it and it's organized in one place.
I have used Day One for years now, the absolute best way to keep a digital Journal!!! üëç
Great app! By far the best journal app I've ever downloaded. I use it every single day. I will say that I don't think the features are worth the $5 I paid for it, but it's still a great app!
They thought of everything. Worth the download.

This app has earned the coveted spot on my main home screen on all my iOS devices. Journaling has therapeutic value, and this app is the best there is. Day One sync works so well that I don't miss the other sync options. Well done developers. I can't wait to see where this app goes in the future.
This is really the best app for writing ur journal. It even has IFTTT support now.

A few days of ISO using the app. 
But believe it is useful and so far I have been enjoying making entries. Alarms and reminders are useful to make entries. Wish they also had a version for the PCs as well.
So far experience is good. 
Recommend everyone to try!

It is finally a more mature app! Good to see that.

Good things first...
A journal app that does a lot of the job, including getting the location info of photos, predicts your "activity" e.g. Walking, stationary, eating etc, gets weather info, edit time/date separately, text editing that allows for 1 type of header, bold, italic, quote, list form, multiple entries per day, 8 photos per entry (not good to have a limit for sure). Nice UI, smooth app response.

Now, on the down side...
Location cannot be actively recorded and turned into automatic journals (heyday has this function and it is more useful than you can imagine!)
And there cannot be more than 1 location / 1 time stamp per entry. Now wouldn't it be great if we could split an entry into 2 locations / 2 time stamps? That could be done perhaps with a little extension on the text editing bar?
And it would be just nice to save recent thumbnails: just the very small sized photos that appear at the sidebar, not in the entry itself, so I can scroll and get visual sense of the past month quickly. Currently it is not syncing very fast with servers. And sometimes I am not with Internet on my iPad.

But that being said, still a very nice app, and can see the effort to continuously improve, so it's worth the money for your "investment" to paperless (and timeless) journaling.
I use Day One every day, to record my thoughts, my feelings, my favorite photos. On slow days, I enjoy reading what I wrote down more than a year ago. I'm always like, oh yeah, I did that :)
This is the greatest app for a journal, I can remind myself and keep myself on track this the greatest, thank you for making this!!!
I absolutely love this app. It's so refreshing and beautifully done. Keep the updates coming! I would love more Apple Watch integration.
Does what it says- it's simple and it makes it very easy to keep a journal.

column9: Five stars if not for for one thing...
column10:
I cannot find a way to make journal entries on a desktop computer. This app works very well for me (it's the first and only journaling software I've ever used and I've only been at it for a couple of months). I have it on both my iPhone and iPad; I'm comfortable with the features and functionality and it syncs well with both devices.

I'd be much more consistent in journaling if I was just able to access it through the internet with a desktop. I type much more fluently on a regular keyboard and using the devices forces me to type with one finger. I realize this is my problem, but other apps have websites that are accessible and I don't understand why this one isn't.
Easy to use and a great way to record important events in your life.
I like the recent rebuild and update. Hopefully it's the last time I have to spend money on it.
It makes keep a journal very easy. Works well and synchronizes with all my devices.

column9: New Update Is Excellent! Location feature is PERFECT!
column10: Only a couple minor things left to fix, and this will be a 5-star review! The latest update addressed most of the big issues we were having, most notably the location issue that required multiple steps to choose your correct location. This was extremely cumbersome for my "home" location, which I had to manually correct every single time I made a new entry. With the new update, though, you can now SAVE LOCATIONS, which is AMAZING! DayOne was always pinning my home to the building next to mine, but once you pin your location and save it (and you can name the location whatever you want, which is super cool), DayOne now knows when I am home! Alternatively, if you are somewhere else but would like to use your home or other saved location, you can just select it from a new menu that pops up over the keyboard! Awesome! Thanks for the emoji fix as well! I'd still like to see the "M" button changed somehow, and to bring back the horizontal scrolling menu and the cursor buttons. I always hit the "M" when I move the cursor to the end of a sentence. If you guys can streamline the horizontal menu the way you did the location services, then you'll definitely get 5 stars from me! Thanks for the update!

My wish list:
- Publish 2.0: Day One Web App with sharing features similar to text files in Dropbox and Google Drive
- Search entries in iOS search
- Search, then Select, Tag, & Move
- Removing dates from entries that are just notes
- Undo delete entries
- Older Versions of an entry are stored
- Localisation (Dutch)
- Night mode
- Empty new item is deleted automatically 
- Tag music from Spotify
- Import notes from other apps and cloud drives
Fixes:
- With every other new version, searching inside Day One seems to become unreliable: it literally shows 0 results all the time for me right now. Very frustrating!
- Fix preview titles - not all first lines are bold in the preview list
- Selecting entries feature has some design quirks that need to be ironed out
- Selecting (bigger amounts of) text in an entry is not working for me
- Delete entries with delete key (Mac app)

column9: The journal app that I've been looking for
column10: This is the journal app that I have been searching far and wide for. I've paid money for other apps that just didn't cut it. Many other apps just lose their appeal. This one does not. It's simple to use, easy to navigate, and makes writing daily entries as you go enjoyable! Definitely worth the five bucks.
Great support for Markdown.
Easy to use journal that helps me remember my travels abroad. The accuracy of the information it pulls from my photos/phone really helps.
I love it.

column9: Fantastic app : day one by bloom
column10:
Utilised the first day one app to visually log my daily life, the updated version of day one with the capacity to multi log photographs and add more information has been even more beneficial. Improvement suggestions: Can we add more options to personally down load and back up our day one personal logs as iPhones backup to the main hard drive as loosing them hurts as they are logged to our handsets !  An added "print my images " would also be exciting extra or the further option of publishing my Day one as small digital book output to my iPad from year to year with the added extra of compiling every month to publication and editing it off my handset üòÄ 
L O V E the DAY ONE app : my favourite and most utilised extra üòÄ
i like it
PDF import capability still in my wish-list.
This is a great app and works exceptionally well. Would highly recommend it to anyone interested in journaling.
This app has made it a joy to keep my thoughts within reach. It's a great tool to preserve memories.

Loved DayOne version 1.  Version 2 is even better.  I've used many note apps trying to find the right one for extensive journaling and note taking, prayers and so forth.  I will give 1 additional star when each of these elements are updated or added:

Widget Tags broken last update.  (Worth one star)

Ability to use all system fonts.  (Worth one start.)

column9: No Dropbox - suggest you don't buy!
column10: I know this sounds mad - but I purchased this app specifically to try and put pressure on the developers. Forcing you to use their own servers to sync data, with no real assurance of security, rather than using a known quantity like iCloud (where they put a huge amount of effort into maintaining security) or Dropbox, is a foolish and counterproductive move.  I love this app on my MacBook and I'm sure I would love it on my iPad, but I won't be using it until the ability to use iCloud or Dropbox is back. No, I don't record secure data in a journal, but I do record thoughts plans and dreams, most of which I wouldn't want the world read.  Not because there is anything sensational in there, just personal - and I don't think that's unreasonable. Your call.

I've always wanted a way to capture the little parts of life that a mother treasures.  This is it! I always have my phone on me, and this app is perfectly designed to snag a quick thought or photo. The export options offer a myriad of ways to produce hard copies for archiving.
As title
I love the new features in this version! Doesn't hang either. Might be a tad slow but better than the earlier version. Great job!
Gr8 job, guys! Thanks a lot!

I've just begun using this app and am already getting things to work out the way I'd like. I especially appreciate being able to use several photos for a single entry and several entries on a single day. Those are new features since I abandoned the classic version. They are the reason for my return.
Loving Day one. It's beautiful and easy to use. It actually inspires me to make notes and save pics - job well done

column9: No iCloud, have to wait for a "secure" service?
column10: iCloud is secure and trusted and ready to be used, but these guys think they can do better than Apple.

I've used Day One for 2.5 years, and I consider an indispensable part of my writing life.  The previous version was strong, but had definitely showed signs of aging over the past nine months.  

This version is even better, and includes support for iOS 9, Split View, and the iPad Pro. There are still a few bugs, but I'm confident that the developers will squash those in the next few weeks/months.  And these bugs are minor, and definitely haven't affected my use of the app.

This is a well-executed journaling app.  If you want to focus on recording your life, Day One 2 is an excellent place to do that.
This app his been instrumental for my personal growth and writing skills. I have had this app for years.
Especially adding multiple photos.
Great app with a beautiful design that reminds me to keep track of important events in my life. It's fun to go a year back and remind myself of what I was doing and with whom. Highly recommended.

Unless & until Bloom Built adds iCoud and Dropbox syncing functionality to Day One 2 I will no longer be a customer (I got it free from Apples free app of the month program) and will no longer be using Day One classic (I've been a loooong time user of that version).  With all the issues surrounding data security I will not trust my private thoughts, pictures etc. to an unproven data storage system especially since they currently do not support end to end encryption (although they claim they will at some point). Deleted both versions of their app and won't look back.  Maybe they will come to their senses and see how this was a VERY POOR business decision.

column9: What are the other guys on about?
column10: Sure, so you can't sync to Dropbox but as far as I'm concerned that's not an issue, because a diary isn't a place to keep your passwords and most secured items - it's for making sure you get the opportunity to remind yourself of what happened in your day. To me, this app is invaluable. I use it daily and I know that I have something to look back on one day. Memory loss is no joke, and this app has become part of daily life.

I never thought I'd enjoy keeping a journal, but how wrong I was! 

Day One is a dream to use.

column9: One of my favorite iOS apps
column10: I have been a DayOne user for some time now. I write in this app almost everyday and I love it. DayOne helps me express my thoughts and record moments on almost all my devices (web access coming soon?) just about where ever I am. The user experience is beautiful and is a joy to use. No app is perfect but this one gets darn close. I know there have been many debates about the sync but I converted to DayOne sync before the update and all my stuff has transferred with no issues. If you are in the market for a true journaling app, look no further. There are things they can improve upon and they usually do, don't let the little things rob you of the best, most immersive writing experience on iOS/MAC platform for journaling.
Love the new revisions - I use this journal app everyday.

I love that Day One now allows multiple journals which can be colour coded. The interface is very pleasant and easy to use. Multiple photos is also a great feature. 
What I love most is that the entires sync instantly between my phone and my computer.

No one else has built a journaling app this gorgeous and this usable. It's perfect because it works everywhere and anywhere. 

(I share the sync concerns, but I also get the developers' skepticism over relying too much on iCloud, and similar.)
Simply keeps getting better and better
It's an amazing app,I really like it.
quite useful and the app is elegantly designed, a joy to use

I loved Day One when it first came out on the market and love the new version.  My only nitpick about this new version at this point is that included hyperlinks in journal entries don't actually launch the iOS Safari browser when tapped.

Otherwise love the interface and the ability to add multiple photos to an entry now.  I don't care for the ability to keep different journals, but I can see how that would be useful to users.
Is planning to use this for a long time, hope it will get better and better!
It's got a real nice interface. Easy to use. This is the only journaling app I've tried but it's pretty great.

Day One has been designed and thought out almost perfectly, in fact I can't even suggest one change. Beautifully streamlined design, intelligent feeling interface, and overall I actually feel the "live journal" experience

column9: App Great, Pricing & Device Synching V Poor
column10:
This app is everything I wanted for the classic version, multiple journals that synch easily across iPhone, iPad & Desktop. 

So why do I have to use THEIR servers for synchronising, giving them permission to do as they please with my content, and why is the Desktop version ¬£24 when the IOS version is only ¬£4? Just doesn't add up!

A great app being ruined by some very warped business thinking.
I have used Day One to write my journal everyday for the past two years. One of the most useful software for me so far.

Now that I have this app I can see myself practically journaling now‚Ä¶ I love that it syncs between your iPhone iPad and MacBook Pro. I've always heard of the benefits of journaling and now I have a tool to assist me in that venture.
highly recommended, even it costs bit expensive

column9: One Major Flaw. That's Why The One Star
column10: This app is great. BUT YOU CAN SEE YOUR CAMERA ROLL WITHOUT THE PASSCODE. Zero Stars...

I am not exaggerating when I say that Day One is my favourite app on my phone, on par with Snapchat. 

People are complaining about removing iCloud sync but the new app's own Sync solution works perfectly and they state basic sync will be free forever. 

In addition, they will be adding encryption in a future update making this 5/5 app become 6/5. 

Everyone should journal, and Day One is the app for doing so, period. üíôüíô
I'm unable to use my photo location to search the places around it. Can you please fix? The new version I can only search the area of current location. This is annoying.

When I launched the app for the first time after the update, it didn't ask for password or touch ID. Directly jumped up to the timeline.

Bonus: lack of iCloud and Dropbox makes no sense.
Great app for compiling my daily activities!
Been using DayOne for years and now with DayOne 2.0 I can do IFTTT integration without too much hassle.

Absolutely love the new update. I've been using this for almost 5 months now. I use it every single day! I used to use the first Day One version and I just upgraded to this one. The transfer was super smooth and easy. Love multiple pics in one entry. Thank you for fixing the emoji problem. two suggestions/questions: I can't figure out how to add a gif. It says via share extension but when I press share it just allows me to do just that, share my entry somewhere. If I add it through photos, it doesn't move. Please reply :( second thing, it would be really convenient if we could have a way to move photos after placing them. Like press and hold and I can drag them to another part or line of the entry. Everything else is great will edit if needed.

The new app is still missing Dropbox sync, and Day One's sync service is unreliable, lacks encryption, and the company's privacy policy is concerning. I'll stick with Day One Classic until they add Dropbox sync to v2.0.

I've been using this app for over two years and it's pretty cool to see what you did last year and have so much more detail of what you did.  I keep notes on when I did something to the house like air filter changes or hey I started having a problem with this or that.  I log all my health events. I log my family outings.  I log my MTG playing.  I use the tagging but now that you can have multiple journals I dedicate on journal to work so I can more easily write up status reports. The throwback I'm glad to see back in but now it shows o e and two (some time three years) ago images and now a random one which is pretty cool to see those.  Great app, best one I've seen.  It would be cool to see some day video (with like a cool overlay on top of the video with date and location) to really capture some things even better.

This is a wonderful app, one I've used for years (at least the Classic version) and I have very few problems with it. I just downloaded the update, supposedly full of fixes and enhancements, and what do I get? Four crashes in the first five minutes of use. I can barely even read previous entries. Last update-version, my review involved photo insert crashes - this one is different. It allowed me to put in a sixth, seventh and even eighth photo, but crashes every time I try to look at them out of "edit" mode. Other than that, this app perfectly fits my desire for a portable, useful journal. The design is amazing and the features are wonderful, just a few bugs to take care of!
Thanks, Ruby

This is my absolute favourite journaling app. It has a clean interface, lots of features, and it makes keeping up with a diary really easy. Unfortunately, instead of updating the first one, they created a new app and made us all pay twice. You can't even download the cheaper, original app anymore.

Love this app!  A cool feature would be the ability to shuffle your journal entries. Kind of like how you can do with songs in iTunes. 

Keep up the good work!
I look forward to journaling every day now that I started using this app. It makes it so easy and I can include pictures and all of my journal entries. I would recommend this to anyone.
It took a while, but after some three and a half years of owning Day One, I started writing more or less regularly, mostly with, you guessed it, Day One.
I use it daily. Perfect for meditating and capturing memories and thoughts.

column9: I love this app and it's original one
column10: I actually got this day one 2 for free through the Apple Store app, the interface is a lil different but still trynna find out the biggest change. Anyways, I love this app because I use it as my diary! The MacBook application is also great if you haven't tried that yet!

column9: what have you done to this app
column10: don't get me wrong it's a good app. i use it every day but it's laggy af now great job. makes my phone a portable hand warmer. so ya be a good app developer and fix this thanks
But seriously, a finely crafted app with layer after layer of capabilities.

That's no exaggeration. This app is so useful in so many areas of life. Do you journal? You can't live without this app in your pocket or on your iPad or Mac. Snap a few photos at your kid's birthday party? Drop them into DayOne and relive the memories later. Need to track favorite quotations? Work notes? Recipes? Poetry? Fitness goals? Anything at all? It's so easy to create multiple journals and do all of that and more! Get it! Get it now!

I had to drop my rating for the following: Sync issues since the move to exclusive DayOne Sync, lack of DropBox or iCloud sync options, lack of encryption, some wonkiness with the app not searching sometimes‚Ä¶ I'll happily move it back up to five stars if some of these are addressed.

I'm an amateur writer and I like to write anything with the markdown in day one. All the extra information (i.e. Altitude, step count etc.) is really fun. 
It would be cool if they could add time machine feature that will remind you to read a entry on a certain date. 
Overall awesome.

This version has many Lek and bugs.
So Slow.
I am so disappointed.
Nice
I really love that you can now include 10 photos. Helps me when I get out of the rhythm of journaling daily; I can use my pictures and get caught up really easily.

Updated, but still a garbage.
I hope there's other brandnew diary application like this. This app requires a plethora of pratience, money, no dropbox sync, no full-sized photo, no full-featured markdown editor, no smooth UI experience and so on. DON'T BUY, you can get it free via U.S appstore, using AppStore Application provided by APPLE.

column9: Good app but needs to be improved
column10: When I view the PDF mode, it always cannot exactly show the words I wrote.
This is a great app - the best for journaling that I've ever tried. I set alarm (in app) to remind me each day.
Amazing app, makes me actually want to keep a journal. The timeline layout is really cool.

It is so easy to organize and save articles I like and I can read it later.

I also can add my thoughts with each article I read.
Nothing more to say. Look no further.
All you need on a journaling app

column9: Solid but could use a slight improvement
column10: Huge fan. It's the easiest journal Ap I've found yet and like how it seamlessly syncs across my iPad and IPhone. Just wish you could get a full screen option when writing a new entry versus having the side bar all the time.

column9: So easy I actually use it!
column10: I really liked it for its ease of use, but with great features like adding location and weather automatically. Now that they added multiple notebooks, I use it for work, too. Highly recommended!

I've used Day One almost every day for four years, but I am disappointed with this new version.  It feels less like a journal and more like any other social media.  On both iPad and iPhone the actual writing areas feel cramped and cluttered, with too much emphasis on being able to add photos, location, weather, music, activity levels; so now I use Pages for my journal.  An uncluttered, full screen for writing, better control over fonts and margins, syncs with iCloud.

column9: The Only Journaling app you need
column10: Great interface, easy to use, looks great, you can publish--or not.  I use it for ideas so it's great that I can put them in different "notebooks" and tag them so I can find them later.  Get it.

column9: Never using another journaling app again
column10: I've used other apps before and was going back and forth between handwritten journaling and electronic (an issue between the emotional connection to writing) and since I started using Day One in 2011 I haven't had to urge or feeling to look elsewhere for my journaling needs.  Day One provides the access to post entries on the go with with the flexibility to add things to make each entry unique (photos, geotagging, tagging,...).  Searching for exactly what you are looking for a breeze.  This is the journaling app to get.

I originally bought DayOne years ago with the best of intentions, that didn't work out but I rediscovered it as a journaling app to chronicle the birth and growth of my first child. It is amazing. Have downloaded the app on my wife's phone and now we have a private journal of every moment that we can both post to. It is great to be able to share single entries via url to family and friends. I also like how you can export the entire thing to pdf. 
Magical!
It's all true.  I've been using it from the beginning and it keeps getter get better.
I love this application.  Has everything I wanted in a journal.
Never thought i would get into a journaling app but Day One is very easy to use and great for tracking everything from allergies to ideas you come up with in the shower

And I love DayOne.  It's particularly good with a nice keyboard, I have the pro.  The update has taken some getting used to, and I thought the old one was fine, but I like the interface.  I particularly like the split screen- I can take notes while reading the bible.  It's pretty cool.

I'd love for DayOne to add a feature where I could use Apple Pencil and hand write notes.
I have used my hand written journal for years. I am hoping that I will be able to switch over to this.
I use it everyday, thanks for making such a great app!

Very good improvements and additions, such as the multi-journaling, the 10 images per entry possibility. Fifth star when they'll implement some of the most requested additional features, already in their suggestions list. But they're working hard, answer to you kindly and quickly and they're up to their promises. Good job!
Day One is an elegant digital journal. It's easy to learn and easy to use - yet has enough features and flexibility to meet many different journaling and organizational styles.

column9: Fantastic app, also very accessible with VoiceOver
column10: Was super excited when this app was released, lots of awesome features that help make journaling fun. Also, as a blind user, I was very pleased to discover that the app is very accessible using VoiceOver.

This version is dreadful! Moving over from the previous version it lost half my old entries, even though they were backed up to Dropbox and now constantly crashes on my iPad Pro. Another example of an upgrade being worse than the original app ... and I had to buy it twice!

This is an excellent app, it is user-friendly and it provides a useful way to jot down daily notes.
Well done.
Works well, the reminders are awesome. Expensive but I Guess if you use it you get a lot of value from it

column9: Too many bugs. Even worse than Day One v1.0
column10: Worth 5 stars only if getting the bugs fixed.
Journal app for the iPhone hands down. I've tried a lot of them but keep coming back to Day One! Don't hesitate to pick this app up today!
Enjoying the app immensely. I'm presently having a bit of trouble syncing with my phone but I'm sure I can work it out.
Even if you have a favorite notes app you use, I recommend Day One as a space for journaling.

column9: Should have considered privacy from day one

Making these apps new and not just updated is good for the company's bottom line, but seems to be a bit of a kick in the teeth for those who purchased the old app. At very least, the new apps should be offered at a discount to customers who have already downloaded the old app.

column9: the app is nice and works well but the proprietary sync is big bs

The first version of DayOne was a pretty little thing, and worth paying for to explore, but it lacked functionality for me to really use it on a daily basis. 

What drove me to get the 1.0 in the first place was the terrible performance behind iNotes after the big iOS update which left syncing between devices terribly broken. DayOne solved this problem by offering their own server to sync against and I was happy enough with it. 

Another drawback in the DayOne business model is that you need to pay for separate devices so I can't have a DayOne on both iPhone and Mac book. A further flaw is that they lack Windows support or even a web interface. This is strictly an iOS centric application. 

So why did I buy the 2nd edition? Simply because it solved the problem of having separate journals (really, just a higher level concept of organizing) since organizing notes with tags is fairly frustrating. They continue their business model by forcing you to buy another edition for MacBook. 

In a way, I feel ripped off because introducing Multiple journals didn't warrant an entirely new product. I think in the long term, they're really shooting themselves in the foot by focusing on an obvious short term profit model and I fail to see how they'll be able to achieve growth in userbase. 

At the same time, I'm conflicted because while 1.0 was pretty compared to Notes of Evernote - 2.0 is definitely more polished and useful. 

If making a decision - stick with 2.0 and be careful since they offer both on the App Store. Would I get a 3.0? Def not. I think any further updates would be really DLC related and it's hard to justify further iterations that would require further payment. I do see opportunity in then allowing better sharing and collaboration between other DayOne users but that's just me since I like to work on notes with other users like planning a trip or jotting down product ideas in rough form. 

In conclusion, I feel kinda fooled but at the same time, I don't regret it because even a month later, I still use DayOne for work, personal, and training notes.

I use this app daily. The user experience is great. The reminders are perfect and I love the Apple Watch app that it comes with as well.

The bloom built team has made a great app even better with Day One 2.0. I really enjoy the refreshed UI that feels new, yet altogether familiar. Also, I love the i can finally add multiple photos/videos to one journal entry! That has been a feature I've been waiting for.

Also, I like that the app gives me a subtle reminder to journal each day. I'm horrible at remembering to stop and take a breather. Day One helps me to stop and reflect and frame my state of mind about the day that has just passed, or the one that is about to begin. 

Overall, great app.
Use it everyday!!
Using daily to keep track of work tasks

Undoubtedly one of the best apps in its category. Haven't seen a better personal journaling app for iOS.
Simplicity, good usability and interaction model, smooth sync on all platforms and exporting your writing are few of my favourite features in the app. It's worth your money for sure!

I love this app!

column9: A safe pic to buy, journal and remember.

The app is good, but I liked the minimalism of the previous version. Hope for improvements.

I always envied people with their moleskine notebooks, taking notes throughout the day, and I never could get myself to write in mine... Now I can do the same, and more, in Day One!

This app does everything a journal app should do plus more.

One of my all-time favorite apps.

column9: Great for Journaling and much more
column10: I've been using DayOne for several years and keep coming back. It's one of the best text editors in the App Store and and people criminally underuse DayOne's ability to track special moments with pictures ‚Äì like a beautiful picture book.
Very nice!
I've been a happy user for years.

I've been using Day One for a while now. I understood this is the next version of a very succesful journaling app, that has caused also some controversy. As I didn't have experience about the previous app, I think I got a pretty nice fresh start with this version.

So far I'm really liking what I see. I understand the privacy and security gripes abou syncing to random cloud, but that's not a dealbreaker for me personally, especially as the app itself is just plain gorgeus and absolutely wonderful to use.

You can just leave syncing off and export stuff yourself, if you really want to play it safe.
This is the best journaling app out there! Thank you!

I write a lot about my true feelings... As most people probably do when having a journal. This app has great security features that I love. It also has he ability to read when a photo was taken and where so if you forget the details of an image you're uploading to write about it, you don't have to worry about thinking back and putting in a backdated entry... It does it for you automatically. Really cool. I often write quick tidbits and thoughts throughout the day with this app. It's really good for getting in and out quickly and letting you say what you want to say. I love having this resource on hand.

I was highly skeptical at the idea of digital journaling, even as a younger man I find myself being more aligned with the traditionalist inside of me that wants to say it is no replacement to pen and paper journaling however DayOne has changed my mind considerably. I had downloaded it as a means to break my instinct to reach for Facebook when I wanted to make commentary on my day. Now rather than sharing many of the thoughts that I have (and think are profound üòè) with every soul that visits Facebook on the regular, I now keep a more personalized and meaningful record of my reflections through the day.

column9: Great journal. Get over your sync whining.
column10:
Update: still an amazing journal. The sync is still awesome. The app is awesome. Period.

Let me be blunt: all the hate and whining about the sync service is hogwash. So you can't use the service you want? Go cry about it. Use a paper journal. Whatever. 
Don't take it out on the developer. This app is great, and their sync service works *really* well. This is the best digital journal out there. Period. The devs deserve better treatment than the storm of 1-star whiners.
Used the first app for many years so happy to pay for the new version. Still use it every day and having multiple journals is fantastic.

compared so many similar app. only day one is suit for me...

It would be nice if you could import your status updates from Facebook and tweets (or full conversations) from Twitter. I've seen it in some other apps and it's great, but they don't do it right' I think you guys can do it.

column9: Excellent journal app. Love multiple pics feature
column10: I've been using Day One for over a year now. My favorite new feature was the multiple pics in a an entry. It works well and allows me to have a contained story which is great when. You have pics of all four kids at one event. But not one photo to show it all off with.

I travel a lot for work and I spend a lot of time on an airplane. I use those times to go back through my photos that I've taken and bring them into Day One as journal entries.   Day One makes it completely easy for me to record all of the great moments I have with my son.  Day One made a great addition to their software allowing me to post multiple pictures onto a single entry. I found that to be extremely valuable.

To commit to writing in a journal. In the past I use the regular word processor, but this makes writing in a daily journal very very easy. I have had to iterations of this program and I am pleased with both.
first app i decide to upgrade without any hesistation
Simply to use. Adding photos and words in a daily way is effortlessly. We need to remember our days and Day One is perfect!

I have tried for so long to find an app that works for both my business and private note taking... With the addition of extra photos this is darn near perfect. Maybe the desktop version is a bit to pricey, but that's my only quibble.

The new version forsakes the ability to sync with a personal cloud (Dropbox or iCloud) for the DayOne cloud. I don't feel that my data is secure especially considering that it's quite personal information. Please bring back the functionality to backup to my own cloud solution.
One the first apps I got for phone, love it.
Once you get the hang of their logic, it is a good program. I have gone through several journaling software programs and this is the best for me.

column9: Most complete and thorough journaling app

column9: Just what I've been looking for

Very easy to use, I've used some others on computers and this is much easier; plenty of information; a doddle to add pics; simple info such as weather, location, exercise which normally would need to be entered manually you can choose to have done automatically.

column9: Easy to use, extensible journaling app
column10: DayOne is a great journaling app composed of all the elements necessary for a quick and easy or thorough journal: secure, simple, and elegant--with quick entries and multi-markdown support. Been using this app for a couple of years and got the updated version so I could add more pics to my daily entries. Fun to look back on, maps are helpful. Looking up places I've been to. I recommend this to all my family and friends and I would suggest you use it too!

I like this app because there are a lot of things you couldn't normally do with a book, like post pictures on entries, record location and weather, and stuff like that. I love this app! It's awesome.

The classic app was saved to iCloud or Dropbox; pretty secure I'd say. This latest version is backed up to the authors own server. Think hard about whether you want your personal writings backed up to the server of persons that I you know absolutely nothing about. If this doesn't concern you then this is a great journaling app; the best I've come across. Although there are bugs in the new version that need sorting quickly.
So far no complaints. The workflow is efficient and easy to use. Excited to see if it makes my note taking easier!

This app has been a wonderful thing for our family. We have recorded memory after memory here, memories that otherwise would have faded away. Now we have a growing family history to keep forever. I love having the ability to add pictures, select the date, and share on social media. 

DayOne will be the reason our children and grandchildren know who they came from, what we all were like at this time, and what we strived to accomplish in our lives. I'm so grateful for DayOne!

Love this app!

column9: Day One is a beautiful way to document your life!

Interesting
So glad they re-added the look back entries to the home screen. Starts my morning!
One of the most beautiful apps I've used. I journal much more after getting this app, a handful entries a day. The Mac app is also great.

Great app. Really enjoying keeping a visual diary.
This sets the standard and benchmark for a journaling app, best on the market.

Great app to use and its very easy to use.

Just the best.
I started using this app which I am really enjoying. It keeps your memories updated with one very to use app. Well done to the developers and the idea is fantastic
I use it aways.

column9: Day one has evolved into a wonderful journaling app
column10: I used a version of Day One about 3 years ago and it didn't work for me. Day One has changed a lot since then though and it now does everything I need, with great UX, across iOS and OS X.

Having used the first version for several years the current new version is even better: now with support for more pictures in each post and geographical search among posts pinned to a world map.
It really helps me keep track of my family's story and I use it almost every day. 
It transferred data from the old version synced on Dropbox to the new version synced on DayOne's own server - no issues, it just works.

Day One 2 is quite an amazing app for journaling. The multiple journals are great for categorization and the new integrations with IFTTT can't be beat! The promise was made a long while ago - and they have met my expectations expertly.

Keep in mind that if you have Day One Classic and install this new version, you will have two apps in Springboard that have the same icon and name. I had to delete one and go back into the App Store and see which one was installed.
I've been using day one for years and I would be lost without it. It's simple and unobtrusive.
Doesn't get get better then this, day one version 1 was great. Day one version 2 is the best! It has everything you will ever need

You've heard the expression "The original was the best." Not true here.  The original version of the Day One Journal was great, the second version (the current version) is outstanding. 

Strong, secure, full of features, reliable, bullet proof. Syncs between iPhones, iPads and Macs using iCloud. Great developer support. This should be your first journaling purchase.  I think it will be your last.

Yes, there are bugs. But there is a big potential to realize too. UI in the new version sometimes is really weird, but no doubts it will be fixed.

The main thing about this app ‚Äî without it my life would be a bit less colorful and enjoyable. So thank you.

column9: The way I end my day
column10: Day One is a superb piece of software, making it easy and hassle free to transcribe my thoughts and impressions from the day into a written form. After almost a year and a half of journaling, my efforts have turned into an interesting record of my day-to-day events and thoughts. I'm a little bummed that the iOS version went free so quickly through the Apple Store, but the developers also deserved the initial fee.
Been using daily for 3 years. It just works.

column9: All I've been looking for in a diary app
column10: I happened upon this app as they went from version 1 to 2. I'd been looking for an app like this for quite a while. It's private and not social. I can write my thoughts and make sense of photos I want to keep. Give it a try if you want a diary.

I use this app as part of my Miracle Morning. Absolutely fantastic app and has become a part of my daily routine. Going back over the last two months, I feel this has the potential to change my life...as well as document it. Thanks for the great application. It's an essential for living fully awake.

I really like this journaling app.  The only bad thing about it is that it removes any excuse for not maintaining a daily journal.  As a procrastinator, I tend to look for reasons to avoid writing.  With this app, none exists.
I like previous version but new one make me like it even more. Multiple journals is what that app needed. Thank you

column9: One of my few paid apps
column10: It's clean and well done. Syncs with my iPad and iPhone. Easy to use, uncluttered and attractive. To sync with my Mac was way too expensive, but I'd likely never use it on my computer anyway since I use it when I'm waking up or going to sleep and my iPad is on the nightstand. So all in all I'm very happy and feel it was a good investment.
Quickly add a todo list / reminder feature and you'll truly be the journal of 21 century ! But hey thanks for this sleek and swank app.
I love this app. Thumbs up!
I love how sync is now just handled for me. Teamed with IFTTT I can get posts started when I post to Instagram or checkin then add more context.

I use this as a commonplace book, kids' memory book, photo book, brain cogitations, and normal journal. Each update gets better. The search and tag functions, ability to store on the cloud, and seemingly limitless customization possibilities make me one very happy customer.

column9: The Best journaling app out there.
