column9: Good but not worth $40 for the Mac version
column10: Good but not worth $40 for the Mac version along with this

I got this app for free from the Apple store and after using it I would've gladly paid
The only thing I wish is that they had a Windows desktop version

I want to make this five stars and so I did, but the only thing I'd like to see change is the search function when I'm looking for a past post. 

I'd love to be able to put a few words in the search bar and if the post is long it will highlight where it found the words. Sometimes it is very difficult to find just where it is in the post.

But still, 5 stars! I love this app.

I am starting to journal with this new version of Day One. I believe the author has the best intentions when he switched us over to a homegrown sync solution. I will have no problem pouring my thoughts into this thoughtfully built app!

column9: Unethical EULA, no choice of storage
column10:
Two points: If you read their EULA, the developers basically stake claim on your content! Apparently, they can use my private journal entries in whatever way they want! Not happening devs! Sorry! And by the way, paid for and use Day One for both Mac and iOS (the ‚Äúold‚Äù versions); did not imagine the creators of such a wonderful app to be so evil! When did that happen?

This new version does not offer iCould or Dropbox as storage options but instead provides only Day One Sync, which basically stores our data on servers owned by Day One. Presumably to assist in snooping and monetising our journal entries. Man! When did you guys get so evil?

column9: one of the best iOS apps. worth paying for.
column10: I know I often hear that people refuse to pay for an app. this is unfortunate since Day One is a amazing, superb app that it worth every penny.

column9: Beautiful app that makes writing on iOS devices a treat.
column10:
If your looking for a app for journaling, note taking, or even for simply any kind of writing on iOS devices, I would strongly recommend the Day One 2 app.

I've always wanted to get into the habit of writing, but Day One app is the thing that really got me started. I've tried many apps and method, including pen and paper, but the beautiful way that the Day One app presents a space for you to write, the gorgeous display of what you wrote, and the portability  really made writing stick for me. I just started writing about a month ago, but I've been writing everyday for 34 days now, and I have no intention to stop.

I know many complaints about Day One 2 are on the lack of syncing options. I'm not sure if Day One servers are as secure as previous options, but I can definitely say that Day One's native sync option is very seamless and blazing fast.

I love this app because it makes me think about actually taking photos, and it's a journal as well. I've tried journaling, and tried some sites where you do a photo a day, and I abandon them because there ends up being some sort of barrier. Well, this app is so user-friendly, and quick and easy to make an entry, that I really believe that, with maybe the exception of my texting app, this gets used the most. It's even better since the ability of putting multiple photos in an entry was added.
Everything one could ask for
Easy to write a note saying what you did that day. Easy to check back if you need to know what you did. And it makes journaling fun!

If you care about words, this is the best way to capture them.  This is the best way to chew on them, to digest them, to let words nourish you.

Day One is easily the best application purchase I've made as I now have a life artifact. It is a digital phylactery.  It keeps me alive and moving and remembering

column9: This is the only app I've bothered to submit a review for
column10: I don't do such things lightly, so maybe it gives you an idea of how good it is.
Good app for writing notes
Love the list feature

column9: Great way to record a life event
column10: My little girl was diagnosed with leukaemia in October. I've been posting every day since then. I'll show her when she's older - then she can see what an amazing persona she's been. Thanks Day1.
This App is very well built! I love using this app and it makes writing a journal fun and easy. It is also a very good tool to deal with emotions! Great job guys, this app rocks!
This app is logically laid out and makes it easy to get my thoughts out. I am most happy with it. Highly recommended.
Why did you not include this? I'm going back to the old version.
Now in my 3rd year of daily use-actually several times a day. The latest version is a big improvement. Looking forward to a solid users guide and better text formatting capacity such as font colors.
I love typing entries on my phone, and I also find it pleasing to dictate entries on my Apple Watch.

You'll be so glad if you dive into Day One!
Get out what's inside, fully form those thoughts, capture the meaningful, write your story. The tags and multiple journals - awesome!

You can even use it for some to do practices.

Day One brings mindfulness alive. You won't regret it.
App is beautifully designed and efficient!!!
Loving the latest version of Day One, ability to add multiple photos is great.
A very good app has gotten better in som ways. But I'm really disappointed with not having the iCloud sync option. Won't use this version. Don't want anyone else than Apple to handle my diary.
Easiest for me to use and cleanest interface. Highly recommend.

Simple interface, but really awesome features once you start exploring. I love this app because it gathers all the information for your entry from your phone and you don't have to put it in manually but it is right there. Ability to add photos and captions is awesome too.

I use this app daily if not more.  I have this app protected via PIN, however I rarely use it  You don't need the PIN to add an entry--only to access (or modify) what you've previously written. This works for me as I don't have the distraction of previous entries as jotting my thought.
Yep. On Mac and iOS you need to get both. Amazing attention to detail, fine craftsmanship. Nobody builds a better journal.
I just wish there was a Windows version of this
New Layout is nicely done. Multiply Journals and new features are excellent and exactly what was needed. Great job, 5 stars!

I've been using Day One for months. I've never had a problem. It is simple to use. It is a clean app. It makes it easy to be a journal keeper.
Crashes when I browse photos. Everytime! Useless app. Too expensive even free. Uninstall.

I have used Day One for a couple of years now. It had been my trusted companion when it came to recording my private thoughts. With the new version I have one spot to record both my private and work observations with the ability to search across both if need be. 

Brilliant App.
The reminder to write in the journal is helpful.
I use DayOne multiple times a day. Writing down memories, meals, places. Really cool to look back on what I did a couple years ago with the app!

really perfect

column9: Great app, easy to such, plenty of functionality
column10: I've used DayOne for several years now and the app continues to grow on me. The new version is a big step forward. I like having the option of multiple journals and adding multiple photos. One bug too: when you switch between journals, the border colour stays default blue rather than adjusting to the colour of the journal you've switched to. All in all, this is an app I highly recommend.

column9: You will always be the best, Day One üíô
column10:
This review is for both apps (iOS & OSX apps) Since I've been using Day One for almost 3 years, I'm glad to say that you never fail the expectations of your customers! I don't really know how to say this, but Day One has been a part of my life and it's always on my to-do list! (Since I don't want to miss any day) It really has a huge impact on me since it also helps me to release the positive and negative vibes that I'm feeling at the moment.. instead of being annoying on the internet üòÇ 
I'm also grateful because it lets me remember the beautiful and not-so-beautiful things that happened in my life, and I can see my progress as a person! Like, who would've thought I was like that a year ago?! And now-- you've improved!! You get me? 

In addition, I'd like to ask some features... It's just simple!! So first, whenever I write an entry, can the format be justified? I'm sorry it's just my OCD and I think my entries would look much better if it's justified! I feel really weird whenever I see it's not aligned.. So yeah, I hope you give us that option! üòä

Second, with the photos, I think it would be better if it's not displayed one by one! Maybe we can arrange it into a more minimalistic format? Like, a format of a collage but it's not a collage... It's like the format in Twitter or Tumblr or something like that.. I hope you guys understand what I'm saying!! 

Aside from that, everything's perfect üòä thank you so much Day One!! Looking forward to more cool features that would make me love writing even more!

Beautiful application but I will not use it until the developer adds iCloud Sync as an option. Unfortunately I do not trust them with my entries in their servers and will no longer be syncing or using the application until they listen to their customers.
icloud sync neededÔºånever trust your server

I'll continue to use the original Day One app so I can sync with iCloud. I don't know why they didn't enable iCloud sync in Day One version 2. Once it's enabled I'll give it 5 stars. I don't want my personal information out on some server that I don't know. Yes, anything can be hacked if someone wants it bad enough, however I've got two step verification enabled on iCloud. That alone makes iCloud sync way more secure than the sync with Day One version 2.

I only got this app since it was free if you went through the Apple Store app hoping one day iCloud sync will be enabled.
Can't really trust day one sync.

I've been using Day One for almost three years. The producers have consistently made improvements, such as syncing on more than one device and the ability to have more than one journal. It is easy to use and has a nice, clean interface. I tried journaling on my desktop and found that I didn't write regularly. With Day One, I do write regularly, so I'm continuing with this app!

You're required to sync your private notes to their servers so they can be read by employees of DayOne. iCloud syncing is free for developers to implement and by going out of their way to implement their own servers to sync your data, it almost shows their determination to monetize your data. Make sure you read that privacy policy in full.

I really don't like the direction Day One has headed in the last couple years, culminating in this version. I used to love the app and how it felt sort of "cut off" from the web. It was a quiet, disconnected space to write and journal. They're turning this app into something very different than a pure journaling app, and I'm just not a fan. It now feels like a casino with all this noise: maps, pictures, step counts, weather info, etc. Just a lot of distractions from the journal itself. I'm sticking with the old Day One for now and am looking for a new journal app, one that is "just" a journal.
Very intuitive design, best journal app on iOS
Hoping for web support and browser-based editing soon! Best journal app so far!
please support Traditional Chinese language.

But these are such minor things, and overall the app does what it's intended for, plus much more. I don't buy apps often, but this one was more than worth the price.

column9: Day One 2 a step up from Day One

Using this for a gardening journal and it is very easy to use. I haven't explored all the new features but the only thing I would like to see is a side-by-side year-to-year review.

column9: Some improvements, some not so good
column10: Having used the earlier Day One I was expecting this would have the same functionality and more. In that context I was disappointed because the developers have chosen to drop support for DropBox in favour of their own storage server. This means that the Windows app Journ Ally can no longer be used in conjunction with Day One 2 which is, I believe, most unfortunate. Perhaps the developers will produce their own Windows app, but I rather doubt it. The ability to attach more than one image to a daily journal is a plus.

Apparently those that are complaining about the loss of iCloud and Dropbox haven't been paying attention. The new DayOne Sync was mentioned AWHILE AGO.
I admit, at first I was apprehensive. My only concern being reliability. So far the DayOne sync is amazing. Fast and reliable.
The new DayOne 2 is a very mature version and seems very stable.
I've been looking forward to multiple journals for awhile now and the experience meets the expectation!
This is an awesome app for those, like myself, who are in need of a robust digital journal.
When Apple Notes is too simple and Evernote is too complex, DayOne 2 is the tool you need.
Bravo!

These guys have been doing a good job here!
This app is very friendly and practical to use. Pretty stable and fast!
I hope we can access our notes via web page too in a near future. 

Cheers!
H.
It may not be free but it's worth it! The best journal app there is. You can have entries that are so organized. The tags are the most helpful features!
I like this app

I love this app. I have been using the Day One app for years. I updated and paid for the new one when it came out. I new I needed to update because I liked all the new features. I didn't like how they made me have to pay for a whole new app. This is my first experience in having to pay again for an app I already paid for. (That is why I gave it four stars) I wish they could have rewarded previous users with some sort of deal.
 All that being sad the new version is great and a pleasure to use. I have wrote in my Day One app everyday for the past two years. I am using it for writing a book and for working on a blog. For people who love writing in journals this app is for you.

I use Day One multiple times a day on both my phone and my computer. It's really convenient.

I've even started using it to keep track of what I've done at work, and what I've eaten ‚Äî gotta follow my doctor's orders! The multiple journals feature makes that really easy.
Great app to help save those memories!

column9: One Of The Best Apps I've Ever Used...
column10: So much possibility with such a seemingly simple app. Very versatile and easy to use. Give it a shot, you won't be disappointed.

I've been using Classic for more than three years. Some great updates in this version. A decent job adding a bunch of new functionality while keeping things fairly simple. It draws some ire to have limitations on the number of journals and such when the cost point is so high, especially if you use Day One on multiple devices. Still the best out there, but at this point it's a little unclear how much of that for me is just them having such an awesome head start vs. concrete, clear strides forward. It's more the former.

Have been using Dayone (V1) since it came out and my biggest dislike was that you could only have one journal. But with Dayone2 I can now separate my work and personal journals. App crashed several time for the first week or so but that seems to hsve stabilised since a minor update was released. Really happy with this version and also was not to peeves to have had to pay for it.

column9: Helped me to start keeping a journal
column10: I never kept a diary or journal before meeting this app.  Now I keep a daily journal. It is wonderful being able to go back in time and remember moments in your life.  You can add photos, locations and text. The app adds the weather and a few other stats.  What a wonderful useful app
I love the multiple photos feature.

column9: The best just needs video support!!
column10: Would be 5 stars just needs video support.  Everything else is spot on!
Great functionality and easy to use.

column9: Nice app, I still prefer the original though.
column10:
It has some nice new features, but is more complicated. I like that you can add more than one photo, they aren't as robust as they were previously. I like that you can add multiple journals and color code them, but I can do the same using hash tag on the old. I don't know where this one is stored in the cloud, I presume the old one is iCloud. 
I'm keeping and using the older version, then forwarding the entries to the new. Needs some work.

Thanks for all that you've done till now. I like to share with you some suggestions. Well I think if you add voice recording option in the journals it would be better for some people to record their voice or record that scene to let it be registered for future flashbacks. 
There were 2 other things that made me to rate it 4 star instead of 5.
First, this app currently has some bugs which makes it to suddenly exit or cause it to display a black screen. Specially when I open my lock screen and it must go into right into Day One's application. It makes a delay or sometimes it fails to get into the app after unlocking my screen.
Second, as a user I have a good user experience or UX but I have not a good user interface or UI on mu iPhone 5s. Icons are a little smaller than normal and big camera and plus icons on main screen have used a lot of spaces caused user see and access less days.
I think navigation also needs to be revised.

Just what I need.  It's really easy to navigate and use for either quick notes (cute picture of the kids) or rambling thoughts with multiple pictures embedded.  I get to create separate journals (kids, garden, life, etc) and keep all those random thoughts separate.  And also keep the in sync between multiple devices.  I don't pay for too many apps, but this one is worth it.

Just one dam word...
   Awesome.....

I love the appearance and the polish. But more impressive is the ability to make a separate journal every month, make a PDF file at the end of the month and export it to Evernote. There too it becomes searchable. Then delete the journal  on the phone for he present month to reduce burden on phone memory and start with a fresh journal.
Organizes your thoughts beautifully and let's you search your own archives with ease!
just love it
I really enjoy to use this app, super useful and easy to use.  I enjoy to record everything in here, but the new version is still unstable, hope it will be better soon.
Cool app, use it for journaling everything!
Really like it the more I use it. Love the ability to have multiple journals in one password protected app.
It helps me to stay on track with journaling.  I wish it had features like a wordcloud or more visual timelines, so I can get some general themes.
There's still a bug or two but I love using this as opposed to writing in a book. It's more convenient for transport when it's already on my phone. Plus I love that you can incorporate pictures.

column9: Best journaling app on the App Store
column10: I have been using Day One since 2013. I've always been in love with the idea of journaling, but I've always struggled to keep up the habit - until Day One. This app is the only consistent journal I've ever kept. I have tried many other apps and always come back to this one. It's gorgeous, it's easy to use, the tagging system is excellent and it integrates seamlessly with the iPad and Mac apps. I write everything in Day One, from my daily planner to random thoughts and things I'd like to remember to long reflections and poetry. I am constantly screen shotting memorable texts and emails and saving them in my Day One. I love how it automatically adds your location so that you can see entries grouped in different places - I'm able to look back at photos and entries I've taken at certain restaurants, for example, or at my sister's house. I love being able to look back on such a beautifully presented record of my life. It was well worth the money when I purchased it the first time and I bought the upgrade without hesitation and  no regrets. The redesign is beautiful, I love the option to upload multiple photos and the lack of an iCloud sync doesn't bother me - I am sure the developers are planning to add that in the future, along with the other handful of features that didn't make it to the upgrade. In conclusion: if you are looking for a quality journaling app, your search will end here. Day One is by far the best option on the App Store.
I've been using Day One since 2012 and it exceptionally easy to use and arranges all my daily notes and photos in a beautiful organized way.

column9: An integral part of my life
column10:
Day One allows me to keep a journal that is actually useful and that I very much enjoy writing.
This app is perfect and it has improved my life like no other.
It's awesome! You should try it if you haven't.
It's great. Multiple journals, adding pictures is easy once you figure it out. Love it

Update: Will not use until iCloud sync is restored 

Apple is the only tech company I trust with my personal data. I will never trust Day One's own servers with my personal journal entries. Here's is a quote from Day One's own website about Day One sync: 

"Access to data is limited to key operational employees. These employees keep the sync service running, but are strictly prohibited from ever accessing journal data unless required for technical support or when legally required to do so."

Guess how many apple employees have access to iCloud sync? ZERO. Because Day One has proven to not prioritize security in the past and I don't trust them to not get hacked or to try to monetize our data to sell adds.
My daily companion in organizing my thought, reminding me of work and occasions and my photo repository
Finally all sync issues worked out!!

Over 200 entries. Beautifully designed, lots of font choices. Excellent ux.  These are the reasons I use it instead of Evernote. 

Needs email entry capability.
I like it

Lots of features, and I love multiple diary capability. I do wish, though, that diaries were synced between my iPad and my iPhone.  Although my devices are on the same account and I didn't have to pay twice, the diaries of one are not visible on the other.  I suspect I must be missing something, as this seems like a surprising behavior.

The old version worked perfectly until the latest update.  Not until I purchased the update did it start working properly again.  In spite of this, this is a great app and my journal entries of the last few years have settled many an argument.  I like it.

I have relearned the joy of keeping a journal and Day One has made this fun.  No longer will I be letting special memories slip into oblivion.  I have not had any issues with the current version I have.  The app has worked perfectly.

column9: I'm not a journalist, but I find this app useful & beatiful
column10:
It's like a journaling Twitter!

A very welcome addition is the multiple photos.

column9: I just paid 5 bucks for the last version..
column10: Bring back cloud support. Offer Tresorit, iCloud, and Dropbox, for starters. Developers: We've read the FAQ. Your reasons are irrelevant and you are too green to peddle such talk of secure servers, we don't even care. Be pragmatic enough to offer yours as a default, but the users demand a legitimate cloud service in addition, or you are purposely denying an option we should have, let's wake up here. We don't want your gut-truck selling overcooked dog tacos. We demand steak and lobster from established suppliers. We just want your journaling app. Stick to your strong suit and grow in years before acting like you are Tresorit

After I downloaded Version 2 because I was unable to import entries from V1 - I was at first quite upset - but the Support guys helped me out and I got back all my entries - it was a very simple process really. I now thoroughly enjoy using V2,and every thing syncs instantly on all my devices no matter which one I use. I highly recommend it. Great App to record all my daily thoughts and to store all my snip bits of information - just like the old hand written diaries. Love it!!!!!!!

column9: Won't use it unless security is added
column10: I won't use it, as there is no encryption and no security feature. Why don't you use the available providers like icloud/dropbox any more and why don't you allow private encryption? Don't want to read my journal in any newspaper.

This an app that houses our most private thoughts on a server owned by a company we know nothing about. 

The app itself is fantastically designed but I cannot understand why they disabled iCloud and Dropbox syncing. I trust Apple to keep my data safe, I don't trust these guys because I don't know anything about them.

column9: Love it and loved the old one too
column10:
Ive been using Day One for years and it is an incredible app.  So glad they added the ability to attach multiple photos to each entry.

There seems to be an issue with the Touch ID prompt at startup.  For the past 2 days, it has not prompted me for Touch ID at the lock screen.  It simply shows the numeric passcode and I have to manually select the Touch ID icon. I checked the in-app settings and though everything was properly configured, I toggled it off and on.  Unfortunately, that didn't help.  Still isn't working properly.
Been using this program for around 3 years now every day. This program just keeps getting better and better. Recommend it.

The description of day one clearly states that this purchase will allow you to sync your journal across all of your devices but this is not true. If you buy the $30 OS X version you must also purchase the iOS version in order to use the program. I feel that the description is misleading.
Good diary app

Day One basically provides everything I need from a daily journal app- it's simple, easy to use and with a nice interface. I few months ago I made the mistake of getting the Diaro App and I still regret it. I've also tried other ones but so far Day One seems to be the best

column9: This is the best journal app
column10:
I have just written my one thousandth daily journal entry using DayOne and won't be stopping anytime soon. 

It is a joy to use on the iPhone, iPad and Mac and syncs effortlessly between all devices. My only gripe is the lack of a web application. I don't always use an Apple device and would like the freedom of not being locked in to always needing an iOS or OS X device just so I can use  this app. I hear it's coming, but it's been coming for a long time now. 

On more than a few occasions the excellent search feature has helped me out quickly when needing to find out some details in one of my entries. The tag system assists here too. You can't go wrong with purchasing this app.
I've used Day One for almost two years now. It was good before but the new upgrades make it great. Hey Day One, how about video?!?
I love the ability to add photos.

Overall I like the app. In the 2.0 version I miss the ability to select the year and go directly to your entries. I also don't believe we should have paid as much as we had to after buying the original app. My fear is in another year or so, I will have to pay again for version 3.0.
Great app for keeping notes and a journal. I find that I use this app frequently. Like the synch features.
I started writing dairy again!

I have been using Day One (classic) for several years across all my devices.  Love the sync and the watch app too.  Now with Day One new version, several of the features I wanted are there.  The big one is the multiple journals.  I can now keep work and personal stuff separate.  The multi pictures and othe attachments make this app incredibly versatile.  The desktop version is a mirror of the mobile app.  My last wish - a Windows version!

column9: Still missing a few things but
column10: I've been using Day One every day for two and a half years. Big fan. I'm glad for the improvements over the last version, but would love the ability to add audio or video to entries, or (like Paper did, I don't know if they still do) to curate and print a year of entries in physical form.

In general the app is well designed and really enjoyable to use. Adding entries is simple and syncing works reasonably well.

The big downside is that the app forces you to use their cloud service alone while previous version provided multiple alternatives to choose from. This was deal breaker for me in the end and I had to switch to a different alternative.
I am new to journaling but realized from a coworker how impactful it can be. If it wasn't for Day One's great lay out I don't think I would have been able to make journaling a habit.

I rarely write review unless the app forced me to do so. But this one is truly what I want to say---if they could invest on the "printing" part of the journal by providing customers various journals books and they could print our journals just like a real journal book instead of PDF version on A4 papers !!!! That would be exciting!!! I know this need a lot effort but it will be cool if they have this feature on it!!!
The previous version had the iCloud sync option while this one replaced it with a proprietary sync where you must create a new account. Please bring back the iCloud storage.

column9: Beautiful UI but a little overpriced
column10: Great experience so far. Lovely UI. Responsive and intuitive. But it's a little pricey for what you get. a looking forward to the Publish option being released. Oh, and I'd get the Mac app but it's ridiculously expensive.

I'm really enjoying this app (and the Mac version, too). Great for capturing the flow of life and the occasional ramblings about whatever strikes my fancy. Going back and capturing the past with imported photos, too, which is more useful for reflecting and reminiscing. Kind of a personal anti-social network. Well worth the money, always enjoy supporting small software companies doing great work.

They just updated it, and didn't fix the problem where it has be be relaunched and redownloads your journal entries every single time you use the app. This WAS my go to journaling app. Now I don't even want to try it on my laptop. Why pay more if the app is still broken?

I feel silly being so enthusiastic about an app but I've been keeping a journal since 1976 so I've gone through all the methods of journaling including writing, typing, word processing, Palm devices and voice dictation to cloud Dox.  Nothing comes close to the effortless process of documenting life into DayOne.  I was even able to upload fifteen years of journaling easily as text files.

The app uses all the functionality of the iphone6 and things I never thought of.  The recent version upgrade adds functionality I didn't know I needed.  My dictation works well even with a Bluetooth headset.

Some users may have some slower performance due to the upgraded features but it's working fine on my iPhone6.

For me, a serious chronicle keeper, it has opened all new horizons.
I just love this app
I use this app all the time, it just gets better and better. Reliable and nicely designed.
Great product easy to set up and use.
Especially the ability to include multiple photos in a single post.

This is by far the best journal app, but it's pushing towards being more and more a public journaling app. For those who want to keep stuff private, be careful. This recent update was displaying photos in the day widget (which anyone who has your phone can access) without asking beforehand. Some clearer, stronger privacy controls would be appreciated.

For several years Day One has been an essential app for me.  It's all in one app for evernotes, Journal, Reviews, documenting and much more. The uses are endless.  It's powerful yet simply designed.  When the Day One 2 app came out I immediately downloaded it. So far, they have added some great new features to the app, but it's still has a few bugs and some annoying glitches.  I wouldn't hesitate to download the app though.  The team at Day One seem to be very dedicated to improving the app and I'm sure it will become seamless.

Love DayOne. Simple, quick, feature rich. Especially love the today plugin that shows photos from the past as well as the map highlighting the locations of previous entries. After using it for 3 years, amazing to see all the memories and places I've been.
I want to support Traditional Chinese!!!

Updated 3/17/16
I have had no issues with the app and use it several times a day. 
I have been using DayOne for years. I use it daily. I had no issue paying for the upgrade. I do have a problem that things are buggy. First it was the MacOS version that was causing concern, today I opened the app on my iPad and sync went crazy. I have created only one journal but now I have 7 with double the entries. I don't know what happened. 
I am glad for the ability to create a backup from the iOS version. I make sure I have a recent backup before I open the app on any other device. 
I will stick with DayOne on my iPhone until the sync settles down.
I used the classic version daily and that continues because the new features are awesome. Thanks for a great easy to use app.
It let me have a way to express myself, and have chance to review myself later. A must have app.

column9: The best journal i have used to date
column10: Good app, easy to use

Use it everyday to chronicle my work activity as a new manager. Serves as a real time recorder of mundane activities such as communication methods and messages with direct reports as well as journaling significant employee performance and/or disciplinary actions. The use of photos provide a broader narrative on subject matter. Wish there was a PC version for better access. But manages to get the job done.
Day One is a great app.
Everything is in the title.

I've been using day one for over a year. I like how you can backdate entries based on photo date stamps and write about memories of that day. I can batch write entries from previous weeks based on photos.
I have been using Day One for several years and will continue to use it as long as the company is around.

Been using Day One since it's "Classic" 1.0 inception.  Journaling daily has been an indispensable tool for me to document my life's activities, meals, happenings and periodic thoughts.  I write practically everything that's important to me into my Day One journal like my daily body weight, the meals I eat and periodic workouts.  I also record where I go/places I visit and my grocery shopping lists into the app.

It would be absolutely phenomenal if other apps like fitness apps and scales (iHealthLabs WiFi scales/FitBit workout straps) integrated with Day One Journal to record important information like body weight, body fat% and run/workout data (heart rate) at the time that they are measured.  It would also be useful if "check ins" were recorded from your iPhone when you go somewhere so that you don't have to write this by hand.  This might represent the future for journaling in the technology age.  

The new 2.0 update has been wonderful because it allows for up to 10 inline photos per entry which makes my entries look much more detailed and professional almost akin to reading a magazine.  The 2.0 update is much more robust than previous versions.  However, there are many bugs / issues that need to be addressed by the development team.  For example, some of my "most used" tags don't show up with their proper occurrence frequency/number.  I also can't flip through my journal on iPad without hitting the arrows at the bottom of the screen.  Tag management and bulk editing tags on iPad iOS needs to be implemented as well.

I use my iPad Air 2 as my primary journaling device because it's much more portable than a laptop and journaling with it is much more intimate.  Also, I take pictures of my meals with my iPad's camera that's already a part of the device.  I currently use the Logitech "LOGI" Blok protective keyboard case to type effortlessly into my journal.  I currently feel that the iPad is the best device to journal with.

Overall a 5 star app!!!!  Thanks, Day One!!!
Seriously, try listening to your users.

Had DayOne for several years now and apart from a couple of hiccups it's been a great app. The best improvement with the latest update: bulk upload of images. Hope sound files and video clips (your own) hopefully will be next. But so far: highly recommended :).

Only complaint: service is quite tardy.

I love day one and went ahead and purchased day one 2 but it won't sync with my mac with my iPad and I'm unable to sync it to my iCloud.  Unfortunately would not recommend day one 2 and instead go back to the previous day one.  Hopefully they have someone on their staff reading our reviews about this new app and they will bring back some of the features of the previous version regarding syncing and security.

Transfer between old and 2.0 works very well though. But you are forced to sign in now to their system. No iCloud Sync or Dropbox available. Very bad.
It also seems like a ripoff to charge that much for minor updates like multiple fotos.

Finger weg!
Well thought out and nicely designed. After moving to other journaling means from the first Day One, I'm now back and loving it.

I used to use the old version as a nice journaling app but with the new version I've created new Notebooks for holding misc notes which I have now used to replace Evernote. The Markdown editor is fantastic for quick and well formatted notes and for writing documentation in my tech job.

The new update is great! I was thrilled to see the option to add multiple photos to my journal pages. It was easy to merge my old version with the current one also. I write daily and add photos to every page! Love üíï
Latest updated added back the today widget customization!

If you set reminders and commit to writing one sentence each time, you'll track the rich fabric of your life and have a collection of memory joggers to allow for deeper reflection.

The app is fun and easy to use.

Needs iCloud and Dropbox option.  Still

Might go back to the previous version as it offers some of what I need. Give us the best of both Classic and 2.0!!

The synced pictures didn't  show up on the page entry  before (iPhone 5s). 

That is fixed in this release - thanks!

column9: DO NOT BUY THIS VERSION IF YOU ARE PLANNING TO USE SYNC
column10:
Once again a big FAIL! Another Update with no iCloud sync in sight.  UNACCEPTABLE!!!

As long as they continue to update their version without iCloud sync, I will continue to give them a one-star rating until they fix this issue.  I strongly urge all others to stay away from buying this app if you plan to use sync, and stay away from their Mac version too.

I've been a Day One user for several years. I've always been impressed by the design and ease of use of the app. Version 2.0 is a nice upgrade. It's gone through some growing pains with the switching to a proprietary sync service. However, support is available directly within the app, and has been helpful and responsive. I highly recommend the app.

I recently re-upgraded from Day One version 1 and I don't understand the hate. many bugs since its launch in the first week have been fixed and though there is still the occasional bug it's mostly as smooth and as user friendly as before. it's kept my confidence in the app and its developers üí™üèª
One of the few apps in the store that actually makes your life better.

column9: The latest version is not reliable
column10: I used MacJournal as my diary program for several years until it became so unreliable that I switched to Day One. I synced my files to Dropbox and never lost anything. I could even recover lost entries that had been deleted by mistake. I was happy. Now with the new version 2.0 Day One appears to go the same way as MacJournal. There is no way to recover deleted entries. Syncing occurs to a different server that does not retain older entries like Dropbox. So I thought I would convert my Day One entries into Word files that I could store on Dropbox. Well, the program crashes every time I try to export. So it appears that Day One will go the same way as MacJournal. Too bad!

column9: Please link to Fitbit in future update!! :)
column10: Works great, just wish it would link to Fitbit

This is just what I have been waiting for. Day One with a reliable Sync system. It's too new to tell but the Sync is what was missing and now it's here. The new v2 looks great as ever along with the new features. I will update this review after a few months of use. Thank you for the new Day One v2:)

I used to love this way of journaling, but now that they are forcing the use of there sync and refusing to allow Dropbox and iCloud sync, I am back to searching for a different way to journal. Thinking of just keeping my journal on a word document where I am able add pictures, my location, date, time, weather, and sync it to the iCloud and have it on all my devices. Simple answer to my dilemma. If they would keep the different sync options available, I might consider staying, but for now I will just work on transferring my journal to a document.

I really like older version of Day One, so I immediately bought version 2 when it came out.

Overall it looks nice, all of its functions, features, and slick UI. But problem is it is too unstable ‚Äî it crashes everytime, so I can't write two posts consecutively. Buggy.

So it became a stress that I use this app which was once a joy.
Good upgrade

Honestly - I am a little disappointed of the new version. I had in mind to save my day one online - it is still not possible.

Then-  the new version is unstable, ....breaks down sometimes, what before never happened!
the yellow star you can use to highlight a day, very small (before it was highlighting the whole day) ...

Positive is the fact that you can use more then 1 pic per day. But that's it....sorry

Hope there will be a free!! Update of this version.
Thanks

column9: Bring back the history notification widget!
column10: My big disappointment of this update is this the history widget is gone. That is, the notification widget shows you one month ago, one year ago, etc. That was a really essential feature for me but it is now gone. Please bring it back ASAP!

I understand the outrage from customers and I do think a half price upgrade would have been a better solution to loyal users of the old application. However, after wondering for ages what to spend my Christmas iTunes voucher on this was the perfect option. I was a long term user of the old day one version and was constantly annoyed by only being able to add one photo and only one journal available.
This is such a great app, I am in love and have been journaling more than ever. It caters for every one of my needs and not a day goes by where I'm not either writing it or looking back on memories, which I've been able to do from importing from my old journal. 
Easy to record, organise, look back on and use I LOVE IT.

My only suggestion would be to add multiple locations and dates to an entry? For example I like to record an entire weekends events in one log and I can only choose one location and date but other than that it's fab and I've recommended to all my similarly nostalgic friends and family!

I've been using day one since before they was a mac app. Have always loved the simplicity and elegance of typing in this journal. 
This upgrade takes the app far beyond the first app. I love multiple journals. The sync service is excellent. This app is still the best and it's the most used app on my phone and Mac. I wish there was an export to self hosted WordPress blogs, but I'm still completely happy with this upgrade.

column9: What direction is this headed in?
column10:
I've long enjoyed this app, but the recent upgrade to Ver 2 (which I paid for in iPhone and Mac!) takes it in a bad direction. 
Nothing is more fundamental than not losing your entries, and removal of iCloud sync took me far too close. I too am concerned about what this company is going to do with my journal entries, and they are not stepping forward to ease people's mind. It appears they will remain quiet, leave things as they are, and take advantage of those who remain. I'm looking for a replacement!!

column9: 5 star app so why am I giving 2 stars
column10:
I would have paid $4.99 for the developers to leave Day One classic alone!

So I have bought the new app to say thanks for all the years of great journaling BUT I want to stay with the classic. Could you please fix this multiple entry problem with Dropbox. It's rarely happened before (only once in 6 years) so why is it happening now?!

2.0 needs Dropbox and/or iCloud. It's a deal breaker, if not.

This app has progressively gotten worse, not better in it last several updates.  It is so slow, lagging and hanging up constantly, that it is not convenient to use for journaling.  Very disappointing considering that earlier versions ran much quicker and I used it several times per day--now I cringe when I use it once, if at all, per day.  Please bring back the old ease of use.  (I am also very disappointed that I paid for the latest update; I can see no improved features and it is slower than ever.)

Do not waste your money. I have been unable to sync with other devices since I purchased. When I contacted day one customer service they were condescending and just forwarded a link that didn't work and didn't answer back when I explained this. Two weeks on, I still can't sync and get error message saying they have a problem they are working on.  Stick to original, why fix what isn't broken!

column9: Two Steps Forward, One Step Back
column10:
I like many of the changes made to the app. My killer feature is being able to add multiple photos to a single journal entry. I've wanted this for a really long time and I'm loving it now that it's here.

On the downside, I've lost the DayOne Publish service and my wife has lost the journaling prompts. I'm hoping both features make a reappearance in a future update.

Even Microsoft came to their senses and supported other services besides OneDrive. This is a great opportunity for another software company to step in and take over the journaling space on iOS and OS X.

After having explored this new version of Day One thoroughly, I can state confidently that once private key encryption is added I'll be using this version as my everyday journal. The new features and layout tweaks improve the experience enough to justify the paid upgrade.

A little disappointed that they have removed iCloud sync. Having read up on their servers, they should be ok. Day One Sync uses Amazon servers for storage. Looking forward to the addition of private key encryption in the coming months.

Now to address a misconception. If you have purchased Day One Classic in the past it will ALWAYS be available to download in the 'Purchased' section of the App Store. Even if it is no longer available to purchase. In fact they are still releasing bug fixes for it.

column9: Great App, much better than the original. Two comments, though
column10:
I love using this app everyday, definitely worth the upgrade from the previous one. Two comments though:

I would love it if you add back the photo summary in Notification Center. I enjoyed seeing what my day was like a week, month, or year ago. 

Also, I found a weird bug, on the main list page, whenever I open the tags screen, I can no longer scroll down to the bottom of the list.
Doesn't work. Very annoying
And I'm not stupid. I just do t want to entrust my data to anyone other than apple. iCloud works and it's trusted. I'm ditching day one.

column9: No iCloud syncing kills this app
column10: No iCloud syncing kills this app for me.  What a joke. Especially when this app used to have iCloud syncing and they took it away in the new version.
Installed on IPhone 6 Plus. Imported entries from Day One Classic successfully. It crashes when entering a new entry. Uninstall, then re-install did not help.

column9: Good but needs Activity feed and iOS calendar entries import
column10:
Please consider having the ability to import activity feeds from Twitter, Facebook, and IG. 

I would also love to be able to import all my calendar entries on here. Please please please!üëçüèªüëçüèª

As a regular user for over a year, I found the classic version of Day One reliable, beautiful, and fun to use. With the iteration to Two, I experience software issues every day: frequent crashes, poetry line breaks not carrying over when copying from another document, font size peculiarities (e.g., no matter which font and size I select, when I create a quote, the text is too large). The dirty petticoats of HTML coding are showing more than they should.

Particularly annoying is losing text, sometimes large amounts, unexpectedly. There is no Undo that I can find. I now compose my journal entries in another app and then transfer them to Day One. This should not be necessary.

Of course, I enjoy the multiple photo feature. But I would happily lose it if the other serious bugs and gremlins could be eliminated. I trust the programmers are listening to their users. If not, I may have to consider a more reliable alternative.
Removing Dropbox is a deal breaker! I haven't decided if I stay with 1.x or find another solution.

column9: one step forward, two steps back
column10: Let's start with the name - Day One 2.  Really??  Is that the best ya got?  Unfortunately, the lame name of this "improved" app is only the tip of the iceberg regarding problems with the updated version.  Here's what I actually like, which there isn't that much of:  it's great having the capability of attaching more than one picture to an entry....there are simply some days or entries in which only one picture does not capture the extent of what you're trying to convey.  I also like the ease with which you can search journal entries for a key word or phrase.  I've been using this app for over 3 years now, so that search function is quite useful when looking for something I've written about in the past.  I also was able to import my entries from the original version of Day One without incident.  Now for the bad:  In short,  the app is incredibly glitchy.  It's slow.  It lags and doesn't flow as gracefully & seamlessly as the old version.   There are problems & delays when going from landscape to portrait position while dictating with the iPhone.  It crashes without warning and has lots of bugs.  It's now clunky and cumbersome where it once was sleek and efficient.  Day One Two feels more like Day One Beta, and that's certainly not a good thing.  I don't have a problem paying money for a new version of such an essential app, but I expect it to build upon the quality of previous versions, rather than getting so caught up in fairly minor improvements at the expense of overall functionality.

After using a number of journalling apps I settled on Day One some time ago. I loved the aesthetic, the quality and speed of sync. All has got better with Day One 2 - multiple photos per entry is great; the map view gives me a wonderful record of all my trips; and somehow they've made the sync even faster still. All it needs for perfection is to have the publication to web added back in, which I gather is in the works. Overall a really well thought out app.

column9: It was really fun to use until
column10: I enjoyed using this app until I found out that they have a terrible privacy policy, and will share my information with third parties. I'll pass.

It's great, does what it's supposed to, not glitchy to me. Wish it had more personalization on each page and on main journal view page, ability to pick background for each day, an emoji option for how you're feeling that day that shows up on the main page and more fonts for a 5‚≠êÔ∏è

Unlike others, I love the updated look and functionality, but no iCloud sync is foolish. In today's times, people are too trusting with their private information. Day One's UI is nice, but now I am forced to limit what I post due to this single monumental change. I understand their desire to speed things up, but some would prefer to have a choice. I choose security and the knowledge of knowing that Apple values their customers constitutional rights to privacy. 

So for now, I will remain reserved and cautious about my posts, and hope the Day One will reconsider their stance.

Once support got back to me we fixed my issue.

Reading other poor reviews it appears most have same duplicate issue I had so I'll share how I fixed it

When I merged day one 1 with day one 2 it created two journals in the new app, journal 1 had approx 4,300 entries and journal 2 had approx 1,600 entries, after checking/confirming the 1,600 entries in journal 2 existed (were duplicated) in journal 1 i simply deleted journal 2 (in settings) and voila problem fixed

It appears more than 1 journal causes some problems

Hope this helps

column9: Great update of the best iOS journaling app
column10:
Day One is the first journaling approach that actually got me to use it every single day for more than a couple weeks. Having my journals synced between the devices that are always in my pocket or in front of me makes all the difference in the world. 

I've been a daily user of Day One for a couple years ago, and this update makes it even better than it was. iPad Pro support is great, and the ability to add multiple photos to an entry makes a huge difference in the way I journal.

Most of the negative reviews around this app revolve around the removal of iCloud sync. I've found that DayOne's new sync is more reliable, and my journal is still safely backed up in multiple locations. I'm completely happy with the changeover, and I'm far more worried about my personal information and details being combed by Facebook, Amazon and Google than the developers of Day One.
It would be perfect if you make windows pc version with sync

I was a Dayone fan but not anymore. Many error with the date, dont know how touch ID work. Nobody answer my questions like before. They provide the chat support but all I get are talking to my iphone like crazy haha. However I love that the user can add more than 1 picture in 1 journal finally!

By the way I will continue support Dayone and I will wait until they give me an answer. 

With love.
Restoring from DayOne Classic is painful. The only awesome feature is multiple photos in entries.

column9: I truly love Day One, but version 2 needs work
column10:
I could live with (but not love) the backtracking in sync support for Dropbox and iCloud. But the crashes and slew of interface glitches on iPad (especially used with an external keyboard) effect me every day.

Day One 2 is still one of my favorite apps. It's still worth the money I paid for it (and more!) But it's several steps backward from the original.

Day One left big shoes to fill. I hope Day One 2 will get there eventually.

I like to maintain control of my data, and with this version, there is no support for either iCloud OR Dropbox. 

Unless I am willing to hand my data over to Day One, I can't sync my journals between my phone and my iPad. 

I wish I had done more homework before I bought.
If you do not have sufficient capacity to provideÔºåat least you can allow the user to select another store.Do not over compress the photos I uploadedÔºÅÔºÅÔºÅ

The calendar-style indexing is why I was so looking forward to this app but I like to hand write my entries.  They have more of a flow this way. Add Pencil support and I think you will have a home run app with me.

column9: Great app upgrade and now I can't use it anymore
column10:
I installed the new day one in place of day one classic. I like the features of the new version - with one exception. I can't import my old journal.

I wish it would work for me but unfortunately I had to remove it until I can figure out a workaround.

column9: No iCloud / Dropbox support is a deal breaker
column10:
I‚Äôm still trying to wrap my head around Bloom Built's decision to cut iCloud and Dropbox sync support. Did they really think that we‚Äôd all happily (and blindly) switch over to their own propriety cloud service without complaint? Sorry guys - I don‚Äôt trust you that much!

I refuse to use this new version until iCloud and Dropbox support are added back in - and if that never happens, well, I guess it‚Äôs time to move on to another app. Better yet, it will be an awesome opportunity for another developer to build an app that shines where Day One falls short.

column9: No Dropbox Sync, no full-screen compose on iPad.
column10:
While there are aesthetic improvements in this version of Day One, the fact that there are missing features feel like a step back.

1. No full-screen writing on iPad - it's very distracting to have the compose screen confined to an off-centre window on the right side. I don't need the side-bar to show up when I am trying to write.

2. No iCloud/Dropbox sync - while I understand that these two syncing services are not 100% fool-proof, I feel uncomfortable by the fact that the data is being stored on Day One servers. My data on iCloud and Dropbox are backed up periodically but in this case I would have to export my data from Day One manually. This is another place that has my data, which feels unnecessary.

I am assuming that more improvements will be coming eventually and the developers probably have their reason for the syncing options (or lack thereof) but this is just my personal review.

column9: DayOne Classic Was Perfect - I Can't Love DayOne 2
column10:
I bought DayOne Classic in early January after stumbling upon a recommendation as a must-have app. That review was spot-on. From the moment I got the app I was journaling like a fiend. The only 2 apps I have on my home screen are DayOne Classic and Camera+. I love everything about DayOne Classic, in particular the sounds, the ability to swipe vertically through the entries with sounds, the smooth scrolling through the timeline, and the publishing option, to name but a few. As far as I was concerned, this was the perfect app. My timeline looked neat: one photo and one text block per entry - just beautiful symmetry.

After a month of very happy journaling, I was quite alarmed to see that DayOne Classic was no longer available and had been replaced by DayOne 2. I wondered what on earth had been so wrong with DayOne Classic that it needed a complete overhaul. Concerned that a) I would no longer be able to use my journal if I didn‚Äôt get the new app and b) I would lose out on the 50% off price if I didn‚Äôt buy the new one immediately; I took the plunge.
 
I spent some time going through DayOne 2 without importing my entries. First impressions were not great for me. I personally have no need for multiple journals and multiple photos per entry. Life is complicated enough! One journal and one photo per entry keep things simple and aesthetically pleasing. Nevertheless I forged ahead and set everything up on DayOne 2, importing my journal. Rather miffed that I had to pay twice in the space of a month for the app, I was determined to make it work for me. Perhaps I should be more concerned about privacy but, having used DayOne sync in Classic, the removal of iCloud and Dropbox was of no concern to me.

As of this date I have moved to DayOne 2 and moved back to DayOne Classic twice. I just can‚Äôt be friends with DayOne 2 and dread the day when Classic is no longer supported. For those of us who love Classic, I‚Äôm begging Bloom Built to continue to maintain it. It was perfect for me and I can‚Äôt bring myself to use DayOne 2. Actually it feels like a betrayal of something I love. Vertical swiping through the entries (with sounds) is part of the joy of Classic.

It‚Äôs hard to quantify my dissatisfaction with DayOne 2; I don‚Äôt like the scratchy scrolling through the timeline and horizontal swiping through entries (with no sounds) just doesn‚Äôt do it for me. I‚Äôm sticking with Classic for as long as I can until I‚Äôm forced to move to 2. At that point I‚Äôll either have to make a determined effort to learn to love it or use a different journaling app altogether. I don‚Äôt want to do that ‚Äì Classic is perfect for me.
The lack of syncing options worries me. If day one disappears on day, then what?

Please, please, make it possible to turn off the horrible clich√©d pearls of wisdom, spitted by the app every time I open it!!!
I do not experience sync issues and I am  otherwise statisfied with the app.

I was happy with Classic but it started duplicating all the old entries on my phone. I naively followed the instructions on the support site about how to remove duplicates, including the instruction to uninstall and then reinstall (free). Then found Classic no longer available! I paid again for this version, was able to reinstall my several years of entries because I still had classic on iPad. Guess what? The new version crashes, is unusable and has unnecessary and useless features. I'm never going to want an Apple Watch - why has this once good app been wrecked just so that it can be used with that fatuous product? Can I have my money back?

column9: Great for storing, not for composing
column10:
Like others here I was happy to upgrade to keep DayOne alive and well, but I'm scratching my head at some of the changes.

As it stands I simply have to use another app to compose text, then upload to DayOne via the share menu. The share sheet works incredibly--my text shoots to DayOne without even opening the app. Which is good because opening the DayOne app is when the issues arise.

On my iPhone 6s Plus, switching into landscape mode to write with my bluetooth keyboard is...unpleasant. If I tap the plus sign to begin a new entry then switch into landscape mode, I am exited from the new entry back into the entries list. I then have to tap the new blank entry that was just created, then it appears on the right side of the split-view screen. I then have to tap edit before I am able to begin typing, and even then I am only given half the screen to type in. There is nothing I can tap to make the compose screen expand across the entire screen and I am forced to write in a square about 2 inches across. This was not the case in the previous version and is enough to make me compose elsewhere.

Lastly, I'd like to also add my voice to the cries for iCloud syncing. Not that I don't trust DayOne, it's simply because I trust more in iCloud's security, stability, and longevity.

column10: I have been using Dayone since first version. This new one is good but sometime it feels delay when touching menus or even typing. I've used the original Day One almost daily since 2012. I love this app and it has been an important part of documenting my life over the past few years. I have no problem supporting the devs for the work it takes to maintain and update their app. The update is worth the price IMO. The new features are great and actually useful. I also did not have a problem moving from iCloud sync to Bloom Built's proprietary sync. The new syncing works great. I migrated over 1,700 entries without any issue. The new sync is fast and reliable so far. I like the UI and find the multiple journals and multiple photos per entry to be good value adds and useful. 

I waited a few days before upgrading, considering whether to stick with the now classic version. I read a lot of reviews about people decrying the lost of iCloud sync which is mostly uninformed fear mongering. In the end, I decided to upgrade and I'm happy I did. Likely they're only going to support the Classic version for so long, it won't make sense to support two apps. As a company, they have to keep their app moving forward and progressing. That's what version 2 represents.

BUT, the removal of such a key feature as the lifetime reminders, that prompt you for recording life experiences is criminal in my book. I can live with a dedicated cloud server (although it's quirky and slow with attached photos - think Dropbox Cariusel), but an actual function that helps me write my personal history, the purpose of my purchase is hard to live with.
