column9: Doubles the price, drops critical sync services support
column10:
Instead of improving on a classic, the 2.0 release reorganizes the interface a bit and drops iCloud and Dropbox sync in favor of a Bloom Built in-house sync service. Although the Day One team dismisses customers upset by dropping iCloud and Dropbox sync as being a "fraction of a percentage" of users, it's actually a huge deal for those who desire to have choice in their sync solution.

Instead of listening to customer requests that it be added back, the team has become increasingly defensive with their customer feedback, promising vaporware features coming in the next few months that they say couldn't be done with iCloud--services that I neither need or want--and teasing future "premium" subscription options. They say that greater-than-iCloud level encryption is one of the things that's coming, but with a company the size of Bloom Built it's hard to imagine they'd wind up doing anything but folding over if the government does come calling, much like secure email company Silent Circle. 

The real nerve isn't even that this is a thinly veiled move into becoming a "software as a service" company, but that the Day One team doubled the price of the software as well. If you want me to buy your subscription service, that's one thing, but then to charge me a premium price on the app that for the same price I could get professional quality photo and vector illustration apps (that support iCloud)? It's really a stretch. 

At this point, it's hard to see this 2.0 app as anything but a money-grab ahead of the introduction of premium features that could, in fact, be supported with existing sync servjces. But instead of being limited only by my existing iCloud storage space to store images and (presumably in the future) videos, I'll have to pay Bloom Built AGAIN to have the privilege of incorporating videos in my journal. It wouldn't tax Bloom Built's servers (or their Money Bin) at all to just allow external sync options for that sort of thing.

I bought this software on both the Mac and iOS expecting the quality care of a team I've supported since 2011, but instead, I feel like I'm setting myself up for a bait and switch. I cannot recommend anyone purchase this app until iCloud/Dropbox service is restored for the combined $50 price (along with a commitment for features they reasonably CAN support). It's unfortunate that the team over there seems to have lost their way after spending two years in development.

I've used Day One since v.1. It's one of the best journaling apps available period. No other journalling app comes close to the reliability, ease of use and flexibility  DO offers. 

Everyone complaining about the price are cheapskates. It's worth twice as much! Users should be incentivized to make sure the DO team can be sustainable to continue to support the product. I'm happy to pay for such a quality product that will be storing my life's memories.

Thank you to the DO team for the great product and enduring the unfair, entitled attitudes I've seen on display on Twitter and in some of these reviews. Keep up the amazing work!

I loved Day One Classic, it was a wonderful journal/ diary app. So, when I read the reviews of Day One 2 I was dismayed to hear what others had to say like, syncing problems, transparency of data on servers, and shifting away from iCloud to name but a few. 

Obviously, I can't speak for others, but I've downloaded version 2 this morning and the syncing is superb. I can see why the owner has decided to upgrade their servers and move syncing there. We don't always appreciate there are other users who experience loss of data until we are the victims. So, well done Bloom for taking the time and expense to ensure our data is safe, and soon to be encrypted.

I'm a writer, so part of my daily routine is to throw down ideas as they come to my mind, therefore I love the multiple journals. That's why I'm giving it five stars!

column9: Frequent Crashs, same but less beautiful design
column10:
I somehow do not understand the update. 
From being number one to crashing, clumsy interface and no sync but via company server... 

So sad...
2.0 is a great update, making a solid product even more outstanding. A clever balance between simplicity and power. Well done!

The new version looks fantastic on all devices. I bought the update to support the developers right away. It's good software.

But I, too, worry about the sync options.

This is the best journaling app around, and v2 is a great upgrade. The sync is excellent. Many apps, such as Omnifocus, Things and Evernote , use their own servers for reasons of performance and data protection. Those one-star reviews are deeply unfair to a very fine app.
Like the app, hate the fact you can only sync to THEIR cloud service. Bring back iCloud and Dropbox sync!!

Contacted support weeks ago and still haven't received a reply. The removal of iCloud for syncing journal entries was a bad decision. I don't want to be forced to trust some other company with my personal info, and I'm guessing they'll be charging a monthly fee for that feature next year, like how they increased the cost by four times for this upgrade. Why else remove iCloud support? It worked well in the past and didn't cost a dime. So I've gone back to the previous version.

After using Day One for over a year I'm extremely disappointed with this release. The user is forced to use Day One's very own sync, as the dev has removed Dropbox and iCloud. I want to control over where my journal is stored. And I don't want it on Bloom's servers.

I recently downloaded the new version of Day One & while I like the app overall, there is a bug in the system. At least two of my entries just disappeared & I can't find them. It is like they were erased. This concerns me regarding all my other entries. I have been using Day One now for 2 years. Because of this problem I cannot give Day One a 5 star rating.

I've used Day One for years. Now that I can't control my data, it's time to move on.

Trust is earned, not mandated.

I refuse to have anything to do with this product until I have the option to sync through my own private service (iCloud) similar to the first version. It is wholly unacceptable that this feature was dropped from this version of the product.

I have an issue with duplicate entries that support offers no solution for beyond telling me to use Dropbox instead of what I had been using which was Day One & I Cloud. My journal is a mess because of duplicates. Day One 2 is a great piece of work but for the price I have paid for both Day one 1 & 2 I expect better support & a solution. 5 star app. 1 star support . My journal a mess!
The new photo will not sync between devices.
Rely on it daily. Latest update worth every penny. Upgrade without hesitation.

No crashes here. Confidence in Day One backup. Excellent product. wonderfully simple. Easy to use. Multiple journals. Sick of the complaining. Even at full price this app is cheap for what it delivers. 10 bucks for something you‚Äôll use for years to come! Give me a break!

Love Version 1.  Liked the additions to Version 2 ‚Äî until I discovered, after paying for the upgrade, that they‚Äôve abandoned sync through iCloud.  Wasn‚Äôt disclosed in description of the upgrade anywhere obvious.  Shame, shame, shame.  Then, when it stopped syncing between iPad and Macbook it became clear my Day One was hijacked in the name of capturing me to the Day One cloud.  Charge more.  Eliminate choice.  How is this not kidnapping in service to their self-interest, rather than my choice?  Again, shame on Day One.  I‚Äôm shifting to another app and flushing this one.

column9: Don't listen to what people say about no iCloud
column10:
Don't listen to what people say about no iCloud sync. This app is absolutely incredible. I've been using the original version for years and I didn't think it could get much better. It was my primary journal for my thru hike on the Appalachian Trail and now I enjoy going back and viewing my entries on the map feature. You can have multiple journals, view the map on your phone, formatting, to name a few. The improvements are endless. 

I honestly was hesitant at buying first because some people complained about no iCloud sync but I finally went ahead and bought it and am so glad I did. I signed up for Day One and enabled sync and within minutes both desktop and phone were updated and synced with all of my previous entries. This app is worth every penny.

The real reason they have removed Dropbox and iCloud sync is so they can charge to sync your data, Paul Mayne and his team are just in this for the cash, couldn't give a damn about the users. 
Haters, that's what he called us, tells everyone to go elsewhere and use another app. 
Bloom are now a universal joke amongst the industry.
Overall a good app. However, syncing between Mac and iPhone is not working.

column9: Update: New features, but many old ones removed
column10: Update: Day One added back missing features from the old version, so hooray! I'm comfortable giving them 5 stars now. So far, the one thing I'd like is for Day One to pull the current song from Spotify in addition to Apple Music, but I'm not holding my breath for that.

As a user of the original app, I was appalled to find that not only did I have to BUY the new app, but there's no discount for current users? So I paid for your first app and to benefit from the updates, I have to pay again and at $6.99 US?!?

Not happy with some of the new features: in the main screen if you have more than one entry for the same date, it leaves the date blank, which looks silly imo. There is no way to permanently shut off the location feature if u don't need it.

column9: Few teething problems but great support
column10: Had been using this app for a year or more before this latest version. I have had a few teething problems with the new version but the support has been fantastic.  Still feeling my way hence the 4 stars at present but seems to be fine.

column9: Poor decision to drop sync support for Dropbox
column10:
Asking users to store personal data with only their service - which does not have a proven security/privacy record is a very bad idea. Unless they add support soon, I will be looking for alternatives.

New features are useless if I don't feel my data is safe.
I really enjoy all those English fronts,but can you guys add Chinese fronts?

Love all the new capabilities of the app, but the constant crashing whenever I try to add pictures or scrub too fast has gotten beyond my nerves.  This version of Day One is a pain and not worth the asking price.  Wait till significant efforts are made to ensure the features the app work properly.

Nope
---
Honestly no iCloud/Dropbox sync, no deal. Refund. I am not gonna pay for your day one sync service which I am afraid may come later in the future updates. Too bad I bought both Mac and iOS version cuz I really liked the old day one.  
---
The day one sync is buggy and slow. And honestly I don't really trust it to be more secure than iCloud or Dropbox. The act itself of pushing users to use your sync service is suspicious.

From iPhone sync to Mac:
1.default journal sync is ok!
2.individuation journal can not sync to Mac

column9: New app seems to have BROKEN old app
column10:
Very upset customer here. I've used day one (original) for years now, so of course I bought the new version for a test drive.

They don't let you sync to Dropbox anymore - so ok, probably a nonstarter. Still, happy to pay a few bucks to the devs as long as the original app still works.

BUT

There seems to be some link between the new and old apps. Now when I open the OLD app, it re-synchs every entry over again, and makes duplicate entries. Between my wife and I, we have 4x duplications now. Deleting dupes is error prone and super time consuming. Funny enough, the new app doesn't have this issue. Of course. 

Very unhappy with the interaction between the apps. Please stop trying to be smart and give me an option to sever the link so I can go back to the old, working software and not your buggy new software that is eating my memories.

The new Day One 2 is visually less minimalistic and not that intuitive compared to the original Day One (just like the latest iPhone), but the added new features are great and I still consider Day One 2 absolutely the best journaling app for iPhone (its Mac app is great too.)

The only problem I have at this point-iCloud stopped backing up my iPhone since I downloaded Day One 2.  According to the alerts shown on my iPhone once in a while my iCloud is out of storage, even though iCloud is no longer used for Day One 2‚Äôs backup and the actual storage remaining has not changed.

Hope this issue is resolved when Day One 2 gets the next update.
Something is wrong with the update. It updated halfway, stopped, and now I can't finish the update or use the app on my iPhone. Terrible.
I will not use DO2 until they bring back iCloud/DropBox synching.
All works well. Nice to get rid of Dropbox sync

Decided to give a negative comment since the launch of v2.0.2 and suggest that Apple should pull this app off the App Store!

Nothing has improved after two updates. Still slow to respond in iPad Air and can't scroll pictures in iPhone 5s.

The team is actually overconfident to release their new version which is overpriced and buggy. They also fail to see the unique value of their app with the cloud server they could choose. They try to promote their cloud but it's incomplete due to the lack of security at this moment.

And on one hand they allow unlimited cloud storage, on the other they force all the diary to be downloaded to my small 16GB iPhone, which is a silly design.

Now Day One has totally lost their reputation. I want to love the app but can't.

I've journaled for the last year using DayOne free version on my IPad.  It has made me rethink what I can use a journal for.  The pictures add a dimension that had not even occurred to me.  I also use the tags for identifying specific thoughts or achievements and miscellaneous things that don't come every day but are interesting to track over time. They make it easy to grab an item from another app like NASA's Astronomy Picture of the Day.  When they offered the new version for a price I took a hard look at their privacy policy.  What it told me is that their business model does not include ads or selling my information.  With that in mind it was easy to decide to pay for the upgrade so they can fund their business and I can have my privacy.  I like the app a lot and also like the direction they are taking so I took the additional step of also buying their Mac version, even though I had not used it before.  The combined price still looks like a good value from where I stand.

Quite simply the best journaling app. Beautiful, simple and stable. It now supports multiple journals and multiple photos. Markdown support and ability to add many realtime features such as steps, activity, weather even music playing. And if that's not enough its simple to send almost any content from other apps to it via iOS sharesheets. Nice stable hosted syncing (which you don't have to use) with full encryption coming in 2.1.  If only all iPhone apps were made this way.

A great app absolutely ruined. I used to be able to sync it via Dropbox but that has now been removed and you are forced to sync with Day One‚Äôs own service.
That means I have to send my journal - my most private and personal data - unencrypted to a company that has no track record of keeping data safe.
Imagine if Day One‚Äôs data is hacked. Your journal and photos, tied to your name and email address, is in the hands of the bad guys. It would be grounds for blackmail.
This is a really, really bad move for Day One users. They say they‚Äôve done it because iCloud and Dropbox aren‚Äôt good enough (like they are going to be better) but it‚Äôs clearly part of a plan to start charging for syncing and/or storage
Even so, that might be down the line but RIGHT NOW if you use this app you will have to send them your journal to store unencrypted out there on the internet.
Don‚Äôt do it.

No Dropbox
No iCloud 

No 5 stars.

column9: Nice feature update but a little cluttered
column10:
Great feature packed update and well worth the money. 

The only reservation I have which prevents 5 stars is all those features comes at a significant UI cost making the app more cluttered. 

For instance I only have one journal but the UI constantly crams a journal picker everywhere in the App. And the default label "Journal" is long and creates a lot of visual noise. 

Also there are lots of inscrutable icons used since there is no room for text labels.

However I still recommend it and it's Mac counterpart as the best journaling app out there. Just wish the UI was more refined and less crammed.

column9: Great app, released before it was ready
column10:
I use this app every day, and I upgraded for the multiple journals alone.

But there are some odd choices: all sync is now Day One only, no iCloud, Dropbox, etc. Command-line tools are poorer than version 1.

I'm more than happy to pay for the upgrade, but it seems it was released before it was finished, and I don't like the proprietary-only syncing.
Loving the new features in version 2. I would give it a five star if I had a choice between sync services. Bring iCloud syncing back please.

column9: Making a great app utterly useless.
column10:
I purchased Day One 2, and I was disappointed to find out there's no sharing option for Foursquare (Swarm) anymore even though it was promised by its developers who even suggested I should buy this app for this feature. 

My second dissatisfaction has to do with the sharing for tumblr and Twitter. Previously tumbler also posted the hashtags from Day One. Now when using the Share Sheet tool only the photo get posted, none of the hashtags which makes it a real nuisance adding them manually once more. The same goes for the Twitter shares, no hashtags or metadata is exported from Day One. Only the photo and diary entry. Extremely annoying. 

So, the lack of Foursquare (Swarm) sharing, despite it being promised, and the lack of export hashtags and metadata from Day One in the Share Sheet tool makes this an huge downgrade from the previous app. Very unfortunate indeed because I really enjoyed that app and its purpose, now this has became the most unnecessary app imaginable. Writing posts and not being able to share them easily on other platforms seems like a joke. An expensive joke nevertheless. Fix these issues and I'll be a happy customer once again.
Like the multiple photos per day and linking between entries.   Eliminating sync options is highly annoying - changes my rating from 5 to 2 stars.

Great app, but assuming that a user will sync to the developer's cloud is not right. Please bring back iCloud syncing. I am staying with the previous version until then, & I'll start looking for alternatives.

Would give no stars if possible. Please listen. You must bring back drop box sync option. Your app is NOT working properly. It is crashing and sync is taking forever if it works at all. A total disaster so far. You can either give up and run for the hills with the money you've made, or you can start the long process of regaining the trust of the people who supported you in purchasing the update.
Now you are forced to make a day one account and trust them for syncing :(

I've used Day One for many years, but lack of iCloud sync and the new terms and conditions are a step too far for me so I have deleted it. I still have the classic version because I didn't transfer my data to the new app, but I won't be using it anymore because it is no longer stable and will not be updated. I can't think why the developers think their servers are more secure than Apple's. Trust is strange to define but Day One had lost mine.

column9: Bugs and issues - Need to bring back "Publish"
column10:
This was a fantastic app originally, so when "Day One.2" arrived surely it was going to be even better, unfortunately no!!! 

The Negatives:-
Sending your diary in PDF is not ideal, especially as an email attachment whilst travelling as Internet can be difficult what happened to "publish" and sending the link? People could see what music you were listening too, see on the map where you were and see your photo's in full screen, plus read all your adventures - now all gone. The PDF does not show enough info and maps and looks cold compared to seeing it on the screen as the old link allowed recipients to,  bring back the publish and link option!!!  

Had some issues with loading and date timing 10 photo's, however an update seems to have resolved this issue.

The app has bugs and problems, after the original day one classic why didn't you take the time to get it right!! The original worked too perfection and I never had a problem with uploading, syncing and publishing and it was brilliant for a daily travel blog - come guys you can do better than this!!

The Positives:
The new layout, slightly different from the old app but looks good, better in fact. 
The prospect of being able physically publish your diary into a book is fantastic but will that option be available to the UK and Europe as well?? And when??
If these problems were ironed out and publishing was brought back this would once again be one of the best travel diary/blogs on the app market. Remember it is marketed as a travel journal - internet is not always great, therefore publishing was fantastic as it meant not having to send out attachments onto email's - just one simple link! 
3 stars for now, as it needs a lot of refining to make it better than the original and to bring back some of the best stuff in the original. However as stated the first update is out and the first improvements, so hopefully in a few weeks time this will be getting the same five stars the original got and deserved. Because if they get it right this will be fantastic.

You may not know this. but no matter how good the app is, leaving your personal data all of he world on foreign servers unencrypted with your own personal private key cannot be done anymore. 

We are in the year 2016. Even if this company is honest with your data, there will never be assurance that they won't get hacked and all your private data is exposed on the Internet. 

Please help us force them to include the encryption we need to do this. 

I emailed the company with my concerns but they did not even have the courtesy to respond. 

Please rate wth one star until they include this feature.

V. 2.0.0
While I am really happy about this upgrade, I am a bit underwhelmed here. The app works fine, and I haven't run into any problems, but DARN. This app is BRIGHT. The white hurts my eyes if I stare at the screen too long, the blues contrast sharply with the whites, and the landscape on this new upgrade is... interesting, to say the least.

Features for the future would be:
- Night mode in the "Style" settings.
- Ability to choose different colors for the overall look of the app; despite me not minding the color scheme of this app, it would be nice to have less glaring colors, like beige or something.

I guess that's about it from me. It's a good app, but the colors and the brightness and the contrast hurts my eyes.

V. 2.0.1
The bug fixes are nice, but now my app crashes when reading entries now? I haven't tested it, but it looks like it crashes when reading entries from the Classic version.

And I am still waiting for that Night Mode. I have grown accustomed to the light blue set against the bright, stark white background.

Still seems a bit underwhelming as well. I understand the reason why iCloud and Dropbox were dropped, but still, it would be a neat idea to off them via IAP for $0.99 or something like that. You guys would still get revenue, and you would have people get their iCloud and Dropbox support.

V. 2.0.2

Eh, it's okay. Not as brilliant as the Classic, but the iPad app is amazing and beautiful. Just wished that there was a way to write a journal in landscape mode on the iPhone 6s + without having half the screen being used for the actual writing. Writing in portrait is quite nice though.

column9: Give me back my iCloud sync!!!
column10: I don't need another sync service!!! I don't believe your sync service for privacy concerns and you will sooner or later charge for that
I've been using Day One since early 2013 and it just keeps getting better. It's simple, yet powerful enough to make things interesting. I plan on using it for years to come.
I think the app is great. It encourages me to write, which helps me organize and clarify my thoughts. Sync is fast and reliable. Looking forward to client side encryption.

First, it took three attempts to install. 

Sync- no more Dropbox or iCloud.

column9: Something told me I shouldn't have bought
column10: No iCloud sync, their FAQs page stated there were "iCloud" issues, I never had a problem, another app that forces you to change, and pay for it.

I had been using DayOne 1 for some months and I loved it. So I decided to pay for the new update (which is pretty much almost a new app). 
I didn't know how to sync between devices since the sync option was always disabled. I contacted the support team and they helped me fast. 
Just make an account and that's it!
I am looking forward the "make a book" option that hopefully will arrive soon!

column9: Still Keep crashing even new version!!!
column10: What happen? Even the new version .... Still crash!!! Pls fix it!! Pay this apps for one week still can not use it!!!

column9: Language: Chinese English can not understand
column10: Language: Chinese English can not understand

column9: much more worse than classic version
column10:
The new version is better. Thx.
I recommend add the recording feature, which I can "say" the diary instead of type it when I was too tired to type.

Update: "New" feature of tagging with hashtags... A feature that has been in Day One Classic for a long time

Day One Classic = iCloud, Dropbox, and Day One Sync
Day One 2.0 = No syncing other than Day One sync 

Day One Classic = Ability to opt out of auto including location. Location can be added manually later
Day One 2.0 = Auto adds your location and you can not opt out. Location must be manually removed.

Why is a 2.0 version of an app taking features away at all, let alone not making it abundantly clear that features were removed BEFORE you purchase?

column9: Day One crashed after new version 2.0.2 of 2-18
column10: I am a iPad pro user, each time when I handwriting entries in Chinese, Day One app will always crashed.

I like the new way of tagging with # within the journal entry.

I‚Äôm fairly new to journaling, and Day One is making it pretty easy.  Took me a couple of minutes to find my way around, but it‚Äôs pretty intuitive.  I can see how this could be a great way to organize and my thoughts and find those thoughts in the future. 

I‚Äôm surprised by people who are worried about security. I‚Äôve read their privacy policy, and their detailed information on how Day One sync is designed, and they‚Äôre clearly serious about security.  I‚Äôm more worried about my privacy on iCloud and Dropbox.  

I had to buy the new version even though I had recently bought the old one, which is a little annoying, but it‚Äôs only $5 for something that you can use virtually forever (and the developers need to make some money to keep developing).
While I've not had any adverse issues with the proprietary sync, I'd feel more comfortable with iCloud and/or Dropbox syncing. Please bring it back as this is a 5 star app otherwise.

column9: Love it, blazing fast to transition
column10:
Installed it, and it imported from my old Day One extremely fast, for a fairly large journal. Turned on Day One sync, and installed it on my iPhone to see how fast sync really was. It synced in seconds, less time than it took to import, over cellular!

And just in case something had gone wrong in the transition, my Day One Classic entries were all still there. Love the ability to hyperlink to other entries with some simple markup, too. Great successor.

So after a lot of consideration about upgrading, I decided to do it and I wish I hadn't.

Migrating to the new version, my diary entries imported ok but half of them have moved over with photos missing. You bunch of cretins. What have you done?

Sorry this out right now.

DO NOT UPGRADE UNTIL THEY SORT THEIR MESS OUT.

I have used the Day One for more than two years. I bought this new version the first day it came out. At the beginning, I was so happy with the new features. When I imported from the Classic version, it filtered the duplicated threads that were caused by iCloud sync. That made my day. However, the iPad app crashes every time I entered the first few words. That's so annoying. Please fix it.

I am a longtime happy user of v1 of this app. I bought v2 on the Mac and iOS to support the developers, but I have not begun using v2 yet. I also am mistrustful of this decision to force a move to the developer‚Äôs propriatery sync solution. 

I appreciate that the developers are trying to do what they see as the right thing in providing a sync solution that is more reliable than iCloud used to be. iCloud sync has markedly improved in the last 18 months, however, and Apple has a team dedicated to making this platform work. They also have the deep pockets to stand up to the US Federal government on data privacy, as we are now seeing play out in the court system. A small developer, however well-intentioned, simply isn‚Äôt in the same position to do these things. 

If you need a source of ongoing revenue, as I suspect this sync play to eventually become, look to Marco Arment‚Äôs patronage model for Overcast. You have (or maybe had until this decision?) a dedicated group of fans using your product who likely would be willing to support you. As I said, I supported the developers by purchasing the new version even though I will not yet begin using it. The longer this drags out, though, the more good will is eroded and the harder it will be to reconsider this decision and select a functional business model for the future.
Buy it now. A truly amazing journaling app that gives me a safe and delightful place to compile my thoughts. Haven't had any crash or sync issues.

Having never bought the first version this "second" version is a great journal app. No issues of crashing. My only wish is being able to save favorite locations so I can re-use them. The GPS/foursquare is so inaccurate.
I made a big mistake purchasing this app. Not expected from the team of Dayone and this upgrade worth nothing for me.
cannot download photo from my iCloud account. Hope it solved soon.

If you‚Äôre intending to buy the desktop version of this app, which is expensive (will be US$60) then be aware that you need system 10.10. I made that mistake! I also believe that the content is now stored in their server - no longer in Dropbox. I actually prefer the simplicity of the original.

I really like the new look and feel and I have not had any issues with stability. I was easily able to transfer over my old entries with no issues. 

The widget for the Today pull down menu on iOS is totally worthless now. It only lets you put an entry in when before in Classic  it showed you some entries either from years prior or at random. I really like that feature and hope they add it back in.

The company has misjudged the mood with this update to a previously excellent app.

To all who can't get into their previous entries you need to install the Day One (Classic), you can find it in App Store > Purchases > Not On This iPhone/iPad. When you install and open that it will load your entries from iCloud. Once they're back in the app you can chose to sync to Day One Cloud (if you've not set up an account do so). This will get all your entries into Day One Cloud, which the new versions do the app, Day One 2, will pick up. Then just delete Day One (Classic) and off you go ...

Loved the original but disliked the limitations. This new version can have multiple photos per entry, multiple journals, has better tagging management, better layout, map view based on geolocation, and so much more. Only missing the publish to Dayone Online which they say is coming. Can still publish to social media if you want. An excellent upgrade I don't mind paying for! Same price as my wife's Starbucks drink! My migration from the old Dayone app went smooth with no problems! Great job!

I have been using the Day One classic app for more than two years and purchased the new app with lot of anticipation. This app is less intuitive than the classic and very few new features. 

One of the features missing is the ability to link an entry in another post. Day One says they are working on it.

Will someone please tell me how to get the original version back? I was extremely happy with it, but when this version was offered for a reduced rate, I bought it. Bad decision on my part. I cannot get this app to sync my two devices. It also does not show the location, nor the weather. These were features I liked. If this new app does not offer these features, then I want the old one back.

column9: Great new features - few bits to smooth out.
column10:
This version solves a lot of problems I had with the first - multiple photos and the option to add additional journals is a feature I've been looking forward to for a long time. 

I did report a bug and received a quick response so I'm very pleased with this. 

The terms of service were a bit of a concern based on other reviews but - having read them in conjunction with the privacy policy I'm not quite as worried as they appear to relate to a publishing/hosting platform. I think this is a case where DayOne would benefit from a "plain English" explanation of that particular section. 

It appears that I can still make backups (not sync) to Dropbox but I've yet to determine how to make them regular. This is important as I prefer to keep backups in several places. 

The PDF export feature seems to have suffered a little with the upgrade and multiple pictures. It doesn't look quite so attractive anymore because of the photo and text alignment. Hopefully this will be fixed soon.

I'm seeing some significant degrade on my panorama photos. Why are images so heavily compressed when synced to the server? If disk space is an issue, maybe allow user to sync to 3rd party providers eg. Dropbox?

The more I think about it, the more likely it seems that premium storage/sync is coming down the road and user will only get full res image if they subscribe indefinitely... Seems like a perfect way to monetize by locking user out of 3rd party services... (I'm saying so because developer mentioned they purposely removed 3rd party sync to provide "better" service and upcoming "features"...)

I just updated and my old journal entries have disappeared. I have one journal entry which is the canned entry from Day One.

Be aware and take precautions! I am afraid my file was overwritten.

column9: Nice UI, please never charge for sync
column10:
Looks like a nice upgrade from v. 1.  My only concern is lack of Dropbox/iCloud sync.  They say it's to enable features in the future.  Doesn't make sense to my; why can you do that via Dropbox?  My fear is that there's a plan to charge for sync service!!!
No no no no no!!!   I already pay for a hefty Dropbox.  Apple forces you to pay for iCloud to use it; can't use it via Dropbox.  I hope that Day One doesn't follow the same example, making you pay to sync your data.  That seems inevitable. :(

Very bad version! Multiple photo is the only good point if this version but when you choose your photo from library you don't see moments any more, that means you don't know the photo taken date which is so important for you write your journal. When you import from old version it repeated 3 times.  I use day one for almost 3 years now I have to go back to the old version.

column9: Love features -- app crashing after importing Classic, please add iCloud sync again
column10:
I have loved Day One for years -- and I am happy to pay money for the new version. I love the new features added in! Thank you to the developers for all their hard work. However, I feel I must give two stars because:

1) After importing classic entries from Day One Classic (v1), the app crashes when I open an entry to view it, returning me to the home screen. This happens repeatedly. NOTE: I reinstalled Day One 2 without importing old entries, and I'm able to use it to create NEW entries without crashing -- so the crashing may be connected with having imported entries from Day One Classic. I have reported this to support.

2) I'm very disappointed by the removal of iCloud sync. I feel much more secure having my data synced through iCloud. Please add it back in! If it is not re-added, I may end up just sticking with Day One Classic in the end, even though the new features (multiple journals, multiple photos per entry) look amazing.

Again, thank you to the developers for the new features. I sincerely hope you will consider re-adding iCloud sync -- that is a big deal for a lot of customers, and may be a deal breaker for me for using Day One 2.
Bought the new version about 10 minutes ago. It has crashed 4 times so far. Regret spending the money.

column9: I could not be more disappointed
column10:
I used the previous version of Day One for years. It allowed me to keep a private journal and use iCloud to keep in sync across my iPhone, iPad, and Mac.

Now Bloom Built, the company that makes Day One, has decided for me that I am to use their syncing service without the ability to use iCloud anymore. Not only that, if you read their website, apparently they're trying to turn Day One into some kind of social platform. 

What are they thinking?! This is a diary app. A place I write about things in my life that are private. The last thing I want to hear from the company that I'm entrusting my secret thoughts and feelings to is, "yeah, how about you let us keep all those diary entries on our servers for you? You might want to publish them to the web some day on the new social platform we're creating."

No thank you! Instead, I'll be looking for a new diary app and saying goodbye to Day One.

Not much difference on the front end from the old version, and if "half-price special" for the first week is $4.99, there is no way this is worth $5 (or even $10 later on) if you have the original version.
So having got the iOS version I find that the Mac version cannot be downloaded. Not a good start to using this app.

Finally multi-photos~ Without hesitation, bought this new vision immediately. I feel so good in my iPhone 6, no bugs. Hope you can always do better, give us more useful funtion. Many Chinese wish you can do a new vision with Chinese.
If you don't want to use ONE DAY's driver or register ONE DAY's account, then it is impossible for you to synchronize or backup. I cannot believe that's what I got after spending money to upgrade.

column9: Buggy and not better than the original
column10: I bought the iOS and Mac copies of this new version based on the quality of the original, but both of them crash constantly, and add no real value to the simplicity and beauty of the original. I am thoroughly displeased and intend to get a refund on both. This was not ready to come out of beta, and it is a huge disappointment.

I was delighted to get this update to Day One. I use my journal a lot since it is useful in many ways (tracking patient progress at our Adult Family Home to how to notes for quick reference later).  This update includes many useful additions but what really thrilled me was that the ability to search now takes you to the key word. Previously, the search result would only find the journal entry and not index exactly were it is at (I have a few lengthy entries and that was not nice to have to eye through the results until you manually find what you are searching for. Could export to iBooks but is redundant).  As far as crashing, the new version did initially and I think it was due to the fact that the previous version was still running. After I closed it have had no crashes. Keep up the good work!

What I like about this version: being able to add multiple photos to an entry. It was easy transferring my old entries. That's about it.

The app crashed the first time I opened it. It crashed a few more times after that. I don't like that it opens to quotes. I would prefer that it opened to my photo timeline.

I'm annoyed that I paid for the upgrade. Not that I mind paying for an upgrade, but this upgrade isn't even worth the discounted price of $4.99.

I'll hold my breath for continuous improvement. I do like this app for journaling. I was just fine with the old version. Did I say I was annoyed to have paid for the new version that doesn't offer noticeable significant upgrades.
Not worth 4.99 on sale and definitely not worth 9.99 regularly. Need to be able to use Dropbox integration.

I paid $10+ after taxes for the original day one. then I bought this during the opening special for $5+ after tax. I would be okay with this IF the creators hadn't removed the original Day  One app that I paid all that money for. I want both apps. I paid for both apps. This is why they should have either updated the old app that people already paid for or kept BOTH the original Day One and Day One 2 available. I feel seriously cheated out of the money I spent on Day One (original app). If Day One 3 comes out, I will absolutely not buy it. They need to put the old app back in the AppStore. I paid for both, I want both.

Not acceptable that Bloom Build, LLC is not offering iCloud sync as an option as part of DayOne 2.  The rationale they offer for not including iCloud sync is disingenuous.  Serious journal writer's should look for other options if Bloom Build, LLC will not add iCloud sync.

With this Update you just give all your data to some random company and you loose all control with it.
In the old version they supported iCloud, so
you data where stored there.
Don't update if you care about your privacy.

column9: I want to have their babies
column10: I adore this app - they do not sell your data at all! Long term user and this will definitely not change! Thanks for the great update guys - your hard work is clearly visible :)

column9: Nice new features, but needs refining
column10:
I bought the original Day One app literally less than two weeks before the release of Day One 2. I wish I had been given some sort of notice before buying the original app. But I paid for the update anyways because I really wanted the ability to add more than one photo. The new app is kind of glitchy. It has crashed a few times on me or become unresponsive. But I think I will soon become as smooth as the original after a few updates. 

It seems to have a bit of a problem when multiple images are added, I think that is when it glitches the most. It is also slower to respond when you touch the back button and other things. 

Overall, I think the update is worth it, but can't wait for it to become more refined.

I like the new features.  What I don't like is the constant freeze and close on my iPad.  If it worked well I would love it, but I don't.   I feel it is a waste of money.  Please fix this so we all will be happy again.

Unreliable slow platform. Although the import from V1 was easy the new app now crashes at random intervals usually when selecting past entry. How can I trust this app to store all my diary empires and photos. Bring back the old app and simply add the multiple photo feature. Get rid of the lame quotes.

I didn't mind paying $4.99 for an updated version of DayOne, which is the only journaling app I ever found that I liked.
The new version crashes very often. I was able to migrate my data for the old to new version no problem. But when I tried to edit a note that already had a photo it crashed.  Then it crashes at other random times.  It comes back to life real quick, and I don't believe I have lost any data.
I hope they fix whatever issues they're having quickly.  I emailed the developer, and I got a standard response, like thanks for letting us know - they will pass along my feedback to their product manager.

column9: Crazy Price & No Benefit of Upgrading
column10: As a user of the old version, I was surprised I had to pay full price. I paid for the app, found the things I do every day are more difficult in the new version, and then found I had to change to their sync service and still multiple photos wouldn‚Äôt sync. If I want that benefit (the only thing I was waiting for) I have to spend $27 (at half price) to upgrade the desktop app. Forget it!  Not worth upgrading.

column9: How to spoil a beautifully simple and effective app
column10: Terrible upgrade and ¬£4 for the privilege. Crashes on iPad when opening an entry on the timeline if it has a photograph attached for e.g. Never crashed before, ever. Trust in a great product lost.

column9: My everyday journaling app, but the improvement is mediocre
column10: Generally speaking I love Day One.  I have been using "Classic" for over 3 years and it has been truly great.  I expected this update to 2.0 would be very impressive, but it really hasn't been.  In the three days I have used it, it crashes almost every time.  Markdown is limited, hashtags aren't activated (though they say they are coming back).  Right now, it isn't more user friendly than the original.  I am sure Bloom will get up to speed, but right now I am disappointed in this change.

'Inspirational' quotes - no thanks.
'We own your data' - no thanks.
'You will use our choice of sync' - no thanks.
Our app will crash twice in the first 5 minutes after installing - no thanks.
It will take longer to do everything with this 'upgrade' - no thanks.
Oh, and we'd like all the existing users to feel like they must pay (a very high price for an app) by implying that their precious journals from v1 are now at risk from a lack of future support...

Really, really shoddy design, coding and behaviour from the previously uncontested leader in this app category. Like so many other reviewers here, I'll be sticking with v1 and looking for an alternative.

ÊÉ≥Èí±ÊÉ≥ÁñØ‰∫ÜÂêß
Â•âÂäùËøòÊ≤°‰π∞ÁöÑÁî®2‰ª£Â∞±Â§ü‰∫Ü

column9: Sorry I'm now not a fan
column10: The previous version was a great step up from the notebook software I used to use, however I then paid ¬£4 and got ripped off. First things first the T&C,s are a complete joke, fair enough if it was a free version but I've paid you cash for this and to be honest it makes the company  look like snoopers. It used to use Dropbox and iCloud but alas not any more I never asked to use your spying servers !!.  What ever the website says you cannot do a backup from the Mac version it just shows you where it is putting its data it's turn up to you to backup. Not happy please note again we have paid for this give us our data back !!!!

A good update to an app I use every day. I've been hanging out for multiple journals and multiple photos, and now they're both here. The developers released a bug fix update a few days after the main 2.0 release, and that fixed a whole lot of things. 

I'm hoping the ability to publish makes a comeback soon (I'm a bit mystified about why it didn't make the cut for 2.0), but I'm willing to wait. The advantage of multiple journals is worth it. 

I'm happy to pay money for the 2.0 app. Well worth it for another few years of daily use, I reckon.

I don't like the new version. I LOVE Day One, so I thought I'll support the developers and buy the new version. Ugh. The simple elegance is gone. It's like the developers fired the designers and said hey, we can do this cheaper without you. Popup windows? On and iPad? Are you kidding me? No, don't lock up my screen with a popup.

I've been using Day One for years and don't begrudge the upgrade price in general - it's a great app - but little has changed to justify the 2.0 moniker. The easy access to Markdown formatting is nice, and multiple journals and photos should have been in 1.x but it's good to have them.

Main problems with this update:
- user interface is different, but not necessarily better. Tags and stars are hidden from the default view in favour of a map view.
- battery drain is shocking, even with background app refresh turned off. Five minutes a day of journalling in my iPhone uses 10% of its battery. I could write in Drafts and export to Day One, but I really shouldn't have to.

I have been using Day One for 2 years and absolutely love my daily journaling. Decided to support the dev team for all the wonderful updates but is it too much to expect it to work?  

After install and converted over the Day One, it crashed right after launch and what a big disappointment. It's not my hardware because I'm using iPad pro. Please fix!

I'm sure that most users of version 1 will find nothing to warrant such an expensive upgrade. 

Completely underwhelmed.

Been using the classic for about 8 months and decided to buy this new one. I have to say that I do like it. Ok, there are a lot of gripes over losing iCloud and Dropbox syncing but I'm more than satisfied with the new set up. Everything passed over form the classic version pretty smoothly. There are a few bugs to sort out like, the app closing when looking at past entries and I don't find that creating a new entry per day is as easy. A help function would be good. This is still the best journal app and I would recommend buying and installing it to anyone.

While the new version has been polished quite a lot with some new features and gimmicks, it is quite poor that some other features have disappeared, such as Dropbox sync (replaced by their own cloud sync - will this remain free, or is it just the first step towards a paid service?) or the widget image preview from past entries which I really loved as a feature (and which is why I reverted back to using the first version for now). I wonder why they just didn't leave those things in?
Great app! Please do add more font choices though...

column9: Hope bugs are fixed with an update soon
column10: A bit disappointed in this new version. It crashes when I click to view a new entry. Also I liked the way the older version allowed scrolling with full page view. Am I missing something?

It is not about being stingy about five dollars.  If I pay for something, it should work and not freeze up.  I shouldn't have to keep rebooting.  It shouldn't say "sync disabled," when I used to be able to sync between my iPhone and iPad.  I understand that the developers need income, but income must come from a quality app.  Fine, Day One, you took my money, but you did not earn it.  What's sad is that this was once such a great app.

column9: Loses last entry every time I open the app
column10: I really love the classic Day One App. I also bought this to avoid missing the launch discount, and after successfully migrating my old data, every time I create a new entry, the app removes all content from my past entry. How did this app get released without proper testing?
The app freezed while typing. And after waiting, it very slow respond, i tried reinstall. And all my journals are gone. Very disappointed for a paid and famous app.

Although I love the new function, I found the the app lags and crashes a lot when I look up my previous diary. A little bit annoying. It should not happen since this is not a free app. Please amend this issue!

While there are a couple of interesting new features, in particular having more than one photo per entry which has been on my wish list, it is missing some basic stuff like Dropbox integration and markup notation, which the app description states they are working on revamping and/or including in a future revision. So basically, I get to add a few more pics to my post at the expense of paying for an app I otherwise already own but is missing key features. I'd kind of rather just sit out the beta test and use the old app until the true GA release is ready.

column9: New features nice.. Lots of crashing
column10:
I bought DayOne but never fully committed due to the "one photo" per entry dilemma. I was excited when the new DayOne was announced but was hesitant when the reviews starting coming in.

I bit the bullet and purchased the new version. However, the app crashes on my iPad Pro any time I view more than one entry.

I would change my review if some of the bugs were worked out and fixed...

So at first like many of the other reviewers I didn't like the idea of removing dropbox sync. After giving it a shot anyway I came to realize why you made the change to sync with your servers.  I do you like that I can back up the journal to my dropbox in case your servers go down or corrupt.

This app is definitely much better than the first one with all the new features that were added. Thank you so much!  Keep up the great work. The haters will be haters, but you are doing the right thing.
Was unable to sync the new version so I deleted it. Will try later if it regains the sync from the previous version. Glad I didn't upgrade the mac version.

This has the potential to be a great upgrade but I liked the initial version a lot more. The big dealbreaker for me here is the annoying inspirational quotes that you can't seem to stop.  As another reviewer wrote, I want to see my own words, not someone else's. 

Having the ability to have more than one picture is great. The ease-of-use when it comes to adding more tags is also great. But forcing me to look at Ronald Reagan and Napoleon hill quotes before I try to write something of my own is just nauseating.

Please make them stop.

column9: Absolutely better for what I use it for
column10: I simply use the app to record my experiences from day to day. I've had no issues with crashing. I'm grateful for the new features and look forward to the rest that has been promised. Couldn't be happier.

column9: Better functions but design going bad
column10: I'm a graphic designer and I loved the simplicity of DayOne version 1 which enticed me to buy it in the first place. I'm on an iPad Mini (Retina) and use it mostly in horizontal view. Unfortunately, with version 2, now the images are not stretching all the way from left to right anymore which makes it look like an amateur layout of a Kindergarden pamphlet. Especially in vertical view this is lame. Furthermore, there used to be a consistant colored top bar. Now it's black or blue at left but white at right. Too bad the feel for simplicity in design is going away. For example I love the idea to know where a certain entry had taken place, but do I really always need to see a non telling little micro cut-out of a map at the bottom of my article that looks like an advertising banner? Heck, if I really want to check out the location on a larger map, I can still tap on it. To be fair, there are some improvements and great new features, but what makes DayOne stand out is the design. Please bring back your great flat and simple look and feel and hide all gimmicks.
I was excited to upgrade and sync my older version and lost all my pictures.  A years worth of work gone.  So mad!!!!
The current version of the app lags horribly for about 20 seconds after every entry I make. I'm using the iPhone 5C. I hope this delay gets fixed in the upcoming updates.

column9: Finally, what I've been waiting for!
column10: I've been waiting for a very long time for the ability to have multiple journals and multiple pictures. Now I can truly journal the way I have longed to. Now there needs to be a non proprietary book printing option such as PDF.

The first app was great! But his is way better. The multiple journals, color scheme options, multiple in line pictures per post, and a bunch of other features are great! Totally worth the purchase. And it can only get better from here. 

My biggest issue is the constant crashing and freezing and bugs. And with the app not resuming where I last was when I need to go into another app and come back. I like that it locks when I leave the app but in the first Day One when I came back to the app and unlock it it'd still be where I last left off writing. Now it takes me back to the main screen EVERY time and that's very cumbersome.

The app is good, I won't contest that. It is the best journaling app out there and now with the new multiple diaries option it can also become something more.
The long awaited ability to add multiple pictures is nice, even though it had to be done much earlier
I don't really care about the creepy T+C about them owning my content nor about the decrease in syncing options.

What drives me berserk is that for what amounts to relatively minor incremental improvements we have been forced to pay for everything again. If it was only the mobile version I could have swallowed it with less anger, but having to pay again the Mac is preposterous.

The changes are so marginal that I considered for long time to ignore v2 and stay on the perfectly functional original version, but the fact that they also totally pulled the old one leaving us without future update virtually amounts to blackmailing

column9: I think it is worth the upgrade
column10: I don't quite get the one star reviews, I've had no issues and quite like this new version.

column9: Let us have the third party sync back please
column10:
Does any one read the privacy policy at all? It says: "you agree that we are under no obligation to delete or modify information that you have previously chosen to provide us." And note that the information includes the journal entries.

I don't trust your storage service for syncing to begin with, and now your storage service becomes the only way to sync, let alone it's under such a policy.

Please give us back the option to use third party storage services for syncing. I can live with watching the syncing carefully for anomalies and taking the risk of missing entries as your company claims to justify the removal of such option.

column9: Paid update had to come eventually
column10: App is very good for its purpose. Adding multiple photos per entry is a welcome update. The new version feels more polished than previous one. It's not groundbreaking but all the details seem nicer. I miss Dropbox sync, though.

New version is ok for new entries, but I don't see true advantages comparing to the old version. 

Reviewing old entries filtered by a tag crashes the app. I have 600+ entries. Filtered by a tag - 70+ entries. First entry opens w/o problem, 2nd - crashes the app. 10 times out of 10 on iPad Pro.

Checked the same process with old version. Works flawlessly.
It seems to be a good new app, but not for old iPhones. I have iPhone 5 16GB a the app still freezes. I have to re-open it all the time and it's annoying. I hope some update will fix it.

column9: Paid for upgrade that is a massive step backwards
column10:
Having to pay for version 2 is bad enough, but when it is such a huge step backwards I am very annoyed. The today widget in v2 is rubbish. A complete nonsense. The way to get to tags now takes longer than before, and taking the date away from the right hand side of each entry might look nice, but why is the space wasted? How pointless is that?

I‚Äôd ask for my money back if I thought I had any chance of getting it. Very poor indeed. I‚Äôd expected better from these people.

Hey, I'm fine with switching account from Dropbox/iCloud to Day One. BUT the color is so bright, so size and type of font on the interface is not friendly readable. I have to switch to Classic. And I want a refund.
Has some useful new features but also lost a few key ones. Where is Dropbox support?! And where is end to end encryption like you promised for v2.0?

I am using the old app because I cant get this stupid "new" version to import my data. First it imported part of it to a Journal1, and the rest to a Journal2. Then, it said it would delete my old data if i deleted Journal1! I just want ONE freakin journal! It also goes over and over again about fixing duplicates, yet it fixes nothing.  Fix this crap or give me my $4.99 back!

I have been using this app since 2011. I have loved it. The update is a disaster for me. When I reach the bottom the screen, any spell check suggestion becomes hidden below the tool bar. Moreover, the markdown toolbar doesn't have the cursor directional arrows any more. Also, I really miss the old sliding tool bar from version 1, with a collection of options. While I would like to use the multiple journals, I insist on backing them up to my Dropbox, which is no longer an option. Additionally, the meta data populates my entries incessantly and the css for block quotes and other styles is not to my liking, but impossible to change. I am very disappointed. I have sent them a letter, but they haven't responded. I hope these things can be fixed or the reasons for the changes better explained. I don't like being so negative, but because I loved this app so much before, I am now so upset with the changes.
It's ok, Doesn't really worth the upgrade but I guess they need some sort of revenue

Feels like this update is an excuse to move people over to a syncing service that I assume will have a 'premium' tier at some point. I would rather go through iCloud. If you are happy with the old version I would just stay there. Im going back.

Was having trouble with sync. Created my first few journal entries and none of the photos were syncing on any other device other than the iPhone that I had created the entries on. Seems to be working flawlessly now. Maybe their servers were down for a bit or something. 
Have the app on my iPhone, iPad and Mac and all are AMAZING!! 
Awesome upgrade and LOVE having multiple journals! The interface is incredible and so intuitive. 
Thanks Day One!
love One Day and looked forward to the upgrade.. however it keeps crashing.. please keep fixing this app

I had not been journaling and was excited to download Day One 2 in hopes the new version of the app would get me back into the groove. I spent about 30 minutes writing my first entry and then click on the calendar icon at the bottom of the screen. I am suddenly back at my home screen with the app icons. Strange. Go to open Day One 2 and it had crashed. Not impressed so far.

I have version 2.0.1 now hoping it would be better. I am still crashing ever night. It just crashes to the home screen. When I launch it makes me type in my password again. Sometimes things I have typed are saved, sometimes not. Please fix.

For being built "from the ground up" as they say, it's remarkable how few things have changed or improved from the original Day One. The biggest change I saw right away was an inspirational quote generator on the dashboard, which should give you an idea how underwhelming this evolution is overall. There are some decent updates to the presentation and interface, but very little has changed, and even less of that is for the better. I'm still irritated that you can't manually enter fields like weather and music, and it's odd that most of the new features seem based on product symmetry gimmicks rather than user-driven improvements. Perhaps the developer sees a demand for smartwatch/journal integration that I don't. If that sort of novelty does it for you, welcome aboard. If not, or if you're generally happy with the original Day One, there's not new much to see here, at least until they iron out the crashes and catch up the publishing end of things.

It was a little disappointing finding out that the differences between Day One Classic and Day One 2 were mostly cosmetic and arbitrary. Will give this app another star if sharing to other blogging platforms was possible, like in Day One Classic.
1 star rating, app crash when I try to read my journal. Prefer the DayOne classic. Not worth the upgrade.
I recommend to stay in the classic version. waste of money

column9: If you want to journal with a beautiful app, buy this, and ignore the complainers
column10:
I have used this app for a long time. I have paid for it again. Why? Because it is best in class. Period. That didn't change with the update. Import from classic was effortless. The workflow is identical given my use. It works and syncs great. 

Now, to speak directly to some of  the complaints. Boy, oh boy! Y'all need to take a breath!

In a hundred years I will not understand people who complain about paid updates. I like to put money in the pockets of people who do good work. If they had changed nothing and simply said they needed extra money to continue working on the app, I would have ponied up, no problem. But, they have released some new features and obviously more on the way. 

Sync? I am no more concerned about this sync service than I am any other. But, I would like if they would support the previous services sometime soon, if only so heavy sync users like myself can consolidate the number of services we use.

Anyway, I am not a power user who relies on this app for my existence. So take my review with a grain of salt. If you liked this app before and used it for, you know, journaling - pay for the new version and use it for a bit. You can go back to classic later if you prefer it.

Feels like a beta version. App crashes often, sync is buggy (had to delete & re-install on both iPhone & iPad). 
I want to like this app but it's not ready yet.
Constantly crashes, just like the other reviewers state. I even have the updated iOS. Wait for a stable version.

column9: Crashes with every change in view
column10: I have used day one for years, and recommended it to many friends.   But I must agree with swim_taxi.  Every time I change a view I get a crash.  I am happy I only upgraded one device.   I wouldn't pay for an upgrade just yet, wait until stable.

Does not have a built in option to share my ENTIRE journal with family and friends. Wanted to use as a travel blog but I don't want to have to share each entry separately- would be more user friendly if could just share my collection of journals as one. Please fix

column9: Still a great way to keep track of your day to day life
column10: Still think this is one of the best journal apps. Yes it is a shame about them dropping Dropbox or iCloud sync all together. I think they should have still left it as a option but I'm sure this will open up a lot more options. I was a little disappointed in the extra features but still worth the upgrade from classic to 2.
Very disappointing. App crashes constantly.

I used to like Day One. Been using it since June last year, both on my iPad and my iPhone. 67 entries till today.
With this PAID update, they won't sync between devices unless I sign in to store my entries on these random people's servers: not what I have in mind for my memories. So basically, I paid ¬£4 to lose an app I liked. Also, the T&C under License to Your Content DOES sound frightening. Granting the company to fully use my content?? I don't think so! At this point the "Export to PDF" feature becomes finally useful. As in, before deleting the app, that is.

This review is for the new version, second update of Day One. 
After reading several reviews of the sap after it was updated, I noticed some people were referring to the FAQ. So I jumped over there to see what they had to say about iCloud. I still don't know that I understand why they decided to go in this direction, so I sent the following note:
I've read the FAQ for sync on your new version of the app. I understand the reasons behind leaving iCloud behind,   However my experience proved to be a positive one. So please return this function to the app and let people choose which synchronization they prefer for their journaling. 
I'm not updating my desktop app have have been waiting to see where things go with the mobile app until this happens. 
Other companies are able to use Apple's iCloud without issue. With the new cost of purchasing this app, surely there are enough revenues to hire techs who can figure out what's wrong with those "thousand or so" people having issues with your previous version of iCloud sync.
For a great app that excels at quickly capturing life's random thoughts and ideas as they happen, organizing them as I go without effort.

First off, I LOVED the previous version, but I paid for the new version for the benefit of adding multiple pictures to my journal entries. 

My behavior is to journal the morning after. So for journaling about the 12th, I would journal on the morning of the 13th.  Well with the upgrade I am no longer able to create an entry for a different day. I am assuming this is a bug and will keep the older version until this is fixed.

column9: Multiple journals did it for me.
column10:
Love day one and have always wished for the ability to create multiple journals. As a writer I enjoy organizing different practice types, so I've been using a number of writing apps I didn't like quite as much, while keeping my private journal on day one. 

I think paying for this upgrade is fair, and I don't expect people to work for free. It's worth the price. 

Syncing really is pretty fast. I've had no problems with crashing, so I wonder if those who do have crashing trouble should chalk it up to user error. 

Don't care for the quotes, though. Wish I could turn them off. 

Good job, Day One 2!

That version is a lot nicer than the first app. You can add up to ten pictures per journal entry, have more than one journal and has new fun features. They need to include usage graph bar and photos in the Notification Center widget.

I love this app and don't mind paying for it. I do mind paying for software that is pretty much a beta -- and that, unfortunately, is where Day One 2 is right now.

The app crashes at launch about 50% of the time. It crashes when I change from one journal to another. It crashes when I move from one entry to another within the same journal. It crashed repeatedly when I tried adding photos. And so on.

To be fair, I've lost no data during these crashes.

Frankly: you guys should have delayed release until this app was more stable. Many updates will be necessary to get this one up to speed.

column9: Don't Upgrade Until The Bugs Are Sorted
column10:
I saw the notification inviting me to spend more money buying version 2, which I foolishly did immediately.  It should not have been released just yet - way too many bugs.
When I installed it on my iPhone and created a new journal entry, it took quite some time until I could find it in my timeline.
I then installed it on my iPad, but this took 3 times to be successful. Again I couldn't find the journal entry I had created on my iPhone and discovered that syncing had been disabled with no obvious way to enable it.
I suggest holding off purchasing the upgrade until the app is stable
I should have believed the reviews. Crashes constantly. What a dismal "upgrade"

I am not impressed by the new design, I dislike the bottom tab bar idea and it works badly. The app was also prematurely released with some old features missing and incomplete with new features not even implemented yet (client side encryption), are we releasing alpha versions in app stores now?

Why did you remove the old Day One app from the store? The Mac counterpart is a paid upgrade as well, and overpriced, probably with bad design decisions as well.

First of all, these guys have always been too dumb to create a solid, reliable sync. It took them years to make it mostly work with v.1, now they‚Äôve messed it up again. Completely. - 

And furthermore: Do you guys really think that I want my data on your untrusted no-name server inside the US?! "Access to data is limited to key operational employees. These employees keep the sync service running, but are strictly prohibited from ever accessing encrypted data unless required for technical support or when legally required to do so.‚Äú :-D Give me one reason why I should trust you, only ONE! Are you an NSA corp already or are you still waiting for their call? You are NO safe harbor for my data!

I have been using a day alone since 2012. I downloaded this new version and it keeps crashing on both my iPad and iPhone I am not impressed. The old classic was always reliable. Before an app is release especial at $7.99 au I would think the developer would have been sure that it was bug free.

Owned Day One Classic and purchased Day One 2 today.  Very disappointed.  Full of glitches! Will only attach photos on one journal (what happen to selling point of multiple journals?)  Attaching photos on other journals (ie:  Travel) shuts down the App.  Attaching photos is not as smooth as Day One Classic.  Attaching stored photos crashes the App; only photos captured in the moment gets attached to the one journal.  Attaching photos captured yesterday crashes the App.  Please fix.

column9: Great version, except no Dropbox sync
column10: The app is worth upgrading with all the newbfeatures, except they removed the Dropbox sync function for whatever reason they claim, my Dropbox sync worked just fine without any problems at all. When I upgraded to one day sync, that's when I run into sync issue and lost one day of entry...

The new version of the app has one major problem that is a no go for me: No more choice which platform you use for syncing.

Most of the users will use day one with private and intimate data. Removing the choice for different platforms hosting your data is a serious concern to my privacy rights. Having less features: I don‚Äôt care but please add the support for other sync options back into the next release.

I love the original Day One, but I haven't been able to use this one on my phone or iPad without it crashing on me. Even with a discount, it's kind of frustrating to pay for the original and then have to pay again for a dolled-up, unstable version. 

On the bright side, for someone who uses Day One religiously, I'm happy we can bulk-edit entries to reassign them to new journals quickly. Once the crashing issue is handled I get the feeling Day One 2 is going to be a big hit.
I use the map view to find nearby restaurants.  Great to see the new feature in iOS.  Multiple photos per entry is also a nice enhancement.  Well done.
Bought this app since v1.x. It is very useful to keep memories. Easy to use. Fast sync speed.
..the app has started crashing on my iPad whenever I try to view entries. Downgraded to a solid one star! Should've spent that USD4.99 on a physical diary :<

Will, DO2 is also awesome!
But please supporting Chinese.
There'r many users in China.
Thank you.

I'm loving using day one -
Since end of last year. Just bought and downloaded 2.0 and my classic journal was imported painlessly. Happy!

A very expensive update with awful T & C's
I'm looking elsewhere!
Constantly crashing on the iPad, it's so frustrating. I've contacted the developers who don't reply. Had really high hopes for this 2.0 release too.

I've been a fan from the start but this "new" version is terribly unstable.  The app constantly crashes when looking at past entries. This was not worth the 50% savings.  2 stars because they finally allowed multiple images per entry.

This is no better than the original Day One.
Cannot save to drop box.
Am going to delete it and continue using the original day one until of course they stop supporting it and then I'll find something else
The today widget is useless. We need the old one from day one classic. Now the good stuff multiple journals and multi photos per entry.
App crashes whenever I try to add photos.

column9: Great app, especially the FIRST time I bought it
column10: Day One classic changed my life in many positive ways and I still use it daily. This is why, despite some reservations, I paid for both updates. It's a bit like how I'll pay extra for an album I love even though I already subscribe to Apple Music. But I just hope Bloom understands that this kind of goodwill has its limits. I've never had to pay for an upgrade to an app I've already bought, except for absolute essentials like MS office. I'm taking it on faith that Bloom's private servers will eventually be as secure as iCloud, and that they have no ulterior motives in moving it there, like data mining or the plan to turn Day One into a subscription-based service. Either of those would cause me to ditch this app, however much I love it now.

column9: Still the best Journal App on ios üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü
column10: The icloud thing is being blown out of proportion, its not a dealbreaker... The app is still phenomenal and does everything I could ask for, thank you!

This is a great little app. It encourages writing without being intrusive at all. It's really fun to use and allows you to keep track of all kinds of things in your life. Looking back on even the last couple of weeks can be so enlightening and entertaining. Beginning an entry is as simple as tapping on the plus button. Each entry can auto add the time, weather, activity level for the day and even what music you're currently listening to. You can add multiple photos to each entry, and they display beautifully alongside each entry in the timeline view. It's best if you have the Mac app alongside this one as they stay in sync perfectly. The only issue I have with it is they removed iCloud sync and replaced it with their own syncing service. iCloud is secure and people seem to prefer it. If they bring that back it becomes a five star app. Besides that minor technicality, it's an amazing app with zero competition.

$5 for some refreshed UI and the ability to add more than 1 photo? What a ripoff! Also, now you can't sync to Dropbox or iCloud. You have to use their sync which means they own your journal. I wish I could get a refund and go back to the old version.
This is one of my favorite apps and I use it daily. Can't recommend it more highly.

There really is not anything that I don't like about the app! And there is a LOT that I love about the app. I have it on all my devices and it syncs just fine. Love the new features. 
And in the end, I'm ok paying extra for the new update. Income for the company just means that they will continue to provide a great app!

I rarely write reviews.  But my disappointment is so great with this latest version of Day One that I feel compelled to share my experience.  First, I loved the original Day One.  Rarely did I have sync or crash issues - and the one time I needed to contact customer service, I received prompt feedback and the problem was resolved with the next update (and a work-around was provided until then).  I upgraded yesterday to the new version of the app - because I didn't want to miss out on the 50% off price - and because I have been such a fan of this app.  Unfortunately I cannot give a very good recommendation on the new app.  Unlike others, my migration from the old app to the new seemed to work fine.  For me the issue is that the application crashes and closes every time I go to view a different entry.  I really don't care about the planned enhancements - or where it's stored ( I don't put anything that personal in here anyway) - but I do care if the core functionality is there and that it doesn't crash every time you look back at your journal.  Until the crashing is fixed - I can't recommend this app anymore.  I hope this wasn't just a beta version that was put out to test on early adopters - and then the price will go up when they fix the bugs.  I don't appreciate being used as a beta tester like this.
