And one last note - there is no way to turn off the irritating quotes that they now load onto my home page.  I want to see my notes and words - not someone else's.

5 bucks is short money the original App could have always been 9.99 in my opinion.
There synch is just fine and they control the operation and you save the room on your cloud favorites.
And to me you want an app like this to be around forever and I don't how many out there show that.
There is no cloud that will help if your app is just gone.

After seeing so many bad reviews I had to step in and comment on a common complaint I'm seeing in these reviews

If you use iCloud or Dropbox, then your data is being securely transmitted and stored the same way as Day One Sync. Neither iCloud, Dropbox, or Day One Sync use private key encryption currently. This is where your data is encrypted locally with a private key only known to you before it is sent to a server.

Here is an excerpt directly from Day One's website describing their plans for private-key encryption:

"In 2016, we will develop and provide full private-key encryption on the server in our 2.1 release for iOS and Mac apps by May 2016. Our encryption features will utilize the user's private key to encrypt all entries before they reach the server. In short, the server will have no access to the user's unencrypted data. Neither iCloud nor Dropbox currently provide this level of security, thus making Day One Sync even more secure than these other sync/backup methods."

Yes, it's apparent that forcing the user to use Day One Sync is paving the way to a subscription based model. Day One is pivoting because being able to sustain themselves on one-time app purchases is not a viable option as their userbase continues to grow. They're rolling their own sync because they have had problems with syncing journal data to iCloud and Dropbox. Writing their own sync engine will make it so they have more granular control making syncing more efficient and secure. Yes, this will piss off a lot of existing users but people have to realize that this is a business decision that will benefit both parties.

Bugs are inevitable especially when an app is first released or rewritten. I'm sure the developers are working hard to fix these bugs.

Keep calm and journal on people.

In this update Day One dropped support for all syncing except their home grown one. They said this was going to allow them to do cool things in the future like private key encryption (which is great, I would love to have that).  

But none of the features their custom sync engine allegedly enable are available, leaving me with a regression and now I'm trusting my data to another third party. 

I'd like to see Dropbox sync return and if they do later offer encryption I'd like to see it with Dropbox too. 1Password is able to do this; I don't see why a custom engine is needed.

I do not like the idea that I cannot sync my journal via iCloud, which was possible in DayOne  v1. I bought this update in iOS and Mac OS form for the ability to add multiple photos to a journal entry. I had no idea my syncing options were being monopolized by the journal creators. This is unacceptable. I've enjoyed using Day One, but it might be time to look for a whole new way to journal. Bring back this option now!

Well done Day One! This new update has many new features such as multiple photos per entry and multiple journals. The UI has been polished and improved, but not dramatically changed, so it feels very familiar to a long-time user. 

The upgrade is well worth the price. I had been worried about the future of this app, wondering how they might continue to make money and evolve the product. This inexpensive upgrade is a great way to move the product forward.
Lack of third party sync options is really disappointing. Will look for alternative apps.

Cannot get this version to install, may not be the author's fault.

Needs the sync options back like version 1 otherwise it would be 5 stars.

column9: Not as simple as it was before.
column10: The increased complexity destroys most of what made the app great. It used to be so simple you didn't even notice the app. Now there is more clicking and smaller click targets.  Definitely a step down from the previous version. Loss of sync options also a minus.

column9: New features sound good but app keeps crashing
column10: Avid day one user on iPad and Mac so I downloaded this to my iPad and imported my previous entries. I haven't tried making a new entry though as when reviewing or editing previous ones, the app keeps shutting down. .
Always been my favourite diary app on iPhone :) simplistic yet rich of functions! Version 2  improved substantially on its predecessor's shortcomings, definitely a must-have!
Best app if you are serious about keeping a diary, writing a journal, a travel blog or just notes. Great new features have been added. Just the best!

column9: Great App but freezes and closes
column10:
Conceptually a great app to help you jot down thoughts and feelings on any given day. It reminds me of old school journaling of 'common' ladies and gentleman of the Victorian era....it's not for the Virginia Wolf's of the modern era, but perhaps more of the Lord Grantham's who are writing about the musings of the day and age. The photo element is great to add a visual touch to journals you don't have with the written form. Also a great spot for those random photos you want to take to capture a moment but aren't quite FB/Insta worthy. 

It has a location component which is helpful if you're journaling on the go, but annoying if you're journaling at home about a past event. 

I've been playing around for about an hour, but the past couple of minutes it keeps freezing and shutting down - hopefully that gets worked out. I didnt use the first version so the dropbox sync doesnt bother me.

column9: Still keep crashing for this update
column10: It keeps crashing when I m trying to create a new journal. Plz fix it ASAP

Needs options to skip the annoying inspirational quote and set a default journal to start in. As it stands it takes far too long to open the app, select a journal, enter a pin and add a entry. The new look 'n' feel is nice but the new features are just getting in the way at the moment.

column9: Makes Journaling a Breeze. Fantastic App.
column10: I bought and downloaded the app a few days ago and couldn't be happier. It allows me to capture my moments with my camera during the day upload them to the journal at the end of my day and write about my day. I used to write in journal, I'm now converted to the app. Highly recommended for anyone interested in saving their memories. 4/5 because I've only used app for a few days, hope to write 5/5 at the end of February.
the Dropbox Function!!!!!
as subject.

column9: I love this app, extra features at the cost of some elegance
column10:
I love this App. It has been my go to app to show people that functionality and elegance are perfectly married together. 

With this update a little of that was lost. I loved how you had the full bleed image on every photo even if it's a portrait gave it that magazine feel. With this version it shows the photo in full portrait which feels allot let elegant. Also with the bolted on Google maps location at the bottom removes from that magazine style feel as well. 

I wish there was an option to turn that off and full bleed on. Just make a swipe left and right on the photos as well so you see the page looking wonderful. 

But thank you to the guys and girls to put this app together!

column9: Really wish I could use this
column10: Please bring back Dropbox sync. I trust them. I don't trust it without it. M

column9: I don't even plan to use this
column10: I purchased it simply as a screw you to the idiots complaining about having to pay for an upgrade. Software development ain't free and neither are quality apps.
I bought Day One just a few months ago and I am more than happy to pay again for this. Stellar features, great product. Props to the team behind it.
I want my money back.  Every time I try to add a photo, it shuts down. Doesn't get much buggier than that.

I assumed update #2 would fix the import issue many are having. It does not. The removal of Dropbox or iCloud is something I could look over but I'll save the headaches to come (server issues on the first day..)  and just delete it.

 I'm sure they'll eventually stop supporting the first one so its the end of the road. It's off my Mac, iPad and iPhone. 

I did try all the suggestions and emailing them. Their response is that the backup is in the wrong format. Um. You set the format on the first one. You allow importing to happen on the second. It recognizes how many and that it should be doing so but there's an error. Now the format and features YOU set is the problem but it's user error? 
What.

Love this app. Happy to support these developers that tirelessly gave us updates for 5 straight years before releasing a new, paid app. The sync engine is even backwards compatible with the old version! Unprecedented care for their users. New features are great and all, and this app has them, but keeping them in business for years to come by paying a measly few dollars a year (amortized over time) is a downright privilege.
I am going to review this app 1 star every update where Dropbox/iCloud are not included in Day One sync options. I spent $5 on an upgrade to support devs, and this is a slap in the face.
I love it, but it is crashing when I add multiple pictures.

$5 extra bucks (though I think it's usually $10!) for just a few more (hardly game-changing) features is ridiculous. If anything, these should've been made as a free update to the original app... If you use the original app, I'd say keep your money and stick to that because this app crashes way too much, too. Hardly useable. Wouldn't even be worth it if it was.

column9: Say goodbye to your privacy for a couple of new features
column10:
I really like Day One, I journal every day with it. The feature I've really been dying for most is uploading multiple pictures in one entry and now that works great. 

However, that's the only feature that is of any real note able difference. The design has changed slightly, I'm sure I'll appreciate extra journals as time goes on but even at half price, it's far too expensive. Especially considering there are other journaling apps that do almost the exact same for a lot less. 

The Mac app is ridiculously expensive as well. Even as an every day user, I can't justify spending ¬£20, on what's essentially the default Notes app can do - and that's free. 

My other gripe as well is the fact that there terms and conditions state they can use your content as they wish. Using this as a personal journal, it's quite frankly ludicrous. I'm having to go back through my entire journal and edit snippets to protect other people's privacy - even though they no doubt keep backups of multiple versions so it doesn't hugely matter anyway - just in the of case something might get publicised and it kind of then defeats the personal aspect of journaling. 

I'm not sure why you can't attach videos in your entries either. I'm guessing it's because you can export entries to PDF but why not omit they video or choose a thumbnail for it so it's gets treated like a photo once it's exported? This seems like such a wasted feature. 

Besides these gripes, the app itself is actually very good and works well. I've only had one crash and considering I downloaded it on day one... excuse the pun, it's a welcome bonus that developers are actually testing their apps decently enough, something which is becoming a dying art nowadays. If you're coming from the original Day One app, content migrates to the new app very quickly and looks just how you remember them. 

Maybe my review is harsh but throwing away your privacy on a very personal app is a bitter pill to swallow. Are they selling these things to other companies so they can use it for data? Why do they need access to the content and why? Also, what's stopping anyone from hacking their servers and getting other people's private information that they've disclosed too? I'm sure users that have used Day One regularly for years will be more upset than me, I've only been using it for a couple of months so I guess I consider myself lucky that it's not years of data and personal information I've signed away, unknowingly, when I downloaded this app at first. 

Unless they change their T&C's regarding this, I will always rate this app one star. It might be unjust but I'm sick of companies stealing what should be personal to us. It's unnecessary and without giving you disclosure of this to begin with, it's deceptive and devious. 

Here's a personal journaling app that we've made for YOU! Want perceived security? With our lock feature, no-one will read your personal information without your code!

.... (any information you disclose in this app is for our personal use and we can use it in whatever way we want, we may sell this information and profit off of your lack of actual privacy. also we'll charge you a premium for it and not tell you up front about any of this :) )
Great app. I used the first one and enjoying #2

So far, the new version won't pick up and show location or weather in entries on my iPad Air. It has frozen on me twice and simply quit working and disappeared suddenly twice. Less screen space is devoted to your written entry and more to the menus than the previous version, which is not a plus. The app is supposed to be about your journal entry, not menus. Even so, other menu items are tiny and at the bottom of the entry and you have to click on three dots for "more." I can't see any improvement and the new version appears to be very unstable.

I downloaded the update thinking it would solve the location/weather problem, but no. It still can't capture that data. And now they have renamed it to Day One. If you are still using the "classic" version, like me, waiting for the new one to get fixed, how are you going to be able to tell which is which? They look exactly alike now.
Love the new version, looks better and the ability to add multiple photos is great, but even after transferring from the old one am still randomly losing entries, appearing blank and with no content.

I like the update but I‚Äôm not happy about the sync. Ive read the reasons behind moving from iCloud - fair enough. Unfortunately, i will have to move away from Day One. In fact, I‚Äôm moving back to locally stored notes that ill back up manually i suppose‚Ä¶ I can‚Äôt have data like this with another company‚Ä¶ I might reconsider when end to end encryption gets implemented but even then not having it ready is not good.

Dropping the iCloud and Dropbox syncing options seems like a bad idea. The only option is the Day One sync. Right now, February 2016, this function is free, but it could easily become a subscription service which I suspect is their plan. 

In general still a beautiful way to journal but with a few hiccups. When I synced my old journal with the new one I got hundreds of duplicate entries and photos. I went through and manually deleted all of them, but it was a pain. When scrolling through my list of entries there is a jerkiness. It is not a smooth scroll on my iPhone 6 Plus. Also I have had the screen freeze up when editing so that no buttons are responsive. I would have expected better from a two-year effort.

You can indeed add up to 10 pictures to a journal entry, something that's been available in most other journaling apps for years. The other biggie is multiple journals, yet another thing that is been available on competing apps for years. 

Change is always hard. It will be interesting to see how this all plays out.

Added 2/9/16- Just dropped a star to 2 stars. A new "feature" must be the half screen landscape mode on the iPhone. So now you have exactly the same amount of real estate to write on in landscape than in portrait. Why did they even bother with landscape. Why do they have those huge camera and plus icons? All the other icons are minuscule.

Second, when you leave the app after editing and then come back to it by tapping the icon you briefly see the page you were editing before the security page. Why are you seeing a page from your private journal BEFORE the security screen? Anybody who wanted to look at your journal would see this page.  I think I will join the crowd that is going back to DO Classic.
I've loved the version one which makes journaling really easy and quick. Now with the added features to this version 2, it makes my journaling experience so much better!

column9: Five stars for the new Day One
column10:
See a lot of grumbling from users complaining about lack of iCloud and Dropbox sync.  Once DayOne sync also includes private key encryption (coming soon) I'll guess most of the negative reviews will cease.

Great job DayOne programmers, love the multi journal, improved photo features, etc.

This app works perfectly for me. The original was great and this seems much improved. I love the extra chance to support the developers too. I was going to give dock it a couple stars for not having Dropbox sync, but i see that it's coming soon so I'm happy! I always want my data to be liberated in case I change my mind.
I hope I can still use iCloud to sync it.

column9: It's Ok but not really an improvement over Classic
column10:
I really liked the first version. I was excited for the update. But little seemed to change to bring it up to date. At least I can pick and edit multiple entries and add multiple photos.

This markup language is ridiculous. I do not understand why it doesn't show what things look like live in edit mode. I'm keeping a journal not wanting to edit code. I want to pick bold and see bold while I'm typing like any other app in this century would do. 
No way to write or draw. I was really hoping to see this as I like to write entries manually at times. Oh well maybe I will just use Notability for everything.

So far it's a bit glitchy and I regret removing the old version too soon. Now I can't go back.
I should have read the reviews about not syncing via iCloud anymore. I'm going back to the older version.

Well it is in the app description 
BUT
No icloud sync anymore could be an privacy problem for some user.
please bring back the classic version design elements.

This app, Day one 2 is a great update to its classic version. I highly appreciate the nice UI and the brand new features. But the app crashes quite often, especially when I look back at the older entries.

column9: Unencrypted with no iCloud or Dropbox
column10:
Cannot use iCloud. Apple and Dropbox dedicate millions of dollars a year to continued data security. 

I don't trust a developer who removes this reasonably-secure method for their own unencrypted-in-transit platform, all under the guise of "stability." I never once had a problem with iCloud sync. 

Without end-to-end encryption, any nosy high school kid with a packet sniffer can see what I write in my journal. 

Requesting a refund. Bring back the option for iCloud and I'll purchase it again.
Beautifully redesigned. Still the same great features of Day One, but with some upgraded features. It still retains its simplicity while being even more functional. Highly recommend!

I've been using DayOne since 2011, and this is by far the greatest improvement to the app. A great service becomes even greater. 

For the negative comments about iCloud, it is specifically the limitations of the Apple service that means iCloud had to be dropped. I trust a custom-built service over the generic Apple iCloud.

column9: Great app with some space for improvements
column10:
Personally I don‚Äôt understand these negative reviews here. Right, there were some photo sync delays mostly in few hours after version 2 was released. Well, it was most probably caused by so many people syncing their old journals at the same moment. After while everything worked very smoothly.

Data encryption remains the same problem as it was in previous version, now it is only highlighted due to lack of dropbox/icloud sync. I would like to have the option to choose the sync platform as well, I agree. But I‚Äôm hoping (and I trust Bloom) the version 2.1 will be data security focused patch

I will continue with the last complain I have and it is map layout on iPad. I think it should use more space that iPad offers..

All others are only improvements and features you will love to use. Multiple journals are absolutely great!. Personally I don‚Äôt care to attach more than 1 photo but if you do, you‚Äôll be satisfied. Filtering by metadata is awesome! Maps on iPhone are awesome! UI remains simple and nice looking - awesome!

Do you journal? There is no better way than start with Day One 2! Once data is encrypted - I‚Äôll gladly change the rate to full 5 stars. Right now I is like 4,5 / 5.

column9: Can't refund if you don't like it
column10: The app is nothing special. I made a mistake and bought the wrong journaling up and wasn't able to get my money back.
Why no sync on our own! No Dropbox or iCloud sync!!! That's just wrong!

Day One is a part of my everyday life and I absolutely love it.
Big thank you to the developers.

I like the feature set and it's a good upgrade from the first version.  However, the syncing is still somewhat flakey.  I tend to make entries on my iPhone and then sync the iPad.  However, on the iPad Pro, most of the time the sync duplicates entries.  One version of the entry will have the pictures and the other version has no photos.  Even worse, the most recent sync was botch in such a way that when I click on an entry that has been imported, the app closes.

By removing iCloud sync, and asking users to create yet another login/password in yet another service, this app has lost me as a customer for now. I'm tired of creating new logins. (I wouldn't mind storing data on their servers, as their described  security appears very robust). Perhaps they should support Facebook or Google login? My journaling needs are simple, so I'm switching to Notes.app that comes with the OS and syncs between Mac/iOS! I wish the app creators luck, and I would happily re-evaluate the app if they eliminated the need for a new service's username/password.

The iOS and OS X apps don't publish anymore and don't have iCloud support. They are planning to add it to this version but haven't yet. It's a nice app but a huge step backwards for sharing until they update.

I think this app is now better overall. I was always frustrated by the lack of multiple photos. That is now fixed.

I LOVE the option to finally have multiple journals.

I agree with others that the PDF export isn't as good now because the photos are smaller, however they are still plenty big. 

Within the journal clicking the photo enlarges it, that part I find annoying is the geotag box at the bottom of the photo that is always in the way and distracts from the photo.

I am very frustrated by the lack of cloud/dropbox support, however their own sync seems to work well. I do not rely on web based storage for my backups, just sync. I always backup to PDF.

So far I like the new version, but I am glad I got it for 50% off. Would hate to pay full price for this app.

A few minor improvements and bring back options for sync and this app will be 5 stars. Still the best journal app out there.

The new version is sluggish and buggy. The UI takes some getting used to it and is not as clean and elegant as the earlier version. The app tends to freeze when I start a new entry, and the sync is not always reliable. I agree with some of reviewers arguing that the price is not justified. I find it odd that images cannot be viewed enlarged, as was the case with the earlier all. All in all I am not terribly impressed.

column9: No iCloud Sync is a dealbreaker
column10:
One star for nostalgia
One star for a good job on this one
One star for it being an essential app that continues to be well executed.... Except....
Simply cannot condone the lack of iCloud sync. Won't trust anyone else, especially withdraws this personal and sensitive. So I purchased this to support the developers.

But still hoping strongly that they reconsider iCloud sync.

I was an avid user of the origins DayOne. When 2.0 was announced, I didn't hesitate to buy it. It's a beautiful app, feature rich with lots of great improvements. For journaling this app just works. I have used it for years and have no plans to stop anytime soon. 

I was hesitant to switch to 2.0 because of the syncing issue. I had used Dropbox syncing for years and it generally worked ok. That said, the DayOne sync is a vast improvement. No more lags and glitches like I had with both the Dropbox and iCloud syncing. I do understand the concern re: data privacy, but my understanding is that the DayOne sync is using the same security methods as Dropbox, so I don't really see a difference there. In addition, once they are able to get encryption out there with v2.1, DayOne 2 is going to be MORE secure than iCloud and Dropbox. Their syncing service is the foundation for giving people encryption, which is what folks have been requesting for years! 

I'm happy with the new syncing method and will be even happier when they release 2.1 with encryption. I know they are getting a lot of criticism for dropping Dropbox and iCloud syncing, but they are also ultimately giving people what they want - a way to make your journal truly private. 

Overall, this is a great app. It's one of the few I recommend to people as a "must buy" and it's the only app I have gifted to a number of friends and family (this actually makes a great present for people. It's the modern version of buying someone a beautiful journal).
I adore this app journal and impressed by their new elegant look. Job well done guys .
The app looks nice, but without synchronization (Dropbox or iCloud) as it was in previous version, it is useless :-(
Just uppgraderad from day one to day one 2 and the new app is great on iphone. Easy to import and  the new design, features with multiple journals and photos is very good. üëç

One minor irritating trait. Every entry you create and export as a PDF is tagged at the bottom 'created with day one' which I find insufferably twee. I am not your marketing vehicle.

Furthermore, the 2.0 version offers no compelling reason to abandon the 1.0 version, and removes the choice of iCloud and Dropbox sync. Instead we are to use their own servers, but as I can't find anything about what they want to do with our data, or what could happen to it if Day One sold itself or went bankrupt, I would rather NOT trust it to keep my private life out of the ad-driven economy.

The good? It uses markdown, so I can export basic text into another markdown app like Ulysses. The bad? So far as I can tell, when you do so you export only text, not dates or tags. But of course the only reason to use a program like Day One 2.0 is so that I can use tags, dates, etc.
Automatic upgrade for me without reading the features/changes. So happy I found the original classic app. Looking forward to using v2!
This looks like they've gone backwards very scrappy

What happened to all those features I loved from the previous version. There's no statistics in the today widget. No way to control the today widget. Thanks for multiple photos per entry. Sync is messed up. Please include those awesome old features and settings. Definitely a downgrade from Day One original

column9: Decent Upgrade but not sure about sync storage ...
column10: Was a little worried when I saw my favourite journaling program come out with a major update. I do find the menu's are easier to see & use and I do like the multiple picture option. I've been using Dropbox as my sync method for many years so was concerned that I have no choice but to use your storage option ... Not going to lie, not sure I trust you (yet) with this type of data. Thanks for your hard work!

I agree with ALL the posters about removing iCloud & Dropbox sync. I also 200% agree with Tylerjohnb regarding having to repurchase the app. This is really not cool. It seems folks that have been purchased this app believed in it enough to fork over $25 plus for it so why in the world would you make them do it again. I really hope in the future this will not repeat. If it does, you will lose me as a customer. 

The app itself delivered on almost all its promises. So continue working on it to deliver it. I took a star off for price and sync options.
One-Star without Cloud Support. I've used this app since it first came out. Now you're forcing me to use your sync service. This needs iCloud and Dropbox Support again.

I was unsure if this upgrade would make any real difference to my daily use of my favourite app apart from some UI enhancements. It‚Äôs turned out to be a fantastic upgrade. I am now using multiple journals and the ease of moving existing entries to a new journal is impressive. Switching between journals is fluid. Syncing is reliable and fast as promised (those complaining about the lack of iCloud sync are misguided).  Multiple images per entry is a very welcome improvement too. Overall, this upgrade is well worth the upgrade fee.
Don't use the Day One Sync until it's fixed.

I really love the new version of DayOne. I love the multiple journals and photos. I don't find using a third party sync a problem. DayOne is in the business of creating a diary app, they have a strong motivation to protect and not access our data. 

I don't think this is goodbye DayOne. I'm excited to see more features.

The app has a lot of great features, but I'd like to be able to type an entry at full length when in landscape.  I have a Bluetooth keyboard and part of journaling is to be free from distractions.  I don't need to see my calendar or other things while I am typing an entry.  There should at least be an option to go full screen.
iCloud is much more trustworthy than a third party vendor who could sell it easily or mine my life. I already have that enough with Facebook and Google. Don't do it here too.

column9: Not worth it, switching to Evernote
column10: This is such a scam, remove old version from the App Store and force people to pay for the new version. Common!!

column9: Not yet five but still a great app.
column10: I have been using the now Day One Classic for sometime. I liked it but was always kind of disappointed that you had to make multiple entries when putting in pictures or make a collage to put them in one. Now in this New version you can put multiple pictures in one entry, awesome! Also you can make multiple journals which is great, too. I really can't wait to see what else they come up with. To the Developers keep it up. If you liked the Original you'll love this app.

Never thought I'd journal but I read some articles discussing benefits of it and then I see this in the App Store for only 5 bucks! I didn't have version one so I complain about the syncing but so far I absolutely love this app and it has definitely helped me make journaling habitual

column9: Take care of your previous users!!
column10: This is by far a better app. It's the app that we've been waiting for with all of the improvements that we wanted,miso thank you very much for that. Now why in the world would you make your customers buy a new app? Not cool. Raise the price if you need more money, but do something for the people who have been with you since you started. Still the best journal app out there, just need to work on the customer service.
Crash all the time in 5S.

It's a shame the creators of the app dropped support for sync via iCloud and Dropbox... This was one of my favourite features due to the security that these platforms provide - hopefully they bring it back!

column9: GUI isn't as useful, prefer iCloud sync
column10: The GUI doesn't present information as simply and as visibly as the Classic version.  Much like Coke Classic, tinkering doesn't alway result in improvements.  The Map and other details generates a "pop-up" - the gentle raise the footer and show the information was a less intrusive approach that could lead to a "force touch" for the detail page.  And iCloud - I specifically did not use DropBox, because I'd prefer limiting the companies having my private data, in my case, Apple.  I'll shelf the new version (bought it partly to take advantage of the sale price) but until the public pressure leads to iCloud sync and the GUI is improved (and hashtags are supported again), I'm staying with the better Classic version.

I have been using Day One for a while and love the way it works especially syncing with icloud. I downloaded the new Day One 2 and like the new features but hate that I can't use icloud to sync. To take away my choice of how I want to sync is not good and I will not use the new Day One 2 until icloud sync is restored!

This app is great thank you..
I don't know why people are saying cloud sync is needed. You just need to create an account then log in works great after that all my devices are synced together it's just not ICloud, but who cares either way it works through the day one server.
No more option to sync via iCloud, have to sign up for account now...perhaps will charge down the road...I want my $5 back.

One of the primary reasons I stayed with day one 'classic' over other apps that had multiple photo option, quick geolocation, and even suggestive entry topics, was that Day One allowed me to sync via Dropbox. 

While the new version looks awesome, you only have Your own cloud server, Day One Sync. This forces consumers to sign up to your server and I truly believe the choice should lie with the consumer to be able to use whichever they please, day one sync Dropbox or iCloud. 

Hope the developers put Dropbox back. Until then, I am forever hating this app. It turns it to be a ridiculously expensive purchase for just being able to put multiple photos (finally) in my entries.

The other day I needed tech support, because I thought all of my journal entries were lost. Being a weekend, I thought I would have to wait, but within minutes of my query, Dallas responded! He walked me through a solution and I was back to journaling in no time, with all my files intact.

That impressed me enough to update to the newest version, which I'm glad I did because it offers more bells and whistles than the original version and works exactly the same, so I didn't have to re-train myself at all.

Day One is a wonderful journaling app.!

I am a Day One daily user, love Day One classic, and really wanted to love this version. Shelled out $25 for this and the OSX version immediately upon hearing of the update, and after a few days am completely underwhelmed. The design feels clunky, cluttered, and unfinished. The writing environment and new way of attaching pictures is inefficient and distracting. No reduced pricing for existing users is a bummer too (launch sale isn't rewarding to loyal users). I'm going to be asking for my money back and returning to the classic version.

column9: Fantastic Update to an Incredible App
column10:
I‚Äôve been using both the iOS and Mac versions of Day One, for over two years now and love it. This new version, adds some exciting new features and is a major upgrade, in my opinion. The UI is smooth and beautiful to look at, it allows you to have multiple journals, with different names and colors and also adds the ability, to have up to ten photographs, in each journal entry.

My journal is quite large and I didn't have any issues with syncing it, from the now classic version. It took less than a minute and after looking through the journal, everything was there, just like the original. I knew I wouldn‚Äôt have a problem, because I've been using their sync service, since they released it, back in May, of 2015. I too, use iCloud, Dropbox, Google Drive as well as a few others, but can honestly say, that after switching to their own sync service, haven't had a single issue.

I don‚Äôt understand why all the negative reviews, for dropping other sync services or having to pay, for the new version. I trust them completely and I‚Äôm not concerned about security issues, any more than I am, with another service. As far as having to pay for the new version, Bloom Built, released 40 updates to the original version, in the last 5 years and never once, charged you for it. I think you got your money‚Äôs worth.

Has everyone forgotten about CD‚Äôs and DVD‚Äôs and how we used to get our software. It came on physical media and when a company, put out an update, we had to pay for it. In todays world, people have gotten greedy and always want something for nothing. They think that once they buy software, they are entitled to free updates, for life, well that‚Äôs not how it works. What if you were in their shoes and the company you worked for, gave your product away, for free. You wouldn‚Äôt get paid, couldn‚Äôt feed your family and your company wouldn‚Äôt be in business, very long. So stop complaining.

Day One 2, is an incredible update, to an already top notch app and I recommend it to everyone. It‚Äôs worth every penny, is a joy to use and the sync service works great. Now I‚Äôm going to go buy, the Mac version.

FAKE 5 STAR REVIEWS?

Rating: 1 Star for destroying what was good.

Why are there so many 5-star fanboy reviews by supposed App Store accounts like "abcdefg12345" or other gobbledygook names? Are these sock puppet reviews?

Anyway, the key thing to know is that Day One 2 is only promising some kind of encryption someday in the future, but it has claimed that was in the works for at least 4 years now. Why think they will they will finally get around to it?

Just as horrible, it has killed off iCloud and Dropbox sync.

Why are they punishing the users like this and then trying to charge a fee for the abuse?

It's already to late I bought the app as some as I saw it without reading the reviews. They took iCloud sync away. Apple encryptions they're servers end to and with out creating a back door. Bloom states that only a few people in their company and law enforcement can look at it. Nope I'll pass.

No. No. No. Function creep. Gilding the lily. Curtailing our privacy protections by forcing us to stop using a large, stable cloud service with a proven security record. A huge part of personal cyber-security is controlling data sprawl. You don't shunt your most personal information to a tiny speck of a cloud startup. Worst of all, your nebulous assurances that you will continue to permanently support the elegantly simple original application, including iCloud Synch, means I am finished. I have made my last Day One Entry. Disappointed. And I have learned a lesson: don't count on ANY permanence with digital legacy apps. Someone in a cubicle can whisk it away with nary a thought.

The long awaited sequel is here and I'm glad to say that it is every bit as expected and then some. It builds tremendously on the original and makes a bold attempt to take journaling to transcendental heights.

Now waiting for the web version which I'm hoping would prove to be the icing on the cake.

column9: Great update for already the best Journal
column10:
I've given it five stars despite a few minor hiccups. Knowing the excellent support from the developers I've had over the years I've been using this app it will be sorted soon. My problems are probably caused by the very slow download speeds and the second generation iPad I'm using. The desktop version is great and unlike other comments there have been no sync. Problems.

I've been using this app. every day for over three years and love the clean uncluttered u.i. It is by far the best journal for the Mac.

column9: Fix bug and this will be five stars
column10: When you tap some synced photos in some newly added journals, the app will crash on my iPhone 6. I guess it has something to do with the Live Photos in iPhone 6s because I uploaded those photos with my iPhone 6s.
It's telling me I have ZERO entries even though I have a ton! Also deleted a couple of my posts in a real glitchy way. Other than that I like the new design.

I use Day One every day and like many others was looking forward to the upgrade but, like others, am disappointed. Aside from the non-options w/ syncing I hate the jumbled photo layout and difficulty of finding photo dates to add to entries already posted, miss the larger pics for the starred days, miss the yellow date numbers for those same starred days and lots of other thIngs. Plus it's perpetually trying to upload and download data. So glad I didn't delete the original version and am hoping for improvements and the return of some of those old features w/ an update or two.

column9: A little sad at first that I'd have to pay once again but it finally has the features I want!
column10:
Was slightly sad initially as I purchased the originally Day One app only about 2 months ago. Bought the app to see the new features and play around with them. I'll probably keep it, but it still feels like the old Day One (the changes are largely underlying and subtle).

Docked two star for having to pay again (the app ain't cheap) but overall recommended for any new users!

This app is a fantastic journaling tool and the upgrade was definitely worth it. 

The concerns others have voiced about lack of iCloud sync are simply bogus.  I had similar concerns about privacy and reliability etc.  But those who have written negative reviews haven't read the FAQs and info provided by the developer.  Under new sync, it's fully encrypted and inaccessible by their staff. It's all on Amazon s3.  This is as good as it gets and frankly there have been persistent issues and frustrations with sync on iCloud for many apps so this really isn't a big deal.  And the developer was clear they did it to facilitate capability that wasn't available with iCloud and Dropbox sync.  

I'm very pleased with the new functionality and want this developer to succeed so they can continue to improve an already awesome app.

Very nice improvements over prior version like multiple pics on entries and multiple journals. 

Looking forward to promised enhancements  like IFTTT integration.
The new improved features are what I was waiting for ....but it keeps on crashing on lot ..plz fix it ! Just a suggestion ..how about code for every journal ,than one fr all ?

The previous version was great. I can't really tell how this version works since the upgrade was sort of sloppy.

The new versions only seems to support day one sync. Since I was using Dropbox sync, the new version is basically empty. Sort of a disappointment. 

I guess I could figure out using day one sync, but honestly for security, etc I would rather stick with something that I already trust like iCloud or Dropbox. 

Anyway. I own the app, but basically can't use it yet. It might be great, but I can't tell. After all the hype about this app, it is pretty disappointing how weak the upgrade path is.

column9: Multiple journals, and their sync service is fine‚Ä¶ everyone relax please
column10: I discovered Day One 5 years ago and have been longing for multiple journals ever since‚Ä¶ and now finally it is here!  I was using this app not as a personal journal but keeping work-related notes.  It was invaluable for staying organized.  I longed to use it as a personal journal, but needed it more for work and was unwilling to mix private and professional.  I‚Äôd previously synced through iCloud and then Dropbox (the latter seemed to work faster and more reliably, as I was getting some iCloud syncing glitches in my calendar and notes, too; Dropbox just works).  When Day One unveiled their own sync service, which as I understand it is located on Amazon‚Äôs secure servers, I changed over and have been very happy with it.  No issues at all so far; everything syncs instantly and nothing has gone missing.  I read all the mixed reviews for version 2 before I purchased, but I have no qualms about using Day One‚Äôs sync service.

column9: Sync FAIL.  Long live Day One Classic
column10:
I was put off by the removal of iCloud option.  But I thought I‚Äôd give it a try regardless.  Installed it on my iPad, imported my ‚ÄúClassic‚Äù journal with no problem.  Installed on my iPhone, it synced everything perfectly.  Poking around, seems fine.   Next morning, poke around some more.  While I‚Äôm looking at the settings dialog on my iPad, I see in the background my whole journal vaporize.   I pick up my iPhone, launch Day One 2, and seconds later the journal vanishes.

I sent the logs off to Bloom Built.  At one point in the log, the iPad starts a sync. It determines that there is no journal ID on the server matching the local one, despite the push notification for the sync containing the journal ID from the server.  So logically it DELETES the local journal. Then to make absolutely sure that a possibly transient error becomes permanent, it then appears to dispatch a message to delete the original journal on the server!  Twice!  And after it all, push notifications to sync the ORIGINAL journal ID continue to arrive.

It doesn‚Äôt matter how great the new features are if it eats your journal for breakfast.  Sticking with Classic, thank you.

Yes, missing the syncing option to Dropbox or iCloud resulted In loss of stars.  While they said that it will be encrypted eventually in 2016, people have to remember that Day One will still have people that can access it and under legal requirements give up your information. I wonder how that notification will happen. 

I have the iOS and Mac apps of the classic apps.  I think the upgrade price for the Mac is too high and I don't think at full price of $40 that too many people will purchase it.  I'm not even considering it at the sale price. I still like the iOS app but I will also be looking for alternative journaling apps now.

Decent update but not worth the price (and I got half price). I also really miss the option to have favourite entries become large photos when viewing as a photo journal. I felt this was a nice touch but now will be missed...

column9: Great improvements but needs iCloud sync back!
column10: They've done an amazing job of implementing new features and listening to user feedback with this release so two stars are awarded for that much but the removal of iCloud sync is a deal breaker for me and many others. As others have mentioned, I don't want personal and private data in the hands of yet another third party. At least I know where it's going with iCloud sync. Private key encryption may help in the coming release but I see no reason not to bring back iCloud with it. Will revise this rating should this change.

I'm a big fan of Day One and the new features are not enough to warrant having to pay ¬£4. Especially as they have removed one of the better features which is syncing via Dropbox or other cloud services. I will be reverting to Day One Classic.

column9: Bloom Built made the right choice
column10:
Day One has made me a consistent journal-writer. I've become more mindful and more grateful, and that's pretty special to me. But about 6 months ago, wary about the wealth of personal information I was entrusting to a third-party, I stopped cloud syncing and have been manually backing up in iTunes since. To me, the most important characteristic a journal should have is confidentiality. When you sync with Dropbox or iCloud, you are ultimately trusting engineers at Dropbox or Apple to not peek at your data. Clearly those companies are going to have rules against such access (except in those cases where they are forced to disclose, which in the US gives authorities numerous ways to get your data...), but those are policy constraints, not technical constraints. You don't hold the keys to your journal. Maybe you're cool with that. I'm not. 

I think the new update is pretty great. I'm not super-fond of all the center-aligned boxes; that selecting tags actively hides what I've written; nor that my writing window in landscape is the same size as my journal entries. But what I'm most excited for is the 2.1 update when I can wrap my writing in a encryption key of my own creation. Good on Bloom for listening to their users' feature requests; I'm happy to pay you again, and I can't wait to begin automatic syncing again.

The userinterface is terrible. Don't know what each buttun does. Most of them seem to do nothing at all tried the app on an iphonr and later on, also on an ipad. But i an clueless. Waist of time and money. 
Why 1 star? Can't give any less...
The original (i.e. Day One) was by far better its clone. I really wonder whose idea was it.

I read lots of reviews prior to buying. I saw lots of complaints on syncing which are valid, however, not a concern for me. I just won't make any real personal entries.  PDF was a concern for me and ended up as expected.  No real ability to format is a shame.  For now I give it two stars because I don't like the export formatting and it just keeps crashing. I'm sure they will fix that in the coming days.  Maybe worth 4.99. Will not pay 19.99 or 39.99!! For the Mac version. I would need some really good formatting options to buy into that.  Cool to have the auto weather and location.  Ultimately a good way to keep track of the small hikes I do through the year.
Pretty cool...this app comes in handy when documenting work orders and even adding pics...great for home and business.

Disappointed. I loved the first version and when they described the features in the upgrade, I didn't hesitate to spend even more money on essentially the same app. 
Like other reviews say, no iCloud sync is a letdown, but not a huge deal. I just signed up for a day one account and thought sync would work across that. Well, it doesn't. At least not right now. Nothing syncs. I tried to import all my entries from the previous version, and at first it seemed to work. Then I went to add a new entry and noticed all my old entries are gone. Tried to import again, same issue happens. So I figured I'd try to just write a new entry, and figure out the import later. Got halfway through an entry, and the app closed it, saying "another device is posting an entry." Not possible; I only have the app on one device. 

Long story short, the glitches and shortcomings of this new app make it almost worthless for someone that really enjoyed the old version. Hopefully the developers can figure it all out soon.
Dont want to update my data on their servers.

column9: No iCloud sync! DO NOT UPGRADE! Read 1st
column10:
Such a great app! Ruined now by the removal of iCloud sync capability! You monetize the upgrade and without telling us you remove our iCloud sync option! Then we are forced to have an account with you to sync with only YOUR servers!
I'll have to keep using the version 1 until the iCloud sync is restored or you no longer upgrade it for different iOS and OS X systems. Darn it all! And this version 2 had so many nice new features. So now you have got $60 out of us all for v1 and v2 and violated our trust in you by kicking us of iCloud! Thanks a whole lot!!!

Day One 2.0 is great! It's gorgeous in all platforms. It's brilliant really.

Those ignorant, paranoid people claiming the fine print gives Bloom Built control over everything you put in here are either lying or misinformed. If you have questions or doubts about that, contact their customer support over email (not Twitter) like a real person would. 

Multiple journals is so great. Multiple images per entry too! Luckily the URL scheme also saw some improvements. There is so much here and design is so perfect. There are a couple of small bugs but nothing serious or truly bothersome imo. Selecting a journal - via URL scheme - to send an entry to isn't working but they're aware of and working on fixing the problem. Otherwise it's incredible.
I love Day One 1. This version has improvement . But the lack of iCloud kills it. Do not upgrade to this new version until they support iCloud. Save your money.
It's nice that the app now allows you to add more than one image per entry. I would like more sync options though.
This application has it all. Clear, easy to use. It is really as in the detail description. Just got transferred my day one version 1 data with ease.

column9: No iCloud Sync: They want to charge for "premium sync"
column10:
Basically the main reason why they're removing iCloud Sync and Dropbox sync is because they're making their own syncing services. 

This means that they'll be able to charge for subscriptions for "Premium" level of syncing (More storage space, storing large panorama images, online web publishing, ...).

And here I was, thinking this app could not get any better - it could! The possibility to have several journals is great and the design with its different choices of views is awesome. Syncing is flawless and migrating worked in a snap. Journaling has never been more fun!
Nice app but poor synchronization. Different devices with misrepresentation. Expensive Mac app.

... ;;; I can't believe dayone sync. 
someday, dayone's file will big data. and then??
add purchase??
I don't want to purchase no more cloud services.

Initially very frustrated with this update. Quite a few changes to how things are done and taking time to rediscover the app. But beginning to warm up to it and loving it more and more. 

Very good support services - developers are very helpful and kin to listen to concerns.

Probably the best journaling app out there.
Bought the iOS and Mac apps, but only because I really like the original Day One. Won't start using them until Dropbox Sync is back.

I have been using Day One for many years and use it most days. This update is worth the wait. Have no problem losing iCloud sync. Multiple photos per entry is a welcome addition. Never kept a journal before Day One. Well worth the price.
Multiple journals are very useful. Importing from old journal was simple and flawless. Very good update.

column9: Why not upgrade Day One Classic
column10: I like this app, I just don't like the way the company collects money by releasing a new app and taking the old one off the shelf. Usually how you make changes to an app is that you upgrade it. The company shows much more eagerness to make money rather than to make a great app. That's not the attitude I admire.
Don't like they took this out.   Leads me to think they will charge later.  The app is great however.
Add iCloud sync pls. For now 3 stars.
Please re-introduce iCloud support.

I've been using Day One since it was originally released and always used Dropbox for syncing. When they added the option for Day One sync I decided to give it a try. It's amazing. If you ever have a problem with Day One sync, they can fix it. If you are using iCloud or Dropbox, they have limited abilities to fix it. 

Download the app. It's amazing. Multiple photos per post and multiple journals are incredible.

column9: And why should I trust you with my data?
column10: Didn't find out until after updating and then reading faq that they killed iCloud sync for whatever nonsense reason. I know apple cloud stuff has been questionable ever since .mac, but c'mon guys, figure out a way to make it work and I'll change my rating to the 5 this app should be.
Great new version, but I need Dropbox sync support. I want to keep my journal on my cloud. Please bring it back.

column9: Some new features, lots taken away
column10: I used to trust app without question. New updates were always solid and welcome. This new version adds some nice features but removes quite a few key ones (iCloud, hashtags, today widget, publish, etc). It doesn't feel like an upgrade as much of a feature trade that I'm not sure I'm happy with. It promises some are coming back (no iCloud, lots of Apple-blaming despite other apps working fine), but my trust waning. I hope this is just a bump in the road. Either way, I recommend holding off. Fingers still crossed since this dev has a great history.
Honestly after trying it the past couple of days I've decided to stay with the Classic, hopefully they continue support for it !
A 4, possibly 5 star application that I have to take away stars for removing iCloud sync.
The only thing that I don't like about this app is that it doesn't offer Publish feature anymore. Also would really be great to have a Publish to WordPress feature simultaneously if one chooses.

It's getting 1 * only because I can't give it zero or minus. Not that the Day One team read or care what we say.

Ok, so finally after years of asking multiple pictures are here. Was it worth it, no it wasn't. Nice neat thumbnails? Nope. Just a stack of pictures on top of each other. Hashtag has gone. iCloud sync - gone. Dropbox sync - gone. Dodgy day one sync - in. No way of changing either.

I was going to downgrade back to Day One but you can't. It's this or nothing. Don't upgrade its not worth a penny to upgrade and certainly not ¬£4.00

Multiple Journals? Why a journal is just that. I can't see the point in multiple ones? I certainly wouldn't need countless ones with very bright colours just one 

I've decided to ditch Day One and try to get a refund from Apple.then I'm going to try and find a new journal app. Or I might and probably will just go back to pen and paper, the way I wrote my journal for 30 years before being fleeced.

The App is advertised as "1/2 price" during the new release, but they are really charging the full $4.99 to your itunes account.  I have used the prior version, and like it, but instead of updating, they are now seliing a "New Version".  Very disappointing without reaching out to current users and offerring a loyalty credit.  I contacted BloomBuilt through their support, but they didn't even reply.  Also you now have to use them to backup, rather than icloud, what will they charge now for that?  Disappointed.
Have tried a few others and was sporadic user of original day one. This upgrade worth the $.

I've had the original version for about four months now and I use it very occasionally. When I discovered that version two came out I am mediately bought it knowing that it was going to be as amazing as the first one. It even came with new features that I've been waiting do you use forever! Although I wish they would've just updated theoriginal app but I am OK that they didn't because I understand. If you're looking for an amazing use journal I highly recommend gay one version two or even version one it is the best journal app iPad in the entire time span of me being on it an I device.

column9: Waiting for private key encryption support
column10: There is no more iCloud sync, but they have their own sync service that's supposedly on-par with iCloud, security-wise. I am patiently waiting for their private key encryption support before using it though. It is on their roadmap and I hope it comes soon.

I've used Day One for a long time and I love it. The new features including multiple journals make the upgrade worth the cost. 

I switched from iCloud sync to Day One sync last year and have been more than happy with the service. Absolutely no issues. Ignore the haters. Best app ever! 

I purchased the upgrade for the Mac version this morning. Can't beat 50% off.
I jumped right into this app, excited to start journaling and after a few posts it deleted everything ... I don't know if anybody else is experiencing this issue.

Let's start with the good...
Some nice new features, multiple journals, map view, add multiple images to an entry, all are welcome additions to Day One.

However...
Sadly you are now forced to use Day One's own sync service, no more iCloud and no more Dropbox.
There are a couple of reasons I am not happy about this, if you have an iPhone or Mac your will already have an iCloud account, now if you want to sync you are forced to sign up for yet another account, an account you have little control over. If the developers decided to sell Day One and the new owners decided to shut it (which happens regularly with tech start-ups) or if it doesn't pay and the developers  decided to call it a day, the app would still work but we would lose the sync function. Whereas if it was using iCloud (or Dropbox)it would likely still work. 
If you are not fussed about syncing your entry to another device I'd definitely recommend this app. 
But if, like me, you want control of your own sync data I'd be wary. It's a real shame, hopefully the developers will relent and restore iCloud and Dropbox support.

Update: I hate having to moan about this app, I loved the original version, but this version is so unreliable, lost some of my entries after the sync service became unavailable. Have just got Apple to refund me for the Mac desktop version, I shall keep the iOS version for now in the hope they relent and add Dropbox and iCloud syncing back. But have gone back to the old version. The Dropbox syncing is more reliable and doesn't require you to accept terms and conditions that force you to sign away your rights to your own content.

I know it's important to win the battle of online synchronization. I know the next step might be monthly charge for cloud storage. But now, at least give me the option for proven dependable and secure sync. Even iWork gives me the option for google drive, why dayone 2 cannot offer the option for Dropbox? I think I will keep using classic version until dayone 2 can sync on Dropbox.
I don't want my personal info/photos on their servers. Huge step backwards. Sh1tty terms of service too. I've complained to Apple and requested a refund.
As a avid user of Day One on mac and iOS, I was disappointed to learn that the removed Dropbox and iCloud sync from both apps. Bring then back!!

I don't love the idea of having to manage yet another account and would prefer to use Dropbox or iCloud to sync my data across versions. As a result this update feels like a regression. Even though there are some useful new features, I regret paying for this and will be switching back to the old version of Day One. Bummer.

So, I went ahead and purchased this and the Mac app under the 50% sale cause I love Day One. But I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm going to be using them simply because I have to send my data to their sync servers. Every company has to start somewhere but the fact that nothing is encrypted bothers me. Even with them being encrypted, I‚Äôm not sure I would do it just because as a small company, I doubt it has the infrastructure and time tested service as that of Apple or Dropbox.  Maybe in a few years...maybe? 

I guess, I just wanted to pay to show the company I love their software but removing alternative sync servers is a real bummer. I hope they listen to the many reviews/complaints for this and bring it back and not just take the money and run ;-)

While it looks like the Day One team has certainly been busy, the continued lack of video / audio (and live photo) support and the disabling of iCloud sync support are disappointing. The latter outweighs any upside this v2 has. I won't be using this any longer.

Great app. It's a fantastic upgrade not a new app, I don't mind paying a few ¬£s for the IOS version but not happy about ¬£15 for the Mac version.  Don't like the removal of Dropbox and concerned the Dayone sync failed right from day one! That's definitely not progress, they have made a 5* app into a 3* one.  I don't understand why they give you features we've been asking for like multi-photos and then screw around and remove options on backups and syncs. Concerned they will in time charge for their sync service.

As a previous owner of day one classic, this app adds not much.
User interface for the classic version is better indeed
Awesome upgrade to an already amazing app

Laggy and clunky. Page layout is like Microsoft Word - no design whatsoever. Underwhelming update and have since reverted back to DayOne Classic which is superior. Hoping developers are not too arrogant to listen to feedback and work on issues presented.

Our memories are priceless and I'm sure Bloom Built is banking on that as they move toward a subscription based service. In the mean time, your priceless memories can only be stored on their servers, with no private encryption. They failed to mention those small details. Very misleading and untrustworthy for a company that expects us to trust them with something so important. Refund requested.
App works great and syncing is no problem.

I've been using Day One since Day One. üòÇ I love Day One 2 the maps & now I can add more photos in my entries. Love it. 

I like how it see Day One Classic & moves everything over to Day One 2 so easy. All my settings, photos & things I've bee writing over the years are all their. 

I can back up iCloud which is an added plus. So, I have the safety of knowing I'm not going to loose a thing. 

The Team has done a wonderful job of saying true to the app's style we all know & love while adding in some fresh new ideas. 

I can't wait to get home & use the Upgrade the Mac App & see how it all looks their as well.

Any app of reasonable size and capability will eventually build their own back-end/sync service. Relying on a third-party for that introduces a lot of restrictions and risks. Just in the past year, both Dropbox and Facebook shut down major sync services.

Furthermore, maintaining multiple sync options is a huge code maintenance problem. Sync is among the most complex endeavors a dev team will undertake, and it is usually simplest when you control the back-end. 

I have zero concern about the integrity and safety of their back-end vs. iCloud or Dropbox. No one is immune to cloud storage challenges and security threats.

This is a fantastic update and it's well-worth the money. Software this good across iOS/Mac is becoming quite rare. 

Excellent work, Day One team!

One of my most used apps.

PROS
Multiple pictures a great idea

CONS
Narrowed sync options to only their servers is ridiculous and somewhat unnerving

The interface although pretty is not particularly intuitive

The multiple diary option was easily handled in V1 through use of tags

No where in their description of the upgrade to Day One 2 does it say that you are signing up to ONLY use Amazon servers as your backup. Amazon over iCloud or Dropbox? Really? Unfortunately they already have my money, my anger at not being upfront, and another great app has been rendered useless. Business as usual.
This really should have been released as a free update. It's the same app, with a few extra features thrown on top.

I updated without hesitation when I saw the new version to support the developer.  But, was I wrong!

What's wrong with this developer?  I would have expected perhaps Day One 2 add Dropbox sync or other cloud sync.  But instead of making it better - took away the one and only sync available.  Please - don't push your sync engine to use.

column9: Poor idea to remove core features
column10: Why release something as me and better but remove a core feature like iCloud sync?  Overall a nice app but I'll stick with the old version until this one is fully baked. Dumb.

If you don't want to buy the app you don't have to stick with Day One Classic. Personally I am more than happy to pay for it on Mac and iOS. You can't expect to pay for an app and then expect that app to stay forever. It takes money to pay for people to keep maintaining apps as good as this.

Pros: same cool interface for journalling. Most of the same features. FAQ indicates great features on the way

Cons: No iCloud or Dropbox sync. FAQ states that these services did not deliver the best customer experience for Day One users. Well, I don't know or trust the Day One Sync service. The FAQ also states that there are "key" employees that have access to my data. No thanks. I'll downgrade until this comes back.

I'd recommend not buying this app unless synchronization is not something of importance to you or something is done to remove Bloom's ability to see Day One entries.
Over priced update with even less sync options than before.
Good update but please rename it to DayOne, there's no need for the (2) beside the icon, DayOne 2 is a bit weird.

column9: Great new design, lacks iCloud backup
column10: I love the new design and the additional features. It would definitely be worth the upgrade except that there is now no longer support for iCloud. This is quite disappointing and becomes a bit of a deal breaker for me. This really needs to be added back in to give the user the choice.

Obviously Nobody signed up for Day one cloud account, so they simply created a new program 2.0 and ditched iCloud sync. And charge for a new app all over again -  CHEAP MOVE!

As things go in the world of ripoff artist, don't count on 1.0 being good for long

column9: A pleasant upgrade - but I'd stick with v1 for now
column10:
I've used DayOne since my first iPhone and since the Mac had an App Store.
Original Day One was wonderful and was well developed and maintained, but was missing a few key features.

Now we have Day One 2.0, which addresses the requests for multiple journals and multiple photos, it seems to have been at the expense of sacrificing iCloud/Dropbox sync. 

Like many others, I feel a little uncomfortable that all of our entries are now synced via their own servers, but I do trust that there will be viable reasons for this.

The new app is clean, functional, beautiful and a pleasure to use. The upgrade is definiteLy years in the making however I do think that the pricing is a little much, even at 50% off.  More so for the desktop version.  I knew I'd pay as it is an app I use on an almost daily basis, but even still, I was a little sore when I saw the price and I can see folk not bothering once it returns to full price.

Also, it is still missing a few features - the ability to lock journals individually would be a good (and I feel an important) feature.

The ability to hide journals from the general interface would also be handy. 

I am hoping that new updates and features will be available faster than the previous version, especially considering the cost that even long term loyal users have paid with this upgrade.

The new version is a fantastic piece of journaling software, and I haven't been tempted to try another app.  There are still a few things that need ironing out and it is missing what I feel are a few key features, and the loss of iCloud and Dropbox sync is a biggie, so I would recommend sticking it out with version 1 for now unless multiple journals and photos is so,etching you cannot wait to use.

I love the app, honestly I do, but I'm looking forward to see more developments-it could go from great to perfect, easily.

Not only there is no iCloud, but the build-in cloud is buggy!!! And the creators write that the reliability was the reason to abandon iCloud. New features are not the game changers, rather an update. Huge disappointed (and rip off).

It's so buggy, I cannot believe I payed for this thing. Been using 1.0 for years and it's one of my favorite apps. You should have tried using it yourself before releasing. It's a waste of time and money for now. Will have to switch back to first before you do anything about this one. Fortunately did not delete the first one.

Its the best diary app but I don't see why people who already had day one couldn't be updated to day one 2 instead of having to pay for the app again. Essentially we are paying to update day one original app.
Well apart from looking nice v2 seems to have removed lots of features that were present in v1 such as iCloud syncing etc. Not impressed.
Bad sync of photos, please add an iCloud sync possibility please!
I lost my money. This is a step backwards.
Perfect as usual! My favorite feature is multiple journal and photos!

All those complaining about the sync get over it. They made it very clear the direction they were going. You should have read before buying. Those complaining about the price, you weren't complaining when you got a ton of free updates to the original. Im sure the app is not perfect today, but they will fix whatever issues there are. I haven't personally had any issues yet. Simple to use and I like being able to add multiple pictures finally. Overall it's not a massive update from the previous but it's still the best journaling app out there and worth every penny.

The app works. That's not the issue.

I've been using Day One for many years. I've loved the additions they've made and gladly purchased Day One 2 but unfortunately, that's where I'll stop. I'd love to actually use the app but Bloom's decision to drop iCloud and Dropbox sync may cost them in the long run.

I'd like to think the purpose of Day One Sync is to better integrate with other third party services like IFTTT. It may also be true that their sync is indeed, more reliable than say iCloud. However, I've never had a single problem syncing with Apple and that's where I am dismayed by their decision.

Day One says it maybe upwards of six months before their private-key encryption system goes online. In the meantime, some of their employees can access your journal data. Read the FAQ.

I agree that if you want your most private thoughts to stay private, don't put them in the cloud. But for those random ramblings that are still your own, Day One is asking us to be patient and give them data for the promise that it will be safeguarded until they update. That's a large gap of time!

I do hope they reconsider but even if they do decide to enable iCloud and Dropbox sync support again, they may not be able to implement that for some time. Their decision to kill iCloud and Dropbox sync isn't puzzling, it's just business. But it also means we customers have choices too, like not buying the Mac app.

The Good: better iPad Pro experience than Day One (1?). Three stars for at least making that experience better.

The Bad: Other than iPad Pro, no other experiences are actually improved in any meaningful way for me. Also, Day One 2? Really? I thought that was a a joke in the blog post announcing it but now I actually have to see that icon on my iOS devices: "Day One 2". There really isn't anything new here that I want to use: Multiple Journals? No. Map view? No. Custom Reminders? No. Multi-Editor Windows on Mac? Maybe.

I paid for the upgrade for two reasons. 1) to support the team that built a great v1 app that I've been using since it launched and 2) because I can't imagine paying the full price they're planning to charge - maybe someday.

I know Bloom says they worked on this for two years but it really doesn't show. Maybe all that work went into building out sync services (that apparently nobody outside of Bloom wants) but there is currently no new value. I hope there is someday but I'm pretty doubtful. I'll keep using it for a while but it won't be as hard to walk away from using than Day One (1?) was.

If you're enjoying Day One (1?), don't care about the new features, and don't feel obliged to support the team then save your money.

Sorry, but it's just not worth it - and I'm sad to say that. I really hope it gets better. :-(

If you want a journal that can do it all and serve almost any purpose‚Ä¶ look no further. Day One 2 delivers with a beautiful new interface, multiple journals, beautiful photo grids, a brand spanking new editor and more! Just buy it already!!!

I love this app! It is the only reason I journal! It is really easy to use and looks beautiful. Just download the new one so we will see how much I will love it, which I know I will.

Just a side note, everyone one needs to lay off the whole syncing problem. Who cares?! If it's Apple or Day One, it's safe. It's probably safer with the people that make the app then Apple. They understand privacy. So, if your submitting lower ratings because of that little deal or even deleting the new update because of that, you need to chill. Change is always a good thing.

Great improvements in UI and features, but! Sync requires sign in (registration) to Day One 2, unlike Day One that allowed sync via iCloud without registration. Therefore this is a step back in privacy and is forcing me to go back to Day One.
Still no support for TextExpander fill in snippets, lame.
These guys seem like they don't value their existing customers at all. The way they have handled this upgrade doesn't inspire trust. Considering they now have our private data that is a big deal.
I have long used this app and felt it was almost perfect before. There were a few features I thought were missing which this update takes care of beautifully.

Day one is an amazing journaling app. But ever since day one 1 was released I've been waiting for an update to bring a video feature. To not only be able to put photos in entires but also video. Think about it! It'd make it better!
Now that day one 2 was released I was hoping for this video feature but instead now you can put more photos in one entry üòÇ lol! Great! Don't get me wrong it's good too......but seriously you guys should really consider in adding video feature.
PLEASE!!!!

Day One has been my most used app.  They have done a great job adding features that are useful with a minimal and slick interface.  By adding multiple journals into the app I'm able to separate my entries by content and by adding up to 10 photos into an entry in able to document so much more than words can explain.

There are a lot of complaints about removing Dropbox and iCloud and personally I've used both, but I had several issues with Dropbox which is why as I understand they choose to remove it.  If I were the creator of an app like Day One, I wouldn't want any features dependent on any other company.  Great job Day One!

Great upgrade if you - like me - had the previous version.
Great app if you are just getting started with journaling.
And for everyone freaking out about no iCloud sync. Just stop. Sure, they have their own proprietary ecosystem now. What do you think iCloud is? Besides, the app allows you to create an external backup to iCloud or - my personal preference - Dropbox.
No sync with iCloud

This app is very nice but has some bugs that need to be attended to. For example it has a tendency to turn itself off without warning when you are writing a new entry. Also it will not sync with my calendar. I'm using an iPad with ios9.2.

This was one app that I used just about everyday for a couple of years. I wiped my phone a few weeks ago an wanted to reinstall. Noticed that the app was on a new version and decided to purchase it to support the developer. Now that iCloud sync is gone and I cannot retrieve any of my old entries. Also I hate the idea of being forced off iCloud to sync. Very disappointed. Will not continue using the app.

(the review is given in hopes anyone from day one actually reads them)

oh dear, the UI is a disaster. who worked on this for 2 years and botched it up like this? this is a mobile app, not a desktop app - you can't be placing tiny icons next to each other (top right) and expect people to "click" on it with your fingers. 

the icon selection horrendous. 

besides the UI mishaps, which are too numerous to list here, you are saying "pay me 5 dollars so you can get what should have been in day one classic" (ie add more than one image and create multiple journals). hm, not really. why not make that an in-app purchase rather than making another app? 

the new app has soooo many flaws that it wasn't really needed (poor design, interaction, etc, no syncing).

seems somebody didn't check with their customers first obviously.

i feel the price is not warranted for existing customers. and for new customers i would advise to just get day one classic, not this version.
