There are some good points but removing iCloud sync is a huge backwards step.

Other than this the app is unreliable 4 crashes in 3 minutes, not good.

column9: The best journaling app is now even better
column10: OMG! Words can't describe how much better this new version has become!

I've been a really long time user of Day One, and is why Day One 2 is so disappointing for a number of reasons. 

The multiple photos feature is really great and long awaited. As well as the mapping tool on iOS now - very impressive. The new design looks great, though the previous looked fine as well.

Now I'm no app developing expert but couldn't all these features have been possible in an app update?

I paid $7 for exactly the same app as Day One, and $31 for the OS X version - so close to $40 and I wonder what for? They took away the Notification Centre feature "on this day" which was my favourite feature. And the Favourite Day Star feature is really under emphasised. 

I also wonder about the encryption security at Day One. I much preferred iCloud sync. 

At this stage I wouldn't recommend purchasing it. Just buy the first version and see how you go.

The new multiple photos are great, but the way they display in the entries is ugly. They don't have the same smooth look at the old journal, they just sit there. It needs to be much more fluid and visually appealing. This (very expensive) update has not added anywhere near enough new features to be worth the money.

I've been enjoying my new morning journal for the last month. Now, I get to do it in an environment that's just that much more gorgeous and inviting. The app is beautiful.

For Watch however, I'd like the ability to preview prior journal entries. It is useful to me to glance what I had written earlier in the day, without going to my Mac or iPhone. Evernote has this functionality, for example.

The app looks good and works well on my MacBook but you pay an extra ¬£4.00 for the iPad/phone version which then doesn't recognise your account or password, and so will not synch. So you do to contact support to learn that SUPPORT DON'T WORK WEEKENDS!!!!!  Very poor service. At present I wish I hadn't wasted my money.

column9: No longer syncs with Dropbox or iCloud!
column10:
Sync is not working properly, especially with photos. They could have at least got their own synchronisation working properly before they took away the ability to sync with iCloud or dropbox.

It is good that they now have multiple journals.

A few bugs left and right as expected but it's a major improvement. Loving it so far. One useful addition would be the option to search by location. It seems to be mentioned in the app notes but missing from the app. Overall, excellent work guys!!!

column9: AMAZING .. BUT  ¬ø ACTIVITY FEEDS & iCLOUD SYNC ?
column10:
As a long time user,I have longed for the day where multiple photos could be added to one entry. So for that alone I find the upgrade.üëåüèºüëåüèºüëåüèº

Developers: *** I have had this app since I don't even know when ... It's one of the most robust journal apps on the market m. However without support for activity feeds from Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter. it's not a one stop shop. Add support for those features and there is no competition.

column9: Good App, Paying for an Update?
column10:
Firstly, let me say that I use this app (well, the old Day One app) every day. It is great for journaling and keeping track of your daily life. It works as advertised and is very reliable. 

That said, I'm not a fan of the new business model taking over the App Store. "We know you've previously bought our app, but now there are significant updates. Please buy it again." I buy an app once. That should be enough. Why couldn't this be pushed out as a free update to Day One? At least offer an extra discount to owners of the previous version. I can't help but feel taken. How long before I have to buy Day One again?? (Answer: I won't)

Also, bring back the other syncing options.
There's no iCloud sync. Useless.
They prompt you to delete the old version... But don't until you realise you can't no longer sync via Dropbox / iCloud as the 'classic' version has been removed from the iStore

I was so excited to get this, but have been really underwhelmed and frustrated. I purchased for both Mac and iOS. The import process, as other users have mentioned, automatically decides what is a duplicate and doesn't tell you. I ran the migration from my old app. The number of entries looked right. Only later did I find that it had not migrated hundred of my images. The restoration process was incredibly time consuming. I'm going to keep using it and hope that it was just a rocky start that gets better.
Good start then no imported data. Then crashed. Then worked. Then no imported data. Then crashed. Deleted app and restarted. Same deal. I'm sure it'll be fine once the bugs are fixed.
Won't sync to iCloud or Dropbox anymore!

DayOne is a killer app for me, one of the apps I use the most. I also use Dropbox, and I sync everything through it. I'm severely disappointed that DayOne 2 does not support Dropbox sync. I wish I would have known that before dropping $30 on both the iOS and Mac apps... Going to try to get my money back.
I don't trust the ONLY new sync option and will not be using the update till we have iCloud back.

I am a bit deceived by the look of full frame photo. They are not really full frame as they were in the classic version. There is some  white space on each sides of most of the photos and  it does not look as good as before, at least for me. Even photos in very high resolution. The old look was distinctive of Day One as very few other app acheive the same good look.  We did not have to bother about r√©solution of the images.  Other changes are interesting but I will stay on Classic version and will not get the Mac version if the look of the photos stays unchanged in the new version.

column9: Great, just a few things I miss
column10:
Overall this is great. I love the facility of being able to add more than one photo at a time. However, I miss the things that really made me smile - "simple" things like the way the text slid over the photo when you pulled the screen down, the way you could pull up and down to get to the next post.... Really minor things but I loved them. It gave the app character.

Also really looking forward to the publish feature appearing again - hopefully in time for my holiday in a month please???

Upgrading was simple, all posts came through fine. Happy with the synching on to Day one server.

So, overall it's very sensible, practical and has more features but just misses out on some of the charm v.1 had.  Hopefully these little things will find their way back soon.

Keep the magic coming please - thank you!

"50% off for a limited time!!"
REALLY?? From where I'm standing, DayOne "classic" was not lacking ANYTHING that this supposedly 'new and improved' version has (with the sole exception of multiple photos/entry), which begs the question--why couldn't you just add this feature to the already existing app? But instead, you charge us ANOTHER exorbitant amount of money for basically more of the same? Rip-off.

Too often you get an app you just love and then the developers come up with an upgrade that leaves you scratching your head and asking why did they do that?  Well, I've loved Day One from the beginning and have loved the small improvements along the way. But this new release is really superb. It shows the dev folks are really in tune with us users, what can improve the app in a meaningful way and take us to the next level in our journaling experience. I simply love this new version and purchased for both iOS and Mac. Way to go and thanks much! I'm happy. üòÑ

Unlike day one 1, which worked flawlessly, DO2 is full of bugs and prone to crashing. The multiple journals feature is unusable and made me lose some entries: the journals I created randomly duplicated themselves (up to 8 times!) and I deleted those duplicates only to discover that it made (at random) the others disappear too! This is a very badly implemented piece of software that still needs a lot of work. The extra journals are a great idea though...

column9: Promising feature but buggy for now
column10: If you are a heavy day one user, better hold out until the bugs are ironed out. Editing entries with multiple photos are a bit hard, sometimes they failed to upload or has errors.

Multiple journals, multiple photos to an entry, nice ui flow, great integration with the Mac app, great syncing! Rare that I have no complaints with a big refresh to a beloved app I've used for years! I bought the Mac app, imported my journal into it, then synced it to their server and downloaded *those* entries to this iOS app, a process which took literally less than five minutes with my huge journal, which is amazing. I guess given that people trust services they've used a while, I can understand why some are mad that iCloud & Dropbox are not supported in this new version (a clearly stated fact in the long announcement, by the way -- do at least a little research outside the App Store before you drop your money, if you care that much, c'mon people) but those folks must never have used an app with native syncing. OmniFocus is a great example. In my experience native syncing is more stable and faster than third-party solutions because the developer controls the API and they know exactly how to support their own apps' data -- beats me why anybody would prefer a one-size-fits-all third-party solution. Especially iCloud, which works great with Apple apps, but with other apps, is kind of a dumpster fire. You see the parallel. Anyway GREAT update and I'm looking forward to future development and features as well!

Clearly a huge update with lots of effort put into it. I happily bought again.

Severely disappointed by the removal of third-party sync options. Day One is supposed to contain my most private information, and I'm supposed to just trust it to their web service? With no way for me to pay to make sure it gets maintained, or that my privacy is kept safe? What am I supposed to do when they inevitably shut down the service, or it gets broken into? With iCloud sync (which, BTW, worked great in the old app) I at least had a fallback; it even seems the Export feature of the new app can't export in full fidelity.

The new app also seems to be a big step back in usability and simplicity. There are buttons everywhere, all of which are tiny, hard-to-press, and hard to know what's going to happen. I had no desire to have multiple journals, but now I have to deal with that everywhere. The editor is now full of tiny mystery-meat navigation, too.

A for effort, but "the best gets better" this is sadly not. Going to look for other options.
Although many ew features still no temperature in Celsius How ignorant is that!! The world doesn't care much about the Fahrenheit system and day one keep ignoring a simple option.

I first learned about and purchased DayOne on 12/23/15 both versions, iOS and OSX, I have been nicely surprised and have enjoyed using this app... Upon purchasing I emailed support to inquire if it was possible to add multi photos to a day's input at which point they said "NO", not; not at this time, but it's on our TODO list, not it's going to be in our next release IN A MONTH! 
So now they want $19.99 for a OSX update even though it's only been  a few weeks since I purchased / paid for their previous version.
I reached out to them to ask if this was an oversight or if they offered a code to discount those how just purchased their app. 
I didn't ask for a free update, and actually shared that I would pay the $4.99 MORE for the iOS version.
Their response was to tell me to contact Apple to ask for a refund!?!??!
Is it me or is this developer abusing those who have shown support for them.

I could present a positive review of the apps, but can not support greedy group of people or developers who think it's ok to abuse their customer base like this.

Within my first email message I shared that even Parallel offered a discount to those who had just purchased their prior software version going back 45 days.

And their response it to contact Apple???!?!!!?

And speaking about their response I replied to ask them what they meant by contact Apple over a day ago and they haven't replied. 
I hope they do and show support for those who have shown support for them and their product or I will not share positive feedback for there app with anyone any longer.

column9: No longer supports iCloud or Dropbox sync
column10:
Unlike Day One Classic, Day One 2 will not sync with iCloud or Dropbox. I've kept my journal on iCloud and have felt secure that Apple was committed to putting our privacy first.

Unfortunately, Day One 2 won't support any other sync service but their own. This is a big disappointment that the developers not only chose to drop sync support for iCloud, but also didn't clearly disclose this to Day One 2 purchasers.

No matter what other great features it may offer, users shouldn't be forced to sign up with Day One to continue to keep our journals synchronized between devices.

column9: Nice app but useless today widget
column10: Love the look of the app but like the classic version, can there be an even more useless today widget?

column9: Scary Privacy Policy coupled with required sync to Day One servers
column10: Read their policy. They can literally so whatever they want with your data, and require you to use their servers to store data.
Crash and laggy is what the developer gave us this time n not even worth the original selling price.
No iCloud Sync üëé they only use they own server which I don't trust they are safe and they can sell your data to other one.

...since three years we are waiting for an encryption. Until today I thought I can live without it because the sync is over iCloud. But now I have to sync over your servers. Sorry, that is not acceptable. Please develop encryption and allow iCloud and Dropbox again. Thanks.

I have loved the original app and was excited to get the update. But there is no Dropbox sync. I don't feel comfortable having to sign up for a Day One account and share my entries with another (unproven) service. Please bring back Dropbox sync.

A real disappointment. I use dayone every day and the removal of Dropbox sync options and the pushing of the developers own sync is a cheap bait and switch lock in attempt that makes this update worthless.

The creators of this app are a disgrace to humanity. I purchased the DayOne App and have been using it since launch. Now instead of putting out an update for DayOne, you decide to remove it from the app store and release DayOne 2 and charge ¬£4 AGAIN? 

Absolutely pathetic. I have written to Apple and complained. I cant even go back in to my purchases and download DayOne again, its been completely removed, forcing me to pay a 2nd time. Money grabbing scammers.

I purchased this new version to continue to support the developers of this app. I quite like DayOne but would prefer to keep using iCloud. 4 stars bc it is a great app but no 5s from me if an iOS app doesn't  include iCloud in their sync/storage options- especially for something as personal as a journal....

I used the classic version for over a year now and I like it.
I just bought the new version to get rid of some of the limitations of the classic version. Unfortunately I had to realize that the iCloud sync option has been abolished. This was not clearly stated in the description. But worth than that is the only alternative offered now. I am not willing to store my thoughts, ideas, etc. on their server where they can be accessed. Telling people not to do so is just not doing it for me.
I will wait for a private key encryption feature.

Needs some kind of external sync. Just using Day One sync forces all entries to store on your device. Great if you have 10 entries, bad if you have 1000. Now it's using over 1GB on my phone. Bringing Dropbox sync back would be the ideal scenario.

Buttons are also a little harder to press since they're now half the size of the classic version.

Usually a 2.0 version is expected to have a new experience, and this one does. 

But the experience is pretty much ruined by the lack of fluency in the app. This build appears bug-bloated, and needs much more work to live up to the quality for Day One 1.0 on its debut. 

And the Mac counterpart is even worse. Wonder how you got here and still charge it $40

column9: NOT HAPPY to pay for an upgrade. But I like it so far.
column10:
- I am not a big fan of journaling. I just like to collect good apps so I just bought it.
- I tried it out and I like it. It IS better the the original version.
- I haven‚Äôt experienced any bug yet.
- The only thing I would complain is I need to pay for an upgrade. There are many apps out there who do not charge for big upgrades. I am a beginner to develop apps and I know developing an app cost a plenty of time and work. But as a user, I just don‚Äôt feel very happy to pay for an app that I have already paid for. Especially it is a very expensive one. 
- Honestly, very unhappy. 
- But it is good enough to make you pay for it, right? There are many free and cheaper apps in the app store but you still choose to pay for this expensive but simple and effective one. 
- ALAS!!!

I don't think this version deserves one star, but randomly no longer supporting these options in any way is an important and major issue. It matters to me, and know it matters a lot to others as well. So in response to so many 5 star reviews (which it otherwise deserves), I feel compelled to contribute to the denting of the overall star rating, knowing that most of those whom this concerns are only going to check out the reviews page if the rating falls under 4 stars.

So hopefully this helps some people out there shed light on this crucial detail, so their purchase can be the result of a fully informed decision, before they shell out any cash.

I should have read more carefully. I don't mind paying for new versions. However, not a version which is just an obvious excuse to launch a paid sync subscription service eventually. I mean really, you can now add as many photos to an entry as you want to! And they are just going to give you all the sync space on their server to store them for free! Uh huh, no. We all realize what 'free' in this ecosystem means now.
Used to sync perfectly via Dropbox. Problems now with their proprietary syncing. Other than for multiple photos, not worth it over "classic".
Everything is better. Map view is great. The whole app feels fresh and new, and multiple photos with multiple journals is icing on the cake. Fantastic.
More bugs than (new) features! No Dropbox support! Backup does not work! Nice done Bloom!
Need to bring back iCloud sync please!

column9: A lot of money for LOSING FEATURES
column10:
NO Icloud sync, and only view thumbnail format..bad update !!! I do Like the old Day One app, which would allow you to click on the picture to enlarge it (especially on my 27‚Äù display) and really get a good look and also use your iCloud account for syncing‚Ä¶.But in this new version you can only use their cloud (sketchy and unknown security for my personal information and thoughts!) and it keeps image view in basically medium size thumbnail format. 

To great extent I can see the benefits of much of the OS, but it really is sad that you can no longer sync to Apple iCloud and you only get small images to look at, when often a memory should allow for a larger view. 

Basically, I wish that it had the option to sync with a company that spends millions in cloud security, as opposed to an app developer who does not, and therefore I  feel that ,my personal info is soooo much less secure on their cloud service, and also the old feature allowing you to highlight images and then see them full screen if you desired is also lost to the new version. 

YIKES‚Ä¶CAN I GET MY MONEY BACK!?!>?!?!

 For as much money as this is I hope they can make ICLOUD SYNC AND LARGER IMAGE VIEWS  possible in later versions. If so I could see this being a five-star app. Unfortunately, until you can keep the sync on a proven secure cloud (iCloud) and also view your images from the past in a larger format, and not merely tiny thumbnails, my review will stand at one star.

Not with the money at all!
Minor improvements.
Mayor change to the worse!
iCloud and dropbox sync is gone - not mention in description!!!
Bad!

I upgraded to find that sync is disabled on iCloud and there is no setting in the app for turning iCloud syncing on. I have it turned on in the iOS settings for iCloud Drive so that is not the problem. This app is useless until sync works.

column10:

column9: You're forced to give them your email to sync

Maybe it's just me, but I'm very, very pleased with Day One Two, particularly the multi photo feature which I'd been looking forward to.  My first sync (previously iCloud) worked perfectly, even after I'd stuffed up by accidentally creating a few more journals.. No losses..  Love the new UI, clean, elegant and intuitive.   If I have to find one, my only niggle would be that a new entry does not seem to auto save.. If I don't tap Done I've lost it.. Or is that just me, again? ;-)

Well done guys, you have one happy punter and, I suspect, a lot more to come.

column9: Good update. Needs to be better.
column10:
UI wise, this is beautiful. A joy to look at, and a joy to use. The "entries nearby" feature is genius. Multiple journals and colors is excellent, though I never felt the need for more than one.

I know that there's always the risk of missing features when apps are rebuilt from the ground up, so I assume that there will be many solid updates in Day One 2's future. The biggest feature I'm missing is the "random day" widget from Day One Classic. It was great to pull down and look back on previous days... Because isn't that the point of Day One? Making memories and thoughts (the most important aspect of journaling) easy to record and recall? The current implementation is effectively worthless. When you create an entry, your location can be add automatically anyway, so I see no reason to have a quick way to check-in.

Many people comment on the removal of iCloud and Dropbox sync. Though I do understand their worries (Day One sync is much newer than the other services), I don't mind the change. 

Among features I'd like to see added:

- It's time for real prompts. Prompts aren't just a "Grid Diary" thing. They remove one less barrier when it comes to actually using your app: figuring out what to write. Prompts provide easy pathways to more engaging entries (not just "today I went to work and ____ happened"). New/shuffled prompts could also make opening your app closer to the front of user's minds, making it exciting to find out what you could be asked to write about each day.

- Flashback. You can sort of do this through search, but there really needs to be a simple way to see milestones (this day/week/month a year ago).

- Shared journals. Oh my word. This would be amazing.

Overall, a good update. Not a great one. Worth the money right now? Maybe not.

I have used Day One since 2011. It's become by far one of my favorite and most recommended apps on my iPhone. I know of many people who journal now because of this app. One of the best features of the app has always been seamless syncing between my many devices, both iOS and Mac. In Day One 2 however they have removed iCloud Sync and effectively killed this app. I agree with other reviewers who have stated they do not trust a third party with their journal data over Apple's iCloud. Not to mention the very real possibility of them charging you for their sync service in the future. If you are going to make an app for iPhone with any type of sync capabilities, it MUST support iCloud as one of the sync options, or it's dead on arrival. No matter how great the feature set, and Day One 2 seems to have some nice new features, if it doesn't support iCloud, it doesn't work 100% on your iPhone. Period!

I could keep using the old version, but it's just a matter of time before they will have to drop support for that one. Beside, I'm an early adopter and using old outdated stuff doesn't appeal to me at all.

Day One, please don't force your sync on users. Please give us the option to use iCloud.

Followed import process to bring in 500+ entries from Day One Classic on my iPad. Text and other data came over, but zero photos recognized for import and none came over (and almost all entries contain a photo.) Can't use until this is fixed, and won't use until Dropbox/GDrive/iCloud sync option added. Wish I could see my entries properly to review the rest of the app, as it seems promising!
After years of requests this new version still doesn't support rich text but don't worry it supports niche markdown.

This app is getting good update though it's paid but useful. I woul say it great of they will include the web app version as most of the user uses Windows as their daily driver. It'll also open a new market for app developer. Multiple photo update is the go.

Update: it's so leggy and not as classic. I am not giving it more stars then 1. Hope developer do some update with it.
I Love this app so much!!! There is literately NOTHING that you need to change!!! I love it so much!!
Adding lots of photo in one diary is much more enjoyable than what I imagined.  Fortunately I decided purchasing the Day One 2 (even though I have the Day One.)

column9: Lots of little problems make me appreciate the original more
column10:
First the good: multiple journals and multiple photos per post.

People are complaining about price, but no one hasn't taken away the original. I don't mind paying for quality apps. (perhaps the Mac version is too steep after the promo is over.)

Negative: lots of little usability problems.

Touch targets are small, which is odd from the company that made its original app have two enormous, wonderful buttons to start a new entry. Those are still around, but then you get tiny ones that feel so crammed. 

I use markdown when I write, and being able to swipe the added buttons above the keyboard was easier in v1 than a small markdown button. And even when you press it they removed the buttons for < and > to move the cursor.

When reviewing, not editing, posts, the spacing/white space was nicer, and photos would fill the width in v1. It looked like a nice website. Now (I'm using iPad mini) they are small, and tapping takes you to a full-sized view which is obscured by a box that hangs off the bottom of screen with more info. In v1 it was also easier to go from full screen pictures to scrolling through photos.

Leaving the interface issues, my biggest issue so far is sync. If you drop other services you need a reliable alternative and my first impressions are not encouraging. First day or so I'd import from v1 then all my posts would vanish. Did that a few times then quit trying. Then got it to work, went about setting up a new journal (a nice new feature), and then it duplicates most of the posts I moved to the new journal. Not all, just some of them. I thought duplication was one reason they mentioned they wanted sync done in house?

At this point with any other app, I'd move on. Having used day one for years, they have some built up credit. They iterated and updated v1 for a good while making it better and better. I have no reason to think they won't do the same. But I am worried about the flashy stuff being the focus over the highly refined usability I seem to have taken for granted from v1. And it takes a while to trust a sync service with such precious data after a troublesome start.

If you want to be reliant on their servers, go ahead. Not worth it to be putting my data on their server. Too bad. Lucky I didn't buy the Mac one. I will go back to using the classic version, which seems quite solid.
The best journaling app just keeps getting better.
Great upgrade to an already great app.

column9: Good upgrade, should be free to existing users
column10: I paid for this app once, now I'm paying for it again to gain features that should have been added to the classic version (namely, multiple photos per entry).  Version 2.0 is better but I'm grumpy about paying $5 to upgrade. Boo on the developer for not giving existing users a free upgrade.
I really do wish it could still support iCloud sync. Also, please (please) bring back the detailed today widget. I loved seeing the random photos!

This version seems to have removed two of the most useful usability features:

1. You can no longer scroll through just the photos across entries, you can only scroll through entire entries. 

2. You can no longer scroll your finger over the calendar to see the entry list update. You have to click on a single date at a time. 

These seem like odd steps backwards. Please bring back these useful features.
from this ver., can't use iCloud sync, dropbox sync.

Regretting purchases of both versions of Dayone ( iOS, OS X).  When I bought the original versions( I was happy with the purchase. Not so with this update. I feel like an ATM. Their justification for the high price is: "we worked for two years on this." Seriously, that's their attitude. It's all about them, customer not so much. 

Only sync option is untested, unknown, and (for most of 2/4/16 AM) down. Not acceptable.

Only 10 journals? Really? Something tells me, were gonna get "nickel'd and dime'd" to death. Could be the end of Dayone for me. 

Why can't I start a new entry, while on a closed entry? Why do I have to go back to the timeline and then have it open the same window I just left? How is that an improvement? (Hint: it's not.)

I long ago tired of the soft colors, shades on shades design. Enough already. It's hard on the eyes. There is something bizarre about the layout, and design. I can't put my finger on it. I will say this: it's better than most. 

The import of previous version post imported easily. I'm not happy about the app assuming what is or is not a dupe. Let me see them, thank you. Support says the app looks for conflicted entries. O.K. I'm
Good with that, but let me check. 

Overall I'm not impressed, and feel it's overpriced, even at the sale price. I can't recommend the app anymore.

I'll second that request for bringing back the detailed today widget, I miss the statistics and especially seeing random photos pop up from a month or a year ago. At the very least, give us the option for that setting please. Otherwise, great new interface, well done with the photo additions, and everything else is really slick.
Always been my favourite journal app and the new update just makes things better. Very pleased with it and don't worry - you can sync and upload all your old entries from the original app.
ctrl-space, langauge switching key does not working.

As a long time user I've been waiting for the ability to add multiple photos! Also, the UI was tweaked just enough to make it seem fresh and newish, yet a total overhaul was not needed, in my opinion. Love it! :)

column9: Easy Transition from V1 to V2
column10: Liking it so far: Within just a couple of minutes iPhone and iPad have been upgraded as well as old journal entries migrated, and synced, impressive. Old tags are still there, photos too, and now I can create multiple journals and - at last! - have more than 1 pic per entry. Very nice!
This early version is missing the Publish feature. While Day One is promising delivery in 2016, it's troubling that they cannot be more specific.
I'm not happy with the fact that this version doesn't support syncing with iCloud. Will delete it and stick to the classic.

Negatives: The images in entries look like they were copied and pasted into a text document, no iCloud support. Pretty laggy side panel opening (pulling from the side and the button), even with passcode enabled you can still make entries (day one classic got it right)

I wont be using the app for a long time or at least until these things are fixed, especially the lagginess (im on an ipad air 2, it shouldnt be laggy)
I need iCloud sync.

column9: Version 2 update REMOVES iCloud and Dropbox syncing
column10: This new version removes iCloud and Dropbox support. The ONLY syncing service possible is Day One Sync. Whether or not this is a good move on Bloom Built‚Äôs part is up for debate. (Do you trust Day One more than Apple or Dropbox with your sensitive data?) However, this aspect of the update needs to be more clearly advertised in the ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs New‚Äù section. It‚Äôs not typical that apps become *stop* being compatible with popular syncing platforms when updated.

column9: Great app but app today widget
column10: Love the new app, but it's missing my favorite today widget feature to show old posts. Love to see the one month ago, one year ago, and random posts. Please add in an update. The rate would be 5 with this feature.

Pretty incredible this version of the app not only does not encrypt your data, but now takes away your choice of where to sync it. Anyone with access to your phone, computer, and now anyone working with the Day One team, or anyone who compromises Day One's servers have complete access to (what could be) some of your most personal thoughts and photos. With the large number of high publicly security breaches over the past few years it's pretty stunning an app of this nature would have superficial design tweaks prioritized about privacy and security of the journal content.

Seriously. No review can state just how phenomenal Day One is (and version 2 only made everything better). Do yourself a favor, if you want a journaling app of any sort for any reason, just go ahead and get a copy of Day One. Wish I could give you guys 10 stars!

column9: They steal all of your data
column10: Instead of using secure iCloud sync, the developers instead force you to use their own non-secure channel that stores your private data on their servers. What a joke.
Make a sketch like a Notability

Beautiful redesign. Well thought out features executed brilliantly. I particularly love the multiple journals. Well worth the upgrade.

The fact that the developers launched this app that with no iCloud syncing (sorry guys but I don‚Äôt trust your Day One sync system, especially since it‚Äôs encryption has been shaky) and then immediately removed the Day One Classic app from the App Store is absurd. It‚Äôs like they are trying to force us to use their syncing system. This is very sad. Wow! This is hands-down the best journal app out there!  I use it every single day and I think the changes are great!

After purchasing several different journal apps I got the original day one as a free app of the week and it just won me over, and with this new version they really refined an already great experience.

Multiple Journals, and multiple photos in an entry alone are two features that would make me pay for this upgrade.  been using the Day One Sync for awhile now and it has been flawless. column9: The Only App of Its Kind
column10:
Don't let the 4 star rating fool you. Day One is absolutely the best app available in the woefully inadequate corner of journaling apps. I've thoroughly enjoyed using the original version (now called Day One Classic, and pulled from the App Store) for a long time. But just because it's the best app in a really bad field doesn't mean it deserves a 5 star rating. It still has issues. Issues I'm sorry to see the developer ignored when publishing the latest version.

Version 2.0 was touted as a major upgrade. It isn't. Improvements include the ability to use multiple photos per entry‚Äîa cataclysmic oversight in the original allowed only one photo per entry‚Äîand multiple journals (nice, but not earth-shattering).

Features still missing: the ability to import Twitter and Facebook feeds, services we use essentially as proxy journals. This is another oversight from the original version that should‚Äîand easily could‚Äîhave been added in v2.0.

Features removed: the ability to sync with Dropbox. This functionality was removed in favor of a proprietary sync solution. Don't get me wrong; Day One Sync works well. But it seems counterintuitive to force users into a proprietary storage/sync solution.

I'll continue to use Day One 2 on my iPhone and iPad. I'll either have to stick with Classic on my Mac or not use Day One at all because the price is *insane*.

Underwhelmed at this point. While I like being able to add up to ten (not unlimited!) pictures, I prefer the layout of the first app, which was cleaner. Further, the search feature of 2 isn't picking up certain tags. Not sure what's going on. Additionally, this version doesn't use Dropbox to sync. You can set up Dropbox as a backup source, but appears you have to physically hit the send button to send it there?  Again, the original app seemed to deal with this more cleanly.

This update has all of the most requested features of the original Day One. It's the only app which helped me journal almost everyday. Beautifully designed and intuitive to use. All other journalling apps which I tried were used only a few times but this is the one which i used regularly. I understand that update is not free but it's worth it.
Love it.

The first version was already very good with sleek design and good fonctionnalities.
The new 2.0 version brings very welcome new functionalities such as multi photos per entry and multi journals. 

Bonus: the import of data between the old and the new version was flawless.

Keep up the good work and can't wait for all the new functionalities you announced on your website!
I feel the App was rushed out of the door. Had troubles signing in. Had issues exporting and importing(I don't think testers tested in iPad/iPad Mini) And no option to sync without signing in.
please celsius.

column9: No letting me sign in for sync
column10: I keep getting errors to sign in for syncing

DayOne is the best diary app I've been using so far. I've been using the Classic version for a couple of years now and I am more than happy to see a big update, welcoming some long awaited functionality. The app is easy to use, logical and has beautiful views.

The original version of Day One was already journaling at its best and Day One 2 is even better, so I guess that makes it betterest.

All of the great features from the prior version are still there - seamless syncing across devices, location tagging, weather, publishing, markdown, etc. Among many other additions, Day One 2 adds multiple journals, multiple photos per journal entry and even faster syncing. The developers have made significant under the hood changes, so syncing is now super fast. I also like the UI changes. They've managed to make it even cleaner and easier to use despite adding all of the new features.

If you like keeping a journal and having it wherever you go, Day One 2 is the app you need.
Where is iCloud sync?? I lost all my previous entries.

column9: Amazing new version! But no Celsius?
column10:
Actually I do not write diaries every day, but I do Love this app! So, when this new version already come, I download immediately. 

Amazing, really! ........................! Isn't it?ÔºÅ

But I can't find Celsius selection, hope it could be join at the next version.
I journal frequently on Day One Classic and this App is an awesome update. It's not just a fresh coat of paint but adds a whole load of new features as well!

column9: Needs iCloud sync before I can use it
column10:
I bought the iOS and Mac versions of the new Day One 2 app. I wanted to support the company since I haven‚Äôt given them any money since I bought the original Day One app. However, I have deleted Day One 2 from my Mac and iPad/iPhone. I did this because the app only offers syncing from Day One, there is no iCloud version. While I love Day One, I do not trust my journal data to be properly secured via Day One sync. I only trust it to iCloud. 

Now this saddens me since Day One 2 has some great new features, the developers did a wonderful job with it. But I will not use Day One Sync in place of iCloud. I simply don‚Äôt trust a third party - even the developers of the app - with my journal data. This is my personal quibble, your mileage may vary. If Day One 2 had offered iCloud syncing I would have given it a five star rating, but for now I must give it only three stars. 

This is a bummer of a review to write since I really like Day One 2. But I just cannot bring myself to trust anyone but Apple with my private journal data. Sorry, that‚Äôs just the way it is. I‚Äôm happy to support the Day One developers by purchasing Day One 2 but I will not be using it until iCloud syncing is added to it. And I doubt that that will ever happen. 

Oh well, hopefully Day One Classic will be supported long enough for me to perhaps find a different journaling app that offers iCloud syncing. Maybe Chronicle or some other app.
Crashes too often: be it creating a new journal or a new entry.
Bring back the detailed today widget with statistics and random photos, please! Otherwise immaculate update, import from DO Classic and sync both flawless! Good luck!
I use this app every day. Been using it for more than two years, and this new update is worth it. Useful, simple, fast.
Good app, but why can't it support iCloud sync?

column9: Looks like crap on iPad pro
column10: The title says it all. Looks like crap on my iPad pro in landscape. Also the sync is down. Great launch year 2016, right?

I can't get enough of this app. The UI is outstanding and the new features are well worth the price point. The transition from classic to 2.0 took a matter of 20 seconds (if that). This includes me reading the welcome pages and transferring my 700+ entries. It was painless. Multiple photos is a gem and batch moving into another journal or tagging is great. Highly recommended this app to any and all.

column9: A Great App Made Better in Version 2
column10: The original Day One app (now Classic) set the standard for journaling apps. They have made it even better in version 2 with a similar simple and clean design for multiple journals and the ability to add multiple pictures for each entry. Transfer of original entries to new app was seamless and went off without any problems. I recommend the upgrade!

Version 2 is even more beautiful than the original! The design and print layouts are refreshed, and working with lots of journal entries is much smoother. There are multiple journals, for one thing. And search is much more robust -- it's now capable of filtering by multiple tags and search terms. And you can act on a list of entries.

Some of the stuff in 1.0 hasn't made it into 2.0 yet. 

iCloud sync is gone for good, unfortunately. 

But it's been years since a major update, and the app now works great on iPad pro.
Signin in doesn't work, so you can't sync the apps!!
Absolutely brilliant and useful update :-) Keep up the good work!

The new interface is great. And it's easy as usual to create good memories for me. 
BTW, I love the old version which has today view in Notification Center. Could it be added in the other day pleaseüôèüèª

Syncing now requires a new account with DayOne.
